name: Modern & Cozy Lincoln Square Condo!
space: Fun, cozy and charming 3rd floor condo on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Square! Our condo features: 2 bedrooms; queen bed in spacious master and comfy futon/couch in 2nd bedroom baby's room (crib and baby items available on request.) 2 bathrooms, both with shower, Jacuzzi bathtub in master suite Back door deck with mini garden and grill for BBQs and relaxing. Central air, stainless steel appliances, parking space available in lot 8 blocks from the brown line train as well as access to 3 main bus routes a half block from the front door Divy bike rentals across the street Enjoy the quaint neighborhood of Lincoln Square and all the shops, coffee houses, restaurants and bars it offers just blocks from our place! If you need to get around, catch a bus or a cab/Uber right outside the door, or take the Brown Line train. If you have a car, park it in our space out back and use it to get around the city during your stay. There is a brand new Tony's Fresh Market grocery store, Walgreen's,

house_rules: No pets No smoking No parties or unregistered guests We appreciate guests who are considerate to noise levels as we have downstairs neighbors Please use coasters and limit eating and drinking to the kitchen and living room. Feel free to use our appliances (blender, panini press, grill, etc.) but please be respectful in keeping our things in good condition. We think it's cool to invite others to share our space while we're away, but hope you'll leave it looking just the way it did when you found it.
host_about:
We are a young, professional couple. Santi is from Spain, I'm from Wisconsin.  We met in Spain where we lived together for 3 years before moving to Chicago 7 years ago. 

We love traveling, decorating, and design and have a non-stop social calander.  Our hobbies include volleyball, latin dancing, and entertaining.  

We love having people over for get-togethers and dinners to share our space, but keeping our home and belongings clean and in good shape is very important to us, therefore we would be mindful of doing the same in someone else's space.

name: Enjoy 100 Days of Chicago Summer in Our Cozy Suite
summary: Our cozy, private room located in a quintessential Chicago two-flat, comes with the comforts of home for two (or even three). Surrounded by one of the city's safest and most charming neighborhoods, Lincoln Square, this suite is steps from local shops, restaurants and the 'El' (train). Experience True Chicago!
space: You'll have your own private suite with a plush queen bed, TV, reading chair and a small kitchen nook complete with a fridge, coffee maker and snacks.  You'll also have access to the living room area, with another TV and a large sofa (sleeps 1 comfortably). There is also a deluxe bed-height air mattress that is available for larger groups. For more than 2 guests, you may have a private entrance which only you use during your stay.
description: Our cozy, private room located in a quintessential Chicago two-flat, comes with the comforts of home for two (or even three). Surrounded by one of the city's safest and most charming neighborhoods, Lincoln Square, this suite is steps from local shops, restaurants and the 'El' (train). Experience True Chicago! You'll have your own private suite with a plush queen bed, TV, reading chair and a small kitchen nook complete with a fridge, coffee maker and snacks.  You'll also have access to the living room area, with another TV and a large sofa (sleeps 1 comfortably). There is also a deluxe bed-height air mattress that is available for larger groups. For more than 2 guests, you may have a private entrance which only you use during your stay. You will share the kitchen and bathroom with us, but we provide a bathroom schedule upon arrival for convenience sake. We cook most weeknights, and often eat/order out on the weekends, but the full kitchen is available for your use, should you wish to. D
neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Square is one of the city's safest and most charming neighborhoods. Still retaining much of its original German charm, it has so far resisted the over-development that has overtaken many of the city's other historical neighborhoods. Populated with a diverse population of ages, races and socioeconomic backgrounds, the tree lined streets are filled with families and young professionals. The Square is extremely walkable, with a number of cafes, shops, groceries, restaurants and pubs only a few minutes away.
notes: We have very busy and inconsistent schedules, so chances are you may only meet one of us, or maybe neither--however we are always reachable via text!  We each have a 'suite-style' bedroom, as well as a home office which we work from a few days a week, so we tend to stay "out of your hair" during your stay.  If you do have questions, want suggestions or have any other needs, please just ask!
transit: There is free street parking throughout our neighborhood, so driving here is a breeze.   Once here, we are located 2 short blocks from the nearest 'El' (the "elevated" train) station, and accessible to several bus routes. The 'El' will take you virtually anywhere in the city, and is a great way to avoid our traffic! A few hot spots: Wrigley Field: 15 minutes Lincoln Park Zoo: 30 minutes Downtown/Loop: 30-45 minutes Soldier Field/Museum Campus: 60 minutes Cabs, Lyft and Uber are also easily accessed from our area.
access: You will share the kitchen and bathroom with us, but we provide a bathroom schedule upon arrival for convenience sake. We cook most weeknights, and often eat/order out on the weekends, but the full kitchen is available for your use, should you wish to. During the warmer months, our backyard and patio are also available for your use.
interaction: With multiple jobs between the two of us,  we are not home often.  That having been said, we are long time residents of the city and happy to help with directions or suggestions. We both moonlight as bartenders and are longtime residents of the city, so chances are pretty good we can help you find what you're looking for!
house_rules: #NAME?
host_about: I'm a native Midwesterner, have a love for the global diversity of the big city, and a serious case of wanderlust! A Chicago resident for over 10 years, I love my city, but jump at the chance to hop on a plane to go to a beach, mountain, Broadway show, or any other far flung destination.  Airbnb enables me to stay in awesome locales, and host folks from all over the planet.

name: Spacious one bedroom in Ravenswood
summary: This one bedroom is located in Ravenswood and only a few minutes walk to the Damen CTA brown line stop. There are multiple restaurants, coffee shops, and a CVS pharmacy all within walking distance. Getting to downtown is easy with the CTA brown line taking you right into the Loop. There is also a large park only two blocks away with nature trails and a running track.

name: Charming Entire Home in Lincoln Square
summary: Welcome to a private 2-bedroom home available in fantastic Lincoln Square! You will be a 10-15 minute walk away from the el train and restaurants, bars, shopping, and parks. My home is filled with vintage finds yet also has modern amenities!
space: Please note: While this listing as a single home does not have many reviews, I've hosted numerous people while I have been within the home. You can read my reviews by looking at the listing I use when I share the space: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6634916?s=wFhn4R3R I've spent years collecting antiques and vintage items in an effort to create a space that is both serene and interesting. One room has a queen bed and the other has a twin bed. My bathroom is spotless, roomy, and updated. You will also have use of my living room, kitchen and dining room as well as my outdoor back porch. In the living room there is a television and DVD player. I offer streamed television such as Amazon Prime and Netflix.

One room has a queen bed and the other has a twin bed. My bathroom is spotless, roomy, and updated. You will also have use of my living room, kitchen and dining room as well as my outdoor back porch. In the living room there is a television and DVD player. I offer streamed television such as Amazon Prime and Netflix. My home has two guest bedrooms. One room has a q
neighborhood_overview: I am biased but this is such a wonderful neighborhood! My home is surrounded by amazing restaurants, bars and shopping, and features a Walk Score of 87. Guests will be a quick 10 minute walk to the Rockwell el stop which will allow them to access all of Chicago's attractions. My home is also a quick (10-15) walk to the charming Lincoln Square neighborhood, complete with fountain, pedestrian mall, and stores and restaurants with a European flair. Feel like you need a little nature in the city? I am a few blocks away from River Park or Winnemac Park.
notes: The kitchen window over the sink is tricky. Please don't open it during your stay. Don't worry- there are plenty of other windows nearby along with the screened door to my back porch.
transit: By car: My street offers easy street parking without a parking permit. By public transportation: I am a quick 10 minute walk to the Rockwell el stop. This will allow visitors to quickly access all of Chicago's attractions. I am also a 5 minute walk to the Western Avenue or Lawrence Avenue bus lines.  By plane: Visitors flying into Midway airport can take the el to the Rockwell el stop (this takes about an hour). Visitors flying into O'Hare can take a combination of the el and a bus to arrive at my home (again, this should take about an hour).  By taxi: Visitors can call a cab or use Uber and expect that their ride will arrive within 10 minutes.
access: My home has two guest bedrooms. One room has a queen bed and the other has a twin bed. The full bathroom offers plenty of space. You will also have access to the living room, kitchen and dining room as well as my outdoor back porch and yard.
interaction: I remain in touch easily through email and text. I'm always happy to answer questions and assist in any way to make your stay more enjoyable.
house_rules: Home rules include- - Refrain from smoking in my home or in the outdoor spaces.  - Please be considerate of noise- and I will do the same for you!  - No pets or parties at this time.  - You will be welcome to my coffee stash yet other food items will not be shared unless specified. You are welcome to bring your own food items and store them in my refrigerator or cabinets.  - Please leave kitchen items as they were found (please wash or place in the dishwasher utensils, plates, and cooking implements).
host_about: I am a school social worker who loves to scour markets for vintage finds, travel, work on home projects, read, spend time with friends, and practice hot yoga. Entertaining and hosting is a joy and I look forward to providing a lovely Airbnb experience!

Green Mill for jazz folks is a 15 min walk, Aragon is nearby & Old Town School of Folk Music.

There is a king size daybed in the living room and a guestbed in a separate room. There's an equipped kitchen for cooking or you may just prepare fresh your morning coffee, tea and have a great start for the day.

name: Cozy and Quiet 1BD in Ravenswood
summary: Our charming and comfortable one bedroom with ample street parking exemplifies the charm of the Ravenswood neighborhood. Enjoy a bike ride along Lake Michigan, or have a picnic in Winnemac Park, or explore the amazing local restaurants and theaters.
space: Our spacious one bedroom comfortably hosts 2 people. The large kitchen and dining area is ideal for cooking a homemade dinner. There are farmers markets and multiple grocery stores within walking distance. This corner apartment receives a lot of natural light and great views of the neighborhood.
description: Our charming and comfortable one bedroom with ample street parking exemplifies the charm of the Ravenswood neighborhood. Enjoy a bike ride along Lake Michigan, or have a picnic in Winnemac Park, or explore the amazing local restaurants and theaters.  Our spacious one bedroom comfortably hosts 2 people. The large kitchen and dining area is ideal for cooking a homemade dinner. There are farmers markets and multiple grocery stores within walking distance. This corner apartment receives a lot of natural light and great views of the neighborhood.  Ravenswood is a charming, quiet neighborhood on Chicago's north side. This artist community features the Ravenswood Art Walk, farmers markets, and is walking distance to the lake shore.  Walking distance to the CTA brown line and red line. Also walking distance to the Metra which gives guests access to the north suburbs (Ravinia Festival) and a 15 minute express ride into Chicago downtown.

name: Don't You Deserve a Lil Pampering? Lush Bed Awaits
summary: Quiet, mature living in the heart of historic Hyde Park. Lush, crisp, fresh hotel linens and a goose-down mattress await in your guestroom of this centrally-located vintage garden apartment, with exposed brick & pipes for an authentic Chicago vibe.  Great for the academic traveler spending time at the University of Chicago, the business traveler en route to McCormick Center, and tourists on a budget ready to live like locals as they explore all that Chicago has to offer. Dog lovers welcome!
space: Your queen guest room in my home awaits: comfortably sleeps one or a couple.  Business travelers, academia, medical staff and leisure travelers all welcome! While you will only be paying for a private room, you will be allowed access to my entire apartment: to use my fully-equipped kitchen, living room and office are quite a value-added when you compare my low room rate to that of the much higher rate for an entire apartment, often times furnished with a lumpy bed, scratchy mismatched towels, and few luxuries of home. Hyde Park boasts some of the finest dining and entertainment venues in the city, as well as many outstanding parks, museums and festivals so there is always something cultural and exciting to do here.  Your evenings don't have to be spent staring at CSpan in some lousy hotel room -- join me instead!   If you're traveling to Chicago on business, this is the ideal alternative to another boring, overpriced hotel room in the Loop.  With easy access to Metra trains, CTA buses
description: Quiet, mature living in the heart of historic Hyde Park. Lush, crisp, fresh hotel linens and a goose-down mattress await in your guestroom of this centrally-located vintage garden apartment, with exposed brick & pipes for an authentic Chicago vibe. neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park is one of the safest and most diverse neighborhoods in the city!! Just one block away is 53rd Street, Hyde Park's oldest shopping district, lined with many small businesses and restaurants.  A10 Eatery and Bar, Pizza Capri, Chant Asian Fusion, Valois Cafeteria (our president's favorite breakfast spot), Five Guys Burgers, and Kilwin's Chocolate Shop are all great places to eat.  There's a cigar shop, a nail salon, and even a movie theater right there too -- or you can walk a couple more blocks or lto grab great Italian at Leona's, maybe a little Indian, scarf down some sushi, enjoy a frozen yogurt or pick out the fresh produce of your choice to have delivered (so you don't have to haul it all back with you).  Even a famous Harold's Fried Chicken is within walking distance.   I'm also walking distance to Harper Court, which extends north of 53rd Street along Harper Avenue.  It has a Chipotle, a Starbucks, Pork Chop, Ja' Grill, an LA Fitness Signature Club, an Ulta, many weekend
notes: I PROVIDE A CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST: rolls, croissants, or bagels; fresh fruit; cold cereal or hot oatmeal; coffee, tea, protein smoothies, or juice; and milk for your cereal.  If you want something more substantial, there's a French bakery and an American Diner both one block away that serve hot breakfasts. Also you're welcome to use my frying pans, pots etc. if you'd like to cook a hot meal of your own, but you'll need to go buy your own groceries at the market up the street.  THERE IS A SEVEN-POUND TOY POODLE ON THE PROPERTY.  She is very affectionate and will definitely want to sit in your lap -- as all lap dogs do when they like you.  If this is not something with which you are comfortable, then perhaps this may not be a comfortable stay for you.  If you like dogs however, you are going to LOVE her -- she's very well trained (only barks at intruders and is paper-trained for night-times and inclement weather), the best cuddler ever and will always happily greet you at the door!   PLE
transit: If the big city experience is more your thing, my home is only a few miles south of downtown Chicago (The Loop), and it's easily accessible by just about every method of transportation: GETTING HERE BY METRA Metra's Electric District Line can be boarded downtown at the Millennium Park, Van Buren Street, Museum Campus or McCormick Place stations for direct access to Hyde Park. Disembark at the 51st-53rd Street or 55th-56th-57th Street Station. The fare is about $3.75. On weekends, their $8 Weekend Pass is good for unlimited rides on all Metra lines. Estimated ride time to and from the loop: 10 minutes.  GETTING HERE BY CTA L and BUS I recommend you buy a 3-day unlimited rides pass for $20 if you plan to ride the bus and L frequently during your stay.   The Orange line L-train from Midway will get you to Roosevelt Station, where you can transfer to a bus or the Metra Electric outbound.  The Blue Line L-train from O'Hare will get you to the Daley Center; get off the train at Dearborn & Wa
access: PARKING Street parking is available on my block for free. Some of the surrounding blocks are metered so please be cognizant of where you're parking. If there are no immediate spots available, park in the Treasure Island/Walgreen's shopping center parking lot, located on the northwest corner of 55th and Lake Park. Find a spot near Potbelly's. It's only a 1/2-block walk to me from there; once a parking spot opens up on my street, you can then just move your car. The shopping center lot has patrolmen so your car will be very safe.  SECURITY Upon your arrival, please scroll through the courtyard's security box for my surname to gain access; this process will then be repeated for my building. Should either security box be out of order, I am available by cell phone.  KEYS You will be provided with your own key to access the apartment. Lost keys replacement charge: $50. Unruly guests will have their key privileges revoked. FINAL NOTES Drop me a line so we can chat and discuss your customized
interaction: I live in the apartment full-time and am readily available should you ever need me. I don't rent out any additional rooms to others.  Because my place is relatively intimate, I find guests who are comfortable being social and are not too introverted have been the happiest guests here. That doesn't mean you need to be a social butterfly -- we will interact as little or as much as you like. I enjoy a little privacy too, so we will work out a respectful balance. I want you to feel like you're staying with family -- your favorite Aunt, perhaps :) Please remember though that I actually live here on a day-to-day basis and my life does not get put on hold when I'm hosting. I have friends & family who will visit periodically. Of course, you're more than welcome to join us for a glass of wine, popcorn and a movie in the living room -- remember, while you're here, you're family too!  You may reach me by phone, text or iMessage in addition to the conversation options here on AirBnB if I am away f
house_rules: 1.Must like little lap-dogs, and be ok with mine sitting in your lap. 2.No street shoes in my home: please bring slippers or be prepared to go barefoot or in socks. 3.Please be quiet while in the courtyard and building lobby so as not to disturb my neighbors -- and don't let the gate slam. 4.If you need help, ask me -- not my neighbors.  Interaction with my neighbors is considered a nuisance by my landlord and is forbidden.  5.Please ensure the bathroom door stays closed during the overnight hours, to restrict the dog.  6.No heavy perfumes, heavy colognes or heavily scented lotions. 7.Visitors are negotiable (ask). 8.Convey your travel plans early: please be considerate and let me know as soon as possible what time you expect to arrive for check-in. It's not fair to expect me to sit here for hours awaiting your possible arrival. I have work, appointments to keep and errands to run, sometimes quite far from Hyde Park. To expect me to drop everything and drive (what can sometimes be an h
host_about:
Don't go to Chicago -- LIVE in Chicago! 

Bienvenue!! Ð½Ð° Ð·Ð´Ð¾Ñ€Ð¾Ð²'Ñ!  I am a friendly Ukrainian-Canadian who now lives in Chicago's historic Hyde Park district. I know the city well and love going on culinary field trips around our great city. Nothing makes me happier than discovering a new dining treasure or a big fat Polish dog from Maxwell Street at 3 in the morning!

I'm the mother of three adult children, a grandma, and a servant to my spoiled little poodle.  I enjoy a wide breadth of music, cultural festivals and dining at mom-and-pop restaurants.  I also enjoy curling up under a fluffy blanket with a good book and a cup of tea on my quiet down days.

I believe that hospitality is something we should offer to every person, every day. Hosting makes me happy. I genuinely enjoy getting to know each and every one of my guests who arrive as strangers and depart as friends. 

Be kind to one another. Safe travels!!

neighborhood_overview: The Hyde park neighborhood surrounds the University of Chicago and famous in some circles for having the most book stores per capita in the country.  Studded with old homes, the tree-lined streets are great places for walks to and from school. If youâ€™re looking for a great place to eat, check out Promontory or A10 on 53rd. For a more inexpensive option, we are fans of the Nile, a mediterranean restaurant on 55th. Beyond the university, make sure to check out the Science and Industry Museum at the north side of Jackson Park. Fans of the book Devil in the White City will note that this is the site of the  World's Columbian Exposition of 1893, and the setting for the iconic book.
transit: To get from Hyde Park to downtown, check out the Metra ($3 each way) or bus #2 or #6 ($2.50 each way).

summary: Beautiful, newly renovated 1900sq ft 4BR/2BA condo in a historic greystone building with in-unit washer/dryer and a generously equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Perfect for couples, families and business travelers, it's located in Chicago's historic Hyde Park neighborhood and within a few blocks of the UofC campus and hospital, restaurants, grocery stores, shops, public transportation and Obama's home. Easy access to the energy of downtown Chicago, Lake Shore Drive and all major highways.
space: This newly renovated condo consists of four bedrooms, two with queen-size beds and two with full-size beds, and two bathroomsâ€”one with a large two-person shower with pull-out showerhead and bench, and the other with a full tub and rain showerhead. The living room has a 48â€ flat-screen tv and a large sectional (pictured) that could sleep a 9th person comfortably. The kitchen is equipped with a refrigerator, range/oven, toaster oven, microwave, dishwasher, coffeemaker, cooking pans and utensils, dinnerware and silverware. The unit also features an in-unit high efficiency washer/dryer, wifi and cable. Towels and most toiletries (bring your own toothbrush) are provided. The closets have hangers so your clothes stay winkle free and an iron/ironing board for use during your stay just in case; rooms also have dressers with drawers ensuring ample room to unpack. A parking space is available to park a car in the back.

neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park, famously home to former President Obama and the University of Chicago, is one of the most diverse and historic neighborhoods in Chicago â€“ it rests on Lake Michigan and is bordered on the west and south by two of Chicago's largest public parks, all of which offer the areaâ€™s best walks and picnic places. Youâ€™ll love the neighborhoodâ€™s jaw-dropping architecture, tree-lined streets and plenty of restaurants, grocery stores, coffee bars, shopping and things to do in general, and a short Uber, bus or train ride from downtown Chicago and McCormick Place. Hyde Park has an artsy, hip vibe, a diverse mix of people and more Nobel Prizes per square kilometer than any other neighborhood on earth. It is residential and urban at once and gives you the best of both worlds.
notes: Please note the unit is not ADA/wheelchair accessible.

host_about:
Hi! I am a Ph.D. Student at The University of Chicago! I was a former social worker and educator through Teach for America. 

My current coursework as a PhD student keeps me very busy. As such, I am offering a new option to people looking for a more cost-effective option. Because I am typically in my apartment in the mornings and again in the evenings, I am offering the opportunity for people to stay in my bedroom in addition to having access to the rest of the apartment for a reduced night fee of $45. 

I hope this option allows people with limited budget the ability to afford a nice place to stay. 

In terms of myself, I am very laid back and easy going. I enjoy preparing meals and look forward to meeting different folks from all over the country. I have lived in 5 different cities over the course of the last 10 years - Miami, DC, Dallas, Ann Arbor, and now Chicago. In addition, I have spanned multiple careers - teacher - financial consultant, clinical social worker, researcher, and now PhD student. 

I feel sharing an apartment with me will be a unique experience.

neighborhood_overview: West Woodlawn is a neighborhood in the south of the Hyde Park township,  which surrounds the University of Chicago. Directly south of Washington Park,   it was an historical endpoint during the Great Migration.  Temperatures run cold in the winter,  occasionally hot in the summer.  ere are many amenities nearby. P.S. Since many people ask:  standard safety rules for any big city applies,  especially if you are unfamiliar.    The Hyde Park / Woodlawn area now has a very low crime rate in comparison to most of Chicago and other US cities.  Keep reading if you are concerned;  the most general rule of thumb I might offer,  is to avoid area directly west of Washington Park during late-night hours. There are notable changes of character at approximately south of 63rd,  and more seriously,  below 71st.  Significant gang activity is further south of 71st.   West of King Drive (approx. 3 blocks West of us) is also generally safe,  but there are small pockets that have seen violent incidents in
notes: I can offer help,  mostly via text messaging-- likely to be around,  or may be in meetings/occupied.  Hyde Park native, recently returned and reacquainting with Chicagoland. Last-minute bookings may require some time before check-in (2-4+ hours),  but we will attempt to accommodate as possible. We proudly employ physically and developmentally disabled individuals,  in partnership with local community projects.  We hope you will be understanding and patient should any issues arise.
transit: (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps now usually provides very accurate, up-to-date transit information and routing in Chicago,  as well as quick links to Uber and Lyft if needed.  This is probably the best way to know how to get to any destination in the Chicago area. We are within two blocks to Green Line (Chicago's CTA "L" elevated subway) stations (Cottage Grove recommended) ;  there are westward bus routes to the Red Line north and south of us on 61st and 63rd;  Metra,  South Shore and other commuter railroad stations are under a mile east;  there plenty of other buses;  Uber and Lyft plentiful and very cheap,  often around $1 for UberPools within Hyde Park.
access: First floor areas of house except other (private) bedrooms. Please let us know anything else you need!
interaction: We may be busy with projects,  but are generally around to work on the house (unless out of town on business).  As frequent travelers,  we'll do all we can to help you have a comfortable stay-- please let us know anything you need!
house_rules: Behave well,  treat the place as your own,  leave things *as you found them* and *where you found them.*   Generally clean up after yourself as you can; dishes should be done soon or placed in dishwasher; we realize short-term guests may be on tight schedules and we'll take care of things,  but for stays more than 5 days,  please take out the trash occasionally etc. We usually consider 11pm-11am or so to be quiet-ish hours-- we may be working late on a project,  we may get up very early,  we may be up after noon.  We'll be very aware and respectful of noise during these times,  and hope you will be as well.  (Let us know if you have specific plans that require adjustment). No drama,  keep it cool and reasonable. For your security and ours,  we have recently installed video security monitoring devices in exterior and interior public areas. Completed in 1927, the building reflects classic Gothic style and Romantic views of the middle ages. Safe neighborhood close to Little India, and Loyola and Northwestern Universities.

neighborhood_overview: Situated in the vibrant heart of Rogers Park, a safe and walkable residential neighborhood (as asserted by Chicago Tribune and Walk Score), you can enjoy the eclectic urban mix of university students, young-professionals, old hippies and new immigrants. Whether you are looking for fine dining or a casual local establishment, you will find it among the 130 restaurants that call Rogers Park home.  Returning to my apartment is an experience as the entire block consists of medieval-style castles, landmarks and historic mansions.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSIT / TRANSPORTATION: Between the bus and â€œL," there are great public transportation options in the area. Both the Jarvis or Howard "L" stations (Red/Purple/Yellow lines) are within six to eight blocks of the castle and will have you in the Loop (downtown Chicago) in about thirty minutes, or in Evanston in about ten minutes. Additionally, the buses stop just a short distance from the apartment. Options abound!  â€¢ For a 30-min ride to the Loop use the Purple Line from nearby Howard station. The Purple Line (or the Evanston Line) runs express from Howard Station to Belmont Station in Lakeview, and then makes local stops to the Loop. It is a panoramic "L" train with elevated tracks that runs completely above ground, which zigzags its way through the neighborhoods of Lincoln Park and Near North Side. When at the Loop downtown, a stop is made at the Merchandise Mart before crossing the Chicago River on the upper level of the Wells Street Bridge, then joining amazing elevated pano
access: There is no moat to cross at this castle! Self check in is available for your convenience and instructions will be provided. Spaces are cleaned before arrival, fresh linens, toiletries and towels are included. Please refer to my Guidebook for transportation, groceries, restaurants, entertainment, nightlife and recreation nearby. You are sharing common areas with other Airbnb guests (bathroom, kitchen and living room).  This home provides you with free Wi-Fi all over Chicago! You will have access to a network of hotspots that keep you connected to the Internet around town at WiFi-level speeds through thousands of hotspots in businesses, homes and outdoor locations!
house_rules: â€¢ Street Parking Only â€¢ Do not open the door for anyone â€¢ Please no shoes in the house, thanks! â€¢ Quiet time is 9PM â€¢ Do not disturb neighbors or manager â€¢ One set of keys per booking: thank you! â€¢ Unexpected extra guests not admitted â€¢ No smoking in building common areas â€¢ Bookings through Airbnb only â€¢ Mail or delivery unavailable â€¢ Building's parking is not for guests â€¢ Please leave A/C off when not at home â€¢ Trash disposal located behind building â€¢ Please take trash out at daytime only â€¢ No oil down the kitchen sink â€¢ No paper or tampons down the toilet
host_about:
Airbnb has been a wonderful experience! I'm truly grateful to have the opportunity to welcome so many amazing participants from all over the world. Ensuring they have an amazing time brings me great satisfaction.

I'm a Chicago-based music producer and a certified ESL teacher also able to communicate in fluent Spanish, basic Portuguese and basic Italian. In between working in the studio and traveling when needed, I enjoy interacting with other music enthusiasts, visitors and colleagues in the city!

neighborhood_overview: We marry the joy of a residential neighborhood with the easy access to all the city has to offer. Our quiet, tree-lined street faces a park filled with families and league games, but we're just a couple blocks from a bustling CTA station that quickly whisks you away to Wrigley Field, Millennium/Grant Park, the Museum Campus, and everything else that the Second City has to offer.
notes: This is a garden flat, so watch your head! The ceilings are a bit low, so please feel free to inquire if you have height concern.
transit: No matter where you're going, you can get there from here. A few blocks from the CTA's Red, Purple, and Yellow lines, as well as over a dozen CTA and PACE bus line stops. A couple blocks further, and you can quickly jump on the Metra to downtown, or all the way up to WI. Taxis are aplenty, and Uber can be here in minutes.  Our neighborhood abounds with street parking. It helps to be comfortable with parallel parking.

neighborhood_overview: Unique dining, arts, culture and entertainment found in Rogers Park are never too far away. And the sound of waves crashing along the shores is near as well, as nearly all the streets leading you east end at public beaches and parkland on Lake Michigan. The Rogers Park neighborhood holds another distinction: it is considered one of the most diverse in Chicago. As a home to people from all over the world, there is no single dominant ethnicity but rather its residents speak nearly 40 different languages and hail from over 80 countries. Glenwood Avenue Arts District and Jarvis Square tout a robust theater scene and lively music clubs, as well as galleries and studios, coffee shops and late-night dive bars.
notes: If you would like to stay longer than 5 days, please email me! You do not have to tend to my cat. Everything he has is automated. If you would like to stay in my place without him, please contact me. Arrangements for him can be made!
transit: A 5 min walk to both the Loyola and Morse redline stop. Uber, and taxi cabs riding within the neighborhood. There are zip car ports less than a 5 min walk way.
access: You will enter through the front door. The entrance is secured, so don't forget the key if you have to run out to your car.
interaction: If you need to get in contact with me during your stay, you can reach me anytime of the day on my cell phone.

name: Great 1B Steps from Beach :)
space: This is a nice, large one bedroom apartment in Chicago steps from the beach, a running track, entertainment, restaurants, and very close to Evanston (a prominent, wealthy surburb) and all modes of public transport, convenient to get anywhere in Chicago.  - A very nice and eclectic neighborhood; walk to the lake at will. Lot of restaurants and bars on Sheridan, live and movie theatres too, about a min of walk. - A 5 min walk to the Loyola red line stop; get anywhere in Chicago conveniently. (If you are a Northwestern student, the NU shuttle is pretty close and convenient). - The apartment has a spacious living space, dining room, many windows and plenty of light, and a full kitchen and bath. - Street parking is available in the neighborhood. - Hi-Speed Wireless Internet is available. - No dogs or cats.  Other animals require a deposit tbd. - No smoking. - You will have the apartment to yourself, keep it clean. - Coin Laundry is available conveniently downstairs for the building

host_about: I am a professional actress who has traveled the world performing.  I love to tumble out of bed in the mornings to run at the running track close by, or take a stroll by the beach. I love animals, sunshine, John Lennon, and people.  I have traveled to Australia, Singapore, South Korea, Africa, and Europe, thankfully all for work. I feel really lucky to live this life, and am certain that "life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans."  Welcome to my humble home.  Enjoy :)

name: Lovejoy Home Floor 1, a chill 2BD, 1 BA Treasure
summary: Rent this 2 bedroom space with your own bathroom, dining, living room and kitchen. I live upstairs and be available to help you with suggestions of what to do in Chicago and how to get around. Experience Chicago in a cozy, homey, safe place. There's a Mac computer, fast Wifi and a large TV with netflix/amazon video. There are many books and comforts of home. There's plenty of free parking right in front. CTA trains and buses make getting around easy.
space: Built in 1922, local Chicago builders designed a historical Dutch barn shaped building with local materials. I transformed this existing building into an oasis of environmentally friendly lifestyle. Modern renovations include: Triple pane windows, all electric hot water heating system for maximum hot showers, electricity is sourced from wind, bookshelves and comfy amenities make staying at the Lovejoy an exceptional experience.  I live in the house and am ready to assist you with recommendations on enjoying your stay in Chicago. You'll also get peaceful urban ambiance on this quiet neighborhood street. The Jefferson Park transit center is a 12 minute walk (or 4 minute bus ride) and can get you around Chicago fast! There is a garden with white roses, peonies, rhubarb, tomatoes and more in season. You may hear birds singing in the morning. Lila the cat lives upstairs but your apartment is pet-free unless your small dog or cat is a traveling companion.

I live in the house and am ready to assist you with recommendations on enjoying your stay in Chicago. You'll als
neighborhood_overview: I love the history of the Jefferson Park community and how close it is to the Forest Preserves of Cook County and the transportation that makes it a breeze to move around the city. This neighborhood is home to many Chicago cops and firefighters. This is a safe place, close to the urban forests and connected to public transit. The Lovejoy Dojo Floor 1 is your home for centering and grounding.
notes: If there's anything special you need during your stay, just let me know!
transit: Yes, Blue Line Jefferson Park, Gladstone Park Metra, Forest Glen Metra, Milwaukee Bus, Foster Bus, Central Bus, free street parking and two major expressways 90/94. It's easy to get to a Sox game from the Lovejoy Farm. We are a ten minute walk to the Jefferson Park Transit center where you catch the blue line towards forest park for $2.25 a person. Then get off at the Jackson stop and follow signs transfer to the red line towards 95th. You'll see signs for the Sox stadium stop.  The walk to Forest Glen metra is safe and residential. Mariano's is a grocery store right next to the train station. There are schools nearby and it's a nice walk. The neighborhood is fairly quiet for good walking. Find schedules by searching for CTA bus tracker and Metra rail.
access: Full kitchen, dishwasher, living room, dining room, wireless internet, soap, linens, books, couch, backyard porch and garden (help yourself to anything in season!) You are welcome to spend time on the back porch and in the back yard. Please ask us before starting the fire pit or a grill.
interaction: Feel free to follow your own journey and message through the Airbnb messaging system when you have any questions. I'm happy to socialize with you and also respect your privacy and time.
house_rules: Guest are expected to be respectful of the neighbors. Please put all trash and recycling in designated containers. Be quiet after 11pm. No tobacco smoking is permitted inside, but you are welcome to partake on the porch.  Check out is easy. Clean up, take the garbage out to the back porch, wash dishes, pile up used linens and towels on the floor. Lock the doors.
host_about:
I love designing living spaces. I'm fascinated by urban agriculture and social cultures. I first started traveling on Airbnb up and down the coast of California. Now, I enjoy meeting new people and socializing through Airbnb. I've met many great friends through the hosting experience. I like showing Chicago to new people and giving recommendations on what to do around town. 
Books, movies, vegetarian food, clean water, indoor plumbing are a few things I couldn't live without. :)

I support responsible home sharing rights and hosting education through Keep Chicago Livable.

name: Lovely 2 Bedroom Apartment
summary: Explore Chicago from the comfort of a bright and neat apartment in one of the safest parts of the city! Feel at home with your own private living area and kitchenette. We love to have guests and strive to exceed expectations! Free Wi-Fi and parking.
space: Located in a very safe and quiet neighborhood, the basement apartment is well lit and comfortable.  There are two bedrooms with two twin beds in each. If you make a booking for 2 guests, I will assume that you are only using one bedroom unless you tell me otherwise. If you need both bedrooms for a 2 person reservation you must tell me beforehand so that I can prepare both rooms.  We can set up an Air Mattress in the living room and/or a Pack in Play for babies or toddlers in any of the rooms.  There is FAST WIFI! Basic kitchen utensils and plastic-ware are provided. Kitchen consists of fridge/freezer in living room and electric oven, microwave oven, stove, coffee maker and hot water kettle and sink in laundry area. It is basic but fully functional.

neighborhood_overview: Great park just one block away. The apartment is located in Peterson Park area of the city, known as a quiet and very safe neighborhood. The Lincoln Cafe close by and provides delicious kosher breakfast choices to go.
notes: I have young children who wake up at 7AM :(  They sometimes go to our main floor and run around, despite my best efforts. If you are a light sleeper, this may wake you up.
transit: This apartment is ideal for people with cars but can also be used without one. Plenty of free parking available in front of the house and right nearby. Close to mass transit. You can get to most places in the city in around an hour via public transportation. The closest cta train stop is accessible by a 8 minute walk followed by a 7 minute bus ride. We are just 20 to 25 minutes by car from O'Hare airport and by Uber it can be 16 to 24 dollars.
access: Separate side entrance to the apartment provides privacy and comfort. Washer Dryer is shared by us and someone may come down between 12pm and 5pm Monday to Thursday and 9am and 5pm on Friday to use it. Otherwise the entire apartment is exclusively for guests. We have two storage rooms located near the apartment and on rare occasions need to access. We communicate with guests before going to the storage rooms.
interaction: I'd be happy to share with you any information you need. I would be happy to tell you about my favorite places to hang out, tour and eat.
house_rules: No loud noise, smoking or pets allowed. Only airbnb guests allowed on premises. No guests of guests allowed. Only the number of guests specified in the reservation allowed, unless otherwise agreed upon.
host_about:
I am a young Rabbi trying to change the world by making quality education more available. My wife and I love it when our home is full of guests. We have two young children who are just adorable. In June 2014 I asked a friend in New York if I could stay at his place. He had no extra space but suggested that I use Airbnb. That gave me an idea. Many of our guests had commented on how much they loved staying in our basement apartment. It is clean and comfy. Why not rent it on Airbnb when we have no guests? 
And here we are today. I hope that it works for you!

Shmuel

neighborhood_overview: Since the 1970s, Albany Park has been a point of entry for immigrants from Asia and Latin America. As one of Chicago's most ethnically diverse neighborhoods, it boasts an unmatched array of multicultural restaurants, including local favorite Noon-O-Kabab and the celebrated falafel of Semiramis. Along the Lawrence Avenue corridor, you will discover independently-owned grocery stores, delicious Korean cuisine and a collection of highly regarded Middle Eastern and Mexican restaurants. But Albany Park is more than delicious Pad Thai and perfectly roasted kabobs. This charming community vaunts year-round musical and stage performances by the Albany Park Theater Project.
notes: Keep in mind that I do own a dog, but she will not be around during your stay. This is a dog friendly apartment so if, you are allergic to dogs your allergies may want be aware of that
transit: I live very close to the Kimball brown line station, which connects to pretty much any other train line to get anywhere in the city.
access: When you book you will have access to the entire apartment. I will not be in the apartment during your stay, so you may sleep in the bedroom if desired.
interaction: I will not be in the apartment during your stay, but I will be available to answer any questions you may have.

name: The Bee Room
summary: Come enjoy a stay in a four-poster bed in a big, sunny private room and bathroom (!) in a new condo in what Wikipedia calls one of the most ethnically diverse neighborhoods in the US. And couldn't be closer to public transit if you tried.
space: The Bee Room is private room with an adjacent private bathroom. I've got a bathroom in my room that I'll use during your stay so you can feel free to spread out.  The neighborhood is vibrant and active round the clock, but the space is quite quiet and comfortable.
description: Come enjoy a stay in a four-poster bed in a big, sunny private room and bathroom (!) in a new condo in what Wikipedia calls one of the most ethnically diverse neighborhoods in the US. And couldn't be closer to public transit if you tried. The Bee Room is private room with an adjacent private bathroom. I've got a bathroom in my room that I'll use during your stay so you can feel free to spread out.  The neighborhood is vibrant and active round the clock, but the space is quite quiet and comfortable. In addition to the Bee Room, closet, and bathroom, the kitchen, dining room, and living room/TV are all available to you, as well as a deck out back when the weather's nice. I have laundry in unit, just let me know if you intend to use it and I'll make sure it's empty. I am happy to help you navigate your way around and provide recommendations for your stay but I'm also more than happy to leave you to your own devices. My schedule puts me out and about most of the day, but I'm always availab
neighborhood_overview: Albany Park is an incredibly diverse, vibrant, eclectic neighborhood with something for everyone. While we're not known as a big "bar/nightlife" neighborhood, our excellent position on the public transit grid will get you around the city in no time. AP is a great example of a true "Chicago neighborhood": you can spend the day out and about and after, come retreat to the relative quiet of the Bee Room.
transit: With three major transit lines converging at my intersection, you can really get anywhere and anything that Chicago has to offer. Of the three transit lines that converge in Albany Park, two run well into the night and the third runs 24 hours. You can take the Brown line to downtown Chicago in about 40 minutes or connect to the Orange line to Midway Airport. The #81 Lawrence bus runs 24 hours and  connects to the Blue line for easy O'Hare transport. Cabs and Ubers are plentiful around the clock. Street parking isn't the best, but it's manageable. Watch out for side streets with permit parking. Most all major Chicago attractions and landmarks (performance venues, stadiums, universities, museums) are accessible via a $2.25 'L' train ride with easy and usually free transfers between lines. Street parking isn't terribly easy, but it is possible (I do it every day without a special permit). If you're planning to drive in Chicago, let me know and I will make sure to explain all your options
access: In addition to the Bee Room, closet, and bathroom, the kitchen, dining room, and living room/TV are all available to you, as well as a deck out back when the weather's nice. I have laundry in unit, just let me know if you intend to use it and I'll make sure it's empty.
interaction: I am happy to help you navigate your way around and provide recommendations for your stay but I'm also more than happy to leave you to your own devices. My schedule puts me out and about most of the day, but I'm always available via text message, email, or phone call. I'm a night owl with evening hours so unless I'm headed out the door to work, I'm most likely going to sleep through the morning. I don't mind if you're up and about in the morning, just so long as it's not too loud!
house_rules: As long as you generally leave the place how you find it, then I'm a pretty happy camper. Smokers welcome on the back deck.

name: Lovely private room in Rogers Park
summary: After having spent 24 years in Paris, my apartment definitely has a bit of a French flair ! It's both formal and informal, with a lovely living room in the front and a more casual family room near the guest room that you are more than welcome to use for yourself. There's a back entrance to the kitchen as well which gives you more privacy.  I'm not far from Northwestern and Loyola universities, and it takes about 15 minutes by car to get to the heart of the city (typically $4-$8 uber pool).
space: There is public transportation to the center of Chicago which is fairly easy as there is a bus at the end of my street, a block and three buildings away that takes one to the Red Line which is direct. With that said, I now only take Uber pool or Lyft Line and depending on the time of the day, I can get downtown for as little as $3.75 or say about $5+. It usually takes about 20-25 minutes, sometimes less. Last night at 7 pm, on St. Patrick's Day, I was in center of city and wanted Uber to get home and incredibly, they asked for $17.00! I had never seen that kind of pricing, so I waited and tried again 40 minutes later and got home for $5.50! Worth the wait,I should say! I tell all of my friends about Uber pool and those that were taking public transportation now prefer door-to-door at unbeatable prices and time-saving.

neighborhood_overview: I am located approximately four blocks from Devon Avenue to the north which is Chicagoland's destination for Indian food. It is amazing and great fun! People come from all over Chicago and elsewhere just to go there. If guests have a car, there is wonderful shopping no more than 10 minutes away on W. Touchy Avenue, not to mention a Nordstrom's, Lord and Taylor, Macy's, Bloomingdales, movie theaters etc via the expressway which takes no more than about 12-15 minutes at the most. If guests want to cook at home, around there corner, there is Aldi's- a very inexpensive grocery store the now offers organic foods!
notes: There is a wonderful park at the end of the street-great for walking-a Bank of America, a Byline Bank, a Walgreens two blocks away along with a Potbelly and Chipotle, as well as a very famous Chicago hot-dog stand. I am not far from Northwestern University or Loyola University or Lake Michigan!
transit: Parking is easy during the day on the street in front. At night, I can arrange, if I am not using my car, to park on the street and then when guests come home, I can give them that space and move to my garage. Otherwise there is always parking at night a little over a block away.
access: For the most part, all spaces are accessible except my own bedroom, of course, and, at times, my living room as I entertain there.  But there is no real backyard!  Just backstairs... . A great park for walking or just sitting is a little of a block away!
interaction: I am very happy to help my guests navigate the Chicagoland area. I am also a realtor with Coldwell Banker so I am sure that I can be of help.
house_rules: It would be helpful to me to know the genders of my guests so I could prepare for them accordingly.
host_about: Hi ! I've recently moved into this wonderful home after several years in the Chicago suburbs. I spent 24 years in Paris so my place has many touches of France, including some great French books! I love being active in the cultural fabric of the city and would be happy to help guests figure out the best things to do in the city. I love hosting people, and am so happy to have the perfect extra bedroom to accommodate travelers.

access: Guests have access to their sleeping space.  Until 10 PM, guests are free to use the common area living room.  The kitchens and bathrooms on both floors are available for guests on either floor to use.
interaction: I am typically around most of the time.  If not, I am generally still available by text.  Iâ€™ve often gone out downtown with guests and routinely bring guests on mystery shops with me. house_rules: Please message us on arrival. Quiet time is after 10pm unless there are no guests trying to sleep/they don't care. name: 7min walk to train, Sunny, Clean, Cozy, Comfy bed!
summary: This room offers you a clean, quiet and calm space to recharge after a busy day exploring the city.  We are conveniently situated close to public transit, 7 min walk to the Western Blue Line EL station and numerous bus routes, Divvy bike stations, restaurants, parks, cafes, bars and shops.
space: Our home is cozy, sunny, clean place of respite.  I am a co-host with my partner (also named Justin). We invite you to stay with us, explore, relax or work.  The bedroom is east and south facing with exceptional views of the Chicago skyline.  The room is equipped with a comfortable full sized memory foam mattress, drop leaf table that can be opened to create a desk area, night stand, lamp, small lighted vanity mirror, bookcase and private closet with hangers. The unit is located on the 4th floor of a walk up building.

The unit is located on the 4th floor of a walk up building. You have access to the kitchen, bathroom, paid laundry facilities with washers and dryers. Feel free to relax in living room and watch TV (Netflix, HBO GO). We really want you to feel a
neighborhood_overview: Living on the border of few neighborhoods (Logan Square, Bucktown, Wicker Park, and Humboldt Park) gives you the chance to explore a very diverse and culturally rich area of Chicago. Here you will find a variety of cultures, foods, and shops from Cuban to Macanese to great Ramen.  This area is about branching out, understanding the local culture of residents, promoting sustainable solutions and slightly off-mainstream habits.
notes: Most points of interest are within walking distance,  a short bike, bus or train ride away. You can be downtown in 20 - 25 mins via EL train.  We are a 2 min walk from a grocery store with global food staples, many of which are organic. They also have a great selection of wine, spirits, and beer (many of which from local Chicago breweries) Walk score: 95
transit: We are closest to the Western - Blue Line station (a 7' min walk) which connects directly to O'Hare Airport. The train ride from O'hare to the Western station is approximately 30 mins. We are also near several bus lines, and Divvy bike stations.  Coming from Midway Airport, involves a transfer from the Orange Line to the Blue Line. There is free (non-permit) parking on our street.
access: You have access to the kitchen, bathroom, paid laundry facilities with washers and dryers. Feel free to relax in living room and watch TV (Netflix, HBO GO). We really want you to feel at home! Concerning check-in and check-out times we do like to be flexible, however it's totally dependent on our schedules and the availability of the room. If a special check-in and/or check-out time is required outside of the posted check-in and check-out times please let us know as soon as you are able.
interaction: We are both pretty easy going guys. We both work and are typically busy with activities outside of the apartment, especially during the warmer months. We are here for you, will interact and assist as little or as much as possible. We understand every guest is looking for something different out of their Airbnb experience, and we try to be sensitive to those expectations. We are engaging while being mindful of your privacy. If you need recommendations for where to eat or drink in our area, feel free to pick our brains. We love our neighborhood and have explored pretty much every nook and cranny and take pleasure in passing this knowledge on to our guests.
house_rules: -Remove shoes before entering the apartment.  -Avoid slamming bedroom and bathroom doors. The doors are solid wood -Quiet hours are between 10 PM and 9 AM. You are welcome to stay out as late as you desire, we just ask that you are quiet and mindful of no
host_about: Currently back on the northwest side of Chicago in the Logan Square / Bucktown neighbourhood.  Flaneur, polyglot, linguaphile, neophile, avid cyclist, amateur cook and gardener.  I like exploring new places, people and ideas and seek ways to challenge myself as a citizen of the world.

summary: Three bedroom apartment, located at Armitage and Kedzie Avenues in Chicago's VERY trendy Logan Square neighborhood.   Plenty of bars/restaurants/cafes within walking distance, including Scofflaw, Giant, Park & Field, Cemitas, Parsons, Damn Fine Coffee, and many MANY more!   Divvy bike rental is 2 blocks away, as well as Chicago's elevated 606 walking/biking trail.  Living room overlooks the street with tons of nightlife.  Bus stop right outside.  CTA train is a twelve minute walk.  Uber is easy.

notes: There are two cats in the apartment, so guests must be pet friendly! Because I live so close to the train there is some noise that comes into the apartment throughout the day. name: Logan Square - Bright 2 Bedroom Apt
summary: Located in  West Logan Square close to the new 606 Elevated Park/Trail.  Relax and enjoy our great city in this cozy, classic Chicago style apartment. This private apartment is on the second floor of a 2-Flat building on a quiet neighborhood street.
space: This 2 bedroom apartment that is the perfect way to visit our amazing city! It's located on a tree lined street in West Logan Square .  It's the perfect place to relax after exploring Chicago all day.  One bedroom is a queen bed, and the second bedroom has a full bed, there is also an air mattress available for extra guests.  There is 1 full bathroom and a full kitchen.
description: Located in  West Logan Square close to the new 606 Elevated Park/Trail.  Relax and enjoy our great city in this cozy, classic Chicago style apartment. This private apartment is on the second floor of a 2-Flat building on a quiet neighborhood street. This 2 bedroom apartment that is the perfect way to visit our amazing city! It's located on a tree lined street in West Logan Square .  It's the perfect place to relax after exploring Chicago all day.  One bedroom is a queen bed, and the second bedroom has a full bed, there is also an air mattress available for extra guests.  There is 1 full bathroom and a full kitchen. The apartment is the second floor of a 2-Flat building.  Guests have access to the entire apartment during their stay as well as the outdoor space and backyard. There is minimal interaction with guests- only to provide them with keys or resolve any issues during the stay. Flexible check-in/check-out can usually be arranged in advance. The keys will either be provided in pers
neighborhood_overview: This place is perfect for someone looking to explore one of Chicago's most eclectic, trendy neighborhoods. The nightlife of Logan Square is an eclectic mix of quirky pubs and Prohibition-era themed bars. Logan Square also contains a wide variety of restaurants, shops and an auditorium which regularly offers musical entertainment. The neighborhood is also home to the Logan Square Boulevards National Historic District, which boasts a spectacular collection of old greystone homes. Logan Square is a vibrant and multicultural neighborhood which is affordable, has easy access to public transportation, trendy shops and a wide mix of interesting options, which make it a popular attraction for people from all walks of life. Three blocks south is the 606 which is an old rail-way given new life as a running/bike path. Something awesome to note, this apartment is: 1 block from Rosa's Lounge, one of Chicago's best hidden gems. A longtime family-owned neighborhood club where both traditional & moder
notes: Chicago is a great place to visit and our hope is that you will enjoy the city as much as we do! Whatever we can do to make your Chicago trip more enjoyable, please let us know and call with any questions or requests...We're happy to make personal recommendations- just ask! Happy travels!
transit: We are one block away from 2 different major bus lines that connect to either the Blue or Brown line trains.  We also recommend using Uber or Lyft, it is a very efficient and cheap way to get around.  You can get anywhere around Logan Square for about $5 and almost anywhere in Chicago for $20.  If you don't already have Uber or Lyft let us know, if we refer you we both win with free credits!
access: The apartment is the second floor of a 2-Flat building.  Guests have access to the entire apartment during their stay as well as the outdoor space and backyard.
interaction: There is minimal interaction with guests- only to provide them with keys or resolve any issues during the stay. Flexible check-in/check-out can usually be arranged in advance. The keys will either be provided in person or by lock box. We will send you information including house instructions & tips prior to your trip. This will also provide neighborhood info including some of our personal favorite restaurants and hangouts, as well as a map of the nearest subway and bus lines. Of course you can always text/email/or call if you have questions during your stay.
house_rules: It is located in a family neighborhood so please be respectful of the neighbors and keep the outside noise to a minimum. -No pets -No smoking inside
host_about:
Katie:  I'm a midwest mutt (lived all over) but have found Chicago to be home for the past 8 years. I'm a former 2nd grade teacher turned educational recruiter (but will eventually find my way back to the classroom). During my spare time I try to go on as many adventures as possible whether locally or far away. I am also an avid runner, instagrammer, bike lover and DIY enthusiast. My dream is to write and publish a young adult novel. 

Dan: I'm a former Navy submariner and current consultant with dreams of leaving it all to travel the world by sailboat.  Originally from Salt Lake City, I love the outdoors especially skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and of course sailing.  For my next adventure I hope to travel to South America so that I can say that I've been on all the continents (except Antarctica...)

Together: After we met we quickly bonded over traveling, cycling, and our cat allergies. Hosting on Airbnb has been great because we get to meet so many people which have led us to adding destinations to our bucket list.

summary: Great room in spacious 2-bedroom apartment. Short walk to the Western L (blue line) and right in the midst of Wicker / Logan Square / Bucktown bars, shopping, and great restaurants! Easy to get to the airport and a few stops from downtown.
space: Large living space and kitchen, with big kitchen table if you need to cook or work.  Full size bed in the guest bedroom. Parking spot in the back reserved for guests.
description: Great room in spacious 2-bedroom apartment. Short walk to the Western L (blue line) and right in the midst of Wicker / Logan Square / Bucktown bars, shopping, and great restaurants! Excellent bars and restaurants in every direction, great dining within walking distance, one of the best coffee shops in all of Chicago right across the street (#coffeesnob)...Pretty much anything you could be looking for is close. 3 minute walk to the Western Blue Line, which runs straight from O'hare and straight into downtown. host_about:
Hello!

I enjoy experiencing different cultures, cities, architecture, FOOD and meeting new people.  In my free time I'm into exploring, running, music / seeing concerts, and I work for Superfly (the company that puts on Bonnaroo and Outside Lands).

I have traveled to and through Australia, Asia, the South Pacific, Canada, Mexico, Central America, South America and Europe, can cook some epic Indian dishes and always pick Toad in MarioKart. Now you know. 

Oh, I also love Chicago and being a pseudo tour guide. Feel free to ask me for recommendations.

name: 3 br in the heart of Logan Square
summary: Entire apartment in the middle of Logan Square. A short 3 minute walk to the California Blue Line station (~35 minutes by train to the Airport). Steps from the best bars and restaurants in the neighborhood! Sleeps 6 in beds.
space: This is a bright and sunny 2nd floor apartment with separate living and dining rooms. It has 3 bedrooms, two with double beds, and one with a bunkbed with twin mattresses. The kitchen is made and outfitted for people who like to cook. There is a beautiful front balcony with table and chairs right off one of the bedrooms. Have fun and treat the place like you would your own home -- but please, no parties. Be respectful of my neighbors when coming and going. ** AC Update ** I've installed window units in the back two bedrooms, and a larger unit in the living room next to the front bedroom. I've also bought additional fans, and there are ceiling fans in each room. It stayed quite cool even on the latest 90 degree day.
description: Entire apartment in the middle of Logan Square. A short 3 minute walk to the California Blue Line station (~35 minutes by train to the Airport). Steps from the best bars and restaurants in the neighborhood! Sleeps 6 in beds. This is a bright and sunny 2nd floor apartment with separate living and dining rooms. It has 3 bedrooms, two with double beds, and one with a bunkbed with twin mattresses. The kitchen is made and outfitted for people who like to cook. There is a beautiful front balcony with table and chairs right off one of the bedrooms. Have fun and treat the place like you would your own home -- but please, no parties. Be respectful of my neighbors when coming and going. ** AC Update ** I've installed window units in the back two bedrooms, and a larger unit in the living room next to the front bedroom. I've also bought additional fans, and there are ceiling fans in each room. It stayed quite cool even on the latest 90 degree day. The whole second floor is yours, but please stay o
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is beautiful and lots of fun. There are numerous bars, restaurants, and coffee shops all within walking distance. On the weekends, stretches of Milwaukee avenue are packed with people going out for the night -- but my block is quiet and residential!
notes: I live next to a post office, the 2nd floor is much quieter than the first, but you may hear some noise from the mail trucks (and mail carriers). They don't really get started til 10am+ and then only for about an hour before they leave for the day. It's never been a problem for me, but I'll leave some earplugs upstairs just in case.
transit: I am literally less than a 5 minute walk from the California stop on the Blue Line -- which goes straight to O'Hare airport in about 35 minutes and downtown in 15. I'm also right next to 3 different bus lines (56, 74, 52). Cabs are plentiful and an Uber is never more than 5 minutes away. The neighborhood is great for walking and there is a Divvy bike stand around the corner. Free on-street parking is almost always available within a few blocks radius -- you do need a permit, so just let me know and I'll leave some out for you!
access: The whole second floor is yours, but please stay off the front balcony after 10pm.
interaction: I live in the apartment on the first floor, so I'll be available if you need anything or want some recommendations on places to go in there area. Otherwise, you probably won't see me!
house_rules: Please treat the space as you would treat your own house. It's a residential neighborhood, so keep that in mind. Have fun, invite people over, but PLEASE be respectful of the neighbors -- keep it quiet and INSIDE after 10pm. There is no smoking in the house, but you can smoke in the enclosed back porch off the kitchen. Pets are usually not a problem, but please double check before booking. Anyone under 21 needs to be accompanied by a parent or guardian!
host_about: 30ish professional (or at least pretending to be), living in Logan Square, Chicago.

The gig economy is booming and I love that Airbnb offers choice and competition in the market! I have a hunger for knowledge I keep alive by reading, using my Smithsonian App (get it! It's amazing), and meeting new and interesting people in different fields. I have a passion for travel and Thailand is on the top of my bucket list. Having me as a guest, you can expect respect and quiet. Having me as a host, you can expect to be spoiled with goodies and to be accommodating.

name: New Lofted 2nd Floor Apartment
summary: My place is close to Logan Hardware, Ipsento Coffee, Revolution Brewing, The Boiler Room, Pequod's Pizza, The Chicago Diner: Logan Square, Margie's Candies, Cafe Mustache, the Blue Line, the Highway, Downtown, Logan Square, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park, Lincoln Park, Bucktown. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the location, the people, delicious local restaurants, easy commute, free parking. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
space: Hello Travelers! Welcome to our brand new loft in the city. This is a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom space with an attic loft. There is a full bed in the bedroom, two twin beds and a queen size floor mattress in the loft, and a futon that sleeps one. This is an upstairs unit located on Western Ave., so there is some noise from the street. But if you're looking for a city apartment that's in the middle of it all, this is the one! There is free parking on Western Ave., also the Blue Line Western stop is just a few blocks south. This is the train that runs from O'hare Airport all the way downtown. If you're driving, Kennedy Expressway 94 is just 2 blocks north, off the Fullerton exit. You will have your own secure passcode to enter, and we live only 20 minutes away. The apartment is brand new and comes with stainless steel appliances, a rainfall shower head, and a unique loft space. My husband and I designed and built this unit. We hope you enjoy this simple, no fuss place that's so close to it al
description: My place is close to Logan Hardware, Ipsento Coffee, Revolution Brewing, The Boiler Room, Pequod's Pizza, The Chicago Diner: Logan Square, Margie's Candies, Cafe Mustache, the Blue Line, the Highway, Downtown, Logan Square, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park, Lincoln Park, Bucktown. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the location, the people, delicious local restaurants, easy commute, free parking. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). Hello Travelers! Welcome to our brand new loft in the city. This is a 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom space with an attic loft. There is a full bed in the bedroom, two twin beds and a queen size floor mattress in the loft, and a futon that sleeps one. This is an upstairs unit located on Western Ave., so there is some noise from the street. But if you're looking for a city apartment that's in the middle of it all, this is the one! There is free parking on Western Ave., also the Blue Line Western stop is just a few blocks
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located right between Logan Square and Bucktown, Avondale, Wicker Park, Humbolt Park, and Lincoln Park are just a few blocks away!
notes: The apartment is on Western Ave., which is a bustling street and can get noisy, especially with the windows open. It does quiet down at night. The unit sits on top of a storefront that we are slowly renovating, so the windows are taped up. My in-laws also live in the downstairs back unit, so don't be startled if you see two old Asian people coming in and out of the storefront! Also, the building was built in 1887 and used to be a Mexican Fruit and Meat store.
transit: The Blue line Western stop is just a few blocks south (10 minute walk), this will get you downtown in 10 minutes and also to O'hare Airport in 40 minutes. A stop before and after Western will get you in central Logan Square or Wicker Park. Lots of shopping and nightlife in either places. The Kennedy Expressway 94 is just a few blocks the other direction, and without traffic will get you downtown in 5 minutes. There are also many busses that can take you where you want to go! There is a Divvy Bike Station a couple blocks down where you can rent bicycles. You can take the bikes on the 606 trail which runs east and west. Or if you're ambitious, you can ride it to Lincoln Park Zoo or the lakefront: 3 miles and around 25 minutes one way. You might also see my husband around in a black pick-up truck. Feel free to ask him where he's going and maybe he'll give you a lift!
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment. There is no outdoor space, but just out the front door is Chicago! If you need to leave your bags somewhere before check-in or after check-out, let me know and I'll open the office space for you downstairs.
interaction: We live only 20 minutes away so feel free to let us know of any maintenance issues. I can also give suggestions for travel according to your interests!
house_rules: Please use the slippers provided inside the apartment. No shoes inside due to our white flooring.  No parties. No outside guests without approval.
host_about: Hello! My name is Margaret, and I am a Chinese American based in Chicago. My hobbies include thrifting (a.k.a. treasure hunting), hiking with my dogs, and traveling! I've spent many years living and traveling in Europe and Asia. Currently I have a new baby so that's what I've been doing. When she's a little older, I look forward to taking her around the world with us! My husband and I bought a couple properties and are renovating them in our free time. Hopefully you will like staying in our first fixer upper. We welcome you to our home and to Chicago, one of the best cities in the world!

name: Whimsical Logan Square 2BR
summary: This cozy 2BR is the perfect place to stay for a private getaway.  The apartment is colorful, bright, and feels like a home away from home.  Just 4 blocks from the train station and an easy walk to the best restaurants Logan Square has to offer.
space: Private, cozy, spacious 2BR apartment. 4 Blocks to the Blue Line California stop. Logan hosts seducing diners, cocktail bars and local shops on its historic, greystone-lined streets. Some of the most popular places in Chicago are tucked away here. The apartment is the entire 1st floor of a 2 flat building.  It has both a private front and back entrance.  It has a master bedroom with a full bed, a small second bedroom with a twin bed, full kitchen, fully furnished dining room, living room with sofa, central heat, wifi, and large tv with a dvd player and HDMI hookup.  Each room is equipped with a fan for a lovely breeze.  The apartment does back up to the EL so you definitely can hear the train noise. I got used to it fast and actually find it soothing, but city sounds may not be your style. Easy free street parking. Close to divvy bikes (bike sharing).  Milwaukee Bus which will put you in Wicker Park's "6 Corners" in minutes.  Late night Mexican food on the corner.  Steps away from deli

neighborhood_overview: One of the best parts of Logan is the farmers market.  It is the perfect place to grab a bite, a fresh bouquet of flowers, or to take in the neighborhood.  It happens every Sunday from 10am-3pm from May through October. Logan is home to some of the best restaurants in Chicago.  Grab a breakfast biscuit from Bang Bang Pie, a pizza from Reno, dinner from Longman, a cocktail at Scofflaw, and dance the night away at Slippery Slope and you will be very pleased.
transit: My apartment is located just a few blocks from the Blue Line train at the California stop.  It is also near the Milwaukee Ave and Fullerton Busses.   There are Divvy bikes (chicago bike share) on my corner and free street parking very close to the apartment.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment including book collection, dvd selection, and board game collection.
interaction: I am reachable by text, phone, or email.  I am always glad to help with recommendations around the neighborhood and Chicago.
house_rules: No smoking inside, please.

name: Artistic & Lovely Home~Logan Square
summary: Welcome to our home! Amenities include 1 bedroom + closet+ dresser +full bath (tub/shower) + kitchen + microwave+ refrigerator+ sunroom+ light breakfast coffee and tea+outdoor seated area with a garden and firepit. Easy free parking, park & cute coffee shop across the street. 8min bus ride to L-stop to downtown.
space: We have a comfy lovely apartment that we love! It's a duplex with a garden out-back, lots of natural lighting, wood floors and granite kitchen countertops.  We enjoy music, traveling, art , food and wine! We have 2 cute housecats (Willow and Buddy) you will likely meet them during your stay, but the guest bedroom and bathroom doors are kept closed for the comfort of allergen-sensitive guests. The bedroom comfortably fits two people and we also have a nice air mattress that you may use , if needed.  The area in trendy Logan square in quiet and safe. We have not yet had a guest that has had any issues parking.  Please Feel free to use our kitchen to cook and store food in the fridge! We have a beautiful marble bathroom with a great shower. We also have a cozy back room with lots of plants you can use to read and hangout in!
