neighborhood_overview: Logan Square is a great neighborhood in Chicago. Hip Restaurants, Art Events, amazing cocktail bars and local breweries. So many great things to do and a realxed quiet neighborhood. We are across the street from a great park and down the road from the best farmers market in the city.   It is steps from the blue line train, and just around the corner from all the great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife that Logan Square has to offer such as: Revolution Brewery, Cafe Lula, Reno, Cafe Con Leche, The Harding Tavern, El Cid, The Lost Lake, Billy Sunday, Longman & Eagle, Rocking Horse,  Websters Wine Bar, Parts & Labor, the Logan Theater, The Chicago Diner, The Whistler and so many more!
notes: We have a really nice comfy one person air-mattress that can be used as well! Shared bathroom .
transit: FREE PARKING!!  Divvy bike rentals are right across the street (great method to get around town and see the city!) , we live close to the blueline ( 8 min bus ride to Logan square blueline stop) and multiple bus lines(Diversey, Pulaski, Fullerton, Milwaukee). It is a 15 minute walk to Blue Line which services O'hare airport and downtown. We suggest taking the quick bus ride in the winter. As mentioned Street parking is available for free. It can be a little difficult when the park is busy but most of the time we don't have any issues. Public transportation in Chicago is great! If you want to have wheels of your own so you can explore areas outside the city, that's great, but you don't have to have a car in town to get around comfortably and conveniently.
access: 1 private bedroom with full sized bed and a closet with small dresser.  There is one full shared bathroom.  Feel free to use the kitchen, fridge and stove.We have a sunny living room and dining area. We also have a nice outdoor area where you can sit and relax, along with a sunroom.
interaction: We enjoy getting to know our guests, but we understand that most people who stay with us have plans that keep them occupied away from the house most of the time during their stay. We would love to share with you tips to get around and places to go in the neighborhood and Chicagoland area.  In the warmer months we like to hangout by the garden and fire-pit. You are always welcome to hang out with us when we're relaxing at the home-head!:) Abby works in the city at an interior designer firm during the week and Kevin owns an instrument repair shop close by the apartment.
house_rules: We don't mind if you smoke but it must be done out in the backyard. We hope you will be comfortable and enjoy all that our wonderful neighborhood has to offer while respecting our friendly neighbors!:-) We are completely flexible on check in and check out just communicate with us on your arrival and departure. Thanks! Safe travels!
host_about:
Hello All and Welcome! 
We are a traveling, cooking, wine drinking, designing, music playing and animal loving couple residing in the awesome neighborhood of Logan Square in Chicago. We are social and fun loving people. We have a lot of knowledge of Chicago's restaurants and bars! We love everything Chicago has to offer us - music fests, delicious restaurants and bars, local artists and boutiques, parks and beaches, bike lanes, museums and so much more! We love to travel and explore new places, and would love to recommend places for you to try in the Chicago area. 

Abby works at a design firm downtown and enjoys crafting, reading, vintage/consignment shopping and listening to all types of music in her free time. She loves trying out new restaurants in Chicago and going to the Logan Square farmers market on sundays! 

Kevin owns his own instrument repair and handcrafted custom guitar shop called Cigar Box Music in Logan Square. He enjoys music, gardening and going to local breweries. 

We recently went on an amazing trip to Europe and got engaged in Paris:) Travel list: Amsterdam, France, Spain, England and Italy. 

We look forward to meeting you and hope you enjoy your stay at our place!

name: Cozy Logan Square Bedroom With Private Bath
summary: Your room in the first floor of our remodeled single family home features a cozy queen bed and attached private bath. There is free street parking around our house and the subway is a 15 min. walk away. Enjoy our funky laid-back neighborhood and have fun!
space: Our space is a cozy and family friendly space. Your room with private bath is on the first floor in our house built in the 1890's. We refinished the original maple hardwood floors throughout with a marble floor in your bathroom. The kitchen was remodeled in 2008 and we added big windows in the dining room to look out over our back yard.
description: Your room in the first floor of our remodeled single family home features a cozy queen bed and attached private bath. There is free street parking around our house and the subway is a 15 min. walk away. Enjoy our funky laid-back neighborhood and have fun! Our space is a cozy and family friendly space. Your room with private bath is on the first floor in our house built in the 1890's. We refinished the original maple hardwood floors throughout with a marble floor in your bathroom. The kitchen was remodeled in 2008 and we added big windows in the dining room to look out over our back yard. You have access to the most of the first floor which includes the kitchen, dining, living room and half bathroom. During the warmer months we are happy to share our backyard and deck - it is the perfect place to hang out with a cup of coffee in the morning or cold drink in the evening. We also have a washer and dryer - let me know if you need to use it. If we aren't at home please contact me if there i
neighborhood_overview: The two best things about Logan Square is its connectivity to the rest of the city and the great food. We can recommend any number of new trendy restaurants, long time favorites or delicious and affordable taquerias. The 606, a new 2.6 mile long bike, running, and walking path on an old elevated rail line connects us to Bucktown and Wicker Park. I was drawn to this neighborhood by its historic tree-lined boulevards perfect for running, biking and walking that connect you to the 606, highway, Humboldt Park and El.
notes: Noise Levels: We have an elementary-school aged child and I can't guarantee peace and quiet during the weekday mornings between 6:30-8 AM. On the weekends I try and keep quiet hours as late in the morning as possible but we generally get up around 8. Cats: We have two cats that are quite lovable but will explore your room if the door is left open. Their names are Gray and Rags and are allowed to go outside so no worries if one runs out when you are coming or going.
transit: There are two Blue Line stops .8 miles from our house to take you downtown (connect to any of the lines downtown) or to O'Hare. The bus to Lincoln Park (and the zoo) stops one block from our house and you can catch the bus to the beach on Lake Michigan and the Nature Museum at the Logan Square Blue Line stop. Other options for transportation are Zip Car, Divvy (year round bike rental) and Enterprise Car Share - all have multiple locations as close as a block away. Street parking is available without a permit.
access: You have access to the most of the first floor which includes the kitchen, dining, living room and half bathroom. During the warmer months we are happy to share our backyard and deck - it is the perfect place to hang out with a cup of coffee in the morning or cold drink in the evening. We also have a washer and dryer - let me know if you need to use it.
interaction: If we aren't at home please contact me if there is anything we can help you with - I am happy to answer your texts and phone calls!
house_rules: -Please remember to lock the doors when you leave!  -Please no cologne or perfume in the house. -I can't guarantee the room will be ready until about 3 PM. If you need to drop off bags before heading out to explore Chicago let me know - it's not a problem
host_about: I'm an architect that has lived in Chicago since 2007 with my family. We love biking, art, architecture (of course) and Chicago. I was inspired to start hosting after we traveled to Guatemala and had a wonderful experience staying with a family there. We know lots of great places around Chicago and great ways to get around.

summary: Cozy, recently renovated, 2-bedroom apartment located steps away from the fantastic views of the 606 biking/walking trail. Location just minutes from the Blue Line train and other public transportation that travels into downtown. Many bars/restaurants in Logan Square and Wicker Park to explore.
space: Cozy, 2 bedroom and 1 bathroom apartment that comfortably sleeps 6 guests. Bedroom 1 has a queen size bed, and bedroom 2 has a full size bed with a playpen available upon request.       The kitchen has stainless steel appliances and seats 4 guests comfortably. The refrigerator is stocked with your basic breakfast foods, consisting of coffee, milk, eggs, and toast.       The living room has a sofa, love seat and chair. It is large enough to fit an air mattress and accommodate an additional 1-2 guests. There is a large, flat screen TV and an electric fireplace. Movies can be watched by using the Xbox console available.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located between two popular neighborhoods, Logan Square and Humboldt Park. You can walk, bike, drive, or take an Uber/Lyft to nearby bars and restaurants. The Bloomingdale Trail (606 Trail), is located 1 block north of the apartment. If you take it East it will take you through Humboldt Park, Logan Square, Bucktown, and Wicker Park.
notes: Please do not go out through the back door, and only use it in case of an emergency. The downstairs tenant has a dog and he hangs out in the back yard.
transit: The apartment is located on a street that requires a parking permit after 6 PM. There is parking without restrictions around the corner from the apartment on Wabansia Ave. Street cleaning is done on every 2nd and 3rd Monday of the month between April and November, between 9 AM-3 PM. Be sure to watch for these street signs as you will get a ticket if your car is parked on that specific side of the street.     The two closest bus stops are located only a couple of blocks from the apartment.  One on North Ave and Kedzie Ave, and the other on North Ave and Humboldt Blvd. The CTA Bus fare is $2.00.     The closest Blue Line stop, Milwaukee/California, is about 1 mile away. You can drive, take an Uber, walk, or bike to it. There is a Divvy bike rental station 1 block north of the apartment, next to the park. The CTA "L" train fare is $2.25.     Downtown Chicago is about 7 miles away from the apartment, about a 20 minute drive. If you choose to drive you'll want to download the app "Waze." It

name: Former Storefront / Artist Studio
summary: This unit was originally a vintage storefront from post Chicago fire days 100+ years ago.  More recently during Bucktown's artist colony days, it was the former studio of famous Chicago artist Richard Loving.  www.RichardLoving The space has been completely rehabbed to modern standards from the gourmet Wolf stove to the Jacuzzi tub.  We have tried to create a very livable 2 bedroom duplex down, while keeping the vintage charm of 100+ year old tin ceilings and original oak floors.
space: A modern take on a vintage space! From the 100+ year old tin ceiling, to the century old door re-purposed as a desk, this former artist studio has been lovingly recreated as an eclectic 2 bedroom duplex down.  The main floor is the primary living space with kitchen, dining area, living room and bathroom, and the lower level has two private bedrooms, an office nook, and laundry room.  In homage to the buildings history as an artist's home and workshop, I have a rotating display of Chicago themed prints from local photographers.

neighborhood_overview: Bucktown and Wicker Park are two of the best neighborhoods in Chicago for food and drinks.  There are countless places to explore along Damen avenue, both North and South of Armitage, just 2 blocks away. Transportation is easy, as a bus stop that is located just 100 feet away will quickly take you to the Blue Line train that connects to O'Hare airport. Also two blocks to the South is Chicago's new '606' walk / bike trail, similar to New York's High Line.  It offers nearly 3 miles of elevated paths traversing 5 different Chicago neighborhoods.  It is a must see for any visitor to our neighborhood!
notes: Children are allowed on a case by case basis but must be approved. This apartment is NOT child friendly.  This is an older building before the concept of 'child friendly' was created.
transit: Public Transportation 1 min walk to Armitage Bus (East / West to lakefront or Blue Line train to O'Hare) 3 min walk to Damen Bus (North / South to United Center / Downtown) 5 min walk to Metra Commuter Train (Clybourn Station to Downtown or North Shore) 10 min walk to Blue Line station at North, Milwaukee, and Damen (To downtown or O'Hare) Bikes There is a Chicago Divvy (shared bike) station just 3 blocks away at Cortland and Damen Cars Easy, no zone, street parking, and Interstate 90/94 entrance is just 1/2 mile East on Armitage Uber / Cabs Rarely more than a few minutes away from your front door
access: You will have access to the entire apartment.  There is a security system so you will need a code to disarm it.
interaction: I will personally meet you when you check in.  I live nearby so we are typically available if something arises.  Please feel free to call 24 / 7 with any questions or concerns.

host_about:
I'm an AirBnB SuperHost, an amateur adventurer, entrepreneur, snowboarder, ironman athlete and the Founder of HelloHealthy, a startup working to bring wellness where people live, work and play. 

Despite trying as a kid, I never developed superpowers to fight crime and help people so I founded HelloHealthy as my way of saving people from the scourge of chronic diseases. 

I love to travel and I rent out my place frequently and enjoy helping each guest experience the awesomeness that is Chicago. 

I'm a big fan of adventure and I hired a designer to help me design an apartment that matches this love for adventure. I guarantee you'll love the space and your stay here!

To adventure, dear friends!

neighborhood_overview: Seriously, there is just too much good stuff in Logan Square to fit into one little paragraph.  You can spend your entire visit in Logan Square and have an amazing time, but we encourage you to check out the many neighborhoods across the city that make Chicago great.
notes: Unfortunately I can't include a link, but check out the recent article in the New York Times "36 Hours in Chicago" for a great list of what to see/eat/do in Logan Square and the surrounding neighborhoods.
transit: Situated in a great location for all types of transit:  - Close to two blue line train stops (the blue line is the train that runs to O'Hare airport).  - Within two blocks of three major bus stops.  - One block away from the 90/94 entrance and exit.
access: Except for a few cabinets, the whole house is yours! Please feel free to use any pots, appliances, teas, spices, blankets, books, etc., during your stay. All we ask is that you do not abscond with any of our possessions when you head out. :)
interaction: We can be accessible via phone or messaging if you need us or have questions about anything.
house_rules: We love this place and we hope you do too! All we ask is that you treat our space and property with care and respect.  So, please...  -No smoking indoors -No pets -No parties or events -No loud music -For everyone's safety, no more than 6 people on back deck at a time  -Please make sure to close the patio umbrella when done and/or when storms are expected in the area.  - Please be sure to lock all doors, including patio door, whenever leaving the apartment.  - You are welcome to use the washer and dryer, but please follow the instructions outlined in our message to you once you book.  - Checkout is at noon â€” depending upon our next guestsâ€™ arrival and when our cleaners can come, we may be able to accommodate a later checkout time, however you must request a later checkout prior to arrival. summary: Come stay in one of the hippest neighborhoods in Chicago!  Just a little way from Palmer Square and Logan Square, this is a great base from which to explore Chicago!   This is a top floor corner unit and gets tons of natural sun.  The guest bedroom is huge, with a Casper queen sized mattress.  Bars, coffee shops, independent bookstores and restaurants are all within walking distance and there's a great grocery store right across the street.
space: This is a 3-bedroom apartment which I share with one roommate.  It is the corner unit on the top floor and has a huge living room with big windows.  There is a back deck.

The 82 bus line stops a few blocks away on Kimball, and w
transit: The 73 bus line stops right in front of the apartment.  The 82 bus line stops a few blocks away on Kimball, and will take you to the Belmont stop on the blue line, which runs to O'Hare.  It is 1.2 miles away from the California stop on the blue line.  Travel time to O'Hare by public transit is about 45 minutes.  Travel time to Millennium Park by public transit is 40 minutes.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment, except for two bedrooms that are in use.  There is one bathroom in the apartment.
interaction: As much or as little as you'd like!  I love meeting travelers and am happy to get to know them.  I am also happy to let you do your own thing!
house_rules: No shoes in the house and no smoking Make sure you don't let the cat out and make sure you lock the door when you leave This is a very calm and quiet home.  We ask for quiet on the weeknights after 10:30 pm and on weekends after midnight.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I love to bike, travel and meet new people.  
I've traveled a lot through Europe - my most epic trip was a 2.5 month solo bike tour through Italy, France and Spain.  I've worked as a bike tour guide in France and New York City, and was a bike messenger in NY for 5 years.  
I love meeting guests from around the country and world - I've had a lot of great experiences as an Air BnB guest and am very happy to open my home up to travelers!  I'd love to get to know a little about my guests before they arrive and if there's anything I can do to make their stay more enjoyable!
I'm quiet at home and like exploring new neighborhoods and finding parks, bookstores and coffee shops

name: On The Boulevard
summary: "Located on historic Humboldt Boulevard in Logan Square."  Our very spacious and sunny dwelling is walking distance to a Blue-line station and 15 minutes to downtown Chicago.  One block north, Armitage Avenue, has a DIVVY bike rental stand and a CTA bus that travels east to Lincoln Park, the Zoo and the Lakefront.  Also, there are many new trendy restaurants, shops and nightlife to be found along Armitage.  For trips, drivers will find direct and easy access to both 90/94 and 290 highways.
space: Is a spacious, 1500 sq. ft./140 sq. m., 3-bedroom apartment plus two full bathrooms, a formal dining room and an eat-in kitchen with an urban feel located on a 2nd floor.  The living room is a bright space offering beautiful views; featuring a sun room and a vintage fireplace with built-in bookcases.  The front bathroom has a claw-foot tub for long soaks, and the second bathroom has a glass-enclosed shower.  The stylish kitchen is fully equipped for cooking and baking and includes a dishwasher.  Most importantly, the bedrooms have been nicely appointed with comfortable beautiful beds and cozy linens, large closets and dressers.  The laundry room contains a full-size washer and dryer equipped with an iron and ironing board.    We hope that it will feel like your second home.

neighborhood_overview: The picturesque and historic Humboldt Park is 219 acres of lush greenery, lagoon and sustainable beach.  It is a seven-minute walk and great for an afternoon picnic or an early morning run.  You can play or watch soccer, baseball, tennis or softball.  Take a swim in the sustainable Humboldt Beach or feed the fish, ducks and geese at the lagoon.  There are also several playgrounds for the kids too. Last but not least and not to be missed, â€œThe 606 / Bloomingdale Trailâ€ is an elevated walking, running, skating and biking path located steps from the front door.  Take a walk east on the trail and 10 minutes later you are in â€œBucktownâ€ or "Wicker Park" for more shopping, dining and frolicking.
notes: Wi-Fi and satellite TV are provided; there is a 43" flat screen in the living room.  Our cable package provides over 200 channels including sports channels.  Prime cable channels like HBO and SHOWTIME are available too.    A set of keys for access into the building and apartment is provided to guests during their stay.  If more than one set is needed just let us know.  A lost key set will incur a $75 charge. The cleaning fee is for linens, dusting and switch-outs only; used towels are to be placed in the hamper.  We abide by Airbnbâ€™s Golden Rule: â€œLeave the Place in the Condition as it was Receivedâ€.
transit: There are several ways to get around the city.  The most economical is public transportation: CTA buses, #73 Armitage (1 block north) and #72 North (3 blocks south) O'Hare Blue line train - California station (15-minute walk; 3 blocks north then 3 blocks east) METRA Clybourn train station located 1.6 miles east on Armitage Avenue  DIVVY bikes - Chicago's bike sharing stand @ Armitage & Humboldt Blvd (1 block north) ZipGo (APP for urban commuting) LYFT or UBER ride sharing Taxi service: Yellow, Flash, Best Cab or try (URL HIDDEN) to book online Driving can be expensive when parking in downtown Chicago.  We recommend that you download the following APPS:  ParkChicago: Instead of stocking up on rolls of quarters to feed the meter box, for a 35 cent service charge per parking session, you can charge your parking and extend your time remotely.  If your parking time is about to expire you will receive a text, giving you a 10-minute warning to extend the time or move the car before incurring
access: Guests have full use of the entire apartment except for the supply and utility room.  Included is a dedicated outdoor deck, a backyard garden, as well as, the boulevard out front.  The boulevard is a great place for a picnic, a soccer or volleyball game.  Furthermore, it offers direct access to â€œThe 606 Bloomingdale Trail".
interaction: We look forward to meeting and welcoming our guest when they arrive.  However, arrangements can be made if your arrival is during off-hours or you prefer self-check-in.  Keys will be left in one of the agreed upon lock-boxes located on the property so that you have full access to the apartment upon arrival.   Above all, we respect our guestsâ€™ privacy.  We live in the 1st floor apartment and when not at home will always be available via text or call.  We are happy to make recommendations for outings and activities.  Moreover, we have prepared a guidebook for guests to use.  Having grown up in Chicago, we have decades of experience in navigating the city.
house_rules: SMOKERS can smoke outside on the deck accessible from the kitchen.  NO Permitted/unpermitted guns or weapons. NO Burning of candles or incense.    Please be respectful and maintain a clean apartment; wash dirty dishes, put them away, and take out your garbage.  Waste and spills attract unwanted pests and bugs.  Leaving garbage, spills or a dirty apartment will incur an additional fee. Information regarding common-sense house and safety rules are made available to all guests.
host_about:
I am the daughter of immigrants, who came to the United States to make a better life for themselves and to help my widowed grandmother.  I was born in Chicago and grew up in Wrigleyville on the Northside of Chicago which is a vibrant and diversified neighborhood.  I have a wonderful husband and an incredible daughter and have lived in our home for almost three decades.
For 15 years, I was honored to teach students Interior Design and Architecture at a Design College in Chicago.  I love to travel to other countries and experience their culture, language and foods.  My favorite cities so far, Amsterdam, Paris, Mexico City and Antwerp.  I hope to continue travels to far-off distant lands.  I used Airbnb for my second trip to Paris, and really preferred it to staying in a hotel.  And the primary reason for hosting on Airbnb is to offer guests the ability to experience Chicago and its unique neighborhoods in a home setting.  I enjoy meeting people from different states, countries and from diverse cultures.
My favorite foods are enjoyed in the company of my family and dear friends: Roasted Chicken, Margherita style thin-crust Pizza, Grilled vegetables, a nicely poached or grilled Fish, Thai, Vietnamese and Italian food.
My favorite books: â€œTo Kill a Mockingbirdâ€, â€œMusic for Chameleonsâ€ and the â€œHarry Potterâ€ series.  My favorite music: Bachâ€™s â€œConcerto for Two Violins in D minorâ€, Debussyâ€™s â€œClaire de Luneâ€, Pucciniâ€™s â€œNessun Dormaâ€, Kern & Fieldâ€™s â€œThe Way You Look Tonightâ€, Pink Floydâ€™s â€œAnother Brick in the Wallâ€, â€œHey Youâ€ and â€œMoneyâ€, Beatlesâ€™ â€œHey Judeâ€, Marc Anthonyâ€™s â€œEl Cantanteâ€, Adeleâ€™s â€œ21â€ album and Sam Smithâ€™s â€œIn the Lonely Hourâ€.  

My life motto: â€œAlways treat people as you would like to be treated.â€

name: The Great Utopia in Logan Square
summary: A sunny loft life apartment in what has to be one of the best locations Logan Square has to offer. A 3 minute walk from the California Blue Line, and access to the 74 bus outside of the front door. 20 mins to O'Hare & downtown via Blue Line Train.
space: Feel free to contact me with any inquiries or questions prior to booking. ***INTERNSHIPS, RESIDENCIES, HOSPITAL ROTATIONS, NATIONAL & INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS ARE WELCOME FOR LONGER STAYS*** This stunning sunny loft like apartment is in the heart of hip Logan Square. The spacious private room features exposed brick, exposed spiral duct work, 10 foot ceilings, private closet and a full size bed.  Only a 3 minute walk from the California Blue Line stop and a 7 minute from the Logan Square Blue Line stop. Just outside is the Fullerton (74) bus stop, which provides access to the Red Line train.  The unit is kept quiet and clean for working professionals and travelers alike. For those that are looking to enjoy the nightlife, this space is within walking distance to some of the best Chicago has to offer. The freshest restaurants, cocktail bars, dive bars, a heralded brewery, two bar arcades, two movie theaters, multiple concert venues, dance clubs and more are just around the corner. -Private

neighborhood_overview: Logan Squares roots trace back further than 1830!!! The historic Logan Boulevard is tree lined  & filled with historic homes that lead all the way to the Illinois Centennial Monument, built in 1918 to commemorate the 100th anniversary of Illinois' statehood.
house_rules: My space is your space while you are a guest here. Feel free to come & go as you please.  I do ask that you do not smoke in the building. No additional guests are allowed unless discussed and please be respectful to my neighbors.  Remember to return your keys after your stay. There will be a $20 replacement fee for any keys that are not returned.  Please apply with a full profile if possible.
host_about:
By day, I am full time medical imaging professional working in the veterinary field. 

In my spare time I enjoy exploring my neighborhood and other parts of the city. I have been in Chicago my whole life and feel that this has provided me with a unique perspective of the city. 

Because of my own experience as a host and guest, Air BNB has become my preferred method of lodging while traveling.

I'm easy going, understanding, extremely laid back and truly want the best for everyone. As a host, I try to make myself as available as possible to answer any questions or concerns you may have. Feel free to inquire about your stay.

The Western Blue Line train station, only a 5 minute walk away, can take you straight to O'hare International Airport in one direction and swiftly downtown in the other.  You won't find a better spot in the city! This listing is for a private room in the apartment that I inhabit.  The room is small but has everything you need!

name: Carriage House in Wicker Park
summary: This vintage rehab is just steps from the nightlife that Chicago has to offer! Comfortably fits 3 & is tucked away on quiet street, in the heart of Wicker Park. Enjoy a semi-private floor, with shared kitchen. Walk to the el/ rental car/ bikes. LGBTQ friendly.
space: Your guest bedroom has 2 West-facing windows, and has a full-size bed in a 1st-floor vintage rehabbed apartment in Chicago's Wicker Park. Central air and heat, wireless internet, your own bathroom, and full access to living room and kitchen.  There is a backyard with deck and herb garden. The guest room is ideal for one or two guests, with another one fitting comfortably on the sofa. I can provide an air mattress for a 4th, maybe even a 5th, but you might be a little cramped at that point. Towels and washcloths are available for your use. I work from home, and am often around. I am happy to recommend places to eat as well as some off the unique non-tourist destinations around Chicago. Want to know the best place to sled in the winter? Where all the best italian ice is? notes: Please send a reservation request instead of an inquiry. Dates book up VERY quickly, often 3-4 months in advance, and I cannot reserve dates without a booking. I typically receive 2-4 inquiries a day during the spring and summer months.  There is ample free street parking in front of the building and the blocks immediately surrounding it. Please check signs before parking, as some  Tuesdays and Wednesdays are street cleaning, and the city aggressively tickets starting at 9am on those days.

There is an I-Go car rental spot less than a block away.
access: Kitchen appliances are all available for your use. You will have an entire closet in the bedroom with organizers/shelves/baskets, and your own night stand as well. There is a cabinet in the bathroom for your toiletries.
interaction: We interact with guests as much or as little as you wish. We try to be very hospitable, and am glad to sit down for a meal with you or leave you to your own devices, just give a heads-up as to what you prefer.  I always love to spend time with people who are creative, doing art, or are involved in interesting endeavors.  I enjoy getting to know guests, but am just as happy to let you have your space. If you need directions or want any recommendations for restaurants, bars, etc please ask!
house_rules: My space is your space while you're here. I just ask that there is no smoking of any kind inside, no loud noises after midnight, and that you make sure that to return all key/s at the end of your stay.  There is a $30 key replacement fee for any keys that are not returned.  Small pets might be ok, but please check with me ahead of time. Please do not use the towels to clean up spills or stains of any kind.
host_about: I'm a 4th generation Chicago native, who has traveled the country many times over on a budget. I am friendly and hospitable to strangers, and believe that community is truly built one conversation at a time.

summary: Enjoy a private bedroom and your own bathroom in this great 3 bedroom 2 bathroom  apartment in a hot neighborhood.  All the modern amenities including cable, wifi, flat screen TV and full kitchen. Close to all Wicker Park has to offer.   We are a recently married couple and will be picky about our guests so please communicate as much about yourself as possible!  We both have "9-5" type jobs so are out of the house every morning and usually have low key nights during the week.
space: Welcome to my vintage 3 bedroom 2 bath condo with all modern updates.  Redone in 2008 and refurnished in 2014, this is a great place to call home during your stay in Chicago.   Space is great for a single person or couple - we have a queen bed and of course access to our living and dining room and common space.  With nice weather there is a great back deck and Humboldt Park is a short run/walk away.

Walk to some of the best coffee shops and restaurants in the city including Kai Zan (amazing sushi - 2 blocks away), Lockdown (voted Best Burger numerous times, and Bite Cafe (great food).  Star Lounge (2 blocks away) roasts their own coffee and CC Ferns and Cafe Ballou are great places to hang out all day and get some work done.  The California Clipper and Empty Bottle are both a 5 minute walk away and have great live music!

I love to travel and have been all around the world.  I've been hosting through airbnb for over 2 years now and I also volunteer to host international guests through an organization here in Chicago for a month at a time.  I'm very professional and clean - I think there are certain standards of hospitality and being a guest that everyone should follow, which basically stems from respect for yourself and others.

I'm big on communication and am happy to help you make your stay in Chicago memorable - from the check in process to restaurant reservations.  I can accommodate special requests like an airport pick up or a pre-stocked refrigerator if you'd like.   Let me know how I can help!

summary: Our cozy place is in the best neighborhood of the city, with endless bars & restaurants steps away!  Stay in the ultimate central spot in Chicago,  a 5 minute walk to 24 hr transit via Blue Line "L" subway to Downtown (3 stops - 10 min), close to bus stops and quick highway access.  You will enjoy a quiet residential street, FREE street parking, modern decor, 2 outdoor spaces and tons of amenities to make it feel like home! We also have a twin air mattresses for use, a Graco Pack n Play, and high chair if you have little ones. -AMAZING LOCATION!!! neighborhood_overview: For a feel of the youthful, creative energy on Chicago's northwest side, make your way to the eclectic cross-sections of West Town, Ukrainian Village and East Village. You'll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers. Mixed in are historic churches, brick cottages, quaint coffee shops and a booming restaurant and bar scene. Day and night, these communities offer a multitude of things to do, all with a low-key vibe and within an easy stroll. Whether you are looking for a brunch spot, antique furniture or vintage accessories â€” or you want to seek out traces of the area's humble immigrant history â€” wander block by block along the main arteries Division, Chicago and Grand Avenue.

name: Modern + Cozy Family-Friendly Home
summary: When you stay here, you stay in a home. So all the things we enjoy in our personal home - from a complete kitchen to the expansive movie selection and fun games - are available for your use. Those with kids will love our baby/kid-friendly amenities; for those without, the kid stuff will remain (mostly) tucked away. Walk to our fav coffee shops or hop in an Uber/bus to explore beyond Humboldt Park. Experience an authentic Chicago neighborhood with a beauty all its own and easy downtown access.
space: Spread out in our single family home! Enjoy a BBQ in the backyard with our grill (grocery store with large beverage selection on the corner) or double up on movie night with two TVs equipped with Hulu, Amazon Prime and Netflix. Optional crib and toys available for little ones. Feel right at home in our home. Welcome! First Floor:  - Open concept living room/dining/kitchen - Office/guest bedroom (sofa bed) - 1/2 bathroom Second Floor: - Master bedroom with Queen bed and ensuite bathroom - Bedroom with crib  - Bedroom with twin bed and twin trundle  - Full 2nd bathroom  Basement:  - open space with queen mattress, air mattress and couch

neighborhood_overview: We love Humboldt Park! We have lived in our home since it was built in 2011. The neighborhood is vibrant, authentic, friendly, urban and has a charm all its own. We have lots of favorite spots in the neighborhood we love to walk to for coffee, brunch, a bite to go or a glass of wine/tasty beer. Also just a 2 blocks from the beautiful, large (and underrated) Humboldt Park for a stroll, playground visit or a run.
notes: This is a home with a dog for those who may be allergic.
transit: Street parking (no permit need on our street) Walk: Very walkable, nice selection of places to eat/drink/shop within walking distance Bus: #70 Division steps from front door; 4 other buses (#49 Western, #52 California, #72 North, #66 Chicago, #65 Grand ) within walking distance CTA Train: Western or Division Blue Line a short bus ride or uber ride away Uber: Easy and plentiful, our best tip for getting around. $10-12 on average to heart of downtown. 15-25 minutes depending on traffic.
access: Access to full home and backyard.
interaction: We enjoy greeting our guests upon arrival and showing the space when able. For times we can't greet (e.g., we are out of town or arrival time is very late), we have keyless access to our home. So arrival/departure time is not dependent upon our availability to give/pick-up keys. We are just a phone call or a text away for questions or any emergency needs.
house_rules: - Carpet: Please remove shoes  - Pets: Dogs welcome with approval, but please keep off carpeted areas (baby gates help, just remember to shut them). :) This is a home with one dog. NO CATS (owner allergic) - Cleaning: Someone will clean before you arrive
host_about: We love Chicago and are proud to call it home! Joe works as the owner of his own bespoke menswear company; Melanie works as the Marketing Director for a top Chicago tourism attraction. We have two sweet boys who are the love of our lives and a cuddly puggle named Josie. We love to host friends and family when they are in town and are excited to extend the same hospitality to our Airbnb guests experiencing our beloved city. Whether you are looking for that one "must do" attraction while in Chicago or want to start your morning at a local brunch spot (breakfast/brunch is a slight obsession of ours), we are happy and eager to point you in the right direction. Welcome to our home, we are glad you are here!

summary: This Noble Square coach house is newly carpeted, painted, and new kitchen appliances - perfect for a large family or group. Entire house will be reserved for your group's use. Free street parking! Also a quick walk to the CTA Blue line or CTA bus stop.
space: Visiting Chicago? This Noble Square coach house is perfect for a family or large group.  The property listed is an independent two story coach house that has four large private bedrooms, huge kitchen stocked with appliances and cooking utensils, spacious living room with large couch, sleeper sofa and television, private outdoor patio with a dining table and chairs, two full size bathroom that include all bath essentials, massive jacuzzi tub, and finally a laundry room with a washer and dryer.  In total the sleeping options consist of three private bedrooms that have one bed each (a king bed, a queen bed, and a sleeper sofa). The 4th private bedroom has a full size bed and another sleeper sofa. In additional to the 4 private bedrooms there is additional sleeping options available in the living room which has a large couch, queen size sleeper sofa, and inflatable mattress. neighborhood_overview: Some people have called West Town the best-located Community Area in the city. The reason? It's 3 miles or less from some of Chicago's most popular destinations, such as: Chicago's Lakefront - multiple beaches and outdoor activities Grant Park - large urban park that is the location Millennium Park, Buckingham Fountain, the Art Institute of Chicago, and Lollapalooza Millennium Park - home of the famous Chicago Bean, Waterfall Towers,   and Pritzker Pavilion Buckingham Fountain - this memorial fountain is located in the center of Grant Park and is one of the largest memorial fountains in the world Art Institute of Chicago - world renowned art institute which houses more than 30,000 works of art Lincoln Park Zoo - spend an enjoyable day visiting a leader in animal conservation and care at no cost  Shedd Aquarium - largest indoor aquarium in the world Field Museum of Natural History - regarded as a premier natural history museum because of its size and quality of educational and scientifi
notes: If you're looking for a variety of possibilities you will love West Town with its restaurants, art galleries, boutiques, neighborhood bars, farmers markets, food trucks parked on corners, independent coffee shops, indie bands playing on small stages, and sports bars. The neighborhoods listed below are also part of West Town, the Community Area where Noble Square is located: Ukrainian Village â€” "where the smart locals go" according to Chicago Magazine Wicker Park â€” "The Midwest Mecca of hipsterdom," according to Forbes (the northern part of Noble Square is often listed by realtors as part of Wicker Park)
transit: This listing is within walking distance (less than a mile) from the CTA Blue Line Chicago Stop and the CTA Grant Bus Stop. It is also easily accessible for Uber and taxi pick ups. Withnall these options it makes it very easy to travel to any community in Chicago effortlessly.
access: Guests will have access to the entire house except for the utility control room.
house_rules: The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement. Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The Tenants shall not sublet the property. No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises. No groups that exceed 6 without written consent. If breached a $80 charge will be accessed per guest per night. No smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted on the patio, but Tenant will be charged if any damage is caused to the property. No firearms, fireworks or other hazardous material shall be in or on property. Tenants shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, etc shall cause termination of this agreement. The tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting that rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall p
host_about: I was born and raised in the Chicagoland area which has made me an avid Chicago sports fan. I love to attend Cubs, Blackhawks, Bulls and Bears games and coach local youth sports teams in my free time. I also enjoy good food and craft beer and will gladly travel out of my way to go a highly regarded restaurant or a coveted beer release. I am currently studying for the CPA test which takes up a good portion of my free time, but I hope to be able to travel and see more of the world once I have completed all portions of the testing. I strive to provide my guests with the best possible lodging experience and my goal is to make their trip a memorable one. I have done a fair share of traveling myself so I know how important the little thing are, and try to accommodate any groups specific needs.

neighborhood_overview: There's plenty of great dining options close to home. Head down to Next if you want to splurge and have a unique dining experience at a restaurant known for opulent prix fixe menus. Or, grab a bite at Carnivale with fusions of Latin and American cuisine.  River WestÂ is a relatively new Chicago neighborhood. Once a part of River North, River West is now a viable, thriving community of its own. In the style of transforming an old warehouse district into a viable residential neighborhood, River West has many fashionable restaurants and nightspots. As it is also known to attract Chicagoans from outside the neighborhood, which means it is best to make reservations whenever possible!

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide proof of identification through ID verification on our website. In order to check in, all guests must complete this process before 6 pm on the day of arrival. 3. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   4. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 5. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 6. Most of our

name: Modern urban oasis
summary: A soothing urban oasis with all the modern amenities and touches.  Beautiful Brazilian cherry wood floors and cabinets give it a luxurious feel. Located in the heart of Bucktown, one of Chicago's liveliest neighborhoods. MONTHLY RENTAL ONLY.
space: The 1,200-square-foot modern condo has a master bedroom with a queen bed and second bedroom with a full bed. The spacious yet cozy-feeling living room has a lot of character and warmth. There's a private deck off the master bedroom in the back.
description: A soothing urban oasis with all the modern amenities and touches.  Beautiful Brazilian cherry wood floors and cabinets give it a luxurious feel. Located in the heart of Bucktown, one of Chicago's liveliest neighborhoods. MONTHLY RENTAL ONLY. The 1,200-square-foot modern condo has a master bedroom with a queen bed and second bedroom with a full bed. The spacious yet cozy-feeling living room has a lot of character and warmth. There's a private deck off the master bedroom in the back. My girlfriend and I live a block away and are happy to help with recommendations or other needs. Bucktown/Wicker Park is one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in Chicago: tons of coffee shops, boutiques, restaurants and music venues. The condo is on a quiet, leafy street but a 7-minute walk from the heart of the action, an intersection known as the Six Corners. The new 606 trail, an awesome elevated walking trail similar to the Highline in NYC, is two blocks away. Walk 8 minutes to the Blue Line L station, w
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown/Wicker Park is one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in Chicago: tons of coffee shops, boutiques, restaurants and music venues. The condo is on a quiet, leafy street but a 7-minute walk from the heart of the action, an intersection known as the Six Corners. The new 606 trail, an awesome elevated walking trail similar to the Highline in NYC, is two blocks away.
transit: Walk 8 minutes to the Blue Line L station, where a train takes you downtown in 15 minutes. Several bus lines on major corridors (North Avenue, Western Avenue) are steps from your doorstep.
interaction: My girlfriend and I live a block away and are happy to help with recommendations or other needs.
house_rules: No pets, no smoking...and no shoes, please. The cherry floors are one of my favorite parts of the condo and they get damaged easily, so I ask that you please remove your shoes upon entering. I have a pretty bench in the entryway where you can put them. :) Also, please be respectful of neighbors; no loud parties late at night.

name: Private bath & bdrm in lovely condo
summary: The house is in a totally rehabbed, walk-up building in the trendy & hip Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. You will have your own bath wh a tub/shower & a comfy queen bed in your own bedroom, on a separate level from the other bedroom for max privacy.
space: The space is very bright and filled with plants and  eclectic decorations.  It is 2 stories, with the 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms being on separate levels.  The bedroom has a larger closet and table in it that can be used as a desk.
description: The house is in a totally rehabbed, walk-up building in the trendy & hip Ukrainian Village Neighborhood. You will have your own bath wh a tub/shower & a comfy queen bed in your own bedroom, on a separate level from the other bedroom for max privacy. The space is very bright and filled with plants and  eclectic decorations.  It is 2 stories, with the 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms being on separate levels.  The bedroom has a larger closet and table in it that can be used as a desk. The guests will have access to the fully stocked kitchen, living room with cable TV and free washer/dryer.  There is also a deck with city views and a landscaped backyard with grill and fountain to enjoy. I usually interact with guests as much or as little as they want.  I'm pretty busy but can be found in the evenings sometimes around the house.  I'm also pretty laid back, but can offer great advice about Chicago nightlife & transportation if needed. I Love living in Ukrainian Village!  It is full of cute restau
neighborhood_overview: I Love living in Ukrainian Village!  It is full of cute restaurants and bars and shops to explore.   There is a grocery store and pharmacy within walking distance.  Also, it is close to several hospitals and sporting venues if you want to catch a game.  The neighborhood itself is very central in Chicago, has several tree-lined side streets and is very SAFE.
notes: I infrequently might have a couple of friends over to make dinner, drink wine or watch a movie.  If this would bother you, then this space might not be for you.  The house is 420 friendly, but I ask that you please smoke cigarettes outside on the porch.  Also, there are 2 wonderful cats that live here as well - they are pretty chill and usually hang in my room, but you might see them around.
transit: There are 4 bus lines very close to the house that can get you just about anywhere you want to go.  There are close bike rentals and it is close to the major expressways.  The house also has ample, free, no-permit street parking all around.
access: The guests will have access to the fully stocked kitchen, living room with cable TV and free washer/dryer.  There is also a deck with city views and a landscaped backyard with grill and fountain to enjoy.
interaction: I usually interact with guests as much or as little as they want.  I'm pretty busy but can be found in the evenings sometimes around the house.  I'm also pretty laid back, but can offer great advice about Chicago nightlife & transportation if needed.
house_rules: Please just clean up after yourself and don't let the cats outside.
host_about:
I'm from Chicago, IL and I work in medical device sales.  I love music, film, animals and travel.  I'm pretty laid back and enjoy just hanging out with some wine and good friends. 
I suppose I should add that I loved using Airbnb so much, that I have put my beloved home in Chicago up for rent on this sight.  So far I have had the pleasure to meet some really nice, cool & interesting people who enjoy staying at my old home as much as I did!!  Safe travels everyone. :)

summary: Adorable room available in a 2 bedroom condo in the trendy neighborhood of Wicker Park. Comfortably fits solo traveler.  Just steps to world class restaurants and shops. Minutes to great public transit.  Fantastic kitchen, cable and living space!
space: Queen Bed, cozy private room in a Beautiful 2 bedroom 1 shared bath condo in the heart of Wicker Park, one of the US's most dynamic and trendy neighborhoods.  Just steps away from Division street and 5minutes away from both the Blue line and bus CTA public transit.   World class eating and drinking right outside the door.

Queen Bed, cozy private room in a Beautiful 2 bedroom 1 shared bath condo in the heart of Wicker Park, one of the US's most dynamic and trendy neighborhoods.  Just steps away from Division street and 5minutes away from both the Blue line and bus CTA public transit.   World class eating and drinking right outside the door. Private room, shared bathroom, Cable, Wifi, Washer and Dryer I'm pretty outgoing but enjoy my alone time.  Always happy to chat, recommend restaurants and if I'm going out to do something fun, you're more than welcome to come along! Vibrant and fun neighborhood! Excellent restaurants, bars, clubs and music venues just steps away.  Just 1/2 a block off Division Street. Quiet apartment but next to all the action! Very convenien
neighborhood_overview: Vibrant and fun neighborhood! Excellent restaurants, bars, clubs and music venues just steps away.  Just 1/2 a block off Division Street. Quiet apartment but next to all the action!
transit: Very convenient public transit.  #70 Division bus right 1/2 a block away and Division Blue line stop is a 3 block walk.  You can get downtown door to door in 20 minutes. Extremely easy access to/from O'Hare airport.
access: Private room, shared bathroom, Cable, Wifi, Washer and Dryer
interaction: I'm pretty outgoing but enjoy my alone time.  Always happy to chat, recommend restaurants and if I'm going out to do something fun, you're more than welcome to come along!
house_rules: Please behave respectfully and please no overnight guests.  I'm happy to accommodate your requests within reason (food, drink, noise level etc.) It's a small condo building and I want to make sure I'm respecting my neighbor's space as well as my own. Thank you for understanding!
host_about:
Hey there! Thanks for checking out my listing.  I would love to host you and help you get acquainted with Chicago.  Ideally looking for a solo traveler who is visiting the city for the weekend.  Can absolutely be flexible with longer visits. 

Outgoing and well traveled, I've always found that trips are much nicer when you interact with the locals. Highlights include Argentina, Uruguay and Brazil, Munich for Oktoberfest (PROST!) and Mexico City. Just returned from a fabulous trip to Lisbon, Portugal. Other favorites have included Israel, Ecuador and Spain.  

I love cooking, dancing, chocolate, swimming and meeting new people.  I'm currently in graduate school and working full time so i'm often hitting the books or at the office.  When not there, I'm either catching a play, out to dinner and drinks, at the museum, taking a fun class or just enjoying my friends.  Come join!

Please make yourself (respectfully) at home in my home.
Welcome to Chicago! 

*** Please note that unfortunately, I do not host first time guests and guests with no previous reviews.  Thank you in advance for your understanding.***

neighborhood_overview: In the heart of Chicago, Wicker Park is the ultimate destination for those wanting to experience one of the most vibrant & fast-changing neighborhoods in the city.  Shopping: Apartment Number 9, Steven Allan, GANT Rugger, Marc by Marc Jacobs, RSVP Gallery, Nike and more.  Libations: The Charleston, Violet Hour, Danny's, Revel Room & The Map Room.  Eats: Big Star, Trenchermen, Mana Food Bar (v), Stan's Donuts, Hot Chocolate, Handlebar (v), Oiistar, Piece Pizza, The Bongo Room & Olivia's Market.  Coffee: Caffe Streets, La Colombe & The Wormhole.
notes: Want more Chicago neighborhood suggestions? Check out my Instagram feed @NathanMichael or feel free to ask. I've created multiple culture guides & have photographed for magazines including: Bon Appetite, Martha Stewart, Sweet Paul & VICE.
transit: Uber App: Request, ride, and pay for taxi service via your mobile phone. Divvy Bikes: Chicago's bike sharing system conveniently located in each neighborhood.  Chicago CTA (Bus & Train): Multiple locations just a couple blocks away.
access: You will have complete access to the living room, kitchen & private guest bedroom.  Including: the fireplace, kitchenware, closet space, washer & dryer, and a personal parking spot with a gated entry.
interaction: My room is upstairs & off the grid, so if you have any questions / potential problems feel free to call or text me any time. Always open to grab a drink with guests as well. Otherwise, I'll be completely out of your way.
house_rules: Guest are expected to enjoy the space as much as possible. Mi casa es su casa. Smoking is allowed outside or on the rooftop deck.  No pets are allowed. Break anything? No problem. Please just let me know. AC & Heating Unit: Please note that due to the large space, the AC & Heating Unit will most likely be run at all times (depending on the season). If you're not comfortable with air conditioning please let me know before hand.
host_about: I'm a photographer & designer living in Chicago, IL. I'm passionate about cultivating a culture of well-lived life through authentic community. When I'm not creating, you can find me exploring new cities, drinking massive amounts of coffee, digging through vintage shops, enjoying the latest restaurants & spending time with friends and family.

name: Heart of East Village/Wicker Park
summary: Completely rehabbed 2 bedroom, 1 bath unit walkable to all the bars, restaurants and shops of Division and Chicago Ave. With easy access to the loop, its the perfect place for families, couples and business travelers alike to explore all of Chicago!
space: - This is a great, two bedroom, one bathroom home on the 1st floor of a four unit building. The first bedroom has a queen sized bed.  The second bedroom is cozy, with a full sized bed, a night stand and a walk in closet.  It is ideal for a single person o
description: Completely rehabbed 2 bedroom, 1 bath unit walkable to all the bars, restaurants and shops of Division and Chicago Ave. With easy access to the loop, its the perfect place for families, couples and business travelers alike to explore all of Chicago! - This is a great, two bedroom, one bathroom home on the 1st floor of a four unit building. The first bedroom has a queen sized bed.  The second bedroom is cozy, with a full sized bed, a night stand and a walk in closet.  It is ideal for a single person or a couple who doesn't mind sharing close quarters!  The entire unit was completely rehabbed at the end of 2013 with stainless steel appliances, granite counters, dark wood cabinets and floors and new bathrooms.  There is a great courtyard with a table and chairs shared with the long term residents of the building for your respectful enjoyment. - There is a queen sized bed in the larger room, a full sized bed in the smaller room and a sleeper sofa in the living area. - The kitchen is fully
neighborhood_overview: The Ukrainian Village and Wicker Park are two of the trendiest neighborhoods in Chicago. There are too many restaurants to list on Division Street, Chicago Ave. and Ashland Ave. all within a short walk of the building.
transit: The Division Blue Line stop at Ashland and Division is just under a mile away. This will have you to the Loop in 10 minutes. You can also walk to the Blue Line stop at Chicago, which is just over a mile. Just 5 minutes north is the 70 bus Division Ave. or less than 5 minutes south is the 66 bus on Chicago Ave. You can use either to connect with the train or to take to the Gold Coast and River North neighborhoods. Finally, you can catch a cab or Uber that will take you to the Loop in as little as 10 minutes!
access: There is coded access to the front door of the unit.  We will provide the code shortly before your stay.
interaction: I own the building but live off-premises, about 10 minutes away. I am available to have as much or as little interaction with guests as they desire. I am very knowledgeable about the area and am happy to correspond in advance about restaurants, things to do, etc.
house_rules: No smoking anywhere on the property, no more than 5 people in the unit at any time, please do NOT use the outside areas past 10:00pm, do NOT use the grills in the back as they belong to long term tenants, and pets ARE allowed...just have fun! Check in Time: 3 pm Check out time: 11 am
host_about: I am a lawyer who is currently staying at home with my three-month baby.  My husband and I love to travel - we spent six months travelling Europe and could not have done it without AirBnb!  On the host side, our partner, Jeremy, and I run the vacation rentals in Chicago.  Jeremy is a "recovering" lawyer and now devotes his time to real estate.

name: Full Basement with Breakfast!
summary: Welcome to our home! When you stay with us, the full basement is yours. Cozy carpeted space includes couch and TV equipped with Amazon Firestick (Hulu, Netflix, etc), sitting area and play area (great for family with young kids). Bed options: queen mattress, queen air mattress, single twin trundle (if requested) and couch. Plus, we have a slight breakfast obsession, so whether hot, cold or grab-n-go, breakfast and coffee is on us! :)
space: Welcome to our home and to Humboldt Park! We are a family of 4 (Ollie is 4; Ford is 1) plus a dog (puggle Josie is 8) loving life in Chicago! We've lived all over the city (downtown, Lincoln Park, by Soldier Field and more) and we appreciate the authentic charm and friendliness you find in the neighborhood of Humboldt Park (we've been here 6 years). You are also bordering some of the hottest neighborhoods - Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square (some walkable, some 5 minute ride or 10 min bus ride away) - and a easy uber ride to other areas, including downtown ($10-15). We live in a single family home that was built in 2011. You will have full private use of the downstairs basement. Note, there is no door to the basement, but anyone upstairs cannot see into the downstairs (due to stairwell placement), so though no sound barrier, the visual privacy is there.
description: Welcome to our home! When you stay with us, the full basement is yours. Cozy carpeted space includes couch and TV equipped with Amazon Firestick (Hulu, Netflix, etc), sitting area and play area (great for family with young kids). Bed options: queen mattress, queen air mattress, single twin trundle (if requested) and couch. Plus, we have a slight breakfast obsession, so whether hot, cold or grab-n-go, breakfast and coffee is on us! :) Welcome to our home and to Humboldt Park! You are also bordering some of the hottest neighborhoods - Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square (some walkable, some 5 minute ride or 10 min bus ride away) - and a easy uber ride to other areas, including downto
neighborhood_overview: We love Humboldt Park! We have lived in our home since it was built in 2011. The neighborhood is vibrant, authentic, friendly, urban and has a charm all its own. We have lots of favorite spots in the neighborhood we love to walk to for coffee, brunch, a bite to go or a glass of wine/tasty beer. Also just 2 blocks from the beautiful, large (and underrated) Humboldt Park for a stroll, playground visit or a run.
notes: We have a friendly puggle named Josie. There are baby gates blocking access to basement, so she will not be in your space, though we welcome you to cuddle with her whenever you want. :) Please note that the basement is private, but there is not a door to basement as it is an open staircase down. Therefore it is not sound proof. We are up and around in the morning between 6:30-7:30a each day getting ready for work and weekend commitments. Though we will try to keep noise levels down for morning snoozers, sound is inevitable (particularly with two happy kiddos). Sound machine provided for those who want to try and sleep in past our wake-up time! :)
transit: Street parking (no permit need on our street) Walk: Very walkable, lots of places to eat/drink/shop within walking distance  Bus: #70 Division steps from front door; 4 other buses (#49 Western, #52 California, #72 North, #66 Chicago, #65 Grand ) within walking distance CTA Train: Western or Division Blue Line a short bus ride or uber ride away Uber: Easy and plentiful, our best tip for getting around. $10-15 on average to downtown.
access: Private full use of carpeted basement. It is one big room. Includes TV. Includes washer and dryer which you are welcome to use. (Note - the times we MAY need to access basement will be for doing laundry - depending on length of guests' stay -, though we will arrange to do when you are out of the house to give you privacy.) Private full bathroom (2nd floor, which is same floor as our bedrooms). Shared 1/2 bathroom on main floor. Shared kitchen. You are absolutely welcome to cook and enjoy as your own! Shared backyard and BBQ.
interaction: Guest interaction includes welcoming you to our home and breakfast together (optional based on your schedule, we can play by ear!) We work during the day M-F and one of us works from home M and F. We are happy to enjoy a beverage with you in the evening and hear about your day, or point you in the right direction for a local watering hole. Since you have the full basement to yourself, our interaction level is up to you, but we look forward to getting to know you.
house_rules: We want you to be comfortable here. Please let us know how we can make your stay most enjoyable. SOUND: As we are in the home as well, we ask you to be mindful of noise levels late into the evening.  Our mornings typically start around 7a getting the kids ready for daycare and us around for work. Breakfast is ready at 8a (or later/earlier according to your schedule as will be discussed). We've provided a noise machine for your use to help soften our morning activity noises, but sound will be inevitable as there is no door to the basement due to the open stairway. We will try our best to keep it to a minimum prior to 7:30a. CARPET: Please remove shoes on carpet. Please also be very careful with any food and drink in the basement. We have not had any spills yet on the new carpet and want to keep it that way. If a spill does occur (we understand!), please let us know immediately so we can properly clean it.  BACK YARD: The back yard is available for your use and enjoyment. Same applies to
host_about: We love Chicago and are proud to call it home! Joe works as the owner of his own bespoke menswear company; Melanie works as the Marketing Director for a top Chicago tourism attraction. We have two sweet boys who are the love of our lives and a cuddly puggle named Josie. We love to host friends and family when they are in town and are excited to extend the same hospitality to our Airbnb guests experiencing our beloved city. Whether you are looking for that one "must do" attraction while in Chicago or want to start your morning at a local brunch spot (breakfast/brunch is a slight obsession of ours), we are happy and eager to point you in the right direction. Welcome to our home, we are glad you are here!

description: Charming condo in the country's hottest neighborhood (Redfin), Ukrainian Village, with original artwork, and easy access to downtown and public transportation. Close to many bars, restaurants, galleries, and music venues. Come stay in our home on a calm block in a happening area. neighborhood_overview: Enjoy a handmade map of the area highlighting notable spots. We are one block from famous rock club, the Empty Bottle, one mile from sprawling Humboldt Park, and one mile from Chicago's new elevated park/former railroad, the 606. There are several great bars and restaurants within a block. We are also close to other popular areas Wicker Park, Logan Square, and the West Loop. A grocery store and drug store are both a couple of blocks away.
transit: We are 5 minutes from the expressway. To get downtown take a 15 minute easy to find taxi, a 20 minute trip by nearby bus or bike share, or enjoy a 15 minute walk to the blue line train for a quick 10 minute ride. Street parking available.

name: Tiny Studio Apartment 94 Walk Score
space: This is a very small  studio apartment with a private entrance.  The apartment is located on the rear half of our first floor. It has its own entrance. It consists of a kitchen and a small bedroom with a queen sized bed (new since October 2016) and bathroom with a tub and shower.  There is a kitchen with a stove and mini fridge and sink and microwave plus a small table for two. We have a Roku Box for tv watching and excellent cable internet. The Roku has Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other channels. We have hi-speed Comcast internet.
description: This is a very small  studio apartment with a private entrance.  The apartment is located on the rear half of our first floor. It has its own entrance. It consists of a kitchen and a small bedroom with a queen sized bed (new since October 2016) and bathroom with a tub and shower.  There is a kitchen with a stove and mini fridge and sink and microwave plus a small table for two. We have a Roku Box for tv watching and excellent cable internet. The Roku has Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other channels. We have hi-speed Comcast internet. You will be in your own intact tiny apartment. You will not see me or my family at all unless you run into us outdoors. My family lives in the building but we are not home 24/7. We are available to answer questions, especially via email.  Guests let themselves in with a key code and generally have total privacy from us unless they need help with anything. Ukrainian Village was just named "Hottest Neighborhood in America" by Trulia. Our address has a
neighborhood_overview: Ukrainian Village was just named "Hottest Neighborhood in America" by Trulia. Our address has a walk score of 94 because it has an awesome combination of places to walk to, public transportation options and rental bikes all over the place.   We are in a convenient location one block away from multiple bars, restaurants, boutiques, etc. you can walk to the El from the apartment (1/2 mile) and take it straight downtown to the museums or to O'Hare airport in the other direction.  Our neighborhood is called Ukrainian Village and we are a historic district which means most of the buildings are old and the neighborhood has lots of character.  We were granted this status in part because it is an unusual neighborhood with numerous Orthodox churches and cathedrals. It is a nice place to walk around. You can walk to the Ukrainian Institute of Modern Art Museum and the Ukrainian National Museum. You can also get Ukrainian food and pastries.  The neighborhood has changed in recent years, however,
notes: We really like our neighbors and want guests to respect their space. You can't smoke in their yard, hang out on their front porch, ring their bell and ask for help, etc. Please do not bother our neighbors. They are nice people who we wish to maintain a good relationship with.
transit: We are 1/2 mile away from the el train stop (blue line) and one block away from the Division Street bus stop. There are Divvy bikes to rent 3 blocks away. There are Ubers always a few moments away and  the easiest way to catch a cab is to  venture one block over onto Division Street, where it usually takes only a few minutes for one to drive by and pick you up.
access: You will be in your own intact tiny apartment. You will not see me or my family at all unless you run into us outdoors.
interaction: My family lives in the building but we are not home 24/7. We are available to answer questions, especially via email.  Guests let themselves in with a key code and generally have total privacy from us unless they need help with anything.
house_rules: This is a tiny apartment and is only appropriate for one or two people. Check out is  flexible if no one is arriving the next day. If someone is arriving we ask you to be out at 11 am on the dot. You can come early but only if no one is there the night before and you have arranged this with us in advance. Otherwise check in is at 2 pm.
host_about: We live in Chicago. We love to travel and see the world with our two children!

host_about:
When Im not spending time in the city working as a classic model with Ford Chicago, you can find me on our farm in the country where I raise honeybees and grow Lavender for my handcrafted skin care products. I love having the best of both worlds and am so happy to share our space with travelers!!!

Things that I can't live without: My reading glasses, a strong cup of coffee, being woken up by the sound of birds singing, the smell of lavender,  garden tomatoes, being barefoot in the grass and snuggling my son.
 
Favorite book: Cabin Porn
Favorite movie: Wasteland
Favorite show: The New Yorker
Favorite food: Anything fresh from our garden....and...well... french fries :)
Favorite lyrics: "Im an alligator. Im a mama papa coming for you"-David Bowie

neighborhood_overview: There's plenty of great dining options close to home. Head down to Next if you want to splurge and have a unique dining experience at a restaurant known for opulent prix fixe menus. Or, grab a bite at Carnivale with fusions of Latin and American cuisine.  River WestÂ is a relatively new Chicago neighborhood. Once a part of River North, River West is now a viable, thriving community of its own. In the style of transforming an old warehouse district into a viable residential neighborhood, River West has many fashionable restaurants and nightspots. As it is also known to attract Chicagoans from outside the neighborhood, which means it is best to make reservations whenever possible!

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   4. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 5. name: Pretty Nice West Town Apartment
summary: This is our totally decent, minimal & tidy 1BR apartment in West Town that we stay in part time. Just a block south of a nice stretch of Chicago Ave, and an easy walk to the CTA Blue Line. It's a pretty quiet building and neighborhood.
space: We're long-time AirBnB hosts (and guests). This is our apartment when we are in Chicago; we also have a home in Louisville, where we visit every month or so (that's also our primary listing, which you can see here: http://airbnb.com/rooms/88061). So when we're away, you can stay! This place it pretty decent, if not super fancy. We have a basic assortment of Ikea furnishings and the like; if you're a minimal type of person that likes art and indirect lighting you'll probably dig it. The apartment is a 7-minute walk from L station (Blue line, Chicago stop), with bus stop & Divvy bicycle station a block away -- you can be in the Loop or Logan Square in little time. West Town is a nice neighborhood on its own of course, with several good restaurants and pubs nearby. Full kitchen with enough equipment to cook if you like. The bedroom isn't big, but it's cozy. Bath & kitchen are larger than average for an apartment this size.  There's a bluetooth Bose speaker you can pair your phone with to

neighborhood_overview: West Town is a great cross-section of Chicago. Nice, but not too nice. Pretty quiet -- though Chicago Ave a block north is quite busy, as is Ashland to the west. Plenty of great places to eat nearby, or hop on the L and quickly get to other neighborhoods.
notes: Nota bene: we no longer have the gray couch; it was simply taking up too much space. This isn't a super-fancy place, but it's nice & simple. Hope you like it!
transit: Close to CTA Blue Line (we take this every day to the Loop) for easy access to downtown or Logan Square.  East-West buses on Chicago & Grand, and North-West buses on Ashland.
access: There will be various things in the fridge that are whatever we have prior to leaving town; help yourself but don't clean us out! Standard shampoo & whatnot in the bathroom; same deal. We'll leave a few Ventra cards out, so you don't have to buy new ones. If you use them, just keep a basic count of how many times you use them, and recharge them at the end of your stay (if they have credit on them already).
interaction: We will not be here when you arrive -- you're on your own! Door code will be provided for easy access.
house_rules: This a quiet building, so no parties. You're welcome to hang out on the rear deck, but please respect our neighbors. Feel free to use the bluetooth speaker, but keep the volume reasonable, especially after 10p. Also please take shoes off in the house. Thank you
host_about:
I'm a designer, photographer and restorer of old buildings; advocate of sustainability, the arts, and LGBTQ & social equality.

I love being in and working on well-designed spaces, meeting new people, traveling, and learning more about the world around us. If on two wheels, all the better. I try to put my efforts toward improving the communities I'm in whenever possible.

name: Vintage Big Bright Top Foor 2br 2bath
summary: Spend July in Chicago! Big, bright, arty old place. Close to Wicker Park, Humboldt Park, Logan Square, locally-sourced restaurants, mom and pop eateries, cafes and bakeries, organic groceries, boutique shopping, thrift stores, yoga studios, spas. Short bus or leisurely walk to train to museums and shopping. .Vintage, not rehabbed, so somewhat shabby and quirky and also cute.  You'll love it because of the spaciousness, location, back porch. Clawfoot tubs! Oh yeah and central AC if you dig.
space: One bedroom has a lofted double bed with desk and closet space beneath The other has a vanity and closet behind a curtain Two bathrooms and two claw foot tubs!

Clawfoot tubs! Oh yeah and central AC if you dig. One bedroom has a lofted double bed with desk and closet space beneath The other has a vanity and closet behind a curtain Two bathrooms and two claw foot tubs! Kitchen, dining room, living room, back porch. Enjoy! For interested and respectful/mindful people there is possibly access to my yoga room/ sanctuary. I'll be reachable and my sister who lives on my street will be available for help if needed. Divvy bikes, buses, and lots of stuff nearby!
transit: Divvy bikes, buses, and lots of stuff nearby!
access: Kitchen, dining room, living room, back porch. Enjoy! For interested and respectful/mindful people there is possibly access to my yoga room/ sanctuary.

house_rules: Smoking okay on the back porch.  Kids 7-12 years old are welcome if parents are always here with them. Toddlers, no because back porch steps are steep with no gate, shelves are wobbly, no protectors on the electrical outlets, etc.. :)
host_about:
I love this city,  neighborhood, and my home which I'm delighted to share with others.
I was an Airbnb host in two of my previous homes, one with a partner, and now I'm back at it in my new space.
My main occupation is teaching yoga. I also work at my favorite small independent music venue, and intern with a local ecological guru mostly composting.
Travel, yoga and meditation, the people I love, spending time outdoors, appreciating art and artful living, and riding my bicycle most places - all make life wonder full.
I've lived in Chicago since 1995 and know my way around pretty well. I'm glad to help with recommendations of where to go and how to get there, especially for those interested in yoga, off-the-beaten-track/quirky spaces, music, and art. 
While I'm happy to share the space, I also appreciate private time, respect the privacy of guests, and may not be around much. When I'm not here I'm often still reachable by text or email.
