name: Private Cozy Master Bedroom in West Town Chicago
summary: My place is close to bars, restaurants, shopping, downtown, and public transit. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the kitchen, the wide open space, the coziness, the hosts, the walk-ability, the public transit availability, and you can get to downtown in 5 minutes without being in the madness or having the expense of being downtown. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), big groups, and furry friends (pets).
space: The is a 2500 square foot duplex down apartment located just west of downtown Chicago in Chicago's West Town.  Tony and Clarissa will be your host, and they share a room located in the basement of the apartment.  You room is the master bedroom, located upstairs on the main level.  The main shared areas are the kitchen and the laundry facilities, which are available for use.  There is cable television available in the social living room upstairs, which is your primary "hang out" area.  That cable box may be moved into the bedroom for extended stay guests, as long as you replace before you leave.  There is a television in your room for guest use, but no cable box currently.  The blue line train is approx 10 minutes walk, and there are also several buses in the area.

transit: We're about 10 minute walk to the blueline train and maybe 5 minute walk to a couple of the bus stops in the city.

They are super friendly and available to help out when needed and just recently moved to Chicago so are interested in socializing and getting to know new people when they aren't busy.

I work in public relations for resort company here in Chicago, so I definitely can make lots of good recommendations of fun things to do! I'm an alum of Florida State, a huge football fan, animal lover, and love eating out and trying new things.

summary: As we looked around, corporate stay options were limited and the options  lacked imagination - and they weren't in the neighborhoods.  This apartment was designed to deliver a fresh, modern experience in the heart of Ukranian Village and Wicker Park!
space: The space is open, light-filled and very modern.  The apartment is new and was furnished just for you!  This isn't someone's apartment - nobody's clothes are in the closet or food in the fridge. We've devoted this space to being a cool place to crash while working in Chicago!

Both Ukranian Village and Wicker Park are the hottest places to live and visit in Chicago - stacked with restaurants, street fairs, music, bars and culture, you'll enjoy wandering and soaking in the vibe.
notes: We can enable check in via a lock box.
transit: We are 7 minutes walk from two major el stops and busses are only a block away.  Most people "uber" around.  There is street parking on the block and it isn't regulated.
access: Guests have access to the full apartment.   Upon request, the apartment can be converted into a 2bd/2ba by allowing access to an adjoining suite (think hotel adjoining rooms)
interaction: We provide an arrival sheet and departure sheet. I'm always available by phone or email for questions prior to arrival or during the stay.
house_rules: This apartment resides in a building with two other units. Please be aware that you are in the context of other people living and working.  NO SMOKING - we will bounce you out the house for this violation. We prefer that your shoes come off in the entry way in an effort to keep the floor and rugs in great condition.  No pets allowed (sorry, we tried it, and someone spoiled it for you.)
host_about:
I'm an avid traveler who loves to explore and get as close to culture as possible.  I live in the city of Chicago, work in the business of building brands and love sharing time relaxing with my superstar husband.

We enjoy seeing live music, seeking out the most amazing food, and walking through new neighborhoods. 

We believe in leaving things as we find them - better in some cases!

neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is one of the most uplifting and exciting neighborhoods in Chicago, and our unit is near by. This area reaches to all your needs and wants. Amazing restaurants, supermarkets, banks, gym, coffee shops, bars, stores and music. Our neighborhood is very safe and quiet at night, if you need to work or you enjoy privacy, this is definitely the place for you.
notes: Please keep clean and leave it in the fantastic condition you receive it in, that simple :) Check in time: After 3PM (Three) Check out time: Before 11PM (Eleven)
transit: The easiest way to travel around is by train which connects every corner of the city, no need to drive!  We are a 3 blocks from the Division blue line stop which can take you to/from O'Hare Airport in 30minutes or downtown in easily 15 minutes. Also the Riverwalk, Magnificent Mile, Wrigley, O'Hare, Midway, etc.). Buses available all over the neighborhood/city. Divvy stations in the area to rent bikes for the day. Cabs, UberX and Lyft are rich. We are only a few blocks from 90/94, the major highway that runs through Chicago.
access: Full private entrance, and use of the entire space. You can access the backyard, really spacey and lots of sunshine for you to work out or do yoga in the morning. Inside the house, you have access to the bathroom and kitchen, which is well-equipped and comfortable!
interaction: The only interaction needed is at check-in 3pm and check-out 11am. I will be around to answer questions, give you tips and advice to make sure your stay is an excellent one. As residents of Chicago for a life time, we have lots of insider knowledge. If you are traveling with little ones, we will be happy to share baby gear & toys. Just let me know in advance.
house_rules: My space is your space while you're here. I ask that there is no smoking of cigarettes inside, outside only and only if butts are properly disposed of.  420 and alcohol friendly within reason -- nothing else. We're all adults here so let's be responsible. We don't allow guests to have parties or play loud music after 10PM. Side note. I am sharing my living space with you as an AirBNB host. If you prefer not to follow these basic instructions, you can take your stay else where, like out in the suburbs for around the same price plus the drive, or downtown for around 2-3 times the cost. Please treat the space as your own, and if you need anything, don't hesitate to reach me. Thank You.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Wicker Park! One of Chicago's trendies neighborhoods - especially for foodies. Some of the highlights of Wicker Park include:  Bloomingdale Trail - an elevated trail spanning nearly 3 miles from Wicker Park to Logan square. Perfect for a stroll, run or biking! Big Star Tacos - the quintessential Wicker Park scene. Great food, margaritas, and a patio to rule all patios.  Up & Up at the Robey - a new addition to the neighborhood, Up & Up is the go-to rooftop in Wicker Park that features dynamite cocktails and a breath-taking view of the Chicago Skyline.
transit: There's street parking on our street if you'll be driving into town, however if driving is not your preferred method of transit you'll be located within 5 minutes to the CTA Blue Line Division Stop!
house_rules: - Quiet hours after 10 pm
host_about: I am fun, friendly, outgoing individual who loves to cook, dance, and travel. My favorite thing to do in Chicago is walk around the different neighborhoods exploring all of the shops and restaurants.

host_about:
I have lived in Chicago since August 2011 and am in love with all the sights, sounds, vibrancy, nature, outdoor activities, and culinary options this beautiful city has to offer.  Prior to Chicago I lived in Hong Kong, New York City, Austin, Dallas, and San Francisco and am very happy to call Chicago home.  

My home is beautifully decorated with art and furniture pieces from around the world and is maintained exceptionally neat and clean.  My motto in life is "friendships are discovered, rather than made" and I welcome the opportunity to connect with you.

Enjoy your stay in Chicago!

name: Private Rm w/all the perks mins from Wicker Park
summary: Our place is a recently rehabbed, fully updated 2 bedroom flat in a 3 floor grey stone with secure entry. Nice new wood floors throughout unit, kitchen includes marble counter tops, a breakfast nook, and is fully loaded with all the gadgets. Tons of natural light since we're on the 3rd floor. Bathroom offers tub/shower combo and we have free on site laundry as well as free on street parking.
space: We're on the third floor and there is no elevator so take that into consideration if you have limited mobility. Your private room is furnished with a futon, dresser, small flat screen TV with mirror capabilities to plug a laptop into. Amazing amount of natural light and a ceiling fan/chandelier combo with a roomy closet that includes shelf and spot to hang clothes. Room itself is about 12x10' sq. ft. and has a lock that can be locked while you're in the room.     Guests can access the kitchen and all utensils. Corey is a chef so most kitchen utensils are available. There is also a coffee maker, coffee grinder, microwave, stove, dishwasher, fridge with ice dispenser and filtered water, freezer, blender, toaster. Breakfast nook has a 4 seated table for dining and more of that great natural light we've been raving about.     We're both artistic, music lovers, teachers (art and yoga) and enjoy movies so we have a stereo with a turntable, 32 inch roku smart TV with basic cable, showtime, ne

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is great because we're centrally located right near the borders of West Town, Ukranian Village and Wicker Park.  We're on the north east side of Humboldt Park and the park itself is walking distance. It offers a couple playgrounds, open fields, a lagoon for fishing or ice skating and a walking/bike path as well as a cafe. Liquor store, bars, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery store, Walgreens and other shops are all within walking distance. We live 5 mins by bike or car from Logan Square and the heart of Wicker Park which offers many amazing book stores, bars, coffee shops, record stores, skate shops, vintage/thrift stores as well as boutiques beercade's, night life, and some of the top brand name retail shops and dining experiences. Basically, you won't be bored and could make easily make a day out of simply walking out our front door.  Another perk is we live on a cul de sac so there's no through traffic; typically pretty quiet with plenty of available FREE parking.
notes: We have an Australian Sheppard named Mila.  She is very friendly but can be hyper from time to time. For the most part she just lays there waiting to get free pets. We have a gate so if you have pet allergies we can confine her to the kitchen area or another part of the apartment.
transit: We are more than happy to help you find your way around the city and with public transit. We are walking distance to a variety of bus lines and to a couple of Blue Line stops that access the rest of the city. We are centrally located. 5 mins to Wicker Park. 35 min train ride to downtown Chicago museums and other attractions. We are only 15 mins from the nearest Metra stations. There's also this bold new ride sharing service called UBER and their competitor LYFT is making a splash as well. The city also has a bike share system. In some instances, we can provide a bike or give you  a ride if things work out that way.
access: We're perfectly cool with people occupying common areas just keep in mind it's still our place and we live here full time! There is free onsite laundry which is shared with the building. We also might be able to provide a bike or skateboard for getting around.     *** In some instances we can accommodate extra guests as we have a queen sleeper in our living room. There is an additional charge of $50.00 per person if we are going to be home and we will consider on a case by case basis for short term situations (unless we are out of town). Contact us if this is your situation.
interaction: As mentioned we live here full time when we're not on vacation. We're a student and a self employed artist.  We really do look forward to meeting our guests but there are times our schedules will conflict and we won't see you. Please feel free to contact us with any questions if we're not available on person. We want you to have an enjoyable stay.  We like people and enjoy hosting from ALL WALKS OF LIFE so our goal is to provide you and your fellow travelers a place to lay your weary head and to enhance your experience while in our fine city of Chicago.

host_about:
We are an artistic and open minded couple. Corey is a painter, muralist, graphic designer, chef and teaches screen printing at a local art and and design academy. Kayla is a psychology student, yoga teacher, ceramicist and travel enthusiast. We both appreciate fashion, interesting dining experiences, philosophical/political debates, music, the outdoors and going to different live events. Can't live without a good cup of coffee, love, creating, breathing and MTN 94 spray paint. Favorite travel destinations: Big Sur, New Orleans anytime except Mardi Gras, LA, France,and the list goes on and on. 
Music: Califone, Red Red Meat, Fugazi, Rites of Spring, Turn to Crime, the Seeds, Little Walter, Dirtbombs, Honey Radar, Sun City Girls, Patty Smith, Joni Mitchell, Bob Dylan, Rodriguez, Wilco, Odd Nosdam, Jel, DJ Shadow, Pink Reason, Sebadoh, Apocalypse Hoboken, June of 44, Rodan, Tom Waits.  (could go on forever) 

Books now: Subtle Art of not giving a fuck, Pygmy, Devil in Paradise, If the Buddha got Stuck, Books then: Jennifer Government, Ham on Rye, Roominghouse Madrigals, Ask the Dust, Just Kids, Black Spring, Choke, The Stranger, Communist Manifesto, Being and Nothingness. 

Life mottos: "The brain is the heart's arch nemesis."

A large search internet company just moved blocks away in Fulton Market / West loop (5 min walk) and the revived Randolph street area is a 10 min walk away.  We are centrally located from the major neighborhoods and a $5 cab ride from them: River North, Bucktown, Greek town, Ukranian Village, and West Loop.
notes: Free street parking around the corner or directly in front of building (based on availability) Close to the highway 20 min walk to downtown
transit: There is a bus stop directly outside (65 Grand) that takes you straight into River North (downtown) and also stops at the blue line train stop to take you to the loop or to O'hare.  Also you can take the Grand bus all the way to Michigan Ave and Navy Pier.  You are a $5 cab ride to most places you need to see and less than a $10 cab ride away from almost everywhere else.

host_about: I've lived in Chicago for most of my life but was born in Korea and grew up in Buffalo, NY and Connecticut in my younger years.  I've enjoyed hosting people from all over the world through airbnb.  So far the best experiences have been when my guests and I have gone out together when I've had the time to be an actual host.  Currently I work at a healthcare technology company and love what I do.  When I'm not working, I enjoy traveling (internationally), eating and trying different types of whiskey's.  I'm pretty laid back, open minded, thrive on new experiences and enjoy the company of others.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is filled to the brim with bars, boutiques, artisan taco shops, ramen, and the latest styles that yuppies and hipsters have managed to glean from the East and West coast.
notes: A third bedroom is available for additional guests.
transit: Transportation is easy, as the blue line is an 8 minute walk to the Western/Damen stop, and about a 15 minute subway ride downtown. The 172 bus is right outside, and will take you to historic Old Town, Lincoln Park, comedy bars, etc.  The 606 is a quick 10 minute walk away, as is the grocery store, and Uber or parking in the gated lot is always an option.

house_rules: 1. Guests should be respectful of neighbors and keep noise levels to a minimum after 10pm on weekdays, and midnight on weekends. 2. Should you want to smoke, please do so on one of the many patios or outdoor areas.  3. Please take your shoes off before entering.  4. No overnight guests.  Otherwise, my house is open to you and everything else is pretty much common courtesy!
host_about:
Hi, I'm a single professional in Chicago who enjoys pets, people, and good conversation. I'm clean, organized, a non-smoker, and get along with generally everyone. I've been living with roommates since I was in high school, so I'm used to close quarters. In my free time, I enjoy hanging out friends over wine, reading, playing tennis, biking, and oil painting. 

Throughout my AirBnB experience, I've met many wonderful people who have been so kind as to offer their home to me throughout the world. I hope to do the same, so please feel free to contact me with any questions!

name: Full floor of a city cottage (up to 4 guests)
summary: This 3rd-floor garrett apartment (built-out attic) is a private space, spacious (324 sf) and simply furnished for cost-conscious travelers. In a friendly, low-crime neighborhood with plenty of free parking; public transportation nearby. Walk to Andersonville and Lincoln Square, very popular districts with restaurants, bars, live entertainment and specialty retail. Kitchenette in unit (micro, mini-fridge, coffee); I wash your dishes room service-style. House kitchen also available.
space: This is more of an apartment or flat than a room. And while it may have all the charm of a Days Inn in Wisconsin â€“ not that there's anything wrong with that â€“ what you lose in style you gain in functionality. It's a great private place to sleep, hang out, do some work, watch some basic cable, and make a simple meal with the microwave/refrigerator/coffee maker kitchenette; full kitchen available also if you prefer. You have easy access to everything, and it's a darn good deal for the budget traveler.

neighborhood_overview: This quiet corner of a neighborhood (Bowmanville) is wedged between Andersonville, Lincoln Square, and Rosehill Cemetery. It's a place where you can get a quiet night's sleep and yet access fun restaurants, shops and bars on foot, or get to Michigan Avenue or the Chicago Loop in 45-60 minutes by public transportation. PARKING: Ample, free street parking almost always on my block. My neighborhood is unique in this regard (most homes in my neighborhood are single family with garages). If you're into craft breweries, this is the heart of that industry in Chicago with several tasting rooms within a short walk.
notes: I welcome long-term visitors (medical students on rotation, business travelers, people here for family purposes).  Public gardens and parks (Winnimac Park), an enormous historical cemetery (Rosehill) and your hostâ€™s own prairie and vegetable gardens make wildlife a part of this neighborhood (birds, deer, opossum, raccoons and coyotes). For physical recreation, rent a Divvy (Chicago bike share) from one of the nearby stations. Also, there is a stadium running track open to the public as well as a public park district pool, and four health clubs (Cheetah, Lincoln Square Athletic Club, LA Fitness and Hardware CrossFit) in walking distance. As a fitness enthusiast, I also have rudimentary free weights in the house that I'm happy to loan to guests. I'm happy to host families because I grew up traveling on a shoestring â€“ it's one of the greatest gifts my parents gave my brothers and me.
transit: Youâ€™re not far from all that Chicago has to offer: Boystown and Wrigley Field (16 minutes by car/Uber; 44 minutes by public transit; 20 minutes by bike/Divvy), North Michigan Avenue (21 minutes by car/Uber; 53 minutes by public transit; 40 minutes by bike/Divvy), Frank Lloyd Wright home/museum in Oak Park (41 minutes by car/Uber; 1 hour 42 minutes by public transit); and Hollywood Beach (12 minutes by car/Uber; 15 minutes by bike/Divvy; 47 minutes to walk). Free street parking is easy in this neighborhood. Accessible via public transit from both airports (O'Hare and Midway). Chicago Transit Authority trains and buses easily accessed and there is a suburban Metra station also in close proximity. Car share program (ZipCar and Enterprise/iGo) locations all within a five-minute walk. Divvy bike share (URL HIDDEN) $9.95/day (24-hour passes) â€“ probably the best way to travel along the lakefront. You have to stop to exchange bikes (dock in, dock out) every 30 minutes. But no locks are needed,
access: The third floor and dedicated first floor bath allow my guests to largely stay here in privacy. My dog (Mardi, a Lousiana Catahoula Leopard) is not permitted on the third floor but lives in the rest of the house (a nod to those with pet allergies).
interaction: Because I largely work at home in my second-floor office, I'm usually available to share whatever information you need to get around town, including how to use active transportation (Divvy bikes, public transit and walking), recommendations on places to visit, etc. This is also a convenience for check-ins â€“ I'm here 85% of the time so your flight schedule and changes are usually not a problem.

Sometimes my boyfriend and dog are here, sometimes they are at his place. I'm grateful to the people who provided affordable housing when I was a young traveler and wish to share my extra space with Chicago visitors today.

name: Bright and Cozy Bedroom + Living Area
summary: This bright and cozy space is perfect for anyone looking to stay in Chicago for a week or longer. Close to restaurants, parks, buses and trains, this room is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood. Live in the city as a local!
space: **When inquiring, please have a picture of yourself in your profile, and include a bio to let me know a little bit about you! This room is a very clean and simple, tastefully decorated in a classic Chicago Greystone building. The room has a queen sized bed and is located in the front of the apartment away from the other bedrooms. My Airbnb guests get the bedroom and living room to themselves.  The bathroom is shared with a full sized tub and great water pressure! The kitchen with basic kitchen supplies is available for your use.  My roommate Sandy and I share the space. Our rooms are at the back of the apartment near the kitchen. Our guests have plenty of privacy and space to themselves. We also have a cat named Maggie. Out of respect for our guests, I do not let her in the guest bedroom.  We would love to have you stay with us! Please remember that this is our home and we are more than willing to accommodate you. Let me know what I can do to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a residential neighborhood between Humboldt Park and  Wicker Park. This means it is a little quieter and away from heavy traffic. It is only a 10-15 min walk to one of Chicago's favorite areas, Wicker Park. It is safe and easy to walk to nearby shops, restaurants, and nightlife. Food nearby ranges from burgers, tacos, ramen, vegan options, brunch cafes, organic grocery stores, bars, coffee shops, Thai food, shopping boutiques, and live music. Many young professionals, families and elderly live around-- it is very diverse and fun.
transit: We are very close to North and Western bus stops and about 15 min walk to multiple Blue line stations.  It is easy to walk into Wicker Park and find food and fun only a couple blocks away. There is also free parking on our street if you have a car!
access: You have access to the common areas, such as the living room, dining room, and the kitchen. We also have a back deck that you can enjoy during warmer weather. There is free street parking available on the block.
interaction: Sandy and I enjoy sharing our favorite places to eat, hangout, and explore. Although our schedules are continually changing, when we are home, we enjoy getting to know our guests. We are only a text message or phone call away with any questions you might have.

name: Unique Retreat at the Art House
summary: This beautiful 2-story 3br/2ba offers a comfortable living experience for 7 guests & is fully furnished with updated amenities. Great location to navigate the city while experiencing true Chicago neighborhood living!
space: This coach house has served as a pure happy place for my family and our guests. It is extremely comfortable, colorful, newly updated and offers 3 queen beds and a twin air bed for up to 7 guests. This spacious 2 story coach house offer a full kitchen and multiple seating arrangements for a great meal together! We will supply fresh new linen and towels for each guest and happy to offer shampoo, conditioner, body wash and even extend a hair dryer. You will also have access to an in unit washer and dryer, iron/ironing board and a fully stocked kitchen for your convenience. The living room also features a roku TV for you to access all of your favorite shows.  Also, the neighborhood offers free street parking.  Enjoy!
description: This beautiful 2-story 3br/2ba offers a comfortable living experience for 7 guests & is fully furnished with updated amenities. Great location to navigate the city while experiencing true Chicago neighborhood living! This coach house has served as a pure happy place for my family and our guests. It is extremely comfortable, colorful, newly updated and offers 3 queen beds and a twin air bed for up to 7 guests. This spacious 2 story coach house offer a full kitchen and multiple seating arrangements for a great meal together! We will supply fresh new linen and towels for each guest and happy to offer shampoo, conditioner, body wash and even extend a hair dryer. You will also have access to an in unit washer and dryer, iron/ironing board and a fully stocked kitchen for your convenience. The living room also features a roku TV for you to access all of your favorite shows.  Also, the neighborhood offers free street parking.  Enjoy! Guests will have private access to the unit. I travel often
neighborhood_overview: For a feel of the youthful, creative energy on Chicago's northwest side, make your way to the eclectic cross-sections of West Town, Ukrainian Village and East Village. You'll pass colorful galleries and museums, independent theater companies, small-scale music venues and retail boutiques touting lines from local designers. Mixed in are historic churches, brick cottages, quaint coffee shops and a booming restaurant and bar scene. Day and night, these communities offer a multitude of things to do, all with a low-key vibe and within an easy stroll. Whether you are looking for a brunch spot, antique furniture or vintage accessories â€” or you want to seek out traces of the area's humble immigrant history â€” wander block by block along the main arteries Division, Chicago and Grand Avenue.
notes: Please note - that while the home is beautifully situated for indoor use - we have strict guidelines regarding noise, in accordance with City of Chicago and neighborhood laws. We respect our neighbors greatly, and simply ask that you do the same. We do penalize aggressively for violations of this - including reporting by neighbors or ticketing by police.
transit: Free street parking! Take Damen bus south 1 mile to United Center or 1 mile north to blue line stop for access to O'hare, Wicker Park, Logan Square, etc. Or take Chicago bus directly downtown for a 15 minute trip to Michigan Ave shopping.
access: Guests will have private access to the unit.

neighborhood_overview: Perfect for a Chicago getaway. Wicker Park is the former meca of the Chicago art community and location of many festivals and concerts throughout the year. The area has experienced massive economic growth over the past few years and is now home to a variety of boutique shops, restaurants and trendy nightclubs. Wicker Park has a thriving night-life and the streets are extremely lively on weekend evenings. Wicker Park is a great neighborhood for walking, shopping and eating. It can be reached via the Division stop of the CTA Blue Line or by Taxi.
notes: We recently renovated the apartment with new furnishings, new hardwood floor, bedding, etc. We know you will enjoy your stay here! We are happy to discount any of your kids bellow 4 years of age, any older ones will have to be counted as a guest.
transit: Public transportation is easily accessible from the apartment, the Blue Line train only steps away will bring you Downtown in only 8 minutes. Major bus routes also deserve the rest of the city. Great for travelers looking to explore the city with easy access to transportation.  If you have a car, we do have a parking space for you to use.

neighborhood_overview: Wicker park neighborhood is an eclectic artsy part of Chicago with great restaurants, coffee shops, parks, and access to the rest of the city via buses and the Blue line CTA stop 1 block away. Some of the best new restaurants are located in Wicker park (and nearby Ukranian Village and Bucktown). You can walk, take the bus or rent a DIVVY (public bicycle rentals) to the bustling Lincoln Park area (about 1.5 miles away) where the array of bars, shopping and restaurants continues. Neighborhood is very safe and you can walk around late at night without a problem.
notes: Located right on the edge of Wicker Park and Ukranian Village, named "Hottest neighborhood in the Country" (URL HIDDEN)
transit: 1) North Ave (#72) bus -(walk 2.5 blocks east down Bosworth ave to catch bus on North Ave. Goes straight east to Lincoln Park, zoo or North ave beach on Lake michigan 2) Milwaukee bus (#56) bus- Walk 1 block to bus stop. Goes Southeast to bring you closer to the "loop" and business district 3) Ashland (#9) bus- walk 1 block to bus stop. Take is straight south to go to "west loop" to find some of the best new restaurants and night life 4) Blue line CTA stop- walk 1 block away to catch stop at Ashland/Division stop. Takes you straight downtown to Michigan Ave "Maginificent Mile" for some of the best shopping in the world. Or go West to O'Hare international airport 5) DIVVY bike stop- walk 1 block to DIVVY stop to get a bike. Take bike to anyone of 100 stops all over the city.

"Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer"

host_about:
Fun, energetic, outgoing individual who loves to meet new people. 

Things I can't live without include: a good cup of coffee in the morning; dedicated time to exercise each day (i.e., walking); a good glass of wine in the evening; nice people; and the ability to be making a difference everyday.  I am also up for trying new things and taking on adventures.  

I live by two of my favorite mottos. The first is, "What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?"  

The second is my favorite movie line from Steel Magnolias, "I'd rather have 30 minutes of wonderful than a lifetime of nothing special."

Finally, life is all about experiencing happiness and joy!  My goal is to have my guests feel happiness and joy in my home!

host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing at more than 40 units throughout the city in or near every neighborhood.  

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City. Wicker Park is a frequent hangout, where we tend to be pulled to the patio at Big Star, the bar at XOCO, and cocktails at Violet Hour. 

And free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

neighborhood_overview: Clean and quiet. Friendly neighbors. Steps to major bus route. Divvy bikes nearby. Huge park two blocks away. Small market across the street and several more within walking distance. Nightlife area (Wicker Park) less than a mile. Close to Ukrainian Village and Logan Square. 20-30 minutes to Loop
notes: There is a dog on premise. A very friendly and playful 6 y/o American Staffordshire Terrier (Pitbull) named Apollo. He loves affection and treats. He's well groomed and up to date on all meds and shots. He's also trained and well behaved. He stays with me at night, fyi.
transit: Steps to Division bus. Two blocks to both Western and California street buses. Walking distance to Chicago bus (direct to Navy Pier). Two Divvy bike stations nearby. 20 minute walk, or 10 minute bus ride to 3 different Blue Line subway stations (Western/Milwaukee/Armitage, California/Milwaukee, Division/Ashland/Milwaukee). Uber/Lyft never more than 5 minute wait.
access: Wifi, kitchen and all appliances, full bath with shower, access to washer/dryer, video games (PC, Xbox 360, Wii U) and internet tv (Netflix, Amazon Prime, Plex, Kody, Chromecast), outdoor charcoal grill, fire pit, loving dog.
interaction: I will be here evenings.
house_rules: Please pickup after yourself (i.e. Don't spill something and leave it there). Please lock all doors behind you (I know, but people forget, and this is a large city with lots of people). Also, please don't feed Apollo scraps. Dog treats and carrots are what he loves. If he seems a bit intrusive and I'm not home, just close him off in my room and he'll be fine. He's usually easy going, just like his dad. Other than that, have a great time exploring this beautiful city!!
host_about: Easy going, fun loving guy. Very respectful of others belongings, and believe in treating others (and their stuff) how I want to be treated

name: Hot Tub Heaven
summary: Welcome to Hot Tub Heaven...Sara and I are both self employed creative people, Sara is a fashion designer who also has the most angelic voice while I have a design/build woodworking studio just down the street.
space: I feel like we have a very warm and comfortable space that one can certainly make themselves at home in.  For clarity, we are offering one private room with one queen size bed. You have a private entrance to that room off the back deck and steps away from the hot tub.  All other areas of the property are shared with Sara and myself.

notes: When you're here just making yourself at home is the most important thing. Also worth noting is although we accept travelers with pets we do not have pets ourselves...we just like animals.
transit: Your best public transportation route to HotTub Heaven is the Blue line train to Western Avenue stop. Then take the Western Avenue bus (#49) south to Iowa Street,  Walk half a block west on Iowa...and your home.  The best route to the city center would be hoping on the Chicago Avenue bus (#66) heading east...and it will end off right in front of the Museum of Modern Art, the Lake and surrounding attractions.

host_about: Young wild and free... I've been running my own design build studio for the past nine years in Chicago which focuses on primarliy restaurant and bar design. I also have decent amount of residential clients where I can use my more refined furniture building background to create heirloom pieces. Prior to and during owning my own business I was a sushi chef working full time behind the sushi bar for twelve years...building beautiful food for people.  I love people and always up for meeting new friends. Consider myself able to adjust well to most encounters, spent my childhood growing up in Texas, Colorado, New Jersey, Virginia and now have been in Chicago for 15 years. Cheers!

name: Bucktown Apartment
summary: The Bucktown Apartment is a spacious, 3 bedroom in a historic home.  Just a block from major shops and minutes from downtown.  It features a full kitchen, dining room, and en-suite bathroom.  Enjoy free parking, WiFi, laundry, and satellite TV.
space: Our Bucktown Apartment has 3 separate bedrooms, full kitchen, dining room, and private bathroom. Breakfast is not provided as you have your own kitchen to prepare meals. Dishes and pans are provided.   We have recently updated this unit to include an HE washer and dryer. Laundry supplies are provided.   Don't do the dishes!  You're on vacation.  Our rate includes daily cleaning.
description: The Bucktown Apartment is a spacious, 3 bedroom in a historic home.  Just a block from major shops and minutes from downtown.  It features a full kitchen, dining room, and en-suite bathroom.  Enjoy free parking, WiFi, laundry, and satellite TV. Our Bucktown Apartment has 3 separate bedrooms, full kitchen, dining room, and private bathroom. Breakfast is not provided as you have your own kitchen to prepare meals. Dishes and pans are provided.   We have recently updated this unit to include an HE washer and dryer. Laundry supplies are provided.   Don't do the dishes!  You're on vacation.  Our rate includes daily cleaning. This spacious apartment has its own entrance, free parking, WiFi, and satellite TV. Our office is open daily.  Feel free to stop by for directions or recommendations.  Or come and go as you please.  Each room is set up with a guidebook, neighborhood map, and other brochures to help you plan your day. Wicker Park is a trendy neighborhood filled with amazing restaurants, g
neighborhood_overview: Wicker Park is a trendy neighborhood filled with amazing restaurants, great shopping, cafes, and nightlife.  It is also family friendly with many parks and wonderful historic architecture.
transit: We are 3 blocks from away the nearest train station and a block from the Milwaukee Ave bus.  Both take you directly into downtown.  There are many cabs in the area.  You can also rent a Divvy bike with the nearest station located just 1 block away.
access: This spacious apartment has its own entrance, free parking, WiFi, and satellite TV.
interaction: Our office is open daily.  Feel free to stop by for directions or recommendations.  Or come and go as you please.  Each room is set up with a guidebook, neighborhood map, and other brochures to help you plan your day.
house_rules: Guests may come and go as you please, but we ask that you respect our neighbors and other guests who may be staying at the Wicker Park Inn.  We respectfully ask for quiet hours between 10p - 6a.
host_about:
Thank you for your interest in the Wicker Park Inn!  We've enjoyed hosting many guests from all over the world, and we're always excited to share our wonderful city and neighborhood with new visitors.  We are honored to be considered a second home for many visiting family and friends in the neighborhood.

I've lived in the Wicker Park/Bucktown neighborhood over 15 years and have seen a lot of amazing changes.  There is always a new restaurant opening while old favorites just get better with time.

I grew up in Chicago and returned home in 1996 after earning an Urban Studies degree from Brown University.  I started running the Wicker Park Inn in 2004.  Over the years, we've updated and expanded the Wicker Park Inn which now includes four guestrooms and three apartments.  We are staffed with amazing innkeepers, Robin and Emily, and our impeccable cleaning staff.

We look forward to hosting your stay!

name: Beautiful Loft Room / Vibrant Area
summary: Location! Unique and quiet brick soft LOFT with gorgeous architecture. Private bedroom for 2 + a couch for 1. You will love our vibrant, safe and super-walkable neighborhood with its 500+ of restaurants, bars, art galleries and live music venues!
space: Hello, Hola, Salut, ÐŸÑ€Ð¸Ð²ÐµÑ‚! I'm Pavel. Welcome to Chicago and to my spacious soft loft located in on a quiet tree-lined street only blocks away from hundreds of great dining and entertainment spots that make up the more authentic Chicago experience!  - Queen size bed in a furnished private bedroom - 15 feet high tin ceiling - exposed brick - huge windows with lots of natural light - cozy unique outdoor sitting/ dining space - movie projector wit(URL HIDDEN)ft image - awesome book collection - always fresh towels and sheets - fully equipped kitchen (+ a grocery store is 3 blocks away) - comfy couch + airbed will accommodate extra guests. - soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, and hair dryer are provided. We are 10-20 minutes away from Wicker Park, Logan Square, Gold Coast, Lincoln Park, Downtown/Loop, Millennium Park, Grant Park, Chicago River, Union Park, Navy Pier, Pilsen and much more!..

We are 10-20 minutes away from Wicker
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location. According to a popular city neighborhood guide, "Chicago's triumvirate of coolness is comprised of Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Ukrainian Village." Well, we are right here in the middle!  - East Ukrainian Village/ Wicker Park - a vibrant, safe and fun, extremely walkable neighborhood that entices Chicagoans and tourists alike to visit and explore our great dining, culture and nightlife entertainment options.  With its kaleidoscopic abundance of cafes and coffee shops, modern boutiques and classic vintage resellers, record stores and live music venues, dive bars and fancy lounges, fine gourmet restaurants and street food vendors, our area has something for everyone to enjoy and explore. Personally, what I appreciate the most is how quiet our side street is. Only a block away from busy Damen and Chicago Avenue, Winchester is quaint, serene, and lined with century-old trees. Your sleep will not be disturbed.
notes: Mindblowingly amazing Gelato establishment a block away! Take rum-raisin or anything with basil. It's on me if you don't like it.
transit: METRO "L" TRAIN: 10 minute walk to either Damen or Division stops of Blue Line that connects O'Hare to downtown/ Loop and many other great neighborhoods in the city. BUS:  (we have a good bus system in Chicago and you can use the same Ventra card you use for the metro train): 1 block to the Chicago Avenue Bus --- gets you downtown in 15 minutes! 1 block to the Damen Bus  1 block to the Augusta Bus 3 blocks to the Division Bus  TAXI/ UBER: You'll have a very easy time hailing a cab 1 block from the apartment on either Damen or Chicago Ave. Cab ride downtown is 5-10 minutes and $9-15. Uber is cheaper. DIVVY Bikes: Chicago has an awesome bike sharing system --- it's $7/ day for unlimited number of rides - there is a station a block away from the apartment. Divvy is a great and fun way to explore the city like a local and to connect to Damen/ Division train from the apartment in just a 5 minutes.
access: Make yourself at home!  Make some tea or coffee after a day of exploring Chicago, take good use of the fully-equipped kitchen and the giant living room. Kick back and relax.  Strong Wi-Fi signal. Washer and dryer in unit. Dishwasher. Large, spotless clean shared bathroom.
interaction: I love Airbnb-ing. As a guest and as a host.  I am pretty active with an 8-6 job and after work stuff, so you will have the entire place to yourself most of the time, but I'm happy to share my love of Chicago should you have any questions!
house_rules: The only house rule is please treat the apartment and hosts belongings with respect, like you would at your own place.
host_about:
Hey there, I'm Pavel.

Being fortunate to live in one of the best cities in the world, I will be happy to share my sunny loft with fellow travelers looking for a quiet and comfortable private bedroom. 

I am a 28 year old professional who's been using Airbnb for years (both for traveling and hosting) and I love it!

Five things I can't live without are: a good brew of coffee in the morning, a nice engaging conversation, learning something new every so often, great literature and carne asada tacos from this one ever-elusive truck on Ashland and Milwaukee. Stay chez moi and I'll tell you how to hunt those tacos down!

I'm out of the apartment 8 am to 6 pm for work, so you will have this large place entirely for yourself most of the day. I'll be happy to offer a local's perspective and answer any questions to make your Chicago stay as comfortable for you as possible.

name: Stay amongst Wicker Park mansions!
summary: Our modern and bright condo is the best place to stay in Wicker Park/Bucktown! The guest room + huge, private bathroom are perfect for couples or solo travelers. Steps from the "el" and the best bars + restaurants but located on a tranquil street.
space: We have the entire second floor in our building, with 12ft ceilings, all hardwood floors, two outdoor spaces, and all new contemporary furniture. The place is sleek and simple, yet comfortable.  You will have a private bedroom and private bathroom.  You have access to all the common areas within the house and the two terraces.  We are friendly and always enjoy meeting new people. We are happy to give suggestions on the area, transportation, etc. When we are home we usually make use of the common areas - cooking and lounging.  On the weekends we like to cook and grill and are always happy to share a meal and some conversation. Elie the cat will usually make the rounds in the house.  If you would prefer that he not walk through your room, then simply shut the door - he won't mind! Close proximity to all of the bars, restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, and funky stores. It's incredible that we live so close to that, while at the same time are on one of the most tranquil tree-lined stree

You will have a private bedroom and private bathroom.  You have access to all the common areas within the house and the two terraces.  We are friendly and always enjoy meeting new people. neighborhood_overview: We're biased, but we think we live in the best neighborhood in Chicago. We are within walking distance to a lively group of restaurants, bars, boutiques, vintage stores, concert venues, coffee shops, book stores and record stores. There is always something going on! However, if it's peace and quiet you're after, we have that too. We live on a residential street that is very family-oriented and quiet. Some of the nicest, largest, quirkiest, and oldest mansions in the city are just around the corner. If you're into architecture, you will LOVE the area. Check out our guidebook for some of our favorite places!
notes: We have a male cat named Elie.  He's pretty playful and will usually be roaming around the house.  If you would prefer that he not walk in your room, then simply shut your door. He won't mind!
transit: Neighborhood is extremely walkable. Damen Blue Line "el" stop is only a two minute walk away. From the Damen stop it's approximately 40 minutes to O'Hare, or 10 minutes to downtown (Clark/Lake or Washington stops). Located near the "el" stop is a Divvy Bike bike share station.  There are also several buses nearby. If you'd like to head across town or to the lake or the beach you can walk approximately 30 seconds to the 72 bus stop at the intersection of North and Hoyne avenue.  Will take approximately 15-20 minutes to reach the lake, traffic depending. Several car shares (e.g., ZipCar) nearby and Uber/Taxi drivers are always around the area. Finally, there is free street parking, but just ensure you read the signs so you're not parked on a street cleaning day.
access: You may have the run of the house (common areas and the two terraces).  Feel free to cook, store food in the fridge or cabinets, use our washer/dryer, and watch tv. We have cable, including HBO.
interaction: We are friendly and like to meet and talk with new people. You may interact with us as much or as little as you like.
house_rules: Smoking outside on either terrace, but otherwise not indoors. Please no guests/parties. Otherwise you may have the run of the house - please make use of our kitchen.  That's it - we just ask that you are respectful of the space (please drop the shoes at the door - city streets are dirty and our floors are cleeeeeeeean).
host_about: Datus is a tax consultant and Stacey is an early childhood educator. They both enjoy hiking, scuba diving, traveling, and good conversation with new and interesting people.

name: Ukrainian Village Warehouse Loft
summary: A spacious 2-bed vintage warehouse loft. High ceilings, exposed brick.  Designer furnishings + WiFi. Cutlery & cookware for 6, linens + towels for 8.  Walking distance to Blue Line. Steps from great dining & entertainment on Division. Quiet location, historic district. Extensive local recommendations for all guests.
space: The space is a vintage loft apartment in a converted 119-year old warehouse.  At one point it was a storefront--hence the glass block windows in the living room.  It is a contributing building in the Ukrainian Village District, a Chicago Landmark district created in 2002 to preserve the distinctive historic character of the neighborhood. Although the building and neighborhood are historic, the inside of the unit has been updated with modern conveniences such as cable TV, wi-fi, designer furnishings, in-unit laundry and an updated kitchen. If you like exposed brick, high ceilings, historic buildings, and all the conveniences of home, this is the spot for you.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is on a quiet intersection (you really shouldn't be bothered by street noise here) populated mostly with beautiful historic 2- and 3-flats.  But just a block to the north you'll find Division, which has many great dining and shopping options and is generally busy until the wee hours. Several blocks north of that you come to the 6 way intersection at North Ave / Damen / Milwaukee.  This is a very busy area at all hours with a nice mix of hip bars, boutiques, coffee shops and inexpensive dining options.  You'll also find an L stop at this 6-way. Your neighbors here will be a mix of hipsters, young professionals and working-class Puerto Ricans.
transit: Parking The Ukrainian Village isnâ€™t a bad place to find parking when compared to downtown, Lincoln Park, or nearby Wicker Park, but it can still be challenging at peak times.  Damen is your best bet, especially to the south.  I believe August also has non-permit spaces available.  Division is primarily metered parking.  You can also check Spot Hero for parking, but I think the closest spots it will show you are over half a mile away. The "L" Train (Subway/Metro) The Blue Line is your friend!  It goes directly to Oâ€™Hare airport and to the loop, where you can easily transfer for free to any other line and get to most places in the city.  The Damen Stop and the Division Stop are both equally close, roughly a 12 minute walk.  If you head into the loop, you can transfer at Clark/Lake or State/Lake onto the Red Line or Brown Line (the other two lines youâ€™re most likely to use).  If youâ€™re coming or going from Midway Airport, then youâ€™ll take the Orange Line to Clark/Lake and transfer to the
access: You will have full access to all parts of the unit, with the exception of a small closet where we store some supplies.
interaction: We provide all guests with an extensive list of dining, entertainment & transportation tips.  We are generally available and happy to help!  We do ask that you only call after 10 in an emergency as we have small children at home.
house_rules: Please read this all the way through! CHECK-IN TIME: 3:00pm or later CHECK-OUT TIME: 10:00am â€¢You must get our express permission for late check-out â€¢This is often impossible because we are frequently booked for same-day turnovers â€¢We will be as accommodating as possible, but please realize a reservation could be booked even the night before you check-out 1. Be Responsible! First and foremost, we expect you and your guests to behave like responsible adults, at least when you're in the unit. Treat it like a responsible person would treat their own home: if you spill something or make a mess, clean it up. If something breaks, notify us ASAP so that we can replace it before the next guest arrives. Please wash all wine glasses by hand, not in dish washer.  We have had several glasses broken even when guests were certain they had loaded them correctly.  You will be assessed a $10 fee out of your security deposit for any wine glasses you break. Donâ€™t move furniture, without express permissio
host_about:
I was born and raised on the north side of Chicago.  My wife is from Manhattan by way of Rochester and Cleveland.  We live with our son in Logan Square.

She's an academic and I am an entrepreneur and real estate investor.  We both love design, art and photography.

We keep telling ourselves that we're going to start cooking more, but constantly find ourselves out exploring new restaurants and revisiting neighborhood favorites.

As hosts, we pride ourselves on being responsive, providing a clean, friendly environment, and sharing enough local knowledge to help you experience the city not only as a tourist, but also like a local.

neighborhood_overview: One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries â€” many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country. The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour. Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products.

The master is large (14x18ft) with a balcony, very large bathroom with shower and bath. The apartment is approximately 1,600 square feet (150 square metres), not including the back terrace that is about 600sq ft (55 square metres). The dining room tables seats 6, the kitchen bar 3. There is a desk in the living quarters to work at, and a gas fireplace for the winter months.

host_about:
I grew up in Kansas, and after university I moved to Europe. I lived, studied and worked in Italy and Germany for several years. I like philosophizing, traveling, golfing, cooking, snowboarding, boating, camping, cycling, swimming, and thrifting.

I read the Economist daily, and can't be without an idea of what's going on in the world. I love meeting new people, especially from "new" (to me) backgrounds. I work in risk management as a predictive modeler, data scientist and wannabe computer nerd, but I'm not as serious as I make myself out to be.

Fun fact: I've lived in 5 cities in the last 10 years, which includes 22 different apartments. I'm a vagabond. Life is the journey that I prefer to live on the streets and in people's homes and not in museums and hotels.

We are happy to share the experience!

notes: We have on 1 year old Carin/Yorkie mix named Harley. Very Friendly.
transit: There are several options to get around. I am a Verified Uber-X Econo hatch back Driver (evenings/weekends and early AM before 7am) anywhere or to/fm OHare . Also, Public Transportation to anywhere around Chicago literally outside the front door.  Local Chicago CTA has a Trip Planner app and website to help you get around.  The website also gives current weather, travel times, alternates and the cost of the bus, L or train options.  CVS drugstore sells Venture Cards that allows you to ride any of the three public transit systems Chicago has to offer.  This will help you make a more informed decision.  If you drive, free street parking is always available right out front. Green Line, Blue Line, Grand Ave The Grand Metra Train are all close and will take you right downtown.

host_about:
Professional, busy, happy, considerate, down to earth.  Love Chicago.  I have an amazing happy and funny puppy and a cool relaxing fishtank.  I live in a very comfortable, welcoming and homey environment.  I stay pretty active, love life and meeting new people.  Love different cultures and enjoy conversing with people from all over the world.  I'm an avid Volunteer at several organizations, eat healthy and don't smoke. Home environment is very easy going.  
Can't live without: My pets, seafood, coffee, boyfriend :) and my career (not necessarily in that order).
I love documentaries, biographies, world music (RadioParadise).  Love country/farm life as well as city life.  Farmers Markets and street Festivals are awesome!!!
I was recently told that my guests felt exactly as if they were at home.  That is the greatest compliment.  I want all my guests to feel "at home".  
My style of hosting: I would say that we are as room mates, adults with mutual respect and consideration.  I can offer ideas or places to go suggestions if needed, and I'm also quite happy to flow with my personal routine and respect the freedom of my guest travelers.  There is so much to see and do in Chicago, I only hope you get to enjoy it all.
I do have a life motto!  "ILG ILG ILG - Positive Focus"

neighborhood_overview: What I love about my neighborhood is that it is so conveniently close to everything.     Need to get on the highway? No problem, it's 3 blocks south.  Need to go a convenience store? 1 block South.  Grocery store? 1 block South.  Bar? 3 blocks north.    Food, booze, and convenience.
notes: I will have one camera.  It is only viewing the outside entrance. It cannot and will not at any time record or view anything inside the condo.
transit: There are three main public transportation stops!  The nearest one is the 20 bus (aka Madison).  It is 3 min walk for the condo.   It takes you east/West and will take you directly downtown/"the bean"  The second  is   the 49 bus (aka western) . It is 5 min walk from the condo. It takes you north/south.   Lastly, the blue line.  It is 4 blocks south of the condo. (10 min walk)  takes you directly into downtown the loop :)
access: Guests will have access to the entire condo! Instruments are for decoration only.
interaction: I will only interact during the beginning and end of your stay.  In between I will be accessible by phone message.

summary: Private room in the heart of Little Italy with FREE PARKING :) You will have your own personal door code and may arrive at ANY time you would like and as late as you wish. You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times :) Price adapts to demand, my rates change constantly - every night is different! transit: "UIC Halsted" is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). DOWNTOWN/LOOP: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending  on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." O'HARE AIRPORT: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC Halsted." MIDWAY AIRPORT: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "UIC-Halsted." UNION STATION/AMTRACK & GRAYHOUND BUS STATION: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less that 10 minutes for about $5 :)
access: You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive ANY time you would like and as late as you would like. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. All the information regarding your check-in will be sent to you the night before your arrival!  You'll have access to the following: > Free WiFi, central air conditioning, and heating. > Private room includes: comfy twin-sized bed, night stand, fresh towels, closet with hangers, lock on the door with a key. > Spacious kitchen includes: microwave, stove, fridge, dishes, and pods. > Cozy living room includes: large table, chairs, sofa, coffee tables. > Clean bathroom includes: bathtub/shower,  shampoo, conditioner, body wash and hand soap. > Closet to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out
house_rules: There is 1 very important rule: PLEASE READ YOUR CHECK-IN INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY, this is mandatory! Thank you :)
host_about: I am an accountant working downtown. I speak Russian and French fluently (in addition to English, of course) and am available to help 24/7 :) Hotels can get really expensive in Chicago, so I do my best to help tourists out!

We are only 3.5 miles from downtown and near a major expressway. A couple of grocery stores are about a mile away. One can take a bus there or drive. United Center is one mile away, Rush, Cook, UIC hospitals are less than a mile.
notes: Some kitchen necessities provided. (utensils, plates, pan, pot and such+ coffee machine with coffee necessities.) I do NOT have a fully stocked kitchen. Towels for 4 people provided.  Clean duvet and comforters. We have one full bed and one queen bed but will provide an air mattress upon request.  1 outdoor parking spot available. Otherwise, free  street parking is available.  (and not too hard to find a spot). Please note, this apartment is not for you if you are very noise sensitive as you might occasionally hear the upstairs guests.

neighborhood_overview: Little Italy is a proud neighborhood; there are landmarks around the area that showcase Italian culture. The National Italian American Sports Hall of Fame, founded in 1977, is â€œdedicated to preserving and promoting the history and heritage of Italian Americans in sports." Across the street from the Hall of Fame is the Piazza DiMaggio, built in 1998 as a gift from the City of Chicago to the Little Italy area. In the piazza is a much-photographed sculpture of Joe DiMaggio. Another landmark in the area is the Our Lady of Pompeii Church, a community center and shrine to Mary. Open to people of all faiths. Nearby is Arrigo Park, a 6-acre park whose main attraction is a large sculpture of Christopher Columbus. Named for Victor Arrigo, an Italian American who served as Illinois State Representative, the park is a picturesque haven in the midst of Little Italy. There are a number of stores and gift shops that sell a variety of authentic Italian items, including furniture, gift baskets, and art
notes: Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 7 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free parking stickers for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)
transit: "POLK" PINK LINE is the closest pink line train (metro) station, only 5 minutes away (walking). Both PINK and BLUE lines will take you downtown and to Chicago's best destinations in minutes! O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" MIDWAY AIRPORT: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine." neighborhood_overview: You can't walk far on Randolph Street before hitting your new favorite thing. What will it be today? The highly-rated Asian BBQ bellyQ, with tabletop grills and sake on tap? Or maybe it's Lou Malnati's Pizzeria, a heavy-hitting contender for Chicago's BEST deep dish pie? Wouldn't want to miss Grange Hall Burger Bar either, which boasts farm-to-table burgers, ice cream, and cocktails (oh my!)---Dorothy may be right when she said there's no place like home, but who ever said home was better? The West Loop is a study of contrasts: An industrial past meets a slew of sleek new restaurants and shops. Walk down "Restaurant Row" and get tempted by sushi bars, bakeries, breweries, taquerias, and more. You'll also find plenty of chic boutiques.
transit: Between Ashland and Morgan stations, you're about a 10 minute walk in either direction to catch the Pink or Green line to connect you all over Chicago. Free street parking can be found outside the apartment with some patience and a keen eye for signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Donâ€™t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, weâ€™ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

summary: **Long Term Stay Special - Only Accepting Reservations of 30+ days**  Enjoy your stay set in the heart of Chicago's West Loop neighborhood. Coffee bars, restaurants, nightlife, shopping galore! Perfectly situated with easy access to O'Hare Airport and downtown Chicago via the Blue line el/subway train. Excellent accommodations to satisfy all of your needs! Book now to reserve while your dates are still available!
space: My 1 bedroom apartment is perfect for a 30+ day stay for up to 2 people.  Key features: -Brand new king sized Tempurpedic bed -Kitchen stocked with every type of high-quality kitchen utensil and gadget you could ever imagine -Private patio with grill.  Facing west, great for sunsets -Bedroom equipped with black-out blinds and white noise machine -In unit laundry -A Host ready to make your entire experience seamless and wonderful

transit: You'll be walking distance from some of Chicago's best attractions in the Loop, West Loop and River North.  You're blocks from the (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) building, a stone's throw from Soho House and right on top of some of the finest dining in North America.  Public transit couldn't be easier. access: I'll be travelling out of the country so the entire place is yours to use, including wonderful building amenities like a pool, gym and multiple roof decks.
interaction: I'll be away but my brother lives down the street and will be standing by to address any need you may have.
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  -No smoking anywhere on the premises.  Our building is 100% smoke free including within 15 feet of any entrance. -Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music.  Quiet hours between 10p and 8a must be observed 7 days per week. -No gatherings or parties of any kind.  Only registered guests are permitted on premises. -Pets are not permitted. -Please respect my neighbors and my community.  I love them and they love me.
host_about:
I'm a Texan at heart but landed in Chicago 10 years ago and haven't looked back.  I love to sail in Lake Michigan with my friends in the summer and explore Chicago's amazing food scene year round.

Can't live without: LaColombe coffee, my Divvy bike keychain or my Uber app
Visitors to Chicago shouldn't miss: Big Star tacos, the water taxi or architecture boat tour, a drink at the Langham or some live music at Lincoln Hall

name: Bright and Spacious Private Room in Chicago
summary: My spacious condo is in a great downtown location, easily accessible by car, any form of public transportation or even by foot from all the major train/bus terminals in the City of Chicago. Willis tower, Greek town and Union Station are within a few city blocks. No cleaning fees! Free Parking! (Note: The reviews on my host profile are for the same guestroom listed here. I had to re-do the listing, therefore most reviews are not being associated with the current listing. Thank you.)
space: Fairly new conversion of a century old industrial building into concrete loft style condominiums with very large windows in all rooms. Exposed beams, air-ducts, plumbing and electrical conduits give this place a unique charm. Queen size bed in the guestroom with premium memory-foam mattress. Closet space to hang your clothes. (Bathroom is not en-suite, but private for the guests, next to the guest bedroom)

neighborhood_overview: My home is close to many major landmarks in the City.  Union Station : 0.2 mile Willis (Sears) Tower : 0.5 mile  Lyric Opera House: 0.8 mile Randolph Street Restaurant Row: 1.0 mile Chicago Symphony Center: 1.1 miles Millennium Park(The Bean and free concerts in summer months) : 1.4 miles Art Institute : 1.2 miles (Michigan) Lake front trail : 1.7 miles United Center: 2 miles Magnificent Mile: 2 miles Greek Town : 0.6 miles Little Italy : 1.4 miles Navy Pier: 2.8 miles McCormick Place : 2.9 miles All the above destinations are accessible via public transportation. Also Bike rental is available nearby.
notes: Parking: Free street parking is available; ask for details. Request for flexible check-in/check-out times are allowed with advance notice. Third Person's sleeping arrangement: 'SoundAsleep Dream Series' Twin size Air Mattress in the living room, thus privacy will be minimal; plan accordingly. If you are traveling with more than one child, message me first and I will try to accommodate and willing to work things out. I live in the same unit and you will be sharing the common area (living room & kitchen) with the host.
transit: Chicago Transit Authority- CTA buses and trains are steps away! Direct (no transfers) train line from O'Hare airport (45 minutes ride) and single transfer from Midway airport. Walking distance (less than two blocks) to inter city train station (Union Station) and bus terminals. I also have a registered Ventra card for city's public transportation (CTA buses and trains) for guest use. You may load the card with enough transit value at train stations and get around the city quickly. Please return the card at the time of checkout. Uber/Lyft Taxi services are usually under three minutes away.
access: As a guest, you will have access to balcony, living room and kitchen (open layout).  You are not allowed to cook or prepare food but more than welcome to use refrigerator for left-overs or soft drinks (please let me know in advance if you like to have space in the refrigerator.) Filtered drinking water, plates, glasses and cups are available for guest use. Coffee or tea is available. Apples and some snacks also will be there for guests.
interaction: I live in the unit and like to receive my guests in person and interact with them, yet you will have the control of the level of interaction. I have been living in Chicago for past 15 years and am willing to offer suggestions regarding attractions and restaurants.
house_rules: 1. Please refrain from using outdoor shoes inside; you may use your house slippers or use shoe covers (will be provided) or anything you are comfortable with.  2. Visitors are not allowed at home during your stay.   3. No smoking is allowed in the unit.   4. Excessive consumption of alcohol and/or intoxication will not be entertained.  5. No illegal substance/drugs usage are not allowed in or around the building. You will be asked to leave if you are intoxicated and act out.  6. Consumption of food is NOT allowed in the bedroom: Feel free to use kitchen island or dining table.  7. Please be quiet when you come in and out of the unit and building; be courteous to the neighbors.  8. If you like to have coffee/tea in the morning, space in refrigerator, etc., please let me know.  9. If you lose or break the common area key, you will be charged $120 from your security deposit.  Thank you for considering this listing and I hope to host you soon.
host_about: I am a friendly and easygoing person who works as an IT analyst in downtown Chicago. I have been living here for last 14 years. Always excited to meet new people and offer all the help I can to make your visit a memorable experience and a pleasant stay. I like urban as well as rural surroundings. Interests include farms, family, politics and cultures. (Note: The reviews I had received are for the same room listed here. I had to re-do the listing thus most reviews are not associated with the current listing. Thank you.)

If ROOM 3 is booked please try ROOMS 1,2,4 Vintage Chicago Graystone  Flat Bright Sunny Third Floor just RENOVATED Flat has 4 PRIVATE GUESTROOMS on the third floor of a vintage walk up. The flat's doors have keyed DEADBOLTS.  Freshly Decorated  new furniture including FULL SIZED BEDS . Original refinished Maple Hardwood FLOORS.  Two rooms have Exposed painted Brick walls all have closets.   There are TWO shared baths with CARARRA MARBLE floors white subway tile walls and white porcelain pedestal sinks with a FULL SIZE SHOWERS . The space has  10 and 12' ceilings , aa light filled BAY WINDOW, new Shaker Style Cabinetry  with Stainless Steel  appliances, white countertops with a BREAKFAST BAR.   Living Room features a comfy sectional sofa with a
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Chicago's LITTLE  ITALY !  Located 1 mile southwest of DOWNTOWN  Easy walk by multiple bus lines and The PINK &  BLUE Trains  Walk to UIC and Rush Campuses  Nestled between the University of Illinois Campus on the east and the Illinois Medical Center & Rush Medical Center on the west.  Explore the Tree Lined Streets of this charming Historic Neighborhood. Enjoy our leafy Parks, Squares & Fountains. View Century Old Bronzes cast in Italy of Columbus and Garibaldi. Visit our many Historic Churches St Basil, Notre Dame de Chicago, Our Lady of Pompeii and Holy Family which survived the Great Chicago Fire of 1871.     Don't miss TAYLOR STREET  ! !  !  Have an Italian BEEF at Al's, an Italian ICE at Mario's and a Chicago DOG at Carms or Patio.  Devour a PIZZA slice at Pompei Bakery a local tradition since 1909. Grab a BEER at Hawkeyes, Vintage or the Drum and Monkey. Taylor Street is sure to please. No one goes hungry in LITTLE  ITALY.   Manga!!!
notes: We provide both   Keurig COFFEE, Assorted TEAS, POPCORN And a CANDY JAR that won't disappoint .  The room features a FULL SIZE BED with fresh linens and plenty of towels and COMFY ROBES.  There is also extra toiletries, shampoo,  body wash, BLOW DRYE in every room and an IRON and board for your convenience.  We have a HDTV with cable HBO  NETFLEX and a BLUERAY DVD PLAYER.
transit: PINK LINE  The Villa is 2 blocks from the Polk Street PINK Station. The station is covered, has infrared heat lamps and a Dunkin Donuts From the PINK LINE you can transfer easily to the ORANGE LINE to Midway Airport.  BLUE LINE  4 block walk to the LOOMIS / RACINE  stop on the BLUE LINE . The BLUE line will take you directly to O'Hare Airport.   BUS  There are also BUS lines on Ashland,  Harrison, Taylor and Roosevelt Road.   The CTA web site can help you find the best route for you.  WALK  The Apartment is a mere 2.2 miles west of  South MICHIGAN AVENUE. and GRAND PARK.  About a 30 minute walk.
access: Guest will have a KEY so access anytime. We are flexible with check in and check out for leaving luggage. Typically the room is ready by 3:00pm and we expect to clean around 11:00am or after.
interaction: There are 4 guest rooms in the flat. Interact as much or as little with the other AirBnB guests as you like. Once again, I the landlord lives next door but not in the apartment you will be staying at.
house_rules: The apartment building is filled with hardworking medical students. Please Keep it down after 11:00pm. NO SMOKING in apt or OUTSIDE of Apt.  No pets in the apartment. Thank you John
host_about: Im a Husband and Dad of two. Real Estate has been my trade for Thirty years. After purchasing several Rental Buildings I decided to convert an apartment to an AirBnB. My Flat is Professionally Designed, Renovated and  Managed. I look forward to your visit.

neighborhood_overview: Today, Uptown is a diverse, bustling neighborhood filled with great ethnic food, modern bars and restaurants, and lots of history.  One of Chicago's most historic neighborhoods, Uptown was once famously known as an entertainment destination, Chicago's Hollywood. It is home of 3 of the city's oldest theaters, The Riviera, The Aragon Ballroom, and The Uptown Theatre, and was frequented by early film stars like Charlie Chaplin and Gloria Swanson, as well as the infamous Al Capone. Uptown was historically a summer resort destination for downtown dwellers and is bordered by some of the Lakeshore's most beautiful beaches.
transit: One block from Lawrence Redline stop, very close to major bus routes, 2 minutes from Lakeshore Drive, about 20 minutes to the Loop on the Redline.

neighborhood_overview: Home to many of Chicagoâ€™s most renowned and historic entertainment venues, Uptown is an exciting and vibrant area. Its location on the cityâ€™s North Side makes Uptown convenient to suburbs as well as the downtown area. Bound by Lake Michigan to the east, Edgewater to the north, Lincoln Square to the west, and Lakeview to the south, this popular neighborhood is great for visitors and residents alike.  Music lovers will find much to explore in this culturally rich neighborhood. The Green Mill, which is one of the most popular Jazz clubs in the city, is found here. Once the hangout of many notorious people, the Green Mill has a lengthy history and is still a popular haunt for locals today. Other entertainment hot spots in the Uptown neighborhood include the Aragon Ballroom and the Riviera Theater, both of which are popular music venues. The Aragon has hosted such greats as U2, the Grateful Dead, and B.B. King.  Uptown is most closely associated with Argyle Street, the fantastic strip of re
transit: Uptown is well-served by public transportation from the center of the city, with all of the sights and nightlife within an easy walk of the train. The CTA Red Line runs from the Downtown Loop through Uptown (Wilson, Lawrence, Argyle) and near Andersonville (Berwyn). This line also drops you off right in front of the world famous Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs.

No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
