Located in the FUN, EXCITING, ECLECTIC ANDERSONVILLE Neighborhood on the north side of Chicago less than 2-blocks west of Clark Street where you can find a wide array of Restaurants, Bars, Coffee Shops, Bakeries and Boutiques, etc.  The apartment accomodates families of 6 or less. Perfect location for vacations and visiting family. The apartment has 7-rooms 3-bedrooms 1-bathroom kitchen dining room front room sun room You have access to the entire 2nd floor, common area laundry, back yard patio, front porch and garage. You can enter the apartment from the front and back. The building is owner occupied. My wife Cathy and I live in the 1st floor apartment. I am always available if you need anything at all. The Andersonville Neighborhood is a very safe and quiet Chicago Neighborhood. Down Town Andersonville is only
neighborhood_overview: The Andersonville Neighborhood is a very safe and quiet Chicago Neighborhood. Down Town Andersonville is only 2-blocks from the apartment. Down Town Andersonville has an array of restaurants, bars, coffee houses, grocery stores, antique shops and is only 1-mile from the beach's of Lake Michigan
transit: Winona Street is very easy to park on during the day. You will have access to garage parking included with your rental. The Foster #92 bus and the Damen # 50 bus stop is 1-block away from the apartment at the corner of Foster and Paulina. The Red-line L is 7-blocks or a 12-minute walk from the apartment. Or take the Foster # 92 bus. The Metra is 6-blocks away at the corner of Ravenswood and Lawrence.
access: You have access to the entire 2nd floor, common area laundry, back yard patio, front porch and garage. You can enter the apartment from the front and back.
interaction: The building is owner occupied. My wife Cathy and I live in the 1st floor apartment. I am always available if you need anything at all.
house_rules: Quiet time after 10pm. Take trash and recycle to the containers in alley by the garage. Keep the apartment clean. No Smoking
host_location: My wife Cathy and I live in the building in the first floor apartment.

name: Bob Marley grdn( 2 miles N. of cubs) Parking incl.
summary: PEACE - READY FOR THE CUBS WORLD SERIES: - Can hold 4 people One Queen bed and two daybeds(parking included) - Close to transportation, restaurants, theater, music, Wrigley Field (CUBS) - Welcome musicians and people from all over the world - Encourage you to pick up an instrument in our musical livingroom - Music/food/bars/ restaurants in the area, dogs allowed. - No problem smoking 420 inside but cigs please go in front or back
space: This is a garden unit of a three flat in the heart of Andersonville.  It is a very safe neighborhood and is known as the second boys town with plenty of diverse bars and restaurants within walking distance.  There is a bedroom with a queen size bed and the living room has two very comfortable day beds.  It has one bathroom and a well equipped kitchen. It has a washing machine but no dryer. There are two tandem parking spaces in the middle back.  We are close to transportation and not far from Wrigley Field and concert venues.  There is a small garden area in the back. It is a seperate front entrance.

neighborhood_overview: Andersonville Neighborhood., North side of Chicago...Off of Clark and Foster. &  7  miles North of Downtown, Chicago. One and a half miles North if Wrigley field
notes: You can park in the middle tandem parking space.
transit: Close to all public transportation.  Easy to get here from the airport via the red elevated train line.  Bus, train, uber, bikes. Can walk down clark Street to Wrigley Field or take the 22 Clark Street Bus or The Argyle El train red line that will drop you off at addison Cubs stop.
access: 24 hour a day access with own key.   $20 dollar replacement if lost. You have access to the kitchen, please be aware that we know that we are still in the process of renovating the kitchen so if you are expecting a 5 star hotel like kitchen and bath do not book with us.  WE DO NOT WANT BAD REVIEWS! This is why we are telling you  this in advance, it is a manageable kitchen and bathroom.
interaction: No interaction with guests.  Has someone who is managing the space when we are out of town. This person is near by and can be reached. We can be reached by message thou..
host_about: Tarek and Diana are world travelers and down to earth with a Bob Marley inspired life motto of peace and one love. Tarek is a world musician and actor from North Africa, Algeria.  Diana loves photography and art and music. We love to meet people from all over the world.  Tarek speaks French ,Arabic, and English. We are both also in the hospitality industry. Come join us and enjoy some Arabic coffee and talk world Culture and music or politics and religion if you like. You can pick up an instrument and jam in our musical livingroom while enjoying a spliff. We welcome you and you are free here and will feel comfortable and sleep well.

name: Chic Manhattan-style Studio Loft w/ Rooftop
summary: Industrial meets Intimacy in this Uptown studio loft haven. With high ceilings, a fully equipped kitchen, the space is sun kissed with lots of natural light. The building is transportation friendly with just one minute walk away from Lawrence redline stop. The residency comes complete with an outdoor/indoor rooftop, pool with private lockers, a state-of-the-art gym, boxing ring, in-house Paris-style cafe in the lobby, and a 24-hour doorman.

name: 3 Bedroom - Heart of Andersonville
summary: Perfect base to explore Chicago! 3 bed 2 bath condo one block from beautiful Clark St. Includes parking for 2 cars.  Only 2 miles from Wrigley Field. Easy access to public transportation. Dozens of dining options and less than 1 mile to the beach!
space: Location. Location. Location. You will not find a better spot in Andersonville (and I may be biased, but I'll say all of Chicago). If you're coming in winter, there's a street full of spiced wine waiting for you. If you're visiting in the summer, the best beach in Chicago is less than a mile away. We've got three beds: one Queen, one Full and one Twin.  Our living room has a 7' extra long, super comfortable library style couch, two plush chairs and a table that seats four. Kitchen features stainless steel appliances. Free tandem parking for two cars.  We have a washer and dryer, wifi, cable (with HBO) all of which you are welcome to use.  Back porch and grill.  Guests are welcome to send texts or call with questions. I've lived in Chicago for 10+ years and Andersonville is the best neighborhood in the city. We've got plenty of bustling bars and places to sip wine and drink craft beer.  There is unique shopping, casual dining, fine dining, fast dining, etc. The Swedish Museum is here in
description: Perfect base to explore Chicago! 3 bed 2 bath condo one block from beautiful Clark St. Includes parking for 2 cars.  Only 2 miles from Wrigley Field. Easy access to public transportation. Dozens of dining options and less than 1 mile to the beach! Location. Location. Location. If you're visiting in the summer, the best beach in Chicago is less than a mile away. We've got three beds: one Queen, one Full and one Twin. Free tandem parking for two cars.  We have a washer and dryer, wifi, cable (with HBO) all of which you are welcome to use.  Back porch and grill.  Guests are welcome to send texts or call with questions. I've lived in Chicago for
neighborhood_overview: I've lived in Chicago for 10+ years and Andersonville is the best place for 30+ adults and families. The community is big on brunch.  If you're looking for clubbing, this is probably not your spot, but we've got plenty of bustling bars and places to sip wine and drink craft beer.  There is unique shopping and all kinds of dining (casual, fine, fast, unique, etc). The Swedish Museum is here in case you want to experience some neighborhood culture and we've got a great improv theater (the NeoFuturists) around the corner. The neighborhood is friendly for all!
notes: We have two decks- one in front and one in back. The front deck is accessible through a window, but is to be used at your own risk and is not recommended for children (the railing is low).  There is also a smallish backyard with table and chairs.
transit: The #22 bus is less than two blocks away and will bring you past Wrigley Field, next to the Lincoln Park Zoo and into downtown. Ride the El while you're here! The Red line is 4 blocks away and is very convenient for getting downtown quickly. Taxis are prevalent (as are Uber and Lyft) and Lake Shore Drive is close by. I can (and have) gone from home to downtown by car in less than 15 minutes.
access: We have a washer and dryer, wifi, cable (with HBO), back porch and grill all of which you are welcome to use.
interaction: Guests are welcome to send texts or call with questions.
house_rules: â€¢ Check-in time is 2PM. â€¢ No parties or events â€¢ No smoking No smoking inside.  Be respectful of the neighbors. Please don't hang out in the back common area (my neighbor's window is at ground level and it can be noisy)
host_about: My sister and I bought this apartment five years ago. I have traveled a lot of places, but Chicago is the best place to be. Hope you enjoy your stay!

name: Large Modern Room with King Bed in Vintage Apt
summary: Large bedroom in a light-filled apartment with a comfortable king bed. There is an option to have the room set up for an additional full-sized sleeper if a separate bed is needed. (Note: sleeper is $25 one time fee - please see attached pictures). The apartment is very close to the Wilson Redline Stop, abundant restaurants and a variety entertainment venues.
space: Our apartment is located in the heart of the Uptown Entertainment District, on the third floor of a classic vintage Chicago style apartment. Free Breakfast: We offer a variety of breakfast items such as: Coffee, Tea, OJ, Milk, Eggs, Cereal, Oatmeal, Poptarts, Bagels and Cream Cheese (let us know if you have any allergies ahead of time so we can accommodate you). Honesty Bar: The room is equipped with a mini fridge and filled with refreshments such as: Soda, Gatorade, Beer and Wine. We ask guests to be honest and leave the requested amount in an envelope. Bottled water is free. Towels and Toiletries: We offer towels and all necessary toiletries such as: Shampoo, Conditioner and Body Wash. The room is equipped with a hair dryer and flat iron. Printing: We do offer free printing of plane boarding tickets and/or passes related to any activities during your stay. Our printer is wireless and prints easily from most mobile phones and laptop computers. Packages/Deliveries: We do allow deliveri

Bottled water is free. Towels and Toiletries: We offer towels and all necessar
neighborhood_overview: Sarah and I Iove Uptown! It is a live, urban and bustling area with many types of people and cultures living side by side. We are very close to a variety of different venues and restaurants.  Food: On our block alone you can get great thai food, top-rated pizza, ethiopian, sushi, mexican, chinese, vietnamese, and even spend $250/pp for your meal.  Entertainment: We are on the same block as a number of venues including The Riviera, The Aragon, The Greenmill, Uptown Lounge and Uptown Underground.  Neighborhoods and Parks: We are also close to a variety of neighborhoods and parks such as Wrigleyville, Boystown, Asia on Argyle, Lincoln Square, Montrose Beach, the Magic Hedge and Cricket Hill.  Safety: While none of our guests have been harmed or mistreated, we want our guests to keep in mind that this is the city of Chicago and we advise our guests to use street smarts and keep to yourself when riding on public transportation, and going out and walking around past 11pm.
notes: Allergies & Requests Please let us know of any known food or other allergies so that we may do our best to accommodate you during your stay. This helps us avoid use of certain foods/products while cooking and cleaning.
transit: Our place is very convenient and located next to a variety of transportation. The Wilson Redline/Purpleline train stop is across the street and getting downtown is about 30 minutes. Parking: Although having a car is not necessary, there is plenty of parking and we give our guests free passes. Please let us know if you plan on bringing a car so we can plan accordingly. Getting here from O'hare:  1. via Uber - 20-30 minutes and will cost you approximately $20 2. via public transportation - 1 hr and will will costs you $5/pp. Please ask for details so we can give you best route for you.
access: Guests have access to the living room, dining room, shared bathroom, kitchen and private bedroom.
interaction: Interaction: I work full time during the day and Sarah works full time at night. We are always available by text and will check-in with you during your stay.  Guest Introductions: We have done our best to welcome all guests and give them a tour of the room and our space, however sometimes our schedules do not permit us to do so. If you are arriving late or at a time we are both at work let us know ahead of time so we can accommodate you. If you are an international traveler and do not have a data plan, we will send these videos via an alternative texting app. We encourage international travelers to find wifi approximately an hour prior to arriving to exchange any last minute check-in information.
house_rules: With respect to privacy and safety, please understand that we are opening up our home to visitors and expect a comfortable amount of transparency. Please include as much information as possible in your introduction message to make sure we provide you with the best response and stay:  Profile Photo: Please make sure that your profile has a current and clear photo. Reason for Travel and Transportation Plans We like to know where you're coming from and why you're visiting Chicago! Also, at some point, we will want to know if you'll be arriving at at our home by taxi, rental car or public transportation. If applicable please include your flight number and airport (MDW or ORD) so we can track for any delayed flights and plan accordingly.  Social Media Account: If you do not have a verified social media account on file, please understand that we may ask for additional information to verify your identity. Verified Phone Number: Sarah and I will text you frequently prior to and during your sta
host_about: Sarah and I have lived together as roommates for 12 years and enjoy Chicago and all it has to offer. We are fun, chill, enjoy meeting new people and have abundant knowledge of the city.

We have 2 queen beds, 2 queen sized pull out couches, a double air mattress, and a twin air mattress - potentially fitting up to 11 guests.

name: 1909 Vintage Building 1 block from the CTA Redline
summary: My home is a 2nd floor, 1909 Vintage stone building.  Like a museum, there is art all over the walls, collectables, a Baby Grand piano, fireplace, and eclectic chandeliers. Your guest room has an antique queen bed, comfy sofa chair, desk, dresser, cable TV with Netflix, and a closet.  You have your own private bathroom and shower, and access to the kitchen with your own cabinet and refrigerator space, and use of the stove/microwave.  Weather permitting, you have access to the outside deck.
space: I don't mind if you relax in my living room or cook in my kitchen.  By the way, chefs are encouraged to stay here!  And for long-term, business folks, you are definitely encouraged to utilize the kitchen.
description: My home is a 2nd floor, 1909 Vintage stone building.  Like a museum, there is art all over the walls, collectables, a Baby Grand piano, fireplace, and eclectic chandeliers. Your guest room has an antique queen bed, comfy sofa chair, desk, dresser, cable TV with Netflix, and a closet.  You have your own private bathroom and shower, and access to the kitchen with your own cabinet and refrigerator space, and use of the stove/microwave. And for long-term, business folks, you are definitely encouraged to utilize the kitchen. You have access to the Airbnb guest room and bathroom, kitchen, dining room, and living room.  The other rooms (my bedroom and study) are not for Airbnb guest access. I'm glad to help you with directions, transportation questions, which sights or restaurant to go to, etc.  I love and know Chicago ve
neighborhood_overview: Known for great vintage architecture and huge stone buildings, you will be able to walk to many delicious ethnic restaurants, several vibrant bars, 2 coffee shops, 2 major concert venues, and the famous Green Mill jazz club frequented by Chicago's favorite 1940's gangster, Al Capone.
notes: Street parking only.  On nights when there is a concert at the Aragon or Riviera venues, parking might be tight. REGARDING CHECK-IN:  If your flight arrives on a weekday, I will be able to give you house keys anytime after 4:30 pm.  If your flight arrives on a Saturday or Sunday I will accommodate your schedule.
transit: I am a block from the Redline "EL" train to take you downtown to the Chicago "Loop".  Within steps of 3 different bus routes.  Close to Lakeview, Boystown, Wrigley Field, and walkable to Andersonville, Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan shoreline.  Cabs are easy to find (or use Uber).
access: You have access to the Airbnb guest room and bathroom, kitchen, dining room, and living room.  The other rooms (my bedroom and study) are not for Airbnb guest access.
interaction: I'm glad to help you with directions, transportation questions, which sights or restaurant to go to, etc.  I love and know Chicago very well, and can definitely give you some great inside tips on places to go only us Chicagoans would know.  You have plenty of privacy here.  We probably will only see each other when we're both in the kitchen!
house_rules: No smoking, except on outside back porch.  Friendly pooches are ok. Please no others allowed inside premises except airbnb guests.  Keep your voices low in the stairway (neighbors hear it all until you're inside the apartment!).  You can use laundry before 10:30pm.
host_about:
Hi!  I enjoy meeting people from all over the world and look forward to being your Airbnb host in this great city of Chicago!  I'm an single gay guy that moved back home to Chicago from California.  I like chatting over wine, discussing things like art, classical music, museums, cooking, and trying new restaurants.

I live between Lakeview and Andersonville, surrounded by great vintage architecture and huge stone buildings.  I steps from the Redline 'El' train and within 1-2 blocks of three different bus routes.  You will be minutes from Lakeview / 'Boystown' and Wrigley Field, and can walk to Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan, several outstanding ethnic restaurants and lively bars, 2 coffee shops, 2 major concert venues, and the famous jazz club frequented by Al Capone in the 1940s, The Green Mill Cocktail Lounge.

name: Bright Uptown suite by the Lake with large porch
summary: Bright and very clean bedroom with a large en suite private bath.  Features a versatile daybed/trundle which expands from a twin to a full.   There is plenty of room for luggage.  A large desk doubles up nicely as a work space for laptop or a bar.  The bathroom just received a total rehab and features a gorgeous brand new tile floor and vanity(new pics to come).  Cable/wifi. 2 blocks to Montrose beach, 3 blocks to Aragon Ballroom/Riviera Theatre/The Green Mill Jazz Club/ and 24 hr. CTA RedLine.
space: Hardwood and tile floor, freshly repainted, closet and 3 large drawers handle plenty of luggage.  Large en suite bathroom.  Cable, TV, and wifi provided.  The room is one of 3 in a large apartment with 2 baths and 2 lovely outdoor spaces as well as a formal dining room and large living room.  The room opens onto the eat in kitchen making it great for preparing meals.  Off the kitchen is the 3rd floor back porch with a nice lake breeze and large table and grill for BBQing.

Guests have access to t
neighborhood_overview: The apartment lies in the heart of the resurgent and thriving Uptown neighborhood.  The entertainment district is 3 blocks away.  Landmark bars and clubs include:  The Green Mill, Uptown Underground, Uptown Lounge, Big Chicks,  and Fat Cat.  The famous and historic Riviera and Aragon Ballroom concert halls complete the district.  The 24 hour CTA red line is the backbone of the neighborhood.  2 blocks in the opposite direction is beautiful Lake Michigan and Montrose Beach (the city's largest), as well as the massive 1,208 acre Lincoln Park.
notes: This location is perfect for concerts at the Aragon or Riviera! (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)
transit: The 24 hour CTA redline Lawrence "L"station is 3 blocks west.  There are CTA bus routes that head down Lakeshore Drive 1 block east.  The beautiful 18.5 mile long Lakefront Trail operated by the Chicago Park District is two short blocks east.  A Divvy bike share station is at the end of the block at Walgreens making it easy for visitors to explore the lakefront by bicycle.  Wrigley Field is a 20 min walk or quick ride on the L The Chicago Loop is a 20 min L ride.
access: Guests have access to the dining room, kitchen, and back porch as well.  There is coin laundry in the basement.  There is also a separate rear entrance for guest who prefer privacy.
interaction: Please let me know if you have any questions about the city or neighborhood and getting around on the train.  We are all in the service industry and very friendly and can answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: Our rules are very causal.  We work in the service industry so you may hear one of us heating up food in the kitchen late at night but we do our best to be quiet when we have guests.  No smoking indoors, but the back porch is super close.  No pets allowed.  You are welcome to have guests but please be quiet and respectful.

name: Sexy,Inviting Lux Condo: Private Room & Bath
summary: Look no further if you are looking for 5 star level accommodations on North side.  Private room w/ comfy queen bed & full bath in new luxe 1600 ft2 lux condo. Priced  a touch higher than the others... for very good reason! No shortcuts here. Lux linens, towels and products.  Christmas travelers take note: I'm traveling at the end of the year, so very motivated to find outstanding guests. Will entertain reasonable counter offers for extended stays.  You'd have the place to yourself!
space: Seductively luxurious, comfortable space.  Limestone natural floors throughout.  Completely redone and decorated.  Your bedroom has a comfy, quality queen bed with nice linens. Plush Ralph Lauren towels for your use.  You will have privacy- my bedroom is separated by a long hall from your bedroom.  The full bathroom is just across the hallway.  West facing balcony to get some fresh air or grill your dinner.

neighborhood_overview: Ravenswood is a safe, quiet neighborhood.  Just a 5 minute walk to heart of Andersonville or with plenty of restaurant and night life options.  None of the sketchiness you often find in Uptown, which is closer to the lake.
notes: Anna, my lovely cleaning lady,  comes every other Wednesday around noon to clean the condo, change the linens and towels and launder them.  If you are in the condo when she comes, kindly accommodate her to clean your areas.
transit: 15 minutes walk to Lawrence red line station.  Buses right outside on Clark St.  Easy street parking (for Chicago)!  (You are welcome to use my indoor garage spot when I am not home).  30-45 minute Uber or cab ride to/from ORD.
access: All common areas in the space, all technologies, including 65" HDTV, Bang & Olufsen Sound, HD Cable with HBO/ Cinemax, Apple TV, high-speed wifi, networked printer for occasional printing jobs.  Balcony with gas grill.
interaction: I'm quite sociable, so happy to interact with fun, interesting new people.  I'm happy to help you get oriented in the city and have a quick reference guide prepared to answer all of your top questions.  However, I do have a busy travel schedule for work.   If I am traveling for work, I will leave you the keys in a lockbox on the front gate and ensure you are well-oriented prior to your arrival.

name: Luxury One Bedroom, Corner Unit, Great Amenities
summary: This 950 sq foot one bedroom is a corner unit of a luxurious but hip apartment building converted from a 1920s hotel. Blend of deco an mid-century the apartment has lots of natural light, is very quiet, full of amenities and is located conveniently two blocks from the red line train. Enjoy joy craft cocktails in the public lobby bar, soak in the rays on the guests-only roof deck or take advantage of the full gym and pool. The bar is a great place to meet people. Never a dull moment.
space: Well-designed space with quality furnishings, interesting, young energetic crowd in the building. Steps from the lake and from the el train.

name: Sun-Drenched Uptown 1BR - Close to Wrigley
summary: Stay in a full apartment like a Chicago local in a gorgeous historic Art Deco building in Uptown. Just steps from great bars, restaurants, The Green Mill (the oldest jazz club in the US), Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater, and the Red Line. Walking distance to Wrigley Field and the beach/bird sanctuary @ Lake Michigan. Amenities at the building include a rooftop lounge, cocktail bar, outdoor grills, indoor pool, and more.
space: Entire 1 bedroom apartment with a comfortable queen bed, one double futon, and a full length leather couch. Great for a family with kids looking for space, a couple looking for privacy and local flavor, or a group of friends looking for a great time out in Chicago.

transit: - 1 min walk to the Lawrence Red Line station - 1 mile from Metra station (commuter rail) - Divvy Bike station just outside the building (bike along the water - it's gorgeous!) - Ample meter parking, free overnight parking a few blocks away, or protected

name: Airy Uptown Apartment
summary: Sunny, comfortable, and convenient to Andersonville restaurants and bars, Uptown classics like the Green Mill, and the Red Line L train downtown. Cozy and well-kept, with simple mid-century accents.
space: A sunny, comfortable, and convenient fourth floor walkup in Chicago's historic Uptown, only a few blocks from the historic Green Mill jazz club and Little Saigon gems like Tank Noodle and Michelin-starred 42 Grams. Half way down the block, you'll find Baker & Nosh, where I like to get a croissant on Saturday mornings (they only bake croissants on the weekends! Don't worry--their other pastries and breads are also excellent.) The apartment itself is cozy but uncluttered. I've tended toward mid-century influenced graphic patterns and curves, but in a warm and unassuming way. The main space is divided into a living and dining space, the kitchen is a somewhat narrow galley, but I've made it quite usable and pleasant, the bedroom is small and simple, and the bathroom is bright, clean, and white.
description: Sunny, comfortable, and convenient to Andersonville restaurants and bars, Uptown classics like the Green Mill, and the Red Line L train downtown. Cozy and well-kept, with simple mid-century accents. A sunny, comfortable, and convenient fourth floor walkup in Chicago's historic Uptown, only a few blocks from the historic Green Mill jazz club and Little Saigon gems like Tank Noodle and Michelin-starred 42 Grams. Half way down the block, you'll find Baker & Nosh, where I like to get a croissant on Saturday mornings (they only bake croissants on the weekends! Don't worry--their other pastries and breads are also excellent.) The apartment itself is cozy but uncluttered. I've tended toward mid-century influenced graphic patterns and curves, but in a warm and unassuming way. The main space is divided into a living and dining space, the kitchen is a somewhat narrow galley, but I've made it quite usable and pleasant, the bedroom is small and simple, and the bathroom is bright, clean, and white.
neighborhood_overview: Uptown My apartment is in Chicago's historic Uptown, only a few blocks from the historic Green Mill jazz club, the outstanding Ethiopian restaurant Demera, Little Saigon gems like Tank Noodle, and Michelin-starred 42 Grams. On my block, you'll find the excellent bakery Baker & Nosh, a high end coffee joint, and a hipster barber shop. Overall, the neighborhood is quite mixed in economic strata, and there are some seedier moments, though nothing that's ever worried me. Andersonville In addition to Uptown, Andersonville is a stone's throw away, a beautiful neighborhood with a busy main street of restaurants and bars. It takes me about 8 minutes to walk there.
notes: The stove isn't great--it's a pretty cheap small thing--but I love to cook and it's completely functional. I do recommend opening the kitchen window when using the stovetop in case anything gets smokey.
transit: The Wilson stop of the L's Red Line, which goes downtown, is about 5 blocks from my front door. The Clark #22 bus picks up a block away, and drops off at Wrigley Field, Lincoln Park Zoo, State Street, Michigan Avenue and the â€œMagnificent Mile,â€ and Millennium Park. Uber/Lyft come around quickly. The CTA has a great trip planner (EMAIL HIDDEN)  You can also purchase 1-day, 3-day, or 7-day passes for unlimited bus and L rides. Divvy is Chicago's bike share service, and, apparently, the largest bike share in the US. Rent a bike for any amount of time, and there are convenient Divvy stations all over the city. The closest station to the apartment is at Clark and Leland. There is plenty of street parking. Late at night, sometimes it's harder to find than others.
host_about: I am thirty-something, work in the arts, and travel often to LA, where I'm from.

name: Luxury Vintage condo in Uptown
summary: Welcome to Chicago's vintage Uptown by staying in our 2200 sq ft 3 bedroom 2 bath condo. It's a short walk to the L-train which can take you anywhere in the city, plus, Lake Michigan is also just a short walk away. Please enjoy our gourmet kitchen for your breakfasts. Washer & dryer are available upon your request.

The room has California closets w/ drawers + built-in wall shelving as well. The chandelier not only lights up the room it has a dimmer too. (new to your room but not pictured: restored vintage desk/chair) The huge private bathroom is yours to enjoy + toiletries too.  Check out my long-term rates!!

notes: We have a baby grand piano that we welcome you to play during daylight hours and into the early evening.

host_about:
I am an international freelance hair/makeup artist. I have an 18 yr old son Brandon, who is a Senior at Northside College Prep and has attended Purdue University in the summers. If you get to meet Brandon, you will usually find him buried in homework. As for me, when I am not working, you'll find me in the kitchen cooking, heading to the lakefront or going to the local jazz club. We are American, but quite cultured: Brandon is in his 4th year of Mandarin and my Polish/Slovak/Czech are rusty, but I get by. Currently, I am taking Italian. 

We love to host and have visitors. We travel a lot too, I have been to 17 countries and Brandon has been to 9. Many families have hosted our visits in their cities, let us Chicago natives host your stay here in our fabulous city.

Come for the music, stay for the best Vietnamese and Thai food in Chicago on Argyle Street. Relax in Uptownâ€™s parks, have a beach day at Foster or Montrose beach, bike or run along the lakefront bicycle/running path, and get somewhere fast on the red line or Metra trains. access: Guests will be able to use the entire apartment as well as all of the beautiful amenities in the building. Feel free socialize at Larry's Bar located in the lobby of the building!  There is free and metered street parking around the property and an open air lot only 3 blocks away!  Additionally, there is permit parking near the property and, if available, 1 permit (good for 24 hours) per day will be provided inside the unit.  There is a limited number of permits the city provides to homeowners each month so, unfortunately, we cannot guarantee a pass for your stay but do our best to provide this amenity when available.
interaction: I travel often so I use an off-site management team to help guests get the information and service they need to make their stay enjoyable!

Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a late checkout or lost key penalty. 3.) Lawrence House, including our apartment, is a smoke-free, drug-free building, subject to a $500 fine per incident, and termination of our lease. No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Lockouts will result in a $50 fee per oc
host_about: My wife Carrie and I have lived in Chicago 15 years, the last 10 in Uptown, where we are raising our two children. I enjoy shopping at farmers markets, running on the lake, biking everywhere, beer and food.

The owners live on the second floor, which is off limits to guests. There may be as many as 4 other people sleeping in the living room space. This listing is best for those who are comfortable with communal living.
space: You are booking a minimalist room in a sparsely decorated apartment. You get complete access to your bedroom and no one will be in there during your stay except for you and your party. There may be up to 4 other guests staying on the futons in the living room.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Little Vietnam! This room is in a shared apartment near the Argyle train stop. This is an ethnically diverse neighborhood near the lake. There is tons of food in the neighborhood, and less than half a mile from the Aragon Ballroom.
notes: Noise pollution from neighbors can occasionally be loud.  We're averaging about 2 nights a month.  We provide ear plugs and I have no hangups on calling the police if it's out of hand. Just let me know, even if it's 3am.  Call and wake me up.
transit: 4 blocks from the Argyle Red Line stop. Just 4 stops to Addison and Wrigley Field! 30-35 minutes to the Loop (downtown).
access: Guests have access to the facilities on the main floor only. Guests booked in the living room are not allowed in the bedrooms. The second floor is off limits and for owners only.
interaction: I will not interact with you as much, but Jae, your on site contact, will be there daily.  We do our best. In order to provide the best service possible, please note that if you set a check in time, we reserve the right to charge you $3.75 for every 15 minutes you are late.  We both have other jobs and if we are not here we are paying someone 15 bucks per hour to wait for you.   We have no choice but to include this surcharge as every week we have people who ask us to meet them at one time and are late from 1 to 8 hours without so much as a phone call until they are already late.  Please help us by sticking to your schedule.
house_rules: No extra guests. No smoking tobacco No parties No loud noises after 10pm No cooking after 10pm Let us know if anyone disturbs your sleep. Guests are NOT allowed to touch the Thermostat for any reason. Speak to Jae.
host_about: Hey, this is Joe and Alex. We'd be happy to be your hosts here in Chicago. We do our best to set expectations for our listings. We encourage you to ask any questions you have about the listings prior to booking so that we can ensure you're getting the best possible experience. We hate to have disappointed guests!

name: Buena Park Condo on Lake Shore Drive
summary: Perfectly located in Buena Park, enjoy the touristy, and less touristy parts of the city with ease. Take a morning jog along Lake Shore Drive's bike path, or stroll past Montrose Harbor to the beach on a sunny day (take the folding chairs!) Jump on the express 146 bus to the Magnificent Mile and restaurants of River North, or enjoy a short Divy ride to Wrigley Field. Enjoy goffee shops, grocery stores, our local Bar on Buena, jazz, and access to quaint northern neighborhoods too. Street parking

Enjoy a walk around the block with a cup of Dollop coffee, and admire the George Maher mansions that line the n
neighborhood_overview: Buena Park is just north of the bustling town of Lakeview, and is considered to be a quiet and secluded part of an otherwise busy and crowded city. It's situated on Lake Shore Drive, making access to the lake, its bike path, harbor, and beach easy. Enjoy a walk around the block with a cup of Dollop coffee, and admire the George Maher mansions that line the neighborhood (he was an apprentice to Frank Lloyd Wright!).
transit: 146 and 151 buses can take you wherever you need to go. Jump on the red line L train (a 15 minute walk) to get around as well. The 36 bus can take you north to a magic show, or let you off at the Green Mill, a great jazz place.  A $10 Ventra pass is provided to get you started with your public transportation needs, otherwise the bus is $2, and the train $2.25.
interaction: I am usually out of town while guests are staying, but will be around for the key exchange, and a quick overview of the area and apartment.
host_about: World traveler on a budget!

summary: My cozy, vintage rehab condo is the perfect Chicago spot in the historic Uptown neighborhood. Amazingly close to the beach & lakefront path, public transit, Andersonville, a grocery store and Asia on Argyle! Enjoy exploring Chicago like a local.
space: Really great little Vintage Rehabbed condo just north of Downtown Chicago in the historic Uptown Neighborhood.  10 min bus ride to Michigan Ave 12 min walk to Andersonville 5 min walk to the beach 10 min train ride to Boystown I have a new full size mattress in your room. The room and my condo are smallish, but actually quite cozy.  There will be fresh linens and towels.  I also have two cats, Dottie & Lucky. They are a little shy and tend to hide when people are around, so you might not even meet them.

neighborhood_overview: Uptown is a historically rich neighborhood. For over a century, Uptown has been a popular Chicago entertainment district, which played a significant role in ushering in the Gilded Age, the Lyceum Movement, the jazz age, the silent film era, the swing era, the big band era, the rock and roll era, has been a filming location for over 480 movies, has ties to significant spectator sport athletes and organizations, including the Chicago Blackhawks and three Olympic figure skaters, as well as theater, comedy clubs, dance performers who later became nationally famous, and even "The People's Music School," a needs-based, tuition-free music school for formal classical music training. A very popular tourist destination, the Uptown Entertainment District is home to various music venues, nightclubs, restaurants and shops. The Uptown Entertainment District is now experiencing a revival, with new restaurants and shops opening every year. Uptown Square, at the center of the Uptown Entertainment Distr
transit: Amazingly close to lots of public transit options! 1 block from the 92, 147 (Downtown Express), 146 and 151 bus lines 2 blocks from the 36 bus line, a Divvy bike-share station, the Argyle Red Line Train Station and the lakefront path (great for running, biking and walking) 3 blocks from the 81 bus line There is free street parking that is pretty easy to come by during the day, but definitely a little more challenging at nighttime. Getting here from either airport is pretty easy, it just takes a while as the airports are pretty far outside of the city.

The Kitchen is fully equipped and you are welcome to all ame
neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is just as the name states, south of the loop. Meaning we are not far from downtown but just far enough that it is not congested or crazy. The neighborhood is fairly quiet but the hustle of downtown is just down the street.  There are grocery stores and restaurants within walking distance as well as two trains(Red and Green line) and many buses. The main attractions downtown like museums, millennium park, Michigan Ave and Boat tours are a 15min train or bus ride away.  The neighborhood is safe, easy to get around and close to public transport.  Cafe Bionda, Spoke &Bird, Opart Thai and Flo n Santos and Reggies are a few neighborhood restaurants that we love.  Mariano's is a local midwestern grocery store chain that is a few blocks away as well.  If you have any questions regarding our location or distance from certain attractions place ask. There is also a guidebook attached to the listing and I can email you some information as well.
notes: There are two flights of stairs leading up to our loft, no elevator on site. Also expect typical amounts of city street noise. Again, the common areas such as bathroom and kitchen are shared with us and we have 2 French Bulldogs.
transit: We are two blocks from the Mccormick Place Green line station and four blocks from the Chinatown redline station.  Buses that run down State St and Michigan Ave. are one block away and there are Divvy bike shares on the corner. On foot walking to the museums and millennium park will take 15-30mins. Michigan Ave shopping is 10mins away by train as are most other downtown attractions like Navy Pier.
access: While you are here you can use the common areas as much or as little as you want. You will receive one set of keys and may come and go as needed, no restrictions on time.   There is a large living area and kitchen you are welcome to sit to eat and relax and enjoy our home.  The bathroom is shared with us but we have flexible schedules and are pretty easy going.   We can accommodate 3 guests comfortably by adding an extra air beds and the couch in the bedroom.
interaction: My husband and I have lived in the city for quite a few years and have our favorite spots and neighborhoods to share.  We are very familiar with the popular tourist destinations and can point you in the right direction or give advice when you needed. We both work irregular schedules and are always available by phone or email if we are not home. Although we are all sharing the space, this is your trip and your preference and style will decide our interactions. Often when we are home we give you space and stay in our room with the dogs.  Many guests like to chat and share their experiences and many prefer to keep to themselves and enjoy their downtime.  Whichever you prefer is great to us.  Sometimes we also enjoy our quiet Netflix evenings.
house_rules: Check In times are flexible, check out is 10am, luggage storage is available. This is a private room with shared bathroom and kitchen.  We have two French Bulldogs, who love people.  We are located 4 blocks east of Chinatown near Soldier Field and McCormick place if you would like to consult a map before booking. We recommend Timeout Chicago's website for ideas and local events!  We can't wait to meet you!
host_about:
Christopher and I have lived in Chicago for ten years, both from the midwest originally.  Christopher has had the chance to travel the world and I hope to do so soon as well.  My favorite part about Air BnB is meeting people from all over the world. 

We are both active and creative people.  We love cycling (on a tandem bike and solo), photography movies and outdoor activities.   I am a massage therapist at a luxury hotel and Christopher is a visual artist, he actually did all of the decorating in our home which many people find surprising. 
We are also animal lovers and have two small french bulldogs. They love attention but are kept in their crates while we are away.  

We have been hosting on Air BnB for over two years now.  The one thing we have learned is that each guest is different and has different expectations and needs.  If you are the more social type feel free to hang out and tell us about yourself and your day.. If you prefer to spend time on your own in your room we won't bother you at all.  We want you to enjoy your time in Chicago.

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop / Downtown neighborhood is home to many famous venues, destinations, and business hubs. The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza. Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chic
transit: We're located in the South Loop with CTA Bus/"L" access (Red, Green, and Orange Line, Bus #29 State, and Bus #62 Archer) right outside your door. Roosevelt CTA and subway station is just a block away. Easy access to Interstates (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), and 95 give you the easy access to quick travel around Chicago for your commute.

host_about: I love hosting people in my beautiful place. Chicago is one of the most fascinating cities in the world and I am happy I can contribute to your experience of it. I love to travel myself and learn new languages and new cultures.

Norwood Park is one of 77 Chicago co
neighborhood_overview: Norwood Park is one of 77 Chicago community areas. It encompasses the smaller neighborhoods of Big Oaks, Norwood Park East, Norwood Park West, Old Norwood Park, Oriole Park, and Union Ridge. Originally organized in 1872 from adjacent townships (Jefferson, Leyden and Niles) as a village, and named after Henry Ward Beecher's novel Norwood, or Village Life in New England (1868), Norwood Park was annexed to the City of Chicago in 1893. The community is now home to many of the city's firefighters, police officers, teachers, construction workers, labor union workers, engineers and other blue collar workers. Norwood Park is known especially for its abundance of green: lawns, parks, churchyards, and trees are its visual hallmarks. Every Memorial Day there is a parade that runs through Norwood Park. The parade has been a local tradition for more than 90 years, starting in 1922. The community area also boasts the oldest extant building in Chicago, the Noble-Seymour-Crippen House, and Taft High S
notes: If you are allergic to cats or do not like them, please do not book this room. I really love my two cute kittens and they are equal inhabitants of the house. Kane and Toews are used to sleeping on the couch or in the windowsill and generally only go in the basement to use the bathroom. Although they will not be in your bedroom, if you are not comfortable with two cats being around, please choose another listing. Thanks!

Milwaukee Ave - a hub for many buses and the Metra Train. This train runs all day; the buses usually stop running at 9:30 pm. I usually take the #68 bus (Northwest Highway) to the blue line "L" (Jefferson Park station) to get to and from downtown.  CTA Bus: 86 - Narragansett / Ridgeland north to Devon/Milwaukee and south to Ridgeland. There are stops along Nagle including one at Nagle & Avondale/Somerset and one at Nagle and Bryn Mawr. This bus runs between 5:30 am and 9:00 pm.  68 - Northwest Highway east to Jefferson Park Metro station and west to Park Ridge. There is one stop directly on Nagle and Northwest Highway. This bus runs between 5:30 am and 9:30 pm. Metra Train:  Union Pacific - Northwest Line (UP-NW) - Norwood Park station is at 6088 N. Northwest Highway. host_about:
I love to read and watch Science-Fiction (5th Element is my favorite movie!) And being a Chicago native, my favorite food is a piping hot piece of deep-dish, butter-crust Lou Malnati's pizza with plenty of parmesan cheese on top!

I love my two kittens, Kane and Toews, and my job as the Director of Teacher Happiness for Classkick. When I'm not at work, I'm usually playing volleyball, running, or playing board games with friends. I also enjoy watching movies on Netflix and practicing my Spanish!

There are local bars and restaurants that would work well for this.
host_about:
I am a health care provider with an emphasis in alternative health.  In addition I instruct individuals and businesses in how to recycle their waste with worms!  My husband is a local caterer and all around handy guy.  We compost year round and maintain an organic garden in our back yard when weather allows.  We welcome our guests to join us in enjoying our urban garden.

We have a pet friendly apartment and enjoy three furry friends of our own; Eve ( grey cat), Emmie (calico cat), and Ms. Pickles ( wacky little dog).  

We love to travel and stay in unique accommodations.  Unfortunately our lives here in Chicago keep us busy and we don't get away often enough.  Hosting helps fill the gap!  It is always interesting to meet our unique guests and hear about where they are from.

neighborhood_overview: Very safe and quiet residential neighborhood. It's like suburban living with all the amenities of the city.   You could take a walk after midnight and feel safe.  There are restaurants, grocery store, shopping mall, a train/bus station, banks, drugstores, library, all within walking distance. It's all listed in my Guidebook here online or paper version.  I'm literally 2 doors from the highway.  So, it's quick to get anywhere.  My guests told me I'm a 7 minute drive to O'Hare Airport, depending on traffic.
notes: There is a combination lockbox with the house key for the BOTTOM LOCK ONLY.  Please return the key after unlocking THE BOTTOM LOCK so that other guests may have access to the house.  I recycle.  Please rinse out anything to recycle and leave the items at the back door near the refrigerator & I'll take them from there.
transit: The Harlem Blue Line is about 5 blocks away.  You could pretty much get anywhere in the city and most surrounding suburbs.  If you take the Blue Line to the Clark/Lake station, you can transfer to any other train lines (i.e. Red, Green, Pink, Brown...) If you're driving a car,  I'm 0.10 miles from the highway and the exits are 0.40 miles away.  Extremely close by.
access: The bathroom & kitchen are shared.  AirBnB toiletries are labeled "AirBnB" the back of the shower & not the toiletries are in the front of the shower.  There is a kitchen table dedicated to AirBnB.  There's also a shelf labeled in the refrigerator only for AirBnB food. The business center is available for printing and checking emails, etc.  Feel free to use the desk, also.
interaction: I'm happy to help in any way, such as weather, directions to the best pizza or 24 hour establishments, etc.  Feel free to come to me with anything you need assistance. That's what I'm here for. I'm available since I work from home.  I may have a SIM card or a portable modem.

We want to be able to greet you and provide a walk-through of the home with the primary occupant. HOLDOVER If Occupant remains in possession of the Premises for any period after the agreed booking period without the Owner's consent, Occupant will pay $15 of the Occupancy Fee required for the rental per day.  - Quiet time after 10p.m.  For example, no blow dryers, burning pizza, loud noises, or slamming doors in the middle of the night.   - We have a shared bathroom.  Please notify us your preferred time to shower, so we can coordinate with the other guests.  - On check out day, please remove bed linens ( ONLY WHITE fitted sheets, top sheet, pillow cases, towels) & leave them on the floor.  This is how we keep the cleaning fees so low.  ;-) - Please leave your dishes in the dishwasher after rinsing them.  Or you could wash them.  Either is perfectly fine.  Also, please rinse out
host_about:
from Chicago.  I've lived in Chicago my entire life.  Love to travel.  I love to travel. I *almost* became an AirBnB host 3 years ago but was offered a renter.  So, I actually started hosting in my new home in mid-November 2016.
I used AirBnB for the first time Summer 2013.  It was simple and easy and we stayed at a wonderful place in WIsconsin in the country.  The people were honest and straightforward; good Midwestern folk.  
I really enjoy meeting new guests from all walks of life. I also have a home business. So, I'm home very often.

neighborhood_overview: Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors. Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. If carrying around loaded shopping bags makes you hungry, you can stop at one of the district's many celebrated restaurants, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.
transit: The Clark & Division red line subway "metro" station is only 5 minutes away (walking). DOWNTOWN/LOOP is within walking distance, alternatively: TO - take red line towards "95th/Dan Ryan" and get off at "Lake, Jackson, or Monroe" depending  on where you are going :) FROM - take red line towards "Howard" and get off at "Clark & Division." O'HARE AIRPORT: TO - take red line towards "95th/Dan Ryan" then get off at "Jackson" and transfer to blue line. Take a train towards "O'Hare" - the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Jackson" then transfer to red line towards "Howard" and get off at "Clark & Division." MIDWAY AIRPORT: TO - take red line towards "95th/Dan Ryan" then get off at "Lake" and transfer to orange line "Clark/Lake." Take a train towards "Midway" - the final stop. FROM - take orange line towards Adams Wabash and get off at "Clark/Lake" then transfer to red line "Lake" towards Howard and get off at "Clark & Division." UNION STATION/AMTRACK & GREY
access: You will be given a door code to access the apartment :) All the information regarding your check-in will be sent to you the night before your arrival! Washer is $2/cycle, dryer is $2/cycle. Located on the first floor of the building. Washing solution is not provided. > Locker to store your baggage before your check-in and after your check-out, must reserve in advance. Please note that the lock is not provided feel free to bring your own lock :)

host_about: I am an accountant working downtown. I speak Russian and French fluently (in addition to English, of course) and am available to help 24/7 :) Hotels can get really expensive in Chicago, so I do my best to help tourists out!

name: Water Tower District: Large Studio!
summary: My spacious studio has a large living area, dining area, and separate kitchen. You'll really feel like a city dweller here! I absolutely love this neighborhood and know you will too. It's located on a quiet street yet close to EVERYTHING including Lake Michigan (one block) and Michigan Ave (two blocks). In warm months, you have to check out the view from the roof! You can check in any time as there's a doorman 24/7.
space: You can't beat this location! In the Streeterville neighborhood of Chicago, in between Lake Michigan and the Magnificent Mile, on a quiet street, you are close to everything when you stay in this large studio that includes a shared roof deck on the 24th floor with panoramic views of the city!  The apartment is all yours and includes a full and comfortable living area, premium cable with DVR, WiFi internet, a queen bed, and a dining area for two, not to mention an ironing board and iron, hair dryer, fresh towels and linens, and plenty of space for your things.  You get your own set of keys and can come and go as you wish.  There's a doorman 24/7 who will hail you a cab, but you are just two blocks from Michigan Avenue and all its buses, and a short seven minute walk to the Chicago Red Line subway station.  You're also a five minute walk to Oak Street Beach or Navy Pier!  You can't beat this location, and the size and amenities of this place are better than a hotel!  I aim to make this a

neighborhood_overview: Chicago is all about its different neighborhoods, and I live in my favorite one of all...Streeterville! It's tucked away just East of Michigan Avenue so it's quiet and quaint, yet steps from everything! It's flanked by beautiful Lake Michigan on its other side, and Navy Pier and the Water Tower District are just steps away!
transit: Public transportation is very convenient in Chicago, and my area is no exception. You're just two blocks from Michigan Ave and all its buses, and the Chicago red line is about a 7 to 8 minute walk. You can easily hail a cab from my condo as well. Or I'll give you a code to get a free cab ride via Uber!
access: Guests will have access to basically everything in my condo unit - kitchen tools, internet, cable and DVR, and my laundry room and supplies if necessary.
interaction: I rarely meet my guests. Not because I don't want to but it just works out that way because you can pick up the keys from the door man and return them upon leaving. However I always leave helpful information for my guests and am happy to make suggestions prior to the trip through email communication.
house_rules: Please clean up after yourself and wash any dishes used.
host_about: Hi! I'm a 30-something single, professional female who is energetic, kind, honest, and clean!  I enjoy taking advantage of the wonderful city of Chicago like going to shows, concerts, the wonderful restaurants here, enjoying the nightlife, going to museums and ball games, but I don't do it alone.  I have a ton of friends in the city and love spending time with them.  I also have a cat, Howie, who is adorable and fun (he won't be there when you are).  Because I love this city so much, I will give you lots of suggestions and ideas, and am happy to answer any questions you have about what to do and where to go!

space: This is not your typical "corporate" rental, but a beautiful home furnished and appointed with quality and distinction in centrally-located Streeterville.
description: Magnificent views and sumptuous decor in this 38th floor Streeterville aptartment. Great location off Michigan Ave. Fabulous amenities, new stainless kitchen, luxe bath, linens and fine art make this an inviting home for your Chicago visit. This is not your typical "corporate" rental, but a beautiful home furnished and appointed with quality and distinction in centrally-located Streeterville. An amenities floor with workout facilities, pool and grill area, business office, library and media room gives you wide access to recreation and diversions. Yet, it's location, location, location that makes this beautiful Streeterville apartment  so fabulously accessible to the BEST Chicago has to offer. The only way this works is if I get to know you before you arrive - and that's done online. Aside from that, I prefer not to be involved with you during your visit. Unless, of course, you have needs, questions or concerns. I'm always available and happy to respond. Chicago is known for its neighbo
neighborhood_overview: Chicago is known for its neighborhoods, and I have lived in five different areas of the city before coming to Streeterville. I absolutely love the proximity of everything (restaurants, beach, parks, river/lake, outdoor venues, etc.). I also adore the pulse of the city. It throbs and propels one to explore and experience.
notes: Although I live in the apartment 8 months of the year, my personally-identifable belongings are removed so this becomes your home during the four months I rent. One exception: Half of the  4X5 walk-in closet is draped.
transit: I discourage guests from renting cars. In Streeterville, it is easy to walk or take public transportation - or taxis - everywhere.
access: An amenities floor with workout facilities, pool and grill area, business office, library and media room gives you wide access to recreation and diversions. interaction: The only way this works is if I get to know you before you arrive - and that's done online. Aside from that, I prefer not to be involved with you during your visit. Unless, of course, you have needs, questions or concerns. I'm always available and happy to respond.
house_rules: Rule #1: Respect my neighbors and my stuff. That's all I ask. I pledge to deliver everything I have represented in this listing. My goal is that you will have an outstanding and memorable experience in this city and that my home will provide you convenience, security and elegant comfort.  This is a non-smoking building. No pets allowed.
host_about: Chicago inspires me and it is my privilege to provide a beautiful apartment, wonderful amenities and a central location that will give you the opportunity to make your own magic in this splendid city.  My cabin that is nestled in the quiet, blissful community of Higman Park in Benton Harbor, Michigan is also a splendid retreat. It charms everyone and is just steps to a beautiful private beach and the golf course that is host to the Senior PGA bi-annually. Welcome.

summary: In the heart of Chicago's Downtown Neighborhood...This is The Place to Be!! Beautiful, Luxury Apartment with 2 Large Bedrooms and 2 Full Bathrooms in Chicago's Best Tourist Neighborhood: River North (just steps to the Mag Mile & Parks). This is a Private, High-End Apartment on an Exciting City Street just Steps from all the Action. space: THIS IS A TRUE HOME-AWAY-FROM-HOME!! BEDROOMS: Both private bedrooms are furnished with a queen bed and a new Sealy 'Posturepedic' Mattress. Comfort is really important to us, so each bed is luxuriously appointed with high-end linens and pure-white, fluffy bedding (500 thread count sheets and down pillows/comforters). All bedding and sheets are sanitized and thoroughly cleaned in between guests by a professional laundry service. No creepy stains or dark colored sheets here! BATHROOMS: You'll find 2 full, modern bathrooms for your use. Both bathrooms are professionally cleaned between each guests' stay and fully stocked with plenty of clean white towels. Soap, shampoo, and conditioner are also provided.  2 hairdryers also provided. KITCHEN: The high-end, gourmet kitchen is available for your use. Light groceries (coffee, tea, oil, spices, snacks, breakfast items, etc.) are provided, but the grocery store (Whole Foods) is just a 5 minute walk from the apartment for further supplies. You

neighborhood_overview: A stylish urban neighborhood that borders the Magnificent Mile and is just across the bridge from the Loop, River North is the go-to district for those who appreciate fine art and design. And for those who appreciate fine dining and drinks, the momentum behind the latest trendsetting openings continues to build and the late night energy swells. Dormant factories and industrial warehouses began their transformation in the 1970s and 1980s, becoming work spaces and studios for artists and entrepreneurs. What followed was an influx of new businesses that densely concentrated the area and have made River North a hub for creativity and entertainment. Anchoring the area is the massive Merchandise Mart, with its endless trade showrooms for furniture and design wholesalers, and surrounding this epicenter are eye-catching galleries, home stores and antique shops. And architectural standouts are plenty, from the twin corn cobs Marina City to its neighbor the stately, steel and glass 330 N. Wabash
transit: Located in the heart of the Downtown/River North/Mag Mile neighborhood, most places are accessible via foot (Mag Mile, Navy Pier, Water Tower, etc.) Brown Line Chicago/Franklin Station is a 0.2 mile (3 min) walk away from the apartment for easy access to O'Hare, Lincoln Park, Millennium Park, and so many other locations. Plentiful Cabs and Ubers available at your door without a wait.  Attached garage parking included for 1 regular-sized car (no large suvs, vans, or trucks please!)  If you have extra vehicles, or an oversized vehicle, there is plenty of additional parking available for purchase in nearby lots.
access: Guests have Private Access to the Entire Apartment & Attached, Heated Garage Parking for 1 Regular-Sized Car, Minivan, or Mid-Sized SUV (no large oversized trucks, vans, or suvs please).  Extra parking available for purchase in nearby lots.
interaction: I almost always meet guests in person to give a quick tour of the place, answer any questions, and give recommendations if requested. After that, I am available on an as needed basis, just a quick phone call or text away if anything comes up or if you need a tip on the best place to enjoy a meal, go shopping, see a game/show, or the best way to get from here to there.
house_rules: Besides asking that you to treat our lovely home as you would your own, we ask you to follow these basic house rules:   â€¢ ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES!  â€¢ No bachelor or bachelorette parties  â€¢ No smoking inside or on the balcony...Chicago ordinance requires 'no smoking' within 15 feet of any building entrance...failure to follow this rule will impose a $500 fine from our building.   â€¢ No Filming, Film Crews, Professional Productions, or using the Apartment for Business Purposes  â€¢ No unauthorized guests, occupants, or visitors other than those prearranged via airbnb  â€¢ No illegal substances or activities  â€¢ Please remove shoes upon entering  â€¢ Please report damage or problems with the home immediately  â€¢ No oversized vehicles in the parking garage. Mid-sized SUVs are ok, but large SUVs, trucks, and vans will not fit. ***For my personal privacy, please do not mention airbnb to anyone else in the building. If anyone asks, just let them know you're my guest (which you are!).   ***While the home
host_about: As native Chicagoans who divide our time between the Europe & the US, we realize how important each vacation stay is for our guests. We like to give extra service to our guests to make their stay special. We love to travel and discover new places but the most important things in our lives are our family, friends, and home. What we can't live without: each other, our passports, Italian food, wine, coffee, planning the next trip, the internet, and lots of laughter with friends!

neighborhood_overview: What is there not to love?  On the edge of 3 great neighborhoods, Lincoln Park, Old Town and Near North -  there is plenty to see, shop and do.  Whether it's riding a rental 'Divvy' bike to the lake, walking to Michelin rated restaurants, or catching the game - it is literally within blocks (or a few miles). It's the best of what the city has to offer with the conveniences of home. Also, the New City mall which boasts a brand new movie theater, a grocery store, bowling alley and restaurants is literally steps from your front door.
transit: Oh my, public transportation is plentiful.  Within blocks of 3 El Stations (Red, Purple and Brown lines) which can take you anywhere in the city.  Moreover, don't worry about cabs,they are easy to hail at the corner.  Now with the new rental bikes - you can easily cruise the city.  Also, if you do choose to being a car, don't worry parking is plentiful or you can use the garage (for a fee).
access: This is really a home away from home.  You have a private entrance that takes you to this well appointed home. So no need to stop and chat with neighbors.
interaction: We are here to ensure satisfaction with the accommodations and the house.  Please feel free to reach out to us prior, during or after your stay.
house_rules: Since this is a home away from home - please treat it as such.  The neighbors can hear elevated voices.  So please be considerate and respectful.  Smoking is ONLY permitted outside. The use of the rooftop deck is strictly prohibited.
host_about:
I'm in love with traveling and exploring real and authentic life in the 4 corners of the world.  

Not a native of Chicago, I love the lake, the food scene (and dare I say it twice) the food scene.  There is much to do and explore amd I continually find something new to learn.

name: Hostel meets Hotel near Michigan Avenue
summary: Join us at Freehand Chicago for your extended travels in Chicago. Perfect for travelers here too long for a traditional hotel. Make us your home away from home. Including complimentary wifi and breakfast each morning in the heart of River North, you'll love The Freehand Chicago. This listing is for one bunk in a room with 4 bunks (up to 3 roommates). We have many options including private rooms or double-bunks to limit roommates. Please send us a message if your exact dates are not available.
space: Somewhere between a hostel and hotel, you'll find the amenities you need to get through anywhere from a week to a few months. This listing is for one twin bunk in a room with four total bunks, so you would have up to 3 roommates. The room has a private bathroom and lockers for storing valuables. Each bunk features a curtain for privacy, reading lamp, and power outlet. Linens and towels are included, as is regular housekeeping service.

access: The Den is the perfect space to relax and hang out or to get some work done. A guest kitchen is available for food storage and meal preparation. We serve a complimentary continental breakfast each morning in the guest kitchen. Coin-operated laundry facilities are on-site. Cafe Integral is onsite for full made-to-order breakfasts (surcharge) and handcrafted coffee and espresso drinks. Broken Shaker, our James Beard Award-nominated cocktail bar, is open daily at 4:00pm for drinks, food, and fun.

name: Large 2BD 2BA Designers Loft
summary: With beautiful 15 foot ceilings, abundant light and an artistic dÃ©cor, this is one of the best old loft spaces in River North. A 1200 sqft 2BD 2BA in the cities best location there is plenty of room for up to 6 visitors to rest, cook, have a drink and relax!
space: The first bathroom has large shower and is just down the hall from the second room which is a cozy 10x12 space with plenty of room for two people and high ceilings. The bed is a queen which can fit two people and I have a memory foam mattress or airbed we can place on the floor if that is more comfortable for larger parties, just let me know ahead of time. The Master bedroom has a queen size bed and room for another 1-2 mattresses on the ground for extra guests or children. It is huge at about 12 x 15 and has access to the back deck for some fresh air. The space has an adjacent bathroom which Jacuzzi tub shower. Its a relatively quiet space for the city but, it still is in the middle of the city so you can hear the occasional siren and car horns. Towels are provided.  The kitchen, dining and living room are all open and connected and for your use! We have a projector which provides a 5 foot screen for viewing your favorite shows on HBO, NETFLIX or Amazon Prime as well as plenty of room

neighborhood_overview: River North started out as an industrial district and morphed into the home of some of the hottest restaurants, nightclubs and the best design stores in town. Being in Architecture I love strolling down the streets and seeing the latest furniture and home dÃ©cor displayed in the local shop windows. Check out the Merchandise Mart just down the street if you have a chance.
notes: Mushroom Pizza our cat will be gone with us so you may not get to meet him. We don't have carpets so allergies aren't usually that much of an issue (I'm supposed to be allergic to cats but I have no issue with him) and he doesn't spend much time in the bedrooms.
transit: The apartment is located in the heart of River North, with restaurants close by. Just a few blocks from the brown line and a 7 minute walk to the red you can get anywhere in Chicago (or just grab any one of the cabs/ubers on the street). Parking is best found through SpotHero, there is usually an $8 spot about 10 minute walk as well if you are looking for cheap! I'm happy to help. You can walk to the loop in 20 minutes and it's about 15 minutes to the Magnificent Mile. Trendy Randolph street is also easy to walk to in about 20 minutes.
access: Since you are renting the whole apartment please make yourself at home! Just try not to poke in the closets too much! Other than that it's your space. I mean it. Spices and cooking oils you are welcome to as well, just do your best to clean up after yourselves and not light the house on fire :).
interaction: I'm more than happy to give restaurant, nightclub, bar recommendations! I'm still exploring the city myself but I've found a few hidden gems I'd love to share. If you lose your key or something happens feel free to contact me, I should be around to help out.
house_rules: Treat others as you would like to be treated! Let me know ahead of time if you plan to have a small party or anything, I don't mind at all but I just want to be aware. The building also does not allow smoking at all so please just hop downstairs to the front if you have to. During weeknights excessive noise/music isn't aloud past 10pm so just be considerate! There are only a few other units in the building so I don't want to make the few neighbors I have unhappy!

name: Mag Mile Experience No.3 by CHICAGOAN
summary: My building is located just steps from Chicago's iconic Magnificent Mile, Michigan Avenue, the cornerstone of the city. With a Walk Score of 100, the location provides convenient access to eateries, shopping, public transit, and local landmarks such as John Hancock Tower, Navy Pier, and the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago. My place melds the charm of the historic building with modern amenities such as a full kitchen, high speed wifi, Amazon Fire Stick, and iPhone charging docks.
space: This spacious 700+ square foot one bedroom apartment includes a full kitchen, bath, and living room plus a breakfast table.  The unit accommodates 2-3 guests with a comfy Queen size bed and a futon/daybed in the living room.  Additionally, high-speed internet, Sling TV, Netflix, and Amazon Prime Video are included free of charge.

The unit accommodates 2-3 guests with a comfy Queen size bed and a futon/daybed in the living room.  Additionally, high-speed internet, Sling TV, Netflix, and Amazon Prime Video are included free of charge. Access is available to the apartment unit and laundry service is available upon request. Please note: the entrance to my unit is tucked away - not curbside like a typical apartment
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located a block from Chicago's famous Magnificent Mile, you will be surrounded by museums, galleries, luxury shopping, historic local attractions, and popular nightlife venues. For good coffee and pastries, stop by Amorino on State & Chestnut. For a cocktail and modern speakeasy vibes, visit Maple & Ash or Celeste. Shoot me a message if you'd like more suggestions on local spots.
notes: If keys are lost or misplaced there will be a $20 charge. Also, please note that I may need to drop in between the hours of Noon-3pm to check on supplies. If anything is not to your liking, please notify me and I will correct the situation as soon as possible. I am not responsible for packages if they are unable to be delivered.
transit: Cab/Uber service is easily available in this location and is my preferred method of transportation downtown. My place is a block from the Chicago Red Line that takes you directly down to Willis Tower or up to Wrigley Stadium.  The apartment is also near several major bus routes.
access: Access is available to the apartment unit and laundry service is available upon request. Please note: the entrance to my unit is tucked away - not curbside like a typical apartment building. Due to being near the backdoor to a restaurant, the common area is simply a staircase.  Also, keep in mind that you are in a popular area of Chicago. Similar to any big city, stay attentive to your surroundings and use your best judgment when interacting with strangers on the street.
interaction: I will be available throughout your stay to recommend local attractions, dining, nightlife, or any other concierge services that interest you.
house_rules: 1. No Late Check Out Late check out will not be tolerated without prior approval.  Guests that check out late will be charged, at minimum, for the nightly rate on the day of check out. 2. No Parties Parties or other gatherings are strictly prohibited. 3. Quiet Time After 10PM Please be considerate of neighbors and refrain from playing loud music or other excessive noise. 4. Authorized Guests Only Additional guests are not allowed without prior notice and approval. I look forward to hosting you!  If you are unable to abide by house rules, please consider another listing as I reserve the right to end your stay early for serious violations.  I take pride in my home and I am excited to welcome you, but please respect the space and others who live in the building.
host_about:
Born and raised in Rhode Island but proud to call myself a Chicagoan. A few of my interests include architecture and design, reading, music festivals, and sharing this beautiful city with friends and guests!

I look forward to hosting you soon!
