name: Beautiful Home in the Heart of Old Town
summary: Located in the middle of all the action, our home is ideal for your next Chicago getaway!
space: Large European styled kitchen with high end appliances. Our beautiful backyard is a great place to relax after a full day of activities. We have a large gas grill perfect for a summertime BBQ!  Three bedrooms each with a queen size bed. The master bedroom has a chaise lounge, balcony overlooking the backyard and an attached bathroom with both a walk in shower and large bathtub.  There are three televisions, with a full Comcast package (on demand, HBO, Showtime, etc.). In the basement we have a large family room, complete with a large comfy sofa and adjoining full bathroom.
description: Located in the middle of all the action, our home is ideal for your next Chicago getaway! Large European styled kitchen with high end appliances. Our beautiful backyard is a great place to relax after a full day of activities. We have a large gas grill perfect for a summertime BBQ!  Three bedrooms each with a queen size bed. The master bedroom has a chaise lounge, balcony overlooking the backyard and an attached bathroom with both a walk in shower and large bathtub.  There are three televisions, with a full Comcast package (on demand, HBO, Showtime, etc.). In the basement we have a large family room, complete with a large comfy sofa and adjoining full bathroom. You have full access to the house, with exclusion of the storage room which is located in the basement. Please feel at home and enjoy everything this great location has to offer. Our daughter, Amanda will be in town to let you in and answer any questions you may have regarding the house and neighborhood suggestions. Old Town is
neighborhood_overview: Old Town is the epicenter of Chicago. It is the oldest part of the windy city, with beautiful houses perfect for an afternoon stroll. But if you would like to explore the many other beautiful neighborhoods of Chicago we are within walking distance of Gold Coast, Lincoln Park and Michigan Ave. Other fun neighborhoods such as Millennium Park Wrigleyville, Lakeview, Bucktown, and Wicker Park are easily accessible by "El" or bus (both can be found within blocks of our home).
transit: The Brown Line and Purple which gets you right to the heart of downtown is two blocks away.  The Red Line also takes all over the city including both Soldier Field and Wrigley Field! The buses which are located a block from our home will also give you full access to the city!  But don't forget Chicago is best viewed on foot! Our location allows you to take a relaxing walk along the lakefront trail! But you can also rent Divvy Bikes, which can be rented in three locations all within two blocks of our home!
access: You have full access to the house, with exclusion of the storage room which is located in the basement. Please feel at home and enjoy everything this great location has to offer.
interaction: Our daughter, Amanda will be in town to let you in and answer any questions you may have regarding the house and neighborhood suggestions.
host_about:
Hey everyone! My name is Amanda, I was born and raised in beautiful Chicago, IL. Like most people on this site I love to travel which I have to attribute to my parents, who from an early age took me and my sister all around the world, seriously there are a lot of pictures of us on camels and horses. We have been lucky enough to travel to crazy places like Bhutan and crawl through ancient Mayan caves in Belize, its been a lot of fun and will continue to be an integral part of all our lives. 

Through our travels we have met amazing people who welcomed us into their homes and made us feel connected to the local community! I first started using Airbnb obsessively when I was living in Denmark and using every free moment to travel around Europe. I loved the experience so much that I was able to convince my parents to ditch the traditional hotel route. We all have become huge Airbnb advocates, and wanted to open our home to people coming to Chicago!

Like most Chicagoans we are very proud of our city! There is so much to do and see and so many great restaurants to eat at, yes our local cuisine extends beyond deep dish pizza (but seriously deep dish is amazing)! 

Feel free to reach out to us regarding any questions you may have! We look forward to welcoming you into our home!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of Old Town just east of Wells on Schiller ave. Wells St is the main drag that goes through Old Town and houses many of the top boutiques, restaurants and cafe's.  Old Town is the oldest and most affluent neighborhood in Chicago and centrally located between Lincoln Park four blocks to the North and the Chicago Gold Coast and Magnificent Mile four blocks to the South. The Chicago loop is easily accessed by the multiple public transportation stations directly within the vicinity.  We are walking distance away from Historic Oak St (Shopping)., Oak St Beach, North Avenue Beach, and the Chicago Magnificent Mile (Shopping), â€œMichigan Aveâ€. Minutes from the Chicago Loop and Historic Lincoln Park. Minutes from multiple public transportation resources and the Metra Rail, Navy Pier, all of the Convention Centers, all of the Theaters and every sporting venue.  Plus, right in your proximity you will find Walgreens, Starbucks, Treasure Island, Jewel, currency exchanges
transit: Old Town is a great neighborhood to just walk around an explore! Four blocks South of the apartment, about a ten minute walk, is the Clark and Division CTA Red Line station. The Brown Line train is also a 10 minute walk from us at Sedgwick about 5 blocks northwest. There is no parking onsite but street parking on the surrounding blocks is free with parking permits, which we can provide upon request. There are also many other paid parking lots within the direct vicinity as well.

name: 4B DowntownChicago Loft w/  Skyline View Roof Deck
summary: Unbelievable location in Old Town with tons of space, 3 big bathrooms, outdoor patio, and amazing roof deck with the best view of the skyline. 3 king beds, 1 full bed, 2 futons, and large leather sectional. Close to everything and comes with parking! Steps away from an L Stop, Second City, world class dining + nightlife, there is no better location than this in Chicago. Highly desired by locals, you'll be among multimillion dollar homes. 90+ Walk and Transit score! Fall in love with Chicago!
space: I love this place! It is a penthouse single floor unit with the absolute best location. It is less than a 2 minute walk from the Sedgwick Brown Line stop which opens the entire city to you for a few bucks and a quick train ride. My favorite part of this location is the proximity to the world famous Second City Comedy Club. If you are in town for just a few nights - you HAVE to make it to a show!  It is also close to some of the best restaurants, nightlife and shopping that Chicago has to offer. There are 2 big bedrooms each with en suite full bathrooms. Plus an extra half bath and washer/dryer. The first bedroom has 2 king beds and the second bedroom has one king and one full. There is also a full kitchen with seating for 7, outdoor seating for 6, and a huge living room. There is a 50'' Smart TV - a large leather sectional and two leather futons! Best part - huge roof deck with unbelievable skyline views. A glass of wine up here at night is a true Chicago experience. Important Notes :

notes: This is a traditional Chicago brownstone. While it is not a brand new property, I am having the property professionally cleaned before and after every guest. It is a highly rated place by locals but probably not well suited for guests expecting a 5 star hotel!

access: Guests have access to the whole place via private entrance and a parking spot! On the third floor - so if you have trouble with stairs, probably not a good fit. You'll need to bring your own toiletries. We provide a beginning supply of bathroom tissue and hand soap!
interaction: I love Chicago and meeting new people. My girlfriend or I are always happy to help with a true local recommendation.

host_about:
We are your source for exclusive fully furnished property rentals. We have been in business since 2010 and our property base is growing daily. Now its time to offer our properties to AIRBNB Costumers. We are specializing in Chicago area and Miami, our friendly team of vacation specialists have an intimate knowledge of all our properties and will find the vacation rental to suit your needs. Whether your trip is for business or pleasure, our properties are outfitted to provide you with a comfortable and pleasant experience. Enjoy all the amenities of a hotel, such as concierge services, wireless internet, cable, flat screen television and luxury linens and bedding. Add to that the additional space, privacy and flexibility of a private vacation home, along with fully equipped kitchens, and you have the perfect vacation. Let us take care of the details.

We respond to all inquires 24/7 ASAP.

name: Gold Coast Lake Front Apartment
summary: Cozy 1 bedroom/ 1 bath with large space in the main living area. Great view of Lincoln Park and partial view of the lake. Large king size bed and large couch can easily sleep 4 (queen size aero bed will fit in the  living room as well) Easy access to the lake front. Gorgeous updated rooftop with grills and deck chairs- OPENS Memorial Day weekend! Grocery store and parking in the building. Charming neighborhood and restaurants and shops are just blocks away. Rental for April and May only.
space: My  place is cozy and many people say it is a relaxing, enjoyable space. Big couches and chairs, gorgeous views from the 19th floor. You can see the Lake front and Lincoln Park. So many restaurants, shopping, and other activities to do all within blocks. The building has a grocery store to make things easier for last  minute needs during your stay. It's just super cozy and inviting to snuggle between your outings for for the day. Easy to get around the city on bus or uber.

neighborhood_overview: On the lakefront  and Michigan Avenue shopping is just a few blocks away. Many restaurants are close by. The zoo is a 20 minute walk through the park. The CTA 151 Bus stops right in front of the building.  Very convenient location.
notes: This is a great building with mostly mature and respectful  adults. When staying, be respectful of your tone and noise level late at night. This is not a loud party building. Please keep it that  way. There is plenty of clubs and bars that stay open very late where you can howl at the moon. Just not back at the apartment.
transit: The CTA buses, uber, or a cab. There is a cab stand right by the building.
access: Guess have access to the rooftops on the building that has two barbecue pits and a bar like area to cook and entertain. Plenty of deck chairs and tables. Guests can also use the gym, grocery store, and dry cleaner in the building. Hourly parking is offered in the building.
interaction: I am mostly out of town but some dates I will stop by for something but will call first to check in. Open communication is expected at all times. If I am not out of town , I can be more accessible to meet the guests socially too if that is a preference.
house_rules: No smoking or pets are allowed in the apartment.  No parties in the apartment, listed guests only in the apartment. Be respectful of the other tenants on the floor in regards to noise level.  Enjoy the beauty in the neighborhood and all there is to do in the city.

host_about:
Hey I'm James, 

I've been living in the city for a while now and am looking for a roommate to fill my extra bed/bath.  I have 3 grown, successful children. I personally don't stay in much, I like going out to eat,  movies, walking in the city, and grilling out.   Traveling has been a huge passion of mine. I've been all over the world - enjoy meeting new people and exploring the cultures.

As a host or a roommate (for longer stays) I keep to myself to respect your privacy. I'm also outgoing so I will not mind if you want to have a conversation.  Very clean and quite. I don't listen to any loud music or cook often so you don't have to worry about disturbances.

neighborhood_overview: Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetiteâ€”for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop, to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.

summary: Deluxe & comfortable one-bedroom apartment in downtown Chicago's vibrant and historic Printer's Row neighborhood. Near Clark & Harrison. ALL GUESTS MUST BE VERIFIED, SCREENED, AND BACKGROUND CHECKED. GOVERNMENT-ISSUED PHOTO ID NEEDED FOR CHECK-IN.
space: This luxurious suite creates the perfect centerpiece for any trip to Chicago, whether for business, pleasure, or both. Not only will you have an incredible view day and night, you will also be centrally located in a hub of all that Chicago has to offer in sightseeing, nightlife, arts, and entertainment.  The unit is located in the heart of the city, very close to Michigan Ave., in a haven that has a reputation for being eclectic, interesting, artistic and tightly-woven. This magnificent building also features a swimming pool and hot tub, balcony and lounge, business center, and more. You will have a king bed, pull-out couch, and an air mattress within the unit, as well as a private washer and dryer, cable television and high speed wi-fi.

neighborhood_overview: Located in downtown Chicago's Printer's Row.  The area has a reputation for being eclectic and interesting, artistic and tightly-woven. Walking distance to Chicago's bustling business district, shopping, dining, culture, and entertainment.  2 miles from McCormick Place.  Here is a list of my favorite restaurants, cultural centers, and entertainment venues all within walking distance of the apartment: Restaurants - Mercata a la Planxa, Hackney's, Giocco, Umai, South Loop Club, Blackie's, Chicago Firehouse Restaurant, Lou Malnati's, Buddy Guy's Legends Culture/Entertainment - Willis (Sears) Tower, Lake Michigan, Soldier Field, Museum Campus (Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium), Buckingham Fountain, Art Institute of Chicago, ShowPlace ICON Movie Theatre, Chicago Cultural Center, Oriental Theatre, Petrillo Music Shell, Harris Theatre, Auditorium Theatre at Roosevelt University, Chicago Theatre, Pritzker Music Pavilion, Goodman Theatre, Symphony Center.
notes: If there's anything you need, please don't hesitate to ask!
transit: If you can avoid having a car, I recommend it. If not, your best option will be to download an app such as SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find discounted spots in parking lots throughout the area. If using public transportation, Chicago's public train system called The L is the best way to get around. There are redline, brownline, and blueline stops all within a few blocks of the apartment.
access: As an "Entire home" reservation, you'll have the ENTIRE suite to yourselves. Enjoy the privacy and luxury of this unique experience :) All amenities shown in the pictures are available to guests too: hot tub, gym, club room, swimming pool, lounge. Just please be polite and respectful to others in the building.
interaction: We can interact as much or as little as you want.  I travel frequently, so even if I'm not here, you can always reach out to me for anything you may need.  The best way to reach me is through airbnb messaging.  If I'm around I'd be happy to show you around or just leave you alone :-).
house_rules: PLEASE REVIEW. FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH HOUSE RULES IS GROUNDS FOR VOIDING YOUR RESERVATION AND IMMEDIATE EVICTION. 1) Please be respectful to others & the property. 2) No smoking. 3) No pets. 4) No parties. 5) No unauthorized guests. Again, GOVERNMENT-ISSUED PHOTO ID IS REQUIRED FOR CHECK-IN. This is extremely important, and there is zero tolerance. If you do not have an ID, you will NOT be able to check-in, and you will NOT be refunded. Please note that this is an apartment building with a 24/7 concierge & security team. This is NOT a hotel. The other people in this building live there full-time, so PLEASE respect the fact that you are guests in a place others call home. The concierge, while extremely friendly and helpful, is not a bellhop :)
host_about:
Recently graduated from U of M - I'm not sure how long recently actually lasts for - anyway, Iâ€™m living it up post-grad; aka trying to figure out this adult thing and picking up some hobbies that don't involve sleeping.

I currently work in enterprise analytics in Chicago. I'm originally from Europe and lived in several places all over the world.  Traveling and trying new things are a big part of my life, and hopefully airbnb will help me do more of exactly that!

Some of my favorite things to do when I have spare time include talking about psychology, eating Chipotle, drinking coffee, and watching da Bears.

Hope to meet you all when I'm either staying at your airbnb or hosting you at mine! :)

neighborhood_overview: The South Loop is such a dynamic mix of attractions and histories that the neighborhood tends to be seen as many different things to many different people. Consider the assorted areas that comprise the South Loop: Much of its eastern edge is encompassed by the Museum Campus, an impressive collection of cultural treasures that includes the Field Museum, Adler Planetarium and Shedd Aquarium. This campus sits on scenic lakefront parklands that are an extension of Grant Park. With 319 acres of green space and recreational fields, Grant Park is known as "Chicago's front yard" to locals and also plays host to major city events such as Taste of Chicago, Chicago Blues Festival and Lollapalooza.  Jutting out further into Lake Michigan is Northerly Island, a peninsula sought out by nature lovers, while along the southern edge the sports fans know Soldier Field as the stadium for the beloved Chicago Bears football team. summary: This AD is for a twin size or full size Bunk bed, in a shared room(s) with other guests. For each person, I provide linen, blankets and pillows. No sharing beds. This is NOT a private room.
space: You will be staying in EITHER of the TWO (2) SHARED ROOMS! One room sleeps 5-7, the other room sleeps 4.  The location of the space will be based on availability at the time of your arrival. (The monthly rate is $350 per month, per person.) You will have access to a full kitchen equipped with utensils, pots and more.  The kitchen in the apartment is closed from 10 pm. until 9 a.m.  However, there is another kitchen (and bathroom) on the lower level that is available 24 hours.  The kitchen in the lower level is equipped with a  microwave and refrigerator. FREE PERKS INCLUDE: - FREE pickup from 87th & Jeffrey  (From 10p.m.- midnight).; NO SHUTTLE if weather is below 35 degrees) - FREE TRIP TO HORSESHOE CASINO (Fri-Sun) - FREE Parking - FREE Wifi Internet - FREE Coffee, Tea and more - FREE Linen & Towels - FREE Use of Kitchen appliances, pots, utensil - FREE Museum tips - Shedd, Art, Field, or Science &  Industry & More! neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a quiet residential area.  I am 10 minutes by car from the beach; less than 5 miles from University of Chicago and 10 minutes from the Horseshoe Casino; 30 minutes by bus to Jackson Park Hospital.
transit: NEARBY TRANSIT LOCATION: You have a couple of options to reach my home to downtown:  Option 1 -   The '87th Street' bus stop is located at the corner of my block.  This bus will connect you to the Jeffrey bus.  The Jeffrey bus will arrive to downtown within 35 minutes.  From downtown you can catch the Jeffrey bus on Michigan Avenue.  Option 2 - Take the 87th bus to the Red line train. Option 3 - The metra train is a 10 min walk away.  It will bring you to the loop in 20 minutes. DISTANCE TO CITY CENTER/DOWNTOWN LOOP. My home is located approximately 11 miles from downtown/Loop area. It is a 45 minute ride to downtown loop by bus; or a 20 minutes drive by car.   I am less than 5 miles away from President Obama's Home and the University of Chicago.
access: A key code will be given prior to arrival for flexible entry time (even tho your beds will not be available until after 6 pm.)  Please review your airbnb confirmation page for instructions, directions and more.
interaction: Arrivals Monday - Friday - Checkin is officially after 6 p.m.  However, you may arrive as earlier and wait in the lower level.  The lower level is NOT where you will be staying and therefore there are no photos listed to reflect this area.  This is a WAITING AREA ONLY.  I will have someone to meet up with you.  Please let me know at least the day before approximately what time you will be arriving.
host_about: Hi Airbnb Community.  My name is Ms. Vee.  I am very excited to become a part of the Airbnb family.  I love travelers, meet new people, experience different cultural foods and bargain hunting.   This is all new to me but I am eager to help make your stay a memorable one.

interaction: Im on site so I can interact as often as you need me
house_rules: WELCOME!!!  There are a few particulars to consider with your stay: SMOKING ALLOWED ON PRIVATE OUTDOOR DECK ONLY NO SECURITY - respect the unit and any other guests;  for the comfort of all guest, please call or message upon arrival (no ringing of bells please);  lock the exterior door upon exit or entry;  maintain the unit as if you were charged a security deposit  and cleaning fee; place garbage in designated area  (keep unit clean, especially kitchen and bathroom - tidy up immediately after use); remove your personal hygiene items from the bathroom;  use or consume groceries or items that were explained as complimentary or that you purchased;  please eat in kitchen and dining areas and keep food in refrigerator or kitchen area only;  smoking is allowable only outside the property; If key provided, leave with me or dining room table upon check out THANK YOU AND ENJOY YOUR STAY!!!
host_about:
Southern belle quality of life with city experience who loves Chicago for its art, rich history, fine cuisines and many things to do. Although this is not a commercial hotel, my guests have described this charming unit as gorgeous, inviting, warm and comparable to a vacation property. In all fairness to me, this is not a lavish hotel. I don't have the latitude or riches of the Hilton or Ritz Carlton  :-)    It is my well kept home that I share with travelers. 
I try to make you feel at home and satisfied. Many have said their stay was like staying with hospitable family members and I have been affectionately nicknamed "Auntie Cass". You are welcomed to book your stay at Cass' Place. If you want to sample home cooked meals, I will prepare meals and even offer shuttle at a cost upon request. I strive to create a 5â˜†star experience at an affordable price.  I'm interested in knowing what you are looking for in your stay. My goal is to make sure every guest has a great experience !!! I look forward to meeting you!!!
Cass ("Auntie Cass")

summary: This spacious apartment offers sleek hardwood floors, charming architectural details, and an expansive kitchen. Located in Wrigleyville, all the bars, restaurants and shopping of greater Lake View are at your finger tips.
space: Whether you're in town to watch Chicago's beloved Cubs or here on pizza-and-jazz related business, this newly renovated apartment by Wrigley Field is the place for your group. With space to sleep eight and a large kitchen, there's plenty of room for you and your crew to rev up to take on the town. Lounge out on the large porch with a coffee or a beer and raise a glass to the Windy City. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentialsâ€”everything you need for an exceptional stay.

Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Donâ€™t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations.
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located by a Whole Foods for your grocery needs. Dining out instead? Check out Tutto Fresco up North Halstead for old-school Italian fare, or a little further over to The Irish Oak for traditional eats of the Emerald Isle and a pint of Guinness.  Wrigleyville is not only steps away from Wrigley Field, but also on the border of Lakeview, an area to the south full of hip restaurants and bars. Because it's bordered by Lake Michigan, it has some of the best views in the city.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help just give us a call.
transit: Just under ten minutes on foot will take you to the Sheridan station where you can hop the Purple or Red line for full-city access. If you're driving, there's a parking garage right around the corner where you can park for around $20/night.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. For security purposes, we require all guests to provide proof of identification through ID verification on our website. In order to check in, all guests must complete this process before 6 pm on the day of arrival. 3. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   4. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 5. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 6. Most of our
host_about: Flatbook is now Sonder. Sonder provides everything you need for an exceptional stay. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials. And every experience is one-of-a-kind, thanks to our unique spaces and Neighborhood Guides.

name: Ultimate Wrigley / Red Line Apt. W/ A View
summary: Spacious apartment right in the middle of things in Wrigley Field. Walk right out the front door and you're in front of the field and the Red Line stop, could not dream of staying any closer. Couch is in the living room where you will have a spacious area with beautiful view of Wrigley Field, and you can even hear the games while they go on (concerts as well!).
space: Lots of work space and very spacious and open apartment. Should not feel cramped whatsoever, and great if you're visiting to see a game or concert.

name: NEW! Family Home - Hidden Gem in Wrigleyville
summary: This bright, custom designed, 4 bedroom, 3.5 marble bath home offers ample living, play, and office space with top of the line finishes, furnishings, and linens. It is a perfect vacation home with a tree covered back porch (with table, chairs and a grill) offering privacy and a backyard that leads to a two car garage. Located in Wrigleyville near the hot Southport Corridor. Great extras! 2 car garage + 1 permit for street parking, girls and boys kid toys, DVDs, video games, crib, and 3 TVs.
space: The Master bedroom has a King bed, its own private bathroom with a large clawfoot tub, walk-in marble shower, and double sink with marble top. There are three additional bedrooms with Queen bed, Twin bed, and full bed + crib. In addition, there is an office with a Queen size air mattress as well as  a large couch in the TV room.  Ideally, up to 8 adults very comfortably sleep in beds without resorting to the couch in the TV room and there is enough sit down dining space for up to 6 people in the kitchen (not including island) and 6-8 in the dining room.

name: Luxury, private bedroom suite in Lakeview
summary: This private master bedroom in a luxury duplex is a quiet retreat right in the heart of Lakeview. Located just a few steps from Wrigleyville and Boystown on a quiet, tree-lined street, this master bedroom offers it own in suite bathroom with tub/shower, a sofa for a relaxing read, tv and ample closet space.
space: This unit is ideal for business travelers or couples visiting family or simply exploring the city.  Because the unit is occupied by an owner that works from home, parties or late noise is not permitted.

This unit is ideal for business travelers or couples visiting family or simply exploring the city.  Because the unit is occupied by an owner that works from home, parties or late noise is not permitted. The unit offers limited access to common areas on the lower floor, which includes a large tv and lounge area; and although the unit is owner occupied, this master bedroom feels very private. High speed wifi access is provided also. access: The unit offers limited access to common areas on the lower floor, which includes a large tv and lounge area; and although the unit is owner occupied, this master bedroom feels very private. High speed wifi access is provided also.
host_about: I am a MidWest born guy that has been in technical sales and who loves interacting with people.  Having traveled frequently for work and pleasure, I know how impersonal hotels can be and therefore thought I would try airbnb as a way to improve the stays of fellow travelers. I love meeting new people and having new experiences.  I am looking forward to meeting others and making their stay in Chicago a great experience.

name: Posh Flat, Close to Downtown (No 2)
summary: A lovely (and tiny) bed 'closet' in a beautifully appointed home in the best area of Chicago.  Close to the lake, transit, exciting nighlife....not to mention complete with an overly friendly cat named Angus and a rather outgoing host.
space: At the start, we have two of these sleeping closets.  One north, and one south.  This is for the south room.  They are virtually identical. Since I am notoriously wordy to begin with, and writing a description of my own flat makes me nervous...forgive me if this comes across as rather too enthusiastic.  I will refrain from using any exclamation points. If you choose to stay with us, you give to experience something that straddles the lines of a little too perfect, a little too quirky, a little too posh, and a little too Martha Stewart.  The flat is in a creeky-old, yet very typical, Chicago building.  It is on the 8 step  elevated ground floor and is blessed with broad expanses of windows that face into a courtyard.   The basics of the flat include a proper bath, living room with TV and comfy sofa, a real kitchen, a cocktail kitchen, a dining room, a sitting room, and lots of room to spread out in the lower level as needed.  Wifi is everywhere. If needed, guests can have access to prof

The basics of the flat include a pro
interaction: I am around, and will be as helpful as possible / needed.  It is a highly fun and social household so you will have soem built in Chicago friends as soon as you arrive.
house_rules: Common sense abounds.  Tidy up after yourself, don't track in unspeakable things on your shoes, coasters under sweaty glasses on wood surfaces, and attempt to not hula hoop whilst showering.  It is an old building, so noise will travel up to the neighbors (URL HIDDEN) keep the TV at a normal level, try to not shout into your mobile, and (much as we do think they are adorable) this is not a child appropriate dwelling.  You are welcomed to use the kitchen (goodness knows we don't) and even entertain...we just ask that you return everything to it's tidy state when you are done.
host_about:
In a nutshell, I am a fun 30s fellow who lives in Chicago and does high end interior design work.  

I have always been interested in showing hospitality to others.  Before airbnb this was mostly done by inviting friends and others over to my home for dinner or cocktails....but I find it equally rewarding to be able to host a traveler and know that my home with influence their trip for the better.  

As I am getting older I have decided that I really want to travel and see more of the world...but limited finances (coupled with my refusal to sit int he back of planes) as well as a desire to really get to see how people live and just not how tourists are treated makes this a great option for me!  

I have quite a few different interests, but I am very into anything design related (architecture, shops, urban life) and am an avid collector of mid century furnishings and love modern art from around 1910 to 1960.  I am happy to have one black cat (I like cat's but one is just enough to keep it interesting) and love to entertain friends often.  I am also a sucker for British TV, and you will often find BBC America in the background.

I was lucky enough to have the New York Times recently devote two entire pages to me in their home section, making me sound much more interesting in print as compared with in reality and publishing some lovely pictures of my life.

Oh, and my favorite color is that of a wet seal.....greenish gray and shiny!

host_about:
I am a grounded young man, born and raised in the United States midwest. I am proud to be a new Airbnb host, and although I am a relatively newly listed host, I have two years of experience managing Airbnb properties, and co-hosting. I look forward to achieving my own "Superhost" status! 

After attending University in Missouri, I moved to Chicago to pursue a career in art and interior design. I am passionate about self expression, creative thinking, and education. I value small business and am thankful every day to be an entrepreneur myself. Chicago has been a beautiful city to call home for over three years and it is filled with wonderful entertainment, museums, dining and more...but nothing beats a night in, cooking at home and spending time with family and friends. 

I have helped decorate and manage Airbnb properties for over two years and am excited to be listed here officially as a co-host!

name: One Bedroom Apartment in Lakeview East
summary: Comfortable one bedroom apartment in Lakeview East. 15 minute walk to Wrigley Stadium and 5 minute walk to the water. TV and Xfinity cable and high speed internet bundle package. Plenty of games for entertainment. Full kitchen and table, near public transit on a quiet street. Pets allowed. The entire place is yours during your stay. The bedroom has a super comfy queen bed and the living room has a couch. I also have an air mattress.
space: I take pride in my apartment for being a cozy place to relax, recover, and rest. I travel and work a lot so it's important to have a peaceful home. What you can always find in my apartment: books, board games, candles, blankets, coffee, lots of mirrors and plants.  The kitchen has everything you need to make whatever food you like. Feel free to have some coffee or tea as well.  The living area has a large TV with plenty of channels to choose from. The coffee table is full of board games and books for your entertainment. There is an auxiliary cord and speakers as well if you want to play music.  The bedroom has a swivel TV with the same Xfinity set up. There is also a queen bed. I have two twin air mattresses and one queen air mattress. I have the pillows, sheets, and blankets for them as well. Just give me a heads up so I can set them up for you!  Pet friendly! I have a dog, so if you forget treats or poop bags, fret not! For kids - there is a whole chest of papers, markers, and a slew

neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood FAQs: Q: Is there parking? A: Yes! There is free parking on my street and the surrounding streets. If, by chance, the streets are full, there are plenty of nearby parking garages for cheap.  Q: Do you recommend any places to eat?  A: Absolutely! My favorite restaurant is at the end of the street on Melrose and Broadway. It's called Melrose's. Great for breakfast.  Chinese takeout: Miso Asian Kitchen
transit: Getting around FAQs: Q: How far are you from the city?  A: 15 minute drive from the city. Bus 151 (Lakeshore and Belmont) will take you straight there in 30/40 minutes for a couple bucks. Uber and Lyft are typically $10-20.  Q: How far from Boystown?  A: 10 minute walk from Boystown!
interaction: I will greet you upon your arrival at the building entrance and take you up to the apartment. Feel free to ask any questions during our time together. I will briefly show you around the apartment and chat with you. After that, I'll leave you alone until the morning of your check out!  If you ever have any questions during your stay, I am always reachable and close by!

host_about:
I'm easy going, but love a plan.  Baking and yoga are passions of mine.  Paris is my favorite place in the whole wide world, but Chicago ain't so bad.  My boyfriend, Dan, is a musician.  We live together.  My dog Chloe is adorable and hypoallergenic.  

I'm not one for tourist sites.  When I travel, I like to make like an unemployed local.  That's why I think Airbnb is so great-- it has so much more real flavor than a hotel.  As guests, we are respectful and clean.  As hosts, we are welcoming and sometimes there's muffins. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------

name: Newly Furnished Kid Friendly Charm
summary: Newly furnished apartment with great amenities and tons of charm in one of the best neighborhoods in the city.  Enjoy all of Chicago's world class attractions within a short train ride while feeling like a local in a delightful/quiet north side neighborhood.  Multiple restaurants, shops, grocery stores and public transit all within a short walk.
space: Newly furnished. Sleeps up to 7 people. Master bedroom has a queen bed. 2nd bedroom has a full bed with a pullout twin trundle.   Living room has a queen sized pullout couch with a memory foam mattress.  There is one queen and one twin air mattress.  This unit also comes with lots of great amenities for kids and parents, including: 2 portable cribs Stroller Children's books and toys Travel Highchair Playground balls Games Full kitchen with all the essentials (pots, pans, glassware, silverware etc.), dishwasher, microwave, coffeemaker. In unit washer and dryer.   Flat Screen TV equipped with Apple TV . High speed WiFi   Shared back deck with private gas grill.  Ample free street parking.

In unit washer and dryer.   Flat Screen TV equipped with Apple TV . High speed WiFi   Shared back deck with pri
neighborhood_overview: West Lakeview/Roscoe Village is a safe family friendly neighborhood, with several great parks and playgrounds within a few minutes walk.  In the summer there is a public pool 4 blocks away.  There are also tons of great bars and restaurants, all within walking distance, many of them which are kid friendly.  Lincoln and Roscoe street both have great local options.  The Southport shopping corridor is also a short walk away.  A great mix of cool boutiques and major retailers. Groceries: Whole Foods is located is just a 7 min walk north. Jewel Osco which has a 24 hour pharmacy is a 5 min walk south.
notes: This unit also comes with lots of great amenities for kids and parents, including: 2 portable cribs Stroller Children's books and toys Travel Highchair Playground balls Games
transit: There is plenty of free street parking on Barry Ave. and the surrounding streets. The apartment is located 1/2 mile south of the CTA Brown Line Paulina Station (The "EL"). Just steps form the #9 Ashland Bus, and a 3 min walk to the #77 Belmont Bus. Wrigley Field is a 25 minute walk or 15 min via public transportation.
access: Guests have private access to the entire first floor apartment with a separate entrance.  Right outside the kitchen, guests have access to a back deck, backyard, gas grill and patio furniture which is shared with the owners.
interaction: This property is owner occupied.  My family lives in the apartment above yours.  We want to be mindful of our guests' privacy, but if you need anything at all please never be afraid to ask.
house_rules: Because we have small children and neighbors close by we ask that there are no loud late night parties (after 8 PM).  We also request that our guests don't use the back patio and front stairs for socializing between 10 pm and 8 am.  There are plenty of great neighborhood bars and clubs that we would be happy to recommend for your late night fun.   No Smoking No Pets No Guns Please abide by all polices and procedures outlined in your welcome email.
host_about:
My wife Courtney and I have lived on the north side of Chicago since 2004, and in the West Lakeview/Roscoe village neighborhood since 2006.   In the summer of 2014 we added our daughter June to our family. Needless to say we love it here and are very excited to welcome guests from around the world into our new space.   

Courtney works as a wardrobe and prop stylist in film and commercial photography.   She has done a great job applying her craft in the design and layout of our space. 


We have been fortunate to have done quite a bit of traveling ourselves over the years (both in the U.S.and abroad).  We know that having great accommodations can be the difference between an amazing experience in a new place, or a total nightmare.  

It's our goal to provide our guests with a space that is clean, comfortable, safe, and conveniently located.  Because we are parents we have set up our space with families in mind.   The opportunity to provide travelers with the type of service and comfort we would hope for on a trip is something that is very exciting to us.   

Please feel free to reach out with any questions you may have about the space, neighborhood, or Chicago in general.  

Thanks!

Ricky, Courtney, and June.

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is fabulous!  Our street is one-way so there is good, free parking, minimal traffic.  It is within walking distance of pretty much anything you could ever need...safe and in a very friendly neighborhood.   If you attend mass, St. Al's is a beautiful church just down the street with Spanish, German and English masses.  Walk to 10+ restaurants and taverns, Irish, Italian, Mexican, American, pizza including the traditional (and yummy!) old school diners with just phenomenal menu choices.  Even Starbucks, Heritage  and Dunkin' Donuts are just 2 blocks away...  Like fast food?  You can see McDonald's and Boston Market just at the edge of the block.
notes: Parking is street parking.  Free and easy to find on my block or true next block over almost always!
transit: Red and brown lines just a 13 min walk away!  Or take one of three major bus lines from 1/2 block to 5 blocks away.  And don't forget Divy bikes...just a block and a half away as well.  And there's always a cab to be found just 2 blocks down.  Or walk to the lake in under 30 min...  Parking is on the street.  No permits or meters.

This room has considerable natural light, features a queen bed and a spacious closet, and has centrally-controlled air conditioning, a ceiling fan, digital television, wireless internet, and shares a bathroom with two other rooms. Sharp lines, retro stainless steel furniture, with a 1930's Harlowesque feel!
space: The ArtDeco Room is one of eight rooms at the inn. The inn is located in the center of a busy urban entertainment district, four miles north of the downtown city center, and six blocks west of the Lake Michigan shores and Belmont Harbor. Wrigley Field, home of the Chicago Cubs, is a ten-minute walk from the inn. The inn is tucked back 140 feet from North Halsted Street and is surrounded by bars, restaurants, retail stores, and other entertainments and attractions.

neighborhood_overview: The inn is located in the Boystown area of East Lakeview, four miles north of the city center, and equidistant from the two major airports serving Chicago, about 15 miles, with excellent ground transport available. Boystown is known as a busy entertainment, dining, and theatre district, the "home" of the city's LGBT community, the largest in the midwest and third largest in the United States. Boundless offerings of bars, clubs, restaurants, nightclubs, shopping, walking, biking, and rollerblading exist in this neighborhood!
notes: We have a three-night minimum on weekends (Friday, Saturday, Sunday nights) March 1 through November 30. Sometimes a two-night or even one-night stay is possible, depending on room inventory availability. Please inquire with us in such cases - sometimes it can work out.
transit: The CTA bus #8 stop is right across from the inn. This route provides access to all areas of the city. The Red Line train is a 10-minute walk away, providing subway/"L"-train access to the entire metropolitan area. We are located 20 minutes from Union Station (Amtrak and Megabus) and 45 minutes by taxi or shuttle from both Midway and O'Hare Airports. Taxis are readily available around the clock from right in front of the inn.
access: Guests will have access to their room, of course, bath, common living room space, and a self-serve continental breakfast is served 6:00-10:30am in the kitchen area. We have a lovely front porch with swing seating and an outdoor deck in the garden area.
interaction: The innkeeper, Ron, lives on site, and is available in person or via text/call, between 9:00am and 9:00pm. Emergency assistance is available 24/7. Information on area attractions, directions, transport, etc., can be provided. Additionally there are neighborhood maps and guide magazines available. We respect your privacy! We are available when you need us, but if you prefer to be on your own, we certainly value that as well.
house_rules: Welcome to The Villa Toscana Chicago! A more detailed House Manual is provided once your reservation is confirmed. Here are some key points to consider:  Office Hours: The office is staffed dependent on guest arrival times, but usually 11 A.M. to 6 P.M.  Check-in is 3 P.M. to 6 P.M. unless prior arrangements are made with the Innkeeper. Inn Policies: All guests must be 18 years of age or older. We do not allow pets. At check-in we require a government-issued photo ID for each guest in the room. We also require a major credit card for incidentals and damages. Always take your key with you! It is indeed possible to lock yourself out, and sometimes we are away from the property. Furniture, inside the inn or outside on the deck or porch, is not to be moved. Room Cleaning: Each day between 12:00pm and 3:00pm we will service rooms. We ask that you discard food and beverage remnants and packaging either in the kitchen trash can or in one of the black dumpsters underneath the front porch, rath
host_about: I enjoy helping others to have a great time when visiting Chicago. There is so much to see and do in this neighborhood and in the city! There are four distinct seasons here in Chicago and each brings unique weather, sights, and sounds. I hope you will come to Chicago and stay with me here at The Villa Toscana Chicago Bed & Breakfast!

name: A Stone's Throw from Wrigley Field/Boystown - 4BR
summary: This is a new listing from experienced Airbnb hosts. Check out our other reviews! Elegantly decorated and spacious 4 bedroom apartment. An 8 minute walk to Wrigley field and a 15 minute train ride to downtown Chicago. Surrounded by countless nightlife options, great food, and public transit as well!
space: Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We've hosted hundreds of guests over the last few years and are very proud of the excellent feedback we've received. We know that the key to our success has been setting proper expectations for our guests; each listing on Airbnb is unique and every host has a different hosting style. We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're a good fit for you. Our lovely home is the perfect place for your group to stay in while you explore all that the city has to offer. There are 4 bedrooms in the apartment. Each bedroom awaits you with a queen size bed and fresh white linens. Also in the apartment: â€¢ Keyless Entry â€¢ Fully equipped kitchen â€¢ Two bathrooms  â€¢ Washer/dryer â€¢ Dishwasher â€¢ Keurig coffee maker â€¢ Tea-making supplies â€¢ High-speed internet â€¢ 65" HDTV w/ Netflix We're conveniently located next to a CTA "L" stop, so making your way around Chicago is incredibly easy. The Loop is a short 15 minute train ride away.

An 8 minute walk to Wrigley field and a 15 minute train ride to downtown Chicago. Surrounded by countless nightlife options, great food, and public transit as well! neighborhood_overview: In addition to the abundance of food, shopping, and nightlife options, there are several attractions near us that we encourage you to visit during your stay, such as: â€¢ Wrigley Field â€¢ Wrigleyville â€¢ Boystown â€¢ The Green Mill â€¢ Aragon Ballroom â€¢ Music Box Theatre â€¢ Lakefront Path â€¢ Blue Man Group Need to pick up some groceries during your stay? We're a 15 minute walk or less away from Walmart Express, Walgreens, Whole Foods, and Jewel-Osco.
notes: Frequently Asked Questions: 1. â€œHow do I get to â€˜xâ€™ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from â€˜xâ€™?â€ GÎ¿Î¿gle Maps provides excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city. Our apartment is next to the Sheridan red line train station. Search for â€œSheridan red line stationâ€ in GÎ¿Î¿gle Maps, click the â€œDirectionsâ€ button, then enter your point of interest. 2. â€œIs there parking nearby?â€ Thereâ€™s free street parking 1.5 blocks north of us on N Sheridan Ave. We also have 1 day parking passes available for $5 each that allow you to park on our street. 3. â€œCan you give me a discount?â€ We offer weekly and monthly discounts to all guests. This discount is applied automatically during the booking process and is reflected in your total.
transit: Not only is the area around us a "Walker's Paradise" with a Walk Score of 93, but we are also located next to several transit options that will take you to virtually any point of interest in the city. Several very walkable roads packed with shops, places to eat, and sights to see are nearby.
interaction: Have any questions? Need more towels? Want our recommendation for the best deep dish? We are always on call should you have any questions on arrival or during your stay.
house_rules: We ask that you be mindful of our downstairs neighbors.  Please no food or drink in the room (water is okay) and no entertaining additional guests in the apartment. Airbnb policy, only guests booked through Airbnb can stay overnight.
host_about:
We've been Airbnb hosts for some time now and we've had an absolute blast with it. So many interesting and charming people have passed through our doors and thoroughly enjoyed their stay. The keys to our success have undoubtedly been that we take every guest's experience very seriously and have a genuine interest in making their trip to Chicago an memorable one.

From George: "I'm originally from Texas but have been living in Chicago for several years now. I majored in Economics and International Relations and I work in development for an international organization. I also enjoy volunteering with arts charity organizations around the city.

"I speak Spanish and French. I love to travel and and was lucky to be an exchange student to Switzerland through Rotary International and to study abroad in France when I was in college. I love business, politics, art, and cooking simple but delicious paleo meals."

From Sean: "I've spent most of my life in the Chicagoland area. I was born in Downers Grove and grew up in Plainfield. I became enamored with Chicago a few years back and knew I wanted to live here. A few things I enjoy very much are cooking home-made meals for my friends, Chicago blues, and photography. My first job in high school was as the photographer for a paintball field in Joliet. I probably still have a few bruises somewhere to prove it!

"I've worked in menswear for a few years and loved it (if you need help coordinating a shirt and tie I'm your guy)I do freelance photography from time to time as well and also some volunteer work for the Center on Halsted."

summary: Beautifully furnished and within walking distance to great bars, restaurants, two el stops, and Wrigley Field.  It's a great apartment in a wonderful & safe neighborhood.  Perfect for a couple of travelers or for someone in on business.
space: Located on the top floor of a 3-flat, this apartment has lots of natural light and great views of the neighborhood. The back porch has chairs for relaxing outside. Large and fully equipped kitchen ready to be enjoyed.

neighborhood_overview: Lakeview is a fun and vibrant area with beautiful town homes and tree lined streets. There is a great bar just around the corner from me...the kind where everybody knows you're name and they'll make you feel at home. While you are within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and bars, the apartment is peaceful and quiet.
transit: Getting around is so easy! The apartment is with a 7 minute walk from both the Belmont and Wellington El stops offering a 10 minute train ride right into the city and Michigan Ave. Wrigley Field is a 15 minute walk away. There is free street parking available. No need for a permit.
access: 1 private bedroom with very comfortable queen bed, closet, and side table. There is 1 full bathroom in the apartment, shared between myself & guests. Feel free to make use of the kitchen & appliances as well as the living room.
interaction: I work pretty long hours and am typically gone early morning and get home after 6pm. I am always available by call or test to answer any questions you have.   I am a self-proclaimed foodie and know all the best spots in the city.  I understand that most guests will have their own itinerary, but if you need any suggestions about what to do or where to eat, I'd love to help!
host_about:
I'm a 31  year old marketing manager, lover of life and great experiences. I am an avid traveler and used to live in Paris.  I wish AirBnB had been around when I was traveling Europe as it would have offered me a much more affordable way to travel.  Having wished it for myself, I like the idea of offering people a beautiful place to stay and great tips for enjoying this incredible city.  I am a self-proclaimed foodie and pride myself on knowing the best places to try in Chicago.  
My friends nicknamed me Martha Stewart years ago for my hosting skills, decorating, and cooking abilities.  I love hosting people and have even considered the idea of opening a B&B some day.  Looking forward to getting some experience through Airbnb first.

name: Amazing Home Steps Away from Wrigley Field
summary: Best location is Boystown / Wrigleyville! Corner of Halsted / Addison across from Whole Foods. 5 min walk to Lake Michigan, Addison Red Line Train, Wrigley Field and countless restaurants and bars. 2 guest rooms with contemporary kitchen and bath. Laundry available in unit. Fun and passionate hosts!
space: Hi everyone. Welcome to our home in Chicago! It is a 2-bed, 1-bath place approximately 900 square feet. My roommate and I moved in in July 2015 and everything including mattress, furniture and walls are new! We rent out the place when we are out of town. In the living room, we have a TV with DirectTV channels. There is also a pull out couch that accommodate another 2 people. The two bedrooms have double beds, small closets with hangers, large dressers, night stands in each room. We have shower and hand towels for you and tons of pillows to select from! There is also free wifi and in-unit washer / dryer.

neighborhood_overview: The Boystown / Lakeview neighborhood is vibrant with tons of restaurants and bars. It is a 5 minute walk to the Lake and Wrigley Field which hosts the Cubs, the local baseball team. We are at the intersection of the gay and straight nightlife so whatever your interests are, you will be within walking distance to everything.
notes: Please be respectful to the neighbors and treat our home like yours. But otherwise please enjoy your stay with us!
transit: Getting around is super easy. The Addison Red Line Train is a 5 min walk, which takes you downtown and to the northern neighborhoods. Whole Foods is across the street. There are also other stores nearby within 5-10 min walk, including Jewel Osco and Treasure Island Foods. We mostly walk everywhere and take the Red Line Train to Downtown occasionally, but buses, Uber and taxis are also readily available in the area.
access: Please feel free to use anything in your room and the common area. You are welcomed to use anything in the kitchen including utensils, plates and cookware in the kitchen. The bathroom has fresh towels, washer/dryer, a blow dryer and other essentials. We also have a rain forest shower head and a jacuzzi tub for a relaxing bath!  Please note that for back to back bookings during the week, we are not able to change the sheets of the bed until later in the evening. You will be able to check in at 2pm or before and use the apartment in the meantime.
interaction: My roommate and I are both in our late 20s / early 30s. I work in healthcare and he is a teacher for a local school. We like to travel, go out to restaurants and bars, and explore the area. We welcome our guests to join us in going out with us to Boystown and other local events then we are in town. We are happy to show you some of our favorite places in Chicago!
host_about: Hi I'm Kyle from San Francisco. I work in healthcare and love to travel. My favorite cities are Chicago, Berlin and Tokyo. I'm easy going and super fun! My friends and I love going out and exploring. I'm a great host... Let me know what you're interested in so I can help you explore our amazing city!

neighborhood_overview: Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two â€˜L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas â€” East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville â€” meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor. Hit the bustling commercial districts along Belmont Avenue, Lincoln Avenue, Southport Avenue, Clark Street, Halsted Street and Broadway Street to shop â€” be it for vintage frocks, designer jeans or leather biker gear â€” or live it up with the locals at the seemingly endless options for bars and pubs, and the dozens of celebrated restaurants in between. Arts and culture come in the form of live music venues, several summer street festivals and a thriving scene for theater, dance and comedy (Belmont Theater District is a stellar collection of nearly 20 independent companies). Not to be outdone by its extraordinary
transit: Easy access (7 minute walk!) to the Red/Brown/Purple line trains with transit all over the city, as well as many bus lines. 15 minute walk to Wrigley Field.
access: You'll have the whole house, as well as the pleasant back patio. We have a large table & chairs to bring out if you'd like to dine al fresco!

Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out/lost key penalty  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid. 6.) Please do not

name: 6 bedroom Wrigleyville Flat Sleeps 16!
summary: You can't stay any closer to Wrigley Field! With 6 bedrooms between two floors, this apartment is an oasis while enjoying all the excitement that Wrigleyville and Chicago have to offer! Walk to Wrigley Field, CTA Red Line, nightlife, bars, restaurants, and more!
space: Lots of space in an awesome location!  This apartment sleeps 16 GUESTS over TWO FLOORS! It offers six queen beds, each in their own bedroom, plus in each of the two semi-private common space alcoves we have a queen bed, as well as two couches (one of which is best for kids).  Prepare meals in both of your gourmet kitchens, featuring granite counter tops, excellent appliances, dining table, and all your needed implements! Relax in your two spacious living rooms, featuring super cozy couches, two HDTVs with premium cable package, or spend time on either of your two spacious decks off the back! Wifi is included!  Both of your bathrooms are excellently renovated, and you'll find plenty of mirrors throughout the apartment to help you look your best!  This is your comfortable home - and all of it in the middle of the best neighborhood in Chicago! neighborhood_overview: Wrigleyville always has something going on! Enjoy the friendly confines of Wrigley Field, or go drinking on Clark Street. Dance on Halsted Street, or run along Lake Michigan on the Lakefront Path. Ride the El to downtown Chicago, or walk to lots of bars, restaurants, live performances, and more. It's all right here when you stay with me!
transit: Trains and buses are plentiful in the area - you can get just about anywhere.  There's no need for a car, but parking is available for an extra charge via the SpotHero website/app.
access: The home is yours while you're here!
interaction: It really depends on the guests. Some people want their key and to be left alone; with others, I'm doing whiskey shots down at Slugger's after midnight. It's up to you!

host_about:
Adventurous and hard working, I'm not afraid to try new things.  A few years ago, that led me to start a food truck in Madison, WI.  I still own and consult, but the day to day operations are managed by employees.  

Now, I manage Airbnb listings in Chicago, which puts me at your service during your stay.  It's my mission to make sure you love everything about the apartment you're staying in.  

5 things I could never live without:
Spicy thai food
Regular physical activity
A hot shower with good water pressure
Reliable people
A project to work on

neighborhood_overview: Everything Lakeview has to offer is steps away -- and as public transportation is literally two steps away, you have access to the entire city.  Within a very short walking distance, you will find WalMart, Marianos, several coffee shops, a million bars (of all kind!), the lake, the lake running path, drycleaners, five gyms, and, oh yeah, the Cubs!  If public transportation isn't your thing, there is short-term parking available.
notes: This location is perfect for everyone!  Cubs fans, Boystown ... Marianos right next door!  Everything Chicago has to offer at your fingertips ...

host_about: I am a thirty-four year old, single gay male.  I try to live an active lifestyle and spend my time socializing, travelling, at the gym and at work.  A former Floridian, I have been living in Chicago for seven years!  I love this city, I love this neighborhood, and I love my home.  I work in the travel industry, and am often out of town.  There's a piano in the home, and I love to play!

name: Sunny Room w/Deck in Roscoe Village
summary: Roscoe Village is a desirable, safe neighborhood in Chicago. We can   easily walk or bike to trains, great restaurants, Wrigley Field (Go Cubs Go) bars and markets. We have two Brown Line stops to the city & Divvy bikes within a 5 minute walk.  Business travel is easy to downtown.
space: The room is located on the third floor so there are steps to climb, 32 to be exact. The main bed is an antique Eastlake style bed. It is about the size of a full-size bed. It is very comfy and close for two people but we have had several couples who have stayed and said they slept well in it.  The second bed is a twin mattress on the floor. Sheets and towels are supplied.  Room comes with ceiling fan, extra heater, refrigerator,  coffee maker, electric tea maker, filtered water, glasses, utensils, cups. There is no central air but we provide a room air conditioner and heater if needed.  We're not fancy but relaxed and we love to talk about Chicago and suggest places to go.

You will have access to two bathroom
neighborhood_overview: This is a very family oriented neighborhood and you will see a lot of people pushing baby carriages.  We have many great restaurants in the area including Turkish, Latin tapas, burgers, vegetarian, brunch, Mexican,  Thai,  etc., etc. And deep dish pizza of course!  Many of our guests have gone to Wrigley Field which is a mile due east of us. You can park for free and walk to Cubs playoff games! We are close to many live stage theatres (American Theatre Company,  Athanaeum, Royal George, and Steppenwolf, to name a few. There is a new improv comedy club a short walk away.  Victory's Banner is a great vegetarian breakfast and lunch spot. There is  Turquoise for Turkish food. Giordano's and Lou Malnati's for Chicago-style pizza.  Bangers and Lace and Four Moons are two great eating spots within walking distance. Martyrs and the Old Town School of Folk Music for live music. Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within walking distance.   We are between two stops on the  Brown Line on the CT
notes: We have a six-year-old Corgi dog who is very friendly.  Daley loves humans and is happy we're doing Airbnb because she gets to meet new people. She will come and try to visit you if you let her.  Please don't feed her, she's a beggar. The El train can be seen and heard from our room. If you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs.  We also have some in the room.  We have beehives on the roof  so you may see some on the deck. Try our Roscoe Village Rooftop Honey.   We are  "foodies" and can direct you to many great restaurants and farmers markets.  We have an 1890 Chicago Row house. It is comfortable, not fancy. It creaks and is always having some repair. It is 120 yrs old, authentic and we love it. We live here so it is always in use.
transit: Street parking is free on our street.  The trains and buses will take you anywhere you want to go. We have used Uber at times to get downtown or to the airport. Divvy rental bikes are all around us.
access: You will have access to two bathrooms on the second floor, a short walk downstairs. The main one has a large whirlpool tub and walk in shower.  The other has toilet and sink and washer and dryer you can use. We have a deck on the third floor that is at the end of the hall you are welcome to use with a beautiful view of the neighborhood.  My wife and I love to have dinner on the deck.
interaction: We live in the house so there is always activity. We are   available to answer questions.  I am a native of Chicago and will be happy to help with directions.  You can have as much or little interaction as you like.  We have enjoyed meeting guests from all over the world. We believe that kindness & love are for everyone.
house_rules: No smoking in the house.  You can smoke on the balcony but please contain the butts.  The room is set up for two guests at most.  We really can't have more than two.  No parties, no additional guests. Please do not feed the Corgi. You can come in late but please be quiet. And please leave the house as you found it. Thanks.
host_about: We love to travel and, when we're home, stay in the "neighborhood," our beautiful village within the city: Roscoe Village. We have used vacation rentals in Paris, Italy, San Francisco, Seattle, and Portland. We are both foodies, love the local, slow food movement. Love to get the hosts' take on the local fare, must see places--and we do the same when others come to stay with us.  Love outdoors, camping, bike riding, flowers and gardens.  Our motto: you only live once in this body, stay in the moment, stay positive, smile and ENJOY!

neighborhood_overview: Close to good public transportation 24 hours, lots of affordable restaurants and bars, young adult population, near nature center lake and zoo, safe and fun. Located strategically close to both the Loop and Wrigley Field!
notes: BUSINESS TRAVERS: I host a ton people in Chicago for all kinds of interesting business. My apartment is exceptionally huge which gives everyone plenty of space. We have blazing fast internet, wireless printing and two co-working spaces that work really well for getting stuff done!
transit: Street parking is free, we're steps from multiple bus lines to the loopâ€”and its only a 12 minute bus ride. Close to the elevated trains. $6-8 Uber ride to Michigan Avenue.
access: The whole house is shared, make yourself at home. I often become friends with many of the travelers who stay here. We keep up with each other on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and LinkedIn
interaction: I travel enough to understand the nuances of guest interaction. I love having guests! I can leave you alone, or chat and help you around town, share a meal, it's up to your needs. I tag team the hosting/welcome duties with my friend Lisa, and we both enjoy taking the time to help travelers as they need.
house_rules: Respect others. There will usually be 3 people in the house (myself, you and another Airbnb guest). I have no cable television but, do have blazing fast wireless internet. We are a non-party house. Lots of bars and places to go to however, coming in very late is perfectly fine (and expected!). I've found the house is the perfect place for people extending business trips for a few days of tourism, or long term guests doing residencies, internships or other things making the world a bit better. 70-80% of my guests are international. While, Airbnb is a great value...I've found people who are more comfortable in hotels, but just want to save money...they typically find sharing a home with others less enjoyable. This makes it less enjoyable for my other guests in the home also. So, please consider this before booking :)
host_about:
Hi, I'm Jimmy. I've been hosting in my apartment for many years. I've been to both Airbnb host conferences and use Airbnb's while I'm traveling the globe for work with my tech-based charity. Glocal is a new platform making community organizing simple, measurable and sustainable. 

I love hosting my home and sharing it, and have found that my guests feel more comfortable knowing that I've enjoyed Airbnb stays in Shanghai, London, Wales, Nicaragua, Thailand, Calgary, South Africa, Paris and all over the U.S.A. I understand the need for an affordable home away from home and love to provide that.

summary: Come and stay in our 1BM apartment located in the beautiful Lincoln Park neighbourhood.  This clean, spacious, light-filled apartment is  centrally located between N Clark and Lake Shore Drive making public transport readily available.
space: Our beautiful, light-filled apartment is located in the leafy green neighbourhood of Lincoln Park.  It is on the top floor of a historic three story walk up Chicago apartment building with a spacious lounge room, large bedroom, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen. If after a busy day exploring Chicago you don't feel like cooking, vibrant North Clark Street is just around the corner offering plenty of restaurants and bars.  As you can see from the photos our apartment is a very cosy, clean and comfortable place to relax in after a day exploring all that Chicago has to offer.   *Please note that while I am new to listing a property on airbnb, I have travelled extensively and know the joy of staying in someone's home.  I will endeavour to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.  Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions regarding the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is a very friendly and safe neighbourhood.  The apartment is centrally located; only a minutes walk to North Clark Street and the beautiful surrounds of Lincoln Park and Lake Michigan.  If you feel like keeping things local why not explore the interesting and quirky shops along North Clark Street or spend the day at the Lincoln Park Zoo, the Penny Notebaert Nature Museum, or the Lincoln Park Conservatory, all of which are within easy walking distance from the apartment.
notes: no
transit: The neighbourhood is safe and easy to navigate with numerous bus lines only minutes away running along North Clark Street and Lake Shore Drive (which conveniently includes an express bus to the Loop), while the Brown, Red and Purple "L" train lines at Fullerton Station are a 12 minute walk away.

summary: If youâ€™re looking for a taste of historic, classic Chicago, this apartment would be your perfect fit.
space: Located on N Wells Street, these great units (We have 4 in the same building!) are surrounded by some of the best restaurants, bars, and shopping Chicago has to offer. You will not go hungry with the famous Nookieâ€™s breakfast cafÃ© downstairs and other great eats just down the street. At night, Old Town lights up with great bars in walking distance and public transit just blocks away to visit other popular areas of Chicago. This unit also gives you great access to the Mag Mile, Lincoln Park Zoo, and North Avenue and Oak Street beaches. host_about:
Hi, we're Bob and Liz Biddle, long time Chicagoans and your hosts. We started At Home Inn Chicago in 2000 as a reservation service for bed and breakfasts in Chicago, and have since evolved into one of the city's most-respected sources for vacation rentals, corporate housing, and weekend getaways. 

We provide fully furnished vacation rentals and corporate housing at more than 40 units throughout the city in or near every neighborhood.  

We are here to answer all of your questions about Chicago, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, public transit tips, or insider tips on how to experience the Chicago that locals know and love. 

We love this city, especially getting ribs at Twin Anchors in Old Town before a show at Second City. Wicker Park is a frequent hangout, where we tend to be pulled to the patio at Big Star, the bar at XOCO, and cocktails at Violet Hour. 

And free concerts at Pritzker Pavilion in Millenium Park can't be matched by any city in the world. 

We'd love to help you experience all of this with us and so much more!

name: Lincoln Park Loft, Too
summary: Lovely Lincoln Park two bedroom apartment with additional loft space, two full bathrooms, washer & dryer in unit. Steps away from the Lincoln Park Zoo, the lakefront. Kitchen fully stocked, sleeps 8 with hardwood floors and huge 12 foot ceilings, a wonderful location in Lincoln Park!
space: This apartment has a private entrance to the street, gorgeous high ceilings, and a fun loft area that fits an additional queen bed. There is also a pull-out couch in the living room that sleeps two. This space is my second rental in Lincoln Park and actually adjoins the other space I have listed there, "Family Friendly Lincoln Park Loft." You can rent also rent both together.  * Right across the street from the Lincoln Park Zoo * 2 bedrooms each with a queen size bed * 1 loft space with a queen size bed * 1 pull-out queen size couch * Open air loft above the kitchen, accessible by ladder, also has a queen size mattress (note: can't stand up in this space, about 4 feet high) * Master bedroom has a private bathroom with bathtub and shower * Another full bathroom with shower - 2 total full bathrooms in the unit * Washer & Dryer in unit * Fully appointed kitchen * Dishwasher * Pets ok - just let me know beforehand * Wi-fi  * Apple TV with netflix, HBOGo, HuluPlus, & ShowtimeAnytime availab
