neighborhood_overview: Lincoln Park is a fabulous neighborhood just north of the city and we are right on the park. The pictures on this listing of the park feature everything that is within 3 blocks of our front yard. Lincoln Park is just north of Old Town, and 5 minutes from the Gold Coast, only 2 miles to downtown and the Magnificent Mile. LP is also very close to the north side and Wrigleyville, only 2.8 miles to Wrigley itself. So much to do here, in any season.  We are across the street from the FarmZoo (literally in our front yard) and the Lincoln Park Zoo is two blocks north. All within a few block radius from our place is the Lincoln Park Conservatory, an outdoor theatre, a rowing canal, the Chicago History Museum, the Peggy Notebaert Nature Museum, the Alfred Caldwell Lily Pool, the North Pond Nature Sanctuary, and the famous North Avenue Beach. There are over 10 miles of lakefront paths to enjoy, and the North Avenue beach has volleyball, stand up paddle boarding, and sand tennis. Bike rentals are
notes: CHECK IN: 3PM CHECK OUT: 11AM Please take the time to read the house manual, available on the Airbnb web site under your confirmed reservation. It's accessible after the reservation has been completed and has lots of important info in there.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT:  22/Clark bus (front door) 156/Lasalle bus (1 block) 11/Lincoln bus (front door) 66/Chicago bus (front door) Trains:  Brown Line - Sedgewick "L" stop (.6 miles, 12 minute walk) at North & Sedgewick  Red Line - North/Clybourne "L" stop (.8 miles, 22 minute walk) at North & Clybourne  Brown/Purple Line - Armitage "L" stop (.9 miles, 24 minute walk) at Armitage & Sheffield  Estimated Airport transit costs:  Taxi from O'Hare $35 and 30 minutes (pending traffic) Taxi from Midway $32 and 35 minutes (pending traffic) PARKING: Street parking only available, no permit necessary. Free street parking on the cul de sac in front of the apartment, Lincoln Ave (hard right out of the cul de sac) and usually lots of Parking on North Stockton Drive, which is the street parallel to Clark that goes right by the Zoo and Farm Zoo.
access: Access to everything in the apartment!
interaction: Since this is a full time rental you will be pretty self-sufficient. I am not there to check you in/out and give you your freedom while you're there. But always available should anything come up, and happy to respond to any questions. Please keep the conversation in the Airbnb thread as much as possible, it's much appreciated!  * As soon as you have an approximate arrival and departure time, please let me know so I can help our cleaning lady schedule her hours * Please send me a message that you've arrived safely in the apartment and all is to your liking * Please send me a message when you've departed   Communication: as much as possible, please keep the communication in the Airbnb message stream. This really helps me to be super responsive to any questions/needs you might have. Of course feel free to call me at any point if needed.
house_rules: No smoking! The building management has been kind enough to let me rent these two units because they have private entrances. They've asked that Airbnb guests use only the private entrance in and out, and unless there's an emergency don't access the lobby or anything else in the building. Thanks in advance for your help with this! Otherwise, no smoking and I think that's about it. Pets are possible - just let me know in advance. No guests allowed in the space beyond those included in the reservation. (I.e., no parties). Send me a message if you'd like to have any extra people and I will likely okay it; we've just had some issues lately with discrepancies in booking and unauthorized parties. (No parties! No smoking! Thank you!)
host_about:
I am a 37 year old single mother who has recently moved from Boston to Chicago with my son, Charlie. We now split our time between Chicago and Iowa City where my family lives. I was formerly the Operations Manager for the Barbara Lynch Gruppo, an independent restaurant group in Boston and  a company I worked with for 8 years. 

My involvement with Airbnb has grown organically, beginning in Boston after I left my job and posted my place in order in order to take advantage of my career gap and do some traveling. Ultimately I decided to move us to Chicago to be closer to family, and I started renting our Chicago apartment during our trips to Iowa City. These trips grew more and more frequent as both of my parents' health rapidly declined. Airbnb turned out to be a unique way to stay unemployed during this difficult family time, and I now have four properties listed. My mom passed away just this past September and I'm incredibly grateful that Airbnb has provided me with a way to spend as much time with my family as possible this past year. It has truly been a gift.
 
This fall I began the MBA program at the University of Iowa, and am loving being in school again. I'm also enjoying a return to my hometown (something I never thought I would voluntarily do) and being able to spend time with my Dad. 

It's been an unusual journey and none of it would have been possible without Airbnb. I am a huge proponent of Airbnb and the sharing communities and an absolute acolyte. I've met so many incredible people and families through Airbnb, and I really look forward to sharing my spaces with you.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide proof of identification through ID verification on our website. In order to check in, all guests must complete this process before 6 pm on the day of arrival. 3. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   4. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 5. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 6. Most of our

neighborhood_overview: Our vintage condo is across the street from the DePaul University campus in gorgeous Lincoln Park. We love the nearby Mon Ami Gabi, Chez Moi, Summer House & Oyster Bah restaurants, and for breakfast, Batter N' Berries and Floriole are close by, as is the Cornerstone Cafe. For Chicago deep dish pizza, Pequods is legendary--across the street from them is the Regal Webster 11 movie theatre showing the latest films. The Victory Gardens Biograph Theatre is less than a 10-minute walk, and the Steppenwolf & Royal George Theatres are one train stop away. There are plenty of sports bars nearby, and for an upscale experience, we love the Violet Hour in neighboring Wicker Park, less than 15-minute Uber drive away.
transit: The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line CTA station as well as the bus system is less than a 5-minute walk from us. DIVVY bike rental stations are everywhere. Nearby restaurants, cafes and boutiques abound. It's a 20-minute walk to the free Lincoln Park zoo and the North Avenue Beach.

name: 2 BR Historic Home in Old Town
summary: Our home, built in 1886, offers guests the chance to live on a tree-lined street in historic Old Town, just blocks from exciting night life. Fully renovated with top-of-the-line finishes, our house combines character with modern conveniences.
space: Our row house, with high ceilings and vintage charm, has all the books you could ever read, plus a flat-screen t.v., cable, and zoomy internet. Fix a gourmet meal in the fully-stocked kitchen, relax in the living room, take a long rain shower, or walk in one of the best Chicago neighborhoods. Upstairs you'll find two bedrooms, one large room with a queen-sized bed, the other, a small room with a full-sized bed. Our home comfortably sleeps four people.
description: Our home, built in 1886, offers guests the chance to live on a tree-lined street in historic Old Town, just blocks from exciting night life. Fully renovated with top-of-the-line finishes, our house combines character with modern conveniences. Our row house, with high ceilings and vintage charm, has all the books you could ever read, plus a flat-screen t.v., cable, and zoomy internet. You will have complete access to the home. Feel free to use the back porch, but please be respectful of our neighbors. We ask that you try to be quiet after midnight. Joe will be available to hand off the key and make sure youâ€™re comfortable. He has his own locked and separate space in the basement w
neighborhood_overview: Old Town has a rich and storied history. Originally settled by Germans, the neighborhood association sponsors a nationally recognized, juried art fair every spring. First known as a neighborhood of immigrants, then of the counter-culture, now of upscale shops and restaurants, Old Town offers a unique and charming neighborhood experience. You can walk to the beach, free Lincoln Park zoo, great restaurants (The Blanchard, North Pond, Mon Ami Gabi, Topo Gigio), dozens of bars, and several grocery stores. You will be two blocks from the famed Second City comedy theater. Runners and bikers: our home is two blocks from the beautiful 18-mile lakefront trail. Shoppers:  the Magnificent Mile, with its world-class shopping, is only two miles away. We also have some lovely boutiques just steps away on Wells Street, including excellent gourmet food purveyors (Cocoa + Company, Old Town Oil, and The Spice House).
notes: This is an old home and has creaky stairs and original details. We have central air and heat, but the bedrooms can be a little cool in the winter and a little warm in the summer. If you need to sleep in a 65-degree room in the heat of the summer, this is not the place for you. If you have always wanted to stay in a classic Victorian row house, you've found it! Parking is on the street, but we are happy to sell you a neighborhood parking pass ($5 per night) that will make it easier to find a space. We rarely have to park more than three blocks away from the house.
transit: We are just a few blocks from both the Brown and Red line trains, which can take you anywhere in the city. DIVVY bikes are available for rent one block away. The Clark Street bus, two blocks from the house, can drop you off in front of Wrigley Field. Catching a cab on Wells Street is very easy! So much here, though, is completely walkable, one reason we love our neighborhood.
access: You will have complete access to the home. Feel free to use the back porch, but please be respectful of our neighbors. We ask that you try to be quiet after midnight.
interaction: Joe will be available to hand off the key and make sure youâ€™re comfortable. He has his own locked and separate space in the basement with its own entrance. You will have complete privacy, but Joe is ready to help if anything comes up!
house_rules: This is our private home and is very dear to us. Respectful guests welcome. Enjoy the space. Have a dinner party but no large gatherings. Because of the historic nature of our home, no pets, smoking, or children under 10, please. Four guests maximum allowed.
host_about: A teacher, reader, cook, and runner, I love Chicago history. My son Joe (a Grinnell graduate and Chicago actor) and I work together as Airbnb hosts, renting out our historic home.

I have many contacts in the area that will have no problem serving as a liaison if you need anything in person!
house_rules: I like to make sure every guest has the highest quality experience. summary: This charming and stylish 1-bedroom residence designed with an appreciation for vintage art and modern comfort.  Perfect for pre and post night time outings. Fully stocked kitchen and long dining room table for dinners, hardwood floors, huge windows, cozy rugs,  and a great courtyard.  2 minute walk to the epic Lincoln Park and conservatory, a 3 minute walk to the zoo, and a 7 minute walk to the lakefront path and beach. Public transit & great restaurants steps away!
space: Memory Foam pillow top queen mattress. Beautiful Large windows in each room. Hardwood floors throughout. There is a projector and speaker system to watch movies on the big wall in the living room. Additionally, there is a large assortment of games and sports equipment(2 tennis rackets, yoga mat, 16 inch softball) to use at one of the near by parks or yoga studios. The space comes with a sweet kitty host named Robert Goulet.  He loves people and doesn't meow or scratch.

neighborhood_overview: In Lincoln Park, Chicago's motto urbs in hortoâ€”or "City in a Garden"â€”truly comes to life. Historic churches and handsome brick row houses nestled within landmark districts sit next to peaceful parks, while quiet, tree-lined residential areas give way to bustling business corridors. Armitage Avenue is lined with independent boutiques and high-end retailers; Clark Street is packed with casual cafes, ethnic restaurants and sweet shops that spill out onto the sidewalks during warm weather; and Lincoln Avenue buzzes all night with bars and taverns that cater to the young college crowd from the nearby DePaul University campus. In addition to shopping and dining, Lincoln Park is a diverse arts and entertainment destination as well with a plethora of museums, top theaters and live music clubs to pick from. For scenery, there's plenty of natural beauty and outdoors to enjoy. This North Side neighborhood's namesake park is a sprawling 1,208 acres of green space with a free zoo open year-round, a
notes: Each stay comes with a bottle of wine!
transit: Tons of public transportation right outside your door! Enjoy easy access to the Halsted Bus, Fullerton Bus, Clark Bus, Broadway Bus, Red Line Train, and Divvy Bike Station.
access: Entry via lock box so there I offer very flexible check-in and out.
host_about:
Hello, 
I am a social justice educator born and raised in Chicago. I love travel, food, art, biking, music, and good company. To me, the oldest and deepest of human passions is the need to hear and tell stories. So a perfect night for me is  drinking wine and eating great food with friends while laughing over each others' stories.

Also, the yard is tiny and pets are not permitted in the yard or o
host_about:
Travel is fun and exciting but can be hard on the wallet.  It doesn't have to be that way.  Email if you have questions, especially if your requested dates are in the near term and I will do my best to work with you!

Having spent more time than I care to remember in sterile, uninviting hotel rooms, I was initially attracted to vacation rentals as refreshing, and often more affordable, alternatives.  What I found were the same white walls and beige furniture or, even worse, cluttered rooms and Aunt Edna's donated dilapidated couch in the living room.  Well, welcome to something different.  Take a break from your busy schedule by relaxing in clean, inviting rental that that feels enough like home that you're immediately comfortable while being so special you'll look forward to your return.  Many of my guests have been back 2 or 3 times, and some have found themselves venturing across the country to check out another Red Hot Vacation Rental.  

My places are located in Chicago, Miami Beach and San Francisco. I've lived in all 3 cities and am happy to suggest hidden local gems or recommend the best nearby dry cleaner.

My loft is on the 4th floor of the building.  Like most of the older buildings in Chicago there is no elevator, but only 4 flights of stairs to the loft. A good rule of thumb is to sparingly using toilet paper, flush twice when appropriate, and put only toilet paper in toilet.  Security System: The unit and our home are on a home security system controlled by us. The alarm alerts (beeps) when a door or window is opened and closed. Please do NOT press any buttons on the alarm key pad.   Temperature Adjustments: Please contact us if you would like the temperature adjusted. name: Garden Suite with private entrance.
summary: A self-sufficient suite with private entrance in Chicago's Edgewater neighborhood. Conveniently located near public trans. Steps to Loyola Univ, shops & restaurants. 4 blks to Lake Mich. 20-40 mins to Downtown depending on time of day and mode of transport. Top-notch hospitality! We can accommodate 2 comfortably/4 cozily. Be sure to read our detailed description below. NOTE: For dates after 10/1/17 please inquire.
space: The garden level Suite is the lower level (sub-basement) of a 2 story condo on a quiet side street in the Edgewater neighborhood. The building itself is over 100 years old and has been gut rehabbed.  Get a great night's sleep on a premium memory foam queen bed in the Garbo bedroom. Enjoy a long, hot shower with great water pressure in the full bathroom that also includes a regular sized tubâ€”should you fancy a soak. The den area is perfect for unwinding and catching a little tv after a full day of exploring the many highlights of our great city.
description: A self-sufficient suite with private entrance in Chicago's Edgewater neighborhood. Conveniently located near public trans. Steps to Loyola Univ, shops & restaurants. 4 blks to Lake Mich. 20-40 mins to Downtown depending on time of day and mode of transport. Top-notch hospitality! We can accommodate 2 comfortably/4 cozily. Be sure to read our detailed description below. NOTE: For dates after 10/1/17 please inquire. The garden level Suite is the lower level (sub-basement) of a 2 story condo on a quiet side street in the Edgewater neighborhood. The building itself is over 100 years old and has been gut rehabbed.  Get a great night's sleep on a premium memory foam queen bed in the Garbo bedroom. Enjoy a long, hot shower with great water pressure in the full bathroom that also includes a regular sized tubâ€”should you fancy a soak. The den area is perfect for unwinding and catching a little tv after a full day of exploring the many highlights of our great city. Guests enter the building's foy
neighborhood_overview: The ever-evolving Edgewater neighborhood has really come in to it's own over the past few years. Please see our Neighborhood Guide here on Airbnb to see our recommendations... Enjoy great restaurants just steps away from the Suite (including Thai, Ethiopian, Japanese/Sushi, Korean, Swedish, Italian, Vegetarian, Mexican, American and more). For shopping there's an Aldi supermarket just 3 minutes away, and a brand new Whole Foods Market along with a new Walgreens... a 5 to 7 minute walk away. A new LA Fitness club is located next to the Walgreens. It's a quick 4 block walk to beautiful Lake Michigan and Berger Park. Also 5 minutes away on foot is the stunning lakefront campus of Loyola University. It's worth taking stroll through there on a nice day. For yet even more of a variety of restaurants, shopping and nightlife, the Andersonville neighborhood is about 1.5 miles southâ€”a 20 minute walk or 10 minute cab/Uber ride away. Evanston, home of Northwestern University is also a quick 15 min
notes: Guests amenities include a mini fridge, microwave, spring water and coffee maker. Need to exercise? An elliptical machine, swiss ball, weights and foam roll are there for your use. Enjoy such perks as bath and body products, teas and coffee. We'll highlight local products whenever possible (look out for a special treat). There are also nice fluffy towels and fine linens. A twin or queen Aerobed will be provided should the reservation be for more than 2 persons- a $25 supplement if just one other person wanting a separate bed. We even offer private or family-style dining options. Tom is a trained personal chef from the top-ranked Kendall College in Chicago. He can host a family-style feast for up to 8 hosted in our own upper level dining room, or an intimate gourmet meal for two down the the Suite. Highlights of his cooking  feature ingredients from the farm he and Drew own 75 miles northwest of the city. Please inquire for sample menus and supplemental pricing.
transit: The Suite is located between two CTA Red Line 'L' stations, Granville and Loyola, each just a 5 to 7 minute walk away. Downtown Chicago is only 7 miles to the south and is easy to get to via the CTA 147 bus on scenic Lake Shore Drive  or by 'L'. Depending on traffic or if there are public transportation issues, it typically takes anywhere from 20 - 40 minutes to get to downtown from the Suite. Street parking is usually easy and ample. It is permit zoned, so you will need to display a guest pass in your passenger side windshield (provided). Cabs are plentiful on Broadway, and Uber is always easy. There is a Divvy Bike (shared bike) station at Granville.
access: Guests enter the building's foyer at street level and walk down a short flight of stairs (six steps) to the Suite's own private entrance. Guests will have access to the entire lower level. There are obvious "off limit" areas, as well as no access to the upper floor beyond the french doors.
interaction: We are social but at the same time private people. We will gauge and be flexible regarding the amount of interaction our guests desire. One or both of us may be there all of the time or some of the time. We will be there upon check-in to greet you and give you any reccommendations on dining, sight seeing, activities, etc. Check-out is easy for a hassle-free departure.
house_rules: No smoking anywhere.  Please observe our check-in times. We can be somewhat flexible, but we are often making special arrangements to greet you in person. If your trash or recycling is full, please dispose in the dumpsters  located in the alley directly west of the building. The toilet is low flow, so be careful what you flush. No unapproved guests. Please do not loiter in the entry foyer, on the front steps or in the parkway. This is a quiet, residential building. Please respect our neighbors. As any good fellow Airbnb-er would do, please do your best to leave the Suite the way you found it. Thanks!
host_about: Hi! My partner Drew and I have a 2 story condo in the Edgewater neighborhood on the north side of Chicago near Lake Michigan and Loyola University. We also own a 5 acre farmette complete with an organic garden and orchard nestled in the countryside just an hour and twenty minutes northwest of downtown Chicago, (an hour from O'Hare airport) off I-90 near Rockford, IL. We've been hosting on Airbnb at the city condo for over a year, and we soon hope to list the country home as well. We are both professionals. I (Tom) am a freelance art director and an aspiring culinary trained chef. Drew is an attorney in Chicago. We like to travel and we're foodies. We are adventurous and love to explore the arts, cultural and historical attractions wherever we go. Every once in a while we just like to "chill" on a beach vacation. We are dog lovers and have  2 labs. Bella & Honey.

neighborhood_overview: Right on the lively N Clark Ave stretch of the Andersonville neighborhood in Chicago. Delicious restaurants and fun bars -- check out Little Bad Wolf, Replay, and Hopleaf! This is a super fun, LGBTQ friendly, racially diverse neighborhood with great energy. The red line metro (Bryn Mawr) is a 12min walk. Our very own beach, Hollywood Beach, is just 20min walk away if you fancy a jog, pet-watching, and gazing out at beautiful Lake Michigan.
transit: 10min walk to the red line CTA (Bryn Mawr station), directly at the bus stop for buses #22 and #50 to downtown. A "Divvy" bikeshare with bicycles for rent, is located 5min away.
access: Guests have full access to the entire apartment -- two bedrooms, bathroom with washer/dryer, a living room, dining/kitchen area, front and back balconies. This unit is on the 2nd floor with stairs.
house_rules: Welcome! Treat this space as you would your home. Be relaxed and enjoy the apartment, but please be mindful of noise and neighbors. No parties, no drugs, smoking is ok on the back balcony.
host_about:
Hi! I'm a postdoc in gender studies who travels frequently. I've lived in Boston, Bangkok, Rotterdam, California, DC, and the Philippines. I'm passionate about technology and anti-violence work. I love getting to know new people over a coffee or beer, and I'm always up for a foodie adventure. I do yoga and drink coffee every morning. I come from a big family, so I can appreciate both loud/cozy environments and savoring privacy and space. 
I have been an Airbnb host for 2 years, and have also stayed at Airbnbs all over the world. I look forward to meeting fellow travelers!

name: Large, Vintage, Chicago Apt. near Train & Lake
summary: This large, 1,200 sq.ft., wood beam vintage apt. is 3 blocks from the lake & beach and only 20 steps to the Metra Redline train.   Conveniently located with restaurants, bars, grocery store & pharmacy within 1-2 blocks.  Come enjoy the charm, convenience, culture and comfort this metropolitan getaway offers!
space: A large living room with gas burning fireplace and bay window; a formal foyer & entry way; a formal mahogany wood beam cieling dining room that seats 6-8; a quiet & private master bedroom with adjoining sun room; white subway tile bathroom; an eat-in kitchen with pantry and back porch with seating for five and overlooks the Metra Redline train platform.

host_about:
Friendly, outgoing, intelligent, creative, kind-hearted, easy going, good sense of humor and love to laugh.

I like to do mosaics and stain glass projects, I decorate birdhouses and have a web-based business called Art In Memory (AIM) - which takes special keepsake items like a ring, war medal, scarf, eyeglasses, etc. of a family member or friend  who has passed away and we incorporate it into a new piece of artwork like a stain glass window; piece of pottery or sculpture; a decorative birdhouse, etc..

name: The Stained Glass Apt. Edgewater #1
space: *Attention to first time users of Airbnb* This is not a private apartment for rent. I live here and I also have another smaller room listed on the site! My apartment is on the third floor of a three flat brick building on a quiet tree lined street in Edgewater. It was built 1916 in Prairie style featuring high ceilings, amazing woodwork and stained glass all of which have been restored. I'm a big fan of flea markets and antique stores so my home is filled with beautiful curiosities. My friend calls it "The museum" but don't let that scare you :) The place has a really comfy and peaceful vibe. It is spacious and open in the way that one can stand at one end of the apartment and see through to the other end. There is an enclosed sunporch in the front of the house which offers a serene view of the tops of trees. The bedroom I can offer has a comfortable double bed and a most prized Eastlake antique dresser with egyptian pharaoh head drawer pulls. There is one shared bathroom in the apartm
description: *Attention to first time users of Airbnb* This is not a private apartment for rent. I live here and I also have another smaller room listed on the site! My apartment is on the third floor of a three flat brick building on a quiet tree lined street in Edgewater. It was built 1916 in Prairie style featuring high ceilings, amazing woodwork and stained glass all of which have been restored. I'm a big fan of flea markets and antique stores so my home is filled with beautiful curiosities. My friend calls it "The museum" but don't let that scare you :) The place has a really comfy and peaceful vibe. It is spacious and open in the way that one can stand at one end of the apartment and see through to the other end. There is an enclosed sunporch in the front of the house which offers a serene view of the tops of trees. The bedroom I can offer has a comfortable double bed and a most prized Eastlake antique dresser with egyptian pharaoh head drawer pulls. There is one shared bathroom in the apartm
neighborhood_overview: The location is really prime as it's a 4 block walk to either Granville or Loyola redline train stations as well as 6 blocks to the lake. The neighborhood is really lovely and down right lush with trees and flowers (when weather permits)  Although Edgewater is a 30-45 minute train ride downtown, there is something to be said for staying here and getting a taste of a real Chicago neighborhood. Staying downtown is great in many ways but it is the typical tourist view and you will not experience  what I consider to be the real heart of Chicago where the regular folks live. There are two antique malls, a couple of great coffee houses and restaurants all a short walk away.
notes: Please let me know if you intend on bringing a vehicle. There is permit parking on my street so depending on the duration of your stay, we would need to discuss the options!
access: Guest are welcome to use the kitchen and refrigerator. Also feel welcome to make yourselves at home in the rest of the apartment. There is one shared bathroom.
house_rules: I would ask that my guests come in and out quietly after 10:00 pm and especially ask to respect the antique furniture: use coasters for drinks and beware of things that might scratch surfaces. Please do not bring anyone else into my apartment without asking.  Also, please do not forget to return the keys. Thanks!
host_about:
I am currently on a new path=which really means I lost my job and I want to try something different. I have done quite a bit of international travel and hope to do a lot more. I love people. I am an artist, card maker and writer. I am obsessed with postcards. I'm really in love with Chicago and although I've lived here my whole life I continue to discover new treasure!

Some things that I love: Writing, reading, bicycling, coffee, trying different types of food, yoga, movies, old cemeteries, art museums, photography, vintage postcards, pen pals, architecture, antique markets, folk art, tiles, decorative metal, wine, beer, and a well crafted cocktail and of course,  traveling!!!

I believe good things can come from seemingly bad things: the symbolic opening of a new door. 

I strive to be present, recognize beauty, project love, and be extremely grateful for my life.  Each person I meet reinforces my belief in a world full of love and kindness and every new friend makes it a better place.  Traveling has been my most valuable education. 

Places I have traveled: Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Kenya, Mexico, Monaco, Morocco, Netherlands, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Scotland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Turkey, Wales

Private entry, renting one unit in a 3 unit buildings You'll be in the heart of Andersonville, a quaint neighborhood known for gastro pubs like the Hop Leaf, chic antique shops like Scout and an urban small town feel.  This neighborhood is unique, unlike any other in the city.  Just walk one block west.     Not far from Wrigley Field for Cubs baseball, or the redline to downtown Michigan Ave for prime shopping.   Take a leisu
neighborhood_overview: You'll be in the heart of Andersonville, a quaint neighborhood known for gastro pubs like the Hop Leaf, chic antique shops like Scout and an urban small town feel.  This neighborhood is unique, unlike any other in the city.  Just walk one block west.     Not far from Wrigley Field for Cubs baseball, or the redline to downtown Michigan Ave for prime shopping.   Take a leisurely walk to the beach, less than a mile away, or ride a divvy bike share to the south end of Montrose Harbor (2.7 miles) provides a beautiful view of the skyline, watch the boats come and go through the harbor inlet. 93 (walkers paradise) out of 100 on walkability ratings.
notes: This neighborhood is a little gem, most people only find it through visiting their kids in the neighborhood.  You get the best of both worlds...  cozy lifestyle living with easy access to world class downtown attractions.  No car needed.
transit: Many choices for public transit from here: CTA train is 4 blocks away (Use to get downtown / Evanston / Wrigley field) Clark St 22 bus is one block away Foster Ave 92 bus is two blocks away (Use to/From Ohare about 1:20 minutes) Best kept secret, 20 min express bus via Lake Shore Drive to Michigan Ave shopping, scenic ride and don't pay for parking.  Or just Uber for $15-ish.
access: Private entry, renting one unit in a 3 unit buildings
house_rules: Non smoking building Please be respectful of neighbors between hours of 10pm and 8am.  Voices carry on wood floors. No pets, no additional overnight guests outside of agreement No creative or enterprising use of the property
host_about: When I travel, I like unique experiences, learning from the locals, seeing different neighborhoods and exploring the area. I also like to be comfortable and appreciate an updated style. If you are anything like me - you'll love my place - good luck!

summary: The location is unbeatable! Quiet and friendly neighborhood with convenient access to red line train, express bus to Michigan Ave, and Lake Shore Drive/Lakefront Trail. Short walk to Whole Foods, Mariano's, Library, and Lakefront. In addition to great views and tons of natural light, this unit has a fireplace and a private front balcony. Also includes a huge shared front yard and back patio! On top of it all, in-unit laundry and parking are also available!
space: The condo is a 2 bed, 2 bath and my bedroom and bathroom are in the back of the apartment, so you have plenty of privacy. You have your own large bathroom with great water pressure in the shower as well. In your bedroom, you will find an armchair, desk, and television with Roku that has access to Hulu and Netflix!

The kitchen and dining area is yours to use and I provide coffee. My
neighborhood_overview: This lovely neighborhood is quiet and safe. There is a school right across the street and convenient restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance.
notes: A guest book will be in your room upon arrival with some local attractions and recommendations. Let me know if you want some more information about this neighborhood or any others!
transit: The condo is a half block away from the train (you can see the platform in the balcony picture). The train will get you to Belmont in 15 minutes and downtown in 30 minutes. I am also one block away from the beach, where you can hop on a bus that will take you to Michigan Avenue in 20 minutes. If you need to know how to get places or how long it will take, I am more than welcome to help you!
access: You may access the apartment as your own home (except for my bedroom, please). Enjoy the living room with a cozy fireplace, gaming system, and a bar cart. The kitchen and dining area is yours to use and I provide coffee. My convenient in-unit laundry is also available for your use. I have a balcony in front that has two chairs, a table, and a gorgeous view of the sunset. There is a parking spot that is available for you, with notice.
interaction: I am able to give you privacy throughout your stay but am also available if you would like some travel advice, as I love this area. I am also unopposed to sharing dinner - I LOVE cooking for other people! I am happy to show you around and perhaps even travel with you and take you around the city, if I am available. I enjoy driving around the city and showing people what I love about Chicago.
host_about: Originally from the north suburbs and have been a City of Chicago resident for 5 years. Somewhat private as both traveler and host, but love meeting new people and sharing information about Chicago (if you're staying with me) or learning about new places.

name: 15 min Drive to N Michigan Ave
summary: As hosts we really stick to ourselves. If you have any questions or concerns we are happy to help or give advice on places to eat or see while in Chicago. We have a very laid back attitude and enjoy meeting new people.  Our apartment is three blocks from the Bryn Mawr redline stop which can get you anywhere in the city and the north suburbs.  Also only a fifteen minute bus ride to Michigan Avenue and Oak Street.
space: I am an Interior Design Major and proud of the way my apartment looks. I hope you enjoy the space as well.

neighborhood_overview: Edgewater is a historic neighborhood that in the 1920s celebrities would travel to too get away from downtown. Very beautiful Architecture and lots of restaurants and shopping in the area. Walking distance to Andersonville. Also only one block from the beach.
notes: no parking spot. Free street parking. Have lived here for years and park on the street everyday.
transit: 2 blocks from the redline which can get you anywhere in the city. Also 1 block from the 147 bus stop. 15 min drive to Michigan Ave and Millennium Park in 25 min.

name: Classic 3-BR, 1-bath, parking, red line
summary: You'll love this classic, Chicago-style vintage architecture. Come relax in this spacious, 1450 sq ft unit on a lovely tree-lined residential block. Very close to public transit, stores/restaurants, and Hollywood beach! Includes one parking spot directly behind the building. Only 7 stops / 12 min to Wrigley on the red line.
space: Enjoy this spacious unit as you explore Chicago! Hardwood floors and crown molding throughout the space. Beautifully decorated with high-quality furniture. Living Room: 12.5 x 13.5 with a 8.5 x 6.5 sun room bump-out, cable + wifi, couches are not pull-out but air mattress can be included if desired Dining Room: 15 x 14, dining table with 8 chairs Kitchen: 19 x 9.75, cookware and dining ware Bedroom 1: king bed, 11.75 x 10 Bedroom 2: queen bed, 11 x 11 Bedroom 3: king bed, 12.5 x 11 Full Bath: shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hair dryer **Bedrooms include linens and towels. The bedrooms have window AC from June -Oct, and all rooms have radiator heat through the winter.

The bedrooms have window AC from June -Oct, and all rooms have radiator heat through the winte
neighborhood_overview: This multi-unit building is right near the lake, with easy access to Hollywood Beach and the lakefront trail & parks for running/biking. Restaurants of all cuisines, lively bars, and unique stores abound in the Edgewater neighborhood.
notes: STAIRS This is a 1st floor unit. There are 6 steps up from the outside to enter the unit, then no steps within the unit. PACK N PLAY Pack N Play may be rented for $5/night. It will be inside the unit waiting for you in its carrying case, and we request you fold it up back into its carrying case prior to departure. Note that linens are not included for the crib. PETS Pets will be considered on a case-by-case basis. There is a $100 fee per pet, as well as an additional $500 security deposit (which is not charged, but just rather increases the maximum we can request in damages). Specific instruction will be provided for pet waste.
transit: Public transportation is an easy and convenient way to get around the city. It's .2 mi to the Thorndale red-line stop. In addition, there are multiple bus options, including the 146 express bus and 151. I am happy to provide additional detail about our public transit system, as well as directions. The bus is $2/person, while the train is $2.25/person; there are also unlimited 3-day passes for $21 and 7-day passes for $28. One parking spot behind the building is included with this rental. If you have additional cars, there is free street parking in the area (no permit required).
access: KEYS You will be given a custom key pad code for entry at your leisure anytime from 3pm on. Inside the unit, there will also be 3 sets of keys. If keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. SPACE You will have full use of the space to yourselves - dining room, living room, 3 bedrooms, 1 full bathroom, and kitchen. This unit also includes the use of one parking spot. For guests staying 5+ nights, you may also use the washer and dryer in the basement. Two of the bedrooms have king beds, and one bedroom has a queen bed. Each has dressers, closets, and window AC from June - September. There is also an air mattress available that can be placed in the living room. Linens and towels are provided for all guests, as well as beach towels.
interaction: Our goal is to ensure you have the most enjoyable and comfortable stay in Chicago. We're more than happy to offer suggestions before or during your trip to help you maximize your time in the city. Depending on our work travel schedule, we may or may not be in town; however, we're always accessible via phone or email for any questions that arise.
house_rules: REQUESTS: 1) Please treat the unit with care. We provide high-quality furniture so that you can truly relax and be comfortable. We simply ask that you treat the home with respect so that we can continue to enjoy it for years to come. Please be courteous of others in building, and keep noise to a reasonable level before 8am and after 10pm. There is absolutely NO smoking inside any unit or the building. Specific guidance will be provided for where to smoke and how to dispose of cigarette butts. 2) We welcome infants and children, but please note that the unit is not "child-proofed." If you have specific questions/concerns, please ask before booking. 3) Pets will be considered on a case-by-case basis. There is $100 fee per pet and an additional $500 security deposit (note the security deposit is not actually charged at the time of booking; rather it's just the max credit a host can request if something is damaged). Specific guidance will be given for pet waste. 4) While we do own the buil
host_about:
I'm a frequent traveler for work and pleasure and try to fully take advantage of each destination. I began using Airbnb as a traveler in the fall of 2013, and I'm hooked! Staying in someone's home allows you to experience the area in a truly authentic way - no more hotels for me! As of May 2014, I've begun hosting in Chicago and absolutely love helping others make the most of their visits.

I enjoy everything from museums to hiking and bars to libraries. Recent favorite trips include Denver, CO; Sante Fe, NM; and Memphis, TN. Last international trip was to Costa Rica and hoping to make it to South America very soon.

I consider myself to be pretty detail-oriented, organized, and responsible. You can fully trust me to take your space as if it were my own.

Just came across this Tommy Bahama slogan and thinking I'll adopt it as my life motto: "Make life one long weekend."

name: Private Bath Suite
summary: Private, small room with queen, pillow-top bed, desk, sitting chair. Located on the lower level of house w/attached private bathroom, walk in closet, plenty of storage. Quiet and private, the bathroom has a soaking tub. This room is a great value.
space: This is a basic suite with a private bath, a queen-sized bed, desk, and lounge furniture. It's on the lower level of the house, which means it doesn't get a lot of light.  It's located on the same level as the washing machines, so you may hear them operating at times. Great for people who don't mind background noise, and whose priority is a private place to rest.

neighborhood_overview: Bronzeville is a mecca of African-American History on Chicago's South Side, just miles south of downtown. Gwendolyn Brooks published poetry in the Chicago Defender, Andrew Rube Foster created Negro League Baseball, and Louis Armstrong kept his trumpet singing at the Sunset Cafe to keep Al Capone off his back.  Long in disrepair, the neighborhood is coming back, with new residents refurbishing historic homes, and with new dining and nightlife scenes beginning to take root. Bronzeville was the site of Chicago's version of the Harlem Renaissance, and was home to many famous African-Americans, including Gwendolyn Brooks, Richard Wright, Louis Armstrong, Bessie Coleman, Ida B Wells, Andrew Foster, and many more. The neighborhood was from the 1920s to the 1940s one of the premiere centers of African-American culture and was fairly affluent and middle class.  Today, the neighborhood is seeing major community-driven revitalization efforts, mostly by wealthy and entrepreneurial African-American
notes: This room is located on the same level as the washing machines, so you may hear them operating at times.
transit: The best things about Chicago are the beaches, museums, architecture, food, and parks. Our location is 10 minutes from the city's center by bus or train.  There are two Divvy bike-share stations within 2 blocks of us, and  several options for transportation including: Uber, bus, train, taxi cab.   We enjoy helping our guests plan to sightsee, eat, shop and adventure in Chicago - just ask! We're within walking distance to the new 31st street boat harbor as well as to the McCormick Center, White Sox Stadium, the Illinois College of Optometry, the Illinois Institute of Technology, and the 31st St Beach.   Within a 2-3 blocks there are several quick-bite options for carry-out food.  Chinese food, Bar-B-Cue, Soul Food, Jimmy Johns, Subway, McDonald's and several other carry-outs like Starbucks, McDonalds, KFC, Hong Kong Delight, and Shark's Fish. We are also two train stops away from Trader Joe's and Whole Foods.  The nearest Kinko's/FedEx is located 3 blocks away. Trains are all located at
access: The shared kitchenette includes a cook top, microwave, waffle iron, a blender, coffee maker and a shared Mini Fridge. We offer a personal, in-house laundry service for $5 a load, (a load is enough to fill a pillowcase).
interaction: On the day of your arrival, you will receive an entry code combination to the front door, and detailed check-in instructions when the room is ready. Typically, check in is anytime after 5:00PM but we will do our best to check you in earlier if you request it. There is no space for storing bags, so we cannot hold your bags while you are seeing the town. I recommend leaving your bags at a hotel concierge until you're ready to check in. Unfortunately, we just have no room to store them before your room is ready. Please send all communications via airbnb site so that I can know who you are and which room you're in when weâ€™re communicating.  After arriving, if you need more immediate assistance, you can call or text the House Manager, whose number will be provided after your arrival.
house_rules: We're looking forward to meeting you! Our easy-to-follow House Rules are posted in each room for easy reference: 1.  Upon checking in, please use clean linen from the green basket to make your bed. When checking out, put your used linen in the blue basket. 2.  Store your towels in your room, on the racks behind your door. If using a shared bathroom, please take your personal items with you after using it. 3.  Remove your trash from your room and place in the trash bin through the rear basement door. Use the white bin in your room for garbage, and the black bin for recycling.  4.  Please return the iron and ironing board to the 2nd floor hallway closet when you are finished using them.  5.  If you would like a load of laundry washed, you may leave a pillowcase full of your personal laundry outside of your door, to be washed by the house manager. The cost is $5 per load. Otherwise, the washer/dryer is for staff use only.  6. There is no cost to wash bedding and used towels during your st
host_about:
I'm very proud of our very nice Zen Mansion in the historic Bronzeville neighborhood. It is near the University of Chicago, IIT, McCormick Place, and all trains, buses, are also  within a 5 minute walk.. Parking is free on the street, directly outside of the house. We enjoy making visitors feel comfortable, welcome and confident about traveling around Chicago.  

The Mansion was purchased in 2008 and has undergone a complete rehab. We've made our house comfortable for academics and professionals. The location of the house is only one train stop away from the city center and a short walk to the lakefront.

The rooms are perfectly functional and comfortable.  Our purpose is to be the best value in Chicago for comfort and convenience.

We intend to be the best value on Airbnb.  The rooms are very generous in size at 22' long X 16' wide.  They function very well as a suites for sleeping, working or lounging in privacy.  Each room has a queen bed, dresser, desk, desk chair, sofa, love seat, chaise lounge, and relaxing art work. Bedding and towels are all included.

This location is safe, with the nearest police station just two blocks away, and we are central to all trains and buses.  We are quietly the best kept secret in Chicago and we intend to make sure you have an enjoyable stay.  Namaste.

name: Concert Weekend Haven
summary: No Cleaning Fee Great Stay for weekend concerts in Chicago.  Stay in the heart of Bronzeville.  Great grassy area in the city.  Close to White Soz Guarantee Field.  Close to the Train Red Green and Metra. Eggs Coffee and oatmeal in the kitchen.

I love to travel and have been through many road trips in the mid-west.  I prefer the great plains instead of the coasts.  Kansas City and Texas are my recent adventures.  Also Vegas.

name: Oasis Retreats Chicago Bronzeville
summary: Hidden Gem! The Gap between South Loop and Bronzeville is a peaceful retreat and the ideal setting for private Family gatherings, vacation stays, or Corporate retreats in an Urban setting with a Suburban feel allowing you to SPREAD OUT and RELAX!
space: Mid Century Modern meets Urban contemporary.  This lovely townhouse is 2700sf of living space and includes access to private outdoor space and the common manicured grounds of a lovely gated community.  This home offers a private parking space, in addition to readily available and FREE street parking most days of the week.
description: Hidden Gem! The Gap between South Loop and Bronzeville is a peaceful retreat and the ideal setting for private Family gatherings, vacation stays, or Corporate retreats in an Urban setting with a Suburban feel allowing you to SPREAD OUT and RELAX! Mid Century Modern meets Urban contemporary.  This lovely townhouse is 2700sf of living space and includes access to private outdoor space and the common manicured grounds of a lovely gated community.  This home offers a private parking space, in addition to readily available and FREE street parking most days of the week. This home offers you access to 3 generously sized bedrooms, where each room sleeps 2 comfortably in addition to a queen sized sleeper sofa in a spacious family room setting.  PLEASE NOTE: This home is a 3 level townhouse.  Our home may not be suitable for those who have difficulty navigating stairs. Our bed set up is as follows:  Ground Level (Family Room) Double size Sleeper sofa.  Ground Level (Diva Suite) Queen size Bed  T
neighborhood_overview: Our home is extremely convenient to the McCormick Place Convention center, Mercy Hospital, in addition to the several local University campuses, including ITT, and Columbia to name a few.  The ideal parameters of Chicago's South and central Loop neighborhoods to the North and The famed Bronzeville, and Hyde Park neighborhoods to the South make for the perfect location to branch out and explore all that the Windy City has to offer.  You'll also enjoy being within a 10-minute drive to the 31st Street Beach and Marina, which can be your gateway to explore biking, and running on Chicago's famed lake front when weather permits.
notes: Our home provides state of the art security, and will require specific instructions for access by all guests.
transit: Transportation options are extremely convenient, with a city bus that stops steps away from our back door.  There are also major EL or Subway lines within a 10-15 minute walk or 10 minute drive if you prefer.  The city bus takes you into downtown Chicago in 15-20 minutes depending on traffic and time of day.  Renting a car is not necessary unless you plan to travel outside of the city limits into neighboring suburbs or to and from the cities two airports during your stay.  If you do have a car, we provide a free designated parking space for 1 vehicle.  There is also readily available street parking on most days of the week.
access: This home offers you access to 3 generously sized bedrooms, where each room sleeps 2 comfortably in addition to a queen sized sleeper sofa in a spacious family room setting.  PLEASE NOTE: This home is a 3 level townhouse.  Our home may not be suitable for those who have difficulty navigating stairs. Our bed set up is as follows:  Ground Level (Family Room) Double size Sleeper sofa.  Ground Level (Diva Suite) Queen size Bed  Top floor (Brown Queen Suite) Queen Size Bed  Top Floor (Brown Twin Suite) (2) Twin Size Beds You'll have complimentary cable and WIFI access with TV's in each sleeping area and the Family room. Our home also features access to the amazing SONOS music system. You'll also appreciate a fully stocked Kitchen, and laundry room for your convenience during your stay.
interaction: Our communication lines are excellent via text, phone calls and email.  We make ourselves readily available to answer questions, and address your needs at all time.  You'll have access to a land line for local phone calls in addition to contact with a host at all times prior to, and during your stay with us.
house_rules: Our home is a complete SMOKE FREE environment.  We do our best to keep our space immaculate and allergy free. Your deposit will NOT be refunded if there is evidence of smoking in the building as additional cleaning fees will apply.  We expect that all of our guests will treat our home with love and respect as we do.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I'm truly a citizen of the world!  To me nothing rings truer than the old expression, "home is where the heart is." No matter where we've been during a hectic day of work or travel, and no matter what the day brings, coming home should be very special, and give you a sense of entering your sanctuary. Because home is so important to us all,  I take pride in knowing that the homes that we occupy are filled with love, warmth, and happiness.  Sharing our homes with friends and family brings us joy, and hopefully gives others joy in the process. My Motto: "You today and me tomorrow" sums up the feeling of making guests feel welcome and at home in our homes.
I travel the world for a living, and have an equal measure of love and respect for beautiful homes, architecture and design.  I tend to make myself at home where ever my travels lead me.
We share homes in gratitude to those who have generously and most graciously shared their homes with us along the road in our travels.  I am a true Chicago native, but have also made Brooklyn and all of New York City home.  In sharing our homes, we hope that you'll find your own love for the Amazing Cities that we call home as well.  Happy Travels!

name: Huge, Historic and Gorgeously-gutted Greystone!
summary: Massive historic greystone w/ warm and modern high-end finishes. neighborhood_overview: Bronzeville seamlessly bridges its historical significance and flourishing modern renaissance. Amongst newly opened coffee shops Stunning residential architecture and its storied history aside, the neighborhood's most striking, modern influence is in the realm of public art. Commissioned to help rejuvenate the area, Bronzeville contains some of the most celebrated works within the City of Chicago's Public Art Collection. Of note is a sculpture-adorned stretch of Martin Luther King Drive that features Alison Saar's "Monument to the Great Northern Migration," The Bronzeville Walk of Fame, and The Victory Monument.
notes: There is divvy bike station located close to the building. You can park your car and rent a bike. Close historic Chicago chicken and waffle. About 15 mins drive to museum of science and industry in Hyde park as well the field museum. Very close to the lake front. Good for jogging and bike ride
transit: Accessible to the cta buses ..king drive bus 3 and cottage grove bus 4. Both runs to downtown magnificent mile and stops by the mccormick place convention center . Few minutes drive to the green line and redline train that runs into downtown and close to SOX  STADIUM  and about 7 mins drive to SOLDIER FIELD for bears games and concerts

name: Great Room in Artistic Home
summary: Private guest room in the finished basement of a lovely row house. There is a full private bathroom for guests. Great family room, with a children's play area. Beautiful backyard, and easy access to Lake Michigan and downtown.
space: This room has one double bed. There is a second guest room right next to it also with a double bed. Let me know if you would like to rent both rooms. We also have a pack and play if you have a baby. There is easy free street parking on the adjacent side streets.
description: Private guest room in the finished basement of a lovely row house. There is a full private bathroom for guests. Great family room, with a children's play area. Beautiful backyard, and easy access to Lake Michigan and downtown. This room has one double bed. There is a second guest room right next to it also with a double bed. Let me know if you would like to rent both rooms. We also have a pack and play if you have a baby. There is easy free street parking on the adjacent side streets. Guests are free to hang out in our cool family room on the lower level, it has a great area for small kids with a chalkboard on the wall. We also have a wonderful backyard, a great place to relax. You are also welcome to use our kitchen if you want to cook your own meals. My husband and I work during the day so you won't see much of us during the weekdays. We rarely use the lower level of the house, so there is a lot of privacy. We will be just upstairs if you do need anything though. Located in historic

notes: This is our first home that we recently bought and we are excited to share it with folks from around the world.
transit: Free and easy street parking on the side streets. Quick 20 minute bus ride downtown. There is also the divvy bike share right across the street from us if you like to get around by bicycle.

Do not smoke in our home, bring in any illegal drugs, participate in any other illegal actives, or bring anyone else into our home other then yourself or additional guests who were spoken of during the booking.
host_about:
I am an art teacher in Chicago Public Schools. I have lived here around 10 years, married to Cory and we have a young son. Before our baby was born we took a year off to travel the world, volunteering and building relationships along the way. 

We love hosting because we get to continue to meet people from around the world. Our house is too big for just the three of us, it feels great to be able to share it with others.

summary: Charming, spacious two bedroom home near Chicago's downtown, historic Hyde Park and the beautiful lakefront.  Nicely decorated full private home just moments away from tourist sites, Bears & White Sox Stadium, Lake Michigan, McCormick Place, University of Chicago, top bars and restaurants!
space: Ask about our 10% discount special!

Nicely decorated full private home just moments away from tourist sites, Bears & White Sox Stadium, Lake Michigan, McCormick Place, University of Chicago, top bars and restaurants! Ask about our 10% discount special! The Space - The entire apartment is yours, including the full bath, equipped kitchen, breakfast bar, furnished living room, and bedrooms.  The apartment is full of multiple windows with excellent natural lighting. Ample street parking is available. There are two large bedrooms; one with a queen bed able to accommodate two guest, and the other with two twin beds allowing for more people to share the space. neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood - The apartment is close to nearby shopping, restaurants, McCormick Place, President Obama's Chicago Home, historic Hyde Park neighborhood, University of Chicago (UofC), Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), Chicago White Sox Stadium, Lake Michigan, Chicago Bears Soldier Field Stadium and so on.  The Bronzeville / South Loop / Hyde Park neighborhood offers some the cities most history and lake front access.  The neighborhood is safe and welcoming.
notes: Other Things to Note - The home is walking distance at five blocks from President Obama's Chicago home.
transit: Getting Around - The home is surrounded by multiple bus lines (no. 3 & 4) that run north & south through McCormick Place, Downtown Chicago, and the Magnificent Mile Shopping; two elevated ("L") train lines (Green & Red lines); and Amtrak lines, Greyhound and Mega Bus lines too. Also, there are also Uber and Lyft drivers in the area, along with taxi drivers, to take you anywhere!
access: The Space - The entire apartment is yours, including the full bath, equipped kitchen, breakfast bar, furnished living room, and bedrooms.  The apartment is full of multiple windows with excellent natural lighting. Ample street parking is available. Additionally, the sofa in the living room is a pull-out full bed allowing for two more guests, allowing for a total of at least six sleeping guests.  Fireplace, wood floors throughout, in-unit washer/ dryer, Wi-Fi, cable and cozy space make this the ideal spot to stay in the heart of it all.
interaction: Interaction with Guests - As a long time resident of Chicago and this rich community, I would be happy to provide you with local knowledge and recommendations on how to get around, where to eat and what to do in the city during your stay.
house_rules: - - Any guests who stay overnight unexpectedly, will be charged an additional guest fee. - - Children must be counted in the total number of guests. - - When leaving for longer than 1-hour, please be mindful to turn off your turn gadgets and TV's. - - No
host_about: I live in Chicago, and I do my best to experience the city's rich culture everyday.  I love to read, visit the lakefront, ride my bike, visit roof top lounges in the summer, try as many restaurants as possible and attend outdoor concerts.

One bus ride #3 King Drive will take you directly to McCormick Place, Soldier's Field, Magnificent Mile. Very close to great  neighborhoods such as China Town, Pilsen, Greek Town, Hyde Park, Navy Pier. My place is good for solo travelers, business travelers, families, and big groups.

neighborhood_overview: Historical Bronezeville neighborhood.  Near McCormick place.  With a pulse that is a very short distance to all of the other wonderful communities such as Greek Town, Pilsen and Ukrainian Village. Home is surrounded by landmark homes. Approximately a 10 minute ride to downtown Chicago and to all of the experiences Chicago has to offer such as Grant Park, The Magnificent Mile, Theatre District, McCormick Place, Illinois Eye Institute, Illinois Institute of Technology, University of Chicago, Hyde Park, Walking distance to 39th beach. We are right off Martin Luther King Drive and Pershing Road. In your backdoor Mariano's Fresh Market is close to opening. This home is located near our two major highways, Lake Shore Drive and the Dan Ryan. In Bronzeville you can walk to Chicago's Chicken and Waffles, Pearl's Place or Yassa's for some delicious African Food. Or take a drive to Norm's Bistro. I will leave on the table a list of what festivals are going on in and around the neighborhood. Bronz
notes: This is a very nice community with concerned neighbors. We just want our guest be a good neighbor and have fun. We are located in an urban setting in the inner city. Full service Mariano's grocery store and pharmacy opens 6 a.m. and closes at 10 p.m. right around the corner on King Drive. They have everything including liquor, beer, wine, cakes, flowers, coffee, breakfast, salad, already cooked foods, seafood, vegetarian, drinks. They will cook your food  that you select from butcher or seafood counter  up to 9p.m. You can take it with you or eat it there. There is also free wi-fi and free parking.
transit: The #3 King Drive bus is right around the corner. This bus will take you to McCormick Place, downtown and to the Magnificent mile, Grant Park, theatre district, Hyde Park, University of Chicago, IIT. The green line is in walking distance on 40th and Indiana. The connection to the red line to Wrigley Field and the vibrant North Side. We are very close to White Sox Park, Hyde Park, University of Chicago, IIT lakefront and Chicago's downtown. I've walked to the lake. There's a beach at 39th Street and 31st Street boat harbor and beach.
access: Front yard and back yard for your enjoyment. There is a security code lock that is changed between guest. There are security cameras on the outside of the home. No extra guest are allowed at any time besides those that are included in the booking.
interaction: I am available for any questions, restaurant suggestions, where to go, or how to use anything in the house. I live directly across the street.
house_rules: NO extra guest are to come into this home at any time for any reason. NO visitors at any time. Only guest on Airbnb confirmation list will be allowed in my home. Every living human being must be included in your reservation, including infants, toddlers, etc. NO smoking. Absolutely NO drug usage. NO hair dying. NO loud noises at any time. NO loud talking, music or loud computer or TV. This home has hardwood floors throughout please be careful regarding scraping of floors, moisture and dirt. These rules will be strictly enforced and any violation could result in immediate expulsion from my home. Instant booking requires you must have at least one review. If the time is available there is an additional fee for early check in and late check out. Thank you.
host_about:
Talkative and ambitious. I am a wife, mother and active in my community. I run my own real estate business. I am passionate about restoring my community. I've committed myself to helping others and enjoy every aspect of making someone else's day a little easier.  My travel has included the South of the United States, Ghana, Jamaica, and some of the other Islands. I'm a avid reader and my favorite book is the Warmth of Other Suns. I love all kinds of foods but I don't normally eat pork or beef. I like the theatre, live concerts, jazz and vocals. I'd love to host so that I can connect with others and hear your story.
My life motto is, "Live Your Life Like Its Golden."

notes: My co-hostess is my puppy, Lexie. She is a mix breed of black lab/border collie. She is well trained and quite the people person. However, she does understand when to keep to herself if she not being engaged. But feel free to engage her, as I say, she loves the attention.

interaction: My home is generally quiet and peaceful so I respect that in our guests. I love engaging everyone I meet, but I also understand some people need their space, so I do respect that very much. Making sure my guests feel 100% comfortable is my top priority. Do not hesitate to let me know if you need anything. I make sure to be available via almost any form of communication: mobile, emails, messengers etc...
house_rules: NO smoking.  NO shoes in the house. Please take them off upon entry. They can be left by the door outside or you can carry them to your room.  As I do not want a rodent or insect issue, there is absolutely NO eating in the bedrooms or on living room sofa, please try and keep the food to the kitchen or dining area. Beverages are permitted, but after usage please immediately clean or dispose of the container. ALWAYS clean up after yourself and be respectful of shared areas, such as living room, kitchen & bathroom. Dishes and utensils are to be washed and set aside to dry on the mat. Please ask before using the dishwasher, unless there are dirty dishes already in the washer, then you are more than welcome to include your own. Be mindful that the bathroom is shared with other guests, so do not leave your personal belongings around. For couples, please remember that the bathroom is shared with the other guest room, so absolutely NO shared baths. ALWAYS LOCK the front door upon entering and
host_about:
My friends and family always say I am the 'Hostess w/ the Mostess.' Growing up in a large family with 4 siblings, I am used to having people around and love it. Which is one of the reasons I joined Airbnb. I love meeting new people and making their acquaintance. As a guest of mine, you will definitely feel secure and safe in my home. I am pretty laid back and love to engage people. My co-host is my 2 year old puppy, Lexie. She is a black lab/border collie mix. I adopted her from PAWs. She is so sweet and like me, she loves to meet new people and give them kisses.

A few facts about myself:
 - Love to cook
 - Very into fashion
 - I am a wine and whiskey gal, bourbon to be exact. I am more of a red wine drinker, but I recently just discovered a love for New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and can't get enough. It has been my summer wine along with Prosecco, which never lets me down.
 - Because I am a foodie, I love having dinner parties and cooking for my friends and family. I also love trying out new restaurants and bars.
 - I am the kind of person that will try almost anything once, so bring on the new and challenging experiences.
 - I love to binge watch shows and movies on most streaming devices. A few of my favorite shows are Game of Thrones, House of Cards, Scandal, How to Get Away with Murder, etc... The list can go on and on. Also LOVE Korean dramas, especially the period pieces.
 - I am a lover of Art and History (I get the history part from my Dad)

I believe travel is the best form of education, there is nothing like immersing oneself in a new culture. You learn a lot about yourself and others when you do this and get to experience so many amazing things and people. The more I travel the more I learn that we are all the same on this planet and I realize that there is nothing I have gone thru that someone else hasn't. I always find myself in awe of the world that I live in and fall in love with it once again.

Anyway, I cannot wait to be your hostess or possibly your guest in the future. And I am excited to build new relationships that I hope will last a lifetime :)

summary: This is a true Chicago loft with exposed brick and just with the right amount of light with tall windows. It's a wonderful space for artists and those who want some quiet time to relax, but still be in the city. It's also very convenient for business travelers, students and anyone who wants to stay in an unique space.  The apartment is steps from IIT, White Sox Stadium, two stops away from McCormick Place using the "L" which is one block away from the Loft.

neighborhood_overview: The loft is located in the heart of Bronzeville this upcoming diverse neighborhood is surrounded by old charming houses and new buildings and it's super close to public transportation. The Green Line is just one block away and the loft is three stops away from downtown, two stops away from McCormick Place/ China Town and one stop away from IIT/ 35th White Sox Stadium. The neighborhood is very secure, but like  any other city public transportation during the day  is your best bet and late at night you can take Uber or Lyft. Lakeshore drive is five minutes away and i94 is literally four blocks away.  Also, if driving there is plenty of parking in front of the building.
interaction: If you have any questions about Chicago, the best places to go out to eat, bars, grocery shopping,  etc. please let me know and I will be more than happy to give you a list of places.
house_rules: Smoking is prohibited inside the loft or atrium, the balcony is OK. No late night parties. There are neighbors and want to respect everyone's space. Plus, I want to keep the home in good condition for other guests. Thank you!! =) Also, there is NO SECURITY DEPOSIT, but please treat this beautiful loft like if it was your home. Every single piece of wood, metal, glass and furniture not only have a monetary value but also sentimental. CHECK-IN is after 3pm and CHECK-OUT is 11am.
host_about:
Hello Everyone!

My name is Pablo, son, friend, and human being. I live in Chicago and love it. I'm a very outgoing, compassionate, unique, respectful and mindful person. I'm 27 years old and full of energy. I love working out, running, and doing some hot yoga.

I'm grateful for all the things that life has given me and I really try to live life to the fullest.

 There is no path to happiness, happiness is the path -Buddha

summary: This is a shared room in a very large 4 bedroom apartment. The apt has 2 other co-ed shared rooms. Our apartment is very close to the University of Chicago, Obama's house, and the Subway. My wife and I are friendly, helpful and offer great service at an affordable price. The indoor and outdoor space is always clean, quiet & peaceful. The neighborhood is quiet, peaceful and safe.
space: Our apartment is pretty simple, but clean, quiet and peaceful. My wife and I are very friendly and outgoing and committed to offering exceptional service at an affordable price. The apartment is located in an upscale neighborhood that's clean, quiet, peaceful and very safe; There is lots of free street parking just around the corner.  Though we are fairly new at hosting, travelers from dozens of countries have selected our place. They have all loved staying with us and have given us a 4.8 Star rating for overall satisfaction with their stay with us. I'm sure you will be happy with your stay with us too if you are open, friendly and enjoy meeting people from around the world.

notes: Check-In is between 5 and 8pm by appointment. Please let us know the time you plan to arrive and we will arrange to be home when you arrive that works for both of us.  Though we do make special check-In exceptions at times, it mostly does not work if you need to check-In at a time later than mid-night. When you arrive in Chicago, call me or my wife at lease 45 minutes befour you arrive to re-confirm your check-In time. When you are about 10 minutes away from the apartment, please call again. Please do not ring the buzer when you arrive, just call to announce your arrival.
access: Our apartment has the open concept design, which means the kitchen, dining room, and living room are all one big room. In addition to your private room, you'll have access to this space and the shared bathrooms. If you need to wash clothes, we also have a washer and dryer in the basement.
interaction: My wife and I both work full-time jobs and therefore only home during the evening hours, Monday through Friday. if you have an urgent matter during these times you can call or text us. On the weekends, we are also pretty busy. We look forward to connecting with you when we can.
house_rules: Providing a Quiet, Peaceful and Safe environment are benefits we want every guest to experience. Please follow these guidelines to help make is so. Drugs and Alcohol Please give the utmost respect to our home environment. If you think there is a chance that you might use drugs, drink heavily or come in and out during very late hours of the night while we are hosting you, then please book with another host. Thank you for understanding. Loitering Note: Our neighbors have made complaints about our guest playing loud music and loitering outside the building and throwing cigarette buts on the ground. Please avoid these activities. Please honor the cleanliness, peace, and quiet of the neighborhood. Do not hang out in front of near the building. Thank you. When you arrive to check in, do not ring any buzzer. Call us 5 to 10 minutes before you arrive and we will come out to greet you. Cleanliness  To maintain a clean and pleasant environment for everyone, please follow these simple guidelines.
host_about:
My wife and I, Jessie, are Teachers of Transcendental Meditation, TM. We have been teaching TM in urban schools around the country for 10 years. I enjoy travel, meeting new and interesting people and taking on new and challenging situations. I am a problem solver by instinct.

I am a life-long practitioner of meditation and committed to the Spiritual goal of Self-mastery and inspiring others along that same path. 

This is my first experience with Airbnb and I love the idea of it.

neighborhood_overview: From (URL HIDDEN) "As part of a community-driven revitalization, Bronzeville seamlessly bridges its historical significance and flourishing modern renaissance. Amongst newly opened coffee shops and restaurants, you will find spectacular displays of Victorian Era architecture. These mansions, which were primarily built in the late 19th century, represent the area's extraordinary display of Gothic, Romanesque and Queen Ann-style design.   Stunning residential architecture and its storied history aside, the neighborhood's most striking, modern influence is in the realm of public art. Commissioned to help rejuvenate the area, Bronzeville contains some of the most celebrated works within the City of Chicago's Public Art Collection. Of note is a sculpture-adorned stretch of Martin Luther King Drive that features Alison Saar's "Monument to the Great Northern Migration," The Bronzeville Walk of Fame, and The Victory Monument." (URL HIDDEN)

neighborhood_overview: The Washington Park neighborhood has been the setting for works of popular literature. James T. Farrell's Studs Lonigan trilogy is set in Washington Park. In Richard Wright's novel Native Son, Bigger Thomas drives the drunken Jan Erlone and Mary Dalton around Washington Park, as the two embrace. In addition to hosting the DuSable Museum, the park hosts Fountain of Time, the world's earliest concrete finished art work. Additionally, the aforementioned adjacent Washington Park Subdivision has been the subject of notable literature. The conditions of this neighborhood are described in a section of Black Metropolis by St. Clair Drake and Horace Roscoe Cayton. The play Raisin in the Sun was inspired by Lorraine Hansberry's time in the neighborhood after her father won the repeal of restrictive covenants. The Hansberry house, the red brick three-flat at 6140 S. Rhodes which they bought in 1937, is up for landmark status before the Chicago City Council's Committee on Historical Landmarks Pres

name: Private Room in Beautiful Home + Safe Neighborhood
summary: Welcome to the Designer's room! In the 2000s, this room was used as the art + design HQ for a record label. Updated in 2015, it's now beautiful room with a luxurious organic mattress in a safe neighborhood near Logan Square, Wicker Park & O'Hare.
space: The Designer's room is ideal for one or two travelers who love culture and want to travel in comfort. In the early 2000s, this House was home to Columbia recording artists Walter Meego and this room was used by the musicians' record label as the design and communication headquarters. Frequently, calls to Australia could be overheard while concert posters were being screen-printed in the background. After being renovated in 2015, the room now features: â€¢ A super-comfortable organic cotton bed + mattress â€¢ Cool art made by the Ashanti people of Ghana â€¢ A beautiful new Couristan rug that is insanely soft (treat your feet!) â€¢ Super fast wi-fi (50+ mbps down, 12+ mpbs up) â€¢ Plenty of space for all of your gear
