neighborhood_overview: Portage Park (sometimes called Old Irving Park) is the original "Six Corners" of Chicago. Today, it's an up and coming neighborhood with gastropubs, cool coffee shops, and easy access to everything in Chicago via the Blue Line. While you're here, you should definitely check out some of the dive bars, hidden clubs, and independently-owned restaurants on the Northwest side.  Portage Park featured in Chicago's Best Places to Live (URL HIDDEN)
transit: One of the best things about the House is the location. Situated near the Irving Park Blue Line stop (it's about 1 mile away), you can quickly get to Logan Square, Wicker Park, and all the Downtown sights (Millennium Park, the Chicago Art Institute, Soldier Field, etc.) without even changing lines. You can also get to O'Hare Airport in about 25 minutes--right to the terminal. If you'll have a car while you're here, you'll have no problem parking on the street near the house.
access: Guests staying in the Designer's room have access to:  â€¢ A shared bathroom (with a rockin' shower with great water pressure) â€¢ A treadmill if you're wanting to get some exercise
interaction: We own and live in the House that Music Built. We do best with guests who are independent and active about exploring the city. We'll be here to greet you when you arrive but you most likely won't interact with us much during your stay. You can contact us via the Airbnb app if you need anything.
house_rules: â€¢ There are 2 indoor cats that live upstairs. While they can be very charming please do NOT let them trick you into letting them in downstairs! â€¢ Please do not park in the parking spot directly in front of the house. â€¢ NO extra guests allowed unless itâ€™s cleared beforehand. â€¢ This is not a party house--there are a ton of great bars, restaurants and parks for visits/ragers while youâ€™re in town! â€¢ Please clean up after yourself.  â€¢ If something breaks, please let Davis or Ludell know. For some things, you might need to compensate the House and others will be considered the price of doing business. Please give Davis or Ludell the courtesy of a heads up. It can be figured out. â€¢ If you are unhappy with ANYTHING, please let Davis or Ludell know beforehand so that it can be fixed rather than waiting until youâ€™re gone and leaving a negative review.  â€¢ Reviews are what help make Airbnb go around and you will receive a personalized review for being an awesome guest as soon as one is left for th
host_about:
From Davis: "I'm pretty obsessed with creating and sharing. It's funny-I'm a nerd but I'm outgoing;I'm a health nut and a chubby kid at heart. I couldn't live without the internet (and I pretty much think it should be considered a human right). Also, I love China--especially northern China. My traveling style is all about becoming local. Once, I lived in Beijing for 2 years. I never visited the Great Wall. Stupid? Maybe. The locals just didn't go there so neither did I. I was in the noodle shop hanging out with the chefs."

From Ludell: "I love business and I love finding ways to to surprise and thrill customers. This also comes out in my style of Airbnb hosting. Little, nice things that don't take a lot of effort or money can make a guest's stay so much more enjoyable. I love to set guests up with everything they need so they can operate independently and not be left with tons of questions. I've used Airbnb a lot as a guest and I use those experiences to create an environment that people will enjoy and walk away thinking they got such a great deal for what they paid for. I love traveling and I want to go everywhere and see everything!"

name: Whole house in quiet city neighborhood near it all
summary: Looking for that perfect middle ground? Our home is perfectly located on the northwest side to get everywhere in Chicagoland; near the blue-line and highway for easy access to downtown, O'Hare, and Rosemont. With four bedrooms and six beds we are capable of sleeping 8 comfortably, 10 with a loft and a couch. Two full bathrooms and a gourmet kitchen will make your stay comfortable. Be in the city in a safe quiet neighborhood with ample street parking, and consider it your home away from home.
space: Four bedrooms on 2 floors.  2 twin beds, one full, and two queens (one a sleep number with a memory foam topper fully adjustable for you).  Two full bathrooms, one with a jacuzi tub.  Fully stocked kitchen: kitchenaid mixer, 5 burner stove with convection oven, and really every appliance and gadget you could want.  2 flat screen tvs with rokus to access all your streaming content.  Washer and drier upstairs by the bedrooms.  Patio and backyard to sit and enjoy a nice morning in the sun or a grill out and drinks in the evening. The space is listed for 15 people, but has bed space for 10. There is plenty of floor space for air mattresses or sleeping bags, that you bring.

neighborhood_overview: Super quiet neighborhood, one block walk to a park for the kids. Close to grocery stores and a variety of restaurants: Earl's BBQ, Beefbelly beefs and burgers, Pho No 1, and Cochinita taco company are some of our favorites.
notes: When the house is not being rented, we reside in the home with our three children. The home will feel like visiting the home of a relative with our personal items around. This also means the home is lived in, but is cleaned for your stay. For example, the carpet on the second floor has a bleach stain from the time our son took a cleaning product out of the bathroom and squeezed the contents onto the carpet in the hall... The things that make a house a home. This also means we take extra care of the items in the home and we keep things clean. This is our home, but we are sharing it with you hoping you have a great visit to Chicago, a city we love. The space is for your use while you are staying in the home. We will be in the basement or traveling and will give you full access to the top two floors with no disruption.
transit: Blue line "el" is a short bus ride away to get downtown or to O'Hare without traffic. We are close to highways and are between the 90/94 split and 294 to quickly get anywhere in the area.
access: You have access to the first and second floor. The basement will be locked off. If we are not traveling, we will be staying in the basement which is a separate space and has a separate outdoor entrance.
interaction: If we are in town we will be staying in the basement completely out of your way, we have our own entrance/exit. We'll be there to greet and help you with anything, if you would like. If we are traveling there are multiple contacts for you in case you need anything. Either way you will be given a code to access the house for your time here.
house_rules: - Quiet hours begin at 11 pm - Shoes off in the home - Make sure all doors and windows are locked when you leave the home - Must be 21 years old to make reservation

summary: Retro style 1 bedroom apartment available in the Irving Park neighborhood. This is a private attic apartment that you will not be sharing. Full bathroom and kitchen included. Nothing fancy here but we intended it to be that way! I offer shuttle service to and from O'hare/Midway/Union Station. If you are looking for more space, I also have a 3 bedroom house available on Airbnb. Please look at my other listing.
space: This apartment is private. Full bath and kitchen. The kitchen is stocked with plates, pans, pots, and various utensils. If you require a special item for the kitchen I can supply it. I provide only coffee which I can replenish upon request. We have cable TV and WIFI along with a smart tv.

neighborhood_overview: The area is very popular with Pop-up restaurants and late night spots.  It has a lot of style without all of the congestion. The apartment is close to Logan Square, Wicker Park, and Lincoln Park however they are not in walking distance. Approximately 7 miles from downtown and 3 miles from Wrigley Field. There is a Divvy Bike Station just down the street. Divvy is the Chicago Bike share Program in which you may rent a bike for a few hours or the entire day. We are off of Elston Street which is also a shared bike path to down town Chicago.
transit: Public transportation is minutes away. I am a few blocks away from the Addison train station (CTA Blue Line). This train brings you to the Loop (25 minutes) and O'hare airport. The 152 Addison CTA bus stop is at the end of the block as well. Plenty of free parking on the block. Uber and Lyft area.
access: Access is limited to the apartment.
interaction: As your host, I can help with any information you may need to make your stay in Chicago a memorable one. If I am around I will come and say hi. You may run into other guests from the other units outside of the house so don't be alarmed.
house_rules: ***NO LARGE PARTIES !!!!  I'm referring to those who reserve the  space intending it to be a party room to have a "house party",  play loud music, and are very loud late at night.  -Respect my neighbors and the neighborhood  -I encourage guests to remove shoes inside the apartment. -Please treat the property as your own.  -Check-in and check-out on time. If the unit is not reserved to  another guest the day you are arriving or departing yes I can be  very flexible with times. So check out the calendar and make a  note if it looks like another guest is booked the day your coming  or going. Or just ask.
host_about: I am a very resourceful and detailed host who was born and raised in the city of Chicago. My passions include Chicago House music, street art, graphic design and tacos. Any destination with warm weather, clear water, and a beach is a place I want to be now.

name: Newly Renovated Flat- All Chicago Access, Sleeps 6
summary: New to AirBNB is our 1910 fully renovated 2 flat located on a quiet tree-lined residential street 2 miles North of Logan Square and 3.5 miles West of Wrigleyville, 7 miles Northwest of United Center, 12 miles form US Cellular Field. Walk to all local amenities and transportation. Just a 18 minute train ride to downtown. Two queen bedrooms, sleeper sofa, one full bath and a fully functional kitchen, makes this completely renovated living space perfect for families, friends, sports fans, and pets.
space: Private flat offering 2 beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable rooms. The first bedroom includes a queen bed with crisp linens, a down comforter, warm rug, beautiful art and closet for your belongings. The room also has an under the stairs nook full of comfy pillows and books. A pack-n-play is also provided.  The second room includes a queen bed with crisp linens, a down comforter, warm rug and closet for your belongings. A room safe is available for use in the back bedroom closet.  The open concept living area contains a sleeper sofa and 2 side chairs. The 42" flat screen is equipped with Cable TV, Apple TV, DVD player and high speed wireless internet.  The kitchen is fully stocked with pots, pans and dishes.  A microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, blender, food processor, stove, oven and full sized fridge/freezer with ice maker and dishwasher complete the kitchen and make it operational for cooking. Please hand wash cooking knives. Complimentary coffee, tea and a bottle of wi

neighborhood_overview: This family and pet friendly neighborhood has local fare and a grocery store within walking distance. Our favorite spring time treat, Miko's Italian Ice, is a 6 minute walk away. The neighborhood dive bar T&A (Tina and Al's- cute, old Hungarian couple) is just 2 blocks away.
notes: Because we live directly above you, and the home was built in 1910, there can be foot traffic noise at times. We are up early and are usually quiet in the evening and settle down early. Our puppies may whine when we leave, but that lasts no more than 60 seconds.
transit: We encourage you to use public transportation. Parking can be painful and expensive in most of Chicago.  Subway "L"- A 5 minute walk (0.3 Miles) to the bus. 15 minute walk (0.8 miles) to the Addison Blue Line Stop. 18 minute walk (0.9 miles) to the Kimball Brown Line Stop. 18 minute ride on the Blue Line to Downtown. 22 minute ride to Ohare. Buy your Ventra card at the airport or at any local drug store. Register online and connect it to your bank to get a 5$ credit.  Uber - A great app for calling for a ride. Download from app stores on your smart phones for free, set up profile with credit card info. ZipCar - Wheels when you want them... Rent a car by the hour and find them nearby with your smart phone. Several drop off and pickup locations can be found within 1 mile of our home. Divvy Bikes: Divvy bikes are a great way to go if you want to get somewhere quickly and see the city.
access: The self-contained home is on the 1st floor, with our home above and my mother in the garden unit. We share a common front entrance into the home, your door labeled # 1, being on the right. Please enter and exit through the front door only. The back door is for emergencies only and dumping trash. Please potty your dogs out front with the provided dog bags. You may dump your trash in the can provided out the back door.
interaction: We are very easy going and social. We are just a call or text away.  We are happy to share our secrets on how to safely navigate the city and give you our opinion on special spots to visit.
house_rules: - Enter and Exit through the front only - No smoking on property. - We appreciate you taking off your shoes on wet or snowy days and placing them in the shoe trays provided- It helps keep everything dryer and cleaner. - Quiet hours are from 10p-6a. Howeve

There's a strong Latino presenc
neighborhood_overview: There's a strong Latino presence here so you can get really amazing tacos as well as this thing I discovered called "coctel de frutas". It's just a fruit salad, but with chili lime powder on top.  You wouldn't think it'd be that amazing from the description, but trust me, it's to DIE for! In addition, the neighborhood is historically Polish, so there are still many remaining Polish businesses including some really scrumptious restaurants just a few block down the road.
notes: The neighborhood is incredibly quiet and peaceful. You'll sleep like a baby.
transit: There is ample free street parking, the Milwaukee bus picks up right outside the door and the Belmont and Addison Blue Line stops are about 3/4 of a mile from here.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the lovely Avondale neighborhood in Chicago. You will love its central location and super easy and convenient access to every mode of transportation: 5-10 minute walk to the blue line connecting you to O'Hare and downtown (~30 minute train ride from house to O'Hare or downtown loop), 5 minute drive to the 90/94 expressway, minutes walk to major bus routes such as Addison Ave, Belmont Ave and Milwaukee Ave, 15 minute walk to the Irving Park Metra train stop and plentiful street parking for your car. Take the Addison Ave bus right to Wrigley Field and catch a cubs game while you are here! It is a safe and quiet neighborhood.  Chicago is a foodie town and there are a handful of great restaurants to enjoy that are walking distance from your door which includes Chicago's famous Honey Butter Chicken!
notes: My cat is generally grumpy with strangers but spend much of her time hiding when there is someone she doesn't know.  She does not have access to the room you'll stay in.
transit: The Blue line is a 10 minute walk away. From there it's about 35 minutes from downtown or O'Hare. Wrigleyville, Lakeview and Boystown are about 20 min away by bus. You can also easily access the Red and Brown lines via a short bus ride.  Logan Square is a 15 minute walk away. There is free non-permit street parking.  It is usually fairly easy to park.
access: Guests are welcome to all common areas of the apartment.  You will have full access to the kitchen such as use of the microwave, stove, oven, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Washer and dryer are available and in unit.
interaction: I do not have regular 9 to 5 hours and I am gone a good bit. But, I do sometimes have big chunks of time when I work at home. host_about: I am a dancer, teacher and choreographer who has lived in Chicago for more than 25 years.  I am a creative, people oriented person who enjoys travel and making new friends.    I have lived and worked in the city for more than 25 years.  I know my way around pretty well, can share the major tourist attractions,  share some things with you that are off the beaten path and be a good resource to you about the arts community.  I am the founder of a small dance company that is in its 20th year.  I value long term relationships, collaboration and mentorship.

name: Rehabbed BR in Logan Sq coop house
summary: Hey Blue Line fans. Hey co-op fans. We keep a spot open in our shared 7-bedroom house for AirBnBers, and we love month-long (or longer!) guests. We're just 4 blocks north of the Logan Square Blue Line stop. Come stay.
description: Hey Blue Line fans. Hey co-op fans. We keep a spot open in our shared 7-bedroom house for AirBnBers, and we love month-long (or longer!) guests. We're just 4 blocks north of the Logan Square Blue Line stop. Come stay. You'll have your own bedroom with a double bed, ceiling fan, window, and closet. But you'll also have access to a whole house worth of kitchens, dens, and workspaces. Did we mention the backyard and tiny deck? Hashtags: #bright #clean #quiet #cozy #bathtub #wifi #plants We owners are also residents, so we'll be on-site throughout your stay, as will the rest of the permanent housemates. Hard to get locked out when you have 6 friends with keys you can call. That said, we're happy to stay out of each others' way. A 3-floor house means plenty of spaces for doing your own thing. Logan Square, the heart of where it's at in Chicago these days. Foodie restaurants, bars that don't suck, street festivals, the boulevard... All the best, in one place. And on the Blue Line, to boot! T
neighborhood_overview: Logan Square, the heart of where it's at in Chicago these days. Foodie restaurants, bars that don't suck, street festivals, the boulevard... All the best, in one place. And on the Blue Line, to boot! That's the one that goes to O'Hare *and* the Loop. Literally around the corner from the house:  â€¢ Small Bar (the perfect neighborhood pub) â€¢ Yusho (fancy ramen)  â€¢ La Cocina (excellent cheap Mexican) â€¢Â Lost Lake (best tiki bar in the nation, says Imbibe magazine)
notes: There is an unbelievably soft and friendly cat who lives in the basement, but floors 2 and 3 are permanently pet-free.
transit: BY TRAIN: We're 4 blocks from the Blue Line, which goes to O'Hare, the Loop, and everywhere in between: Wicker Park, Bucktown, West Town, UIC, Oak Park. BY BUS: We're 2 blocks from buses heading east to Lake View and Lincoln Park, north to Albany Park, or south to Humboldt Park. BY-CYCLE: we're Â½ block off the amazing N-S bike route known as Kedzie. Nearby Divvy station if you want to bike around. BY CAR: We're 2 blocks from an I-90/94 entrance (but no road noise inside the house). Free unlimited street parking is all along our block and surrounding blocks. We can provide daily parking permits if needed.

house_rules: House philosophy: â€¢ LGBTQ-friendly / safe space  â€¢ Cooperative living is better living â€¢ Take care of your space and help others do the same â€¢ Live and let live â€¢ When in doubt, be kind â€¢ NO smoking indoors â€¢ NO more furry pets (beyond the one cat already living here)
host_about:
Whether hosting or visiting, I am the king of caring. I allow and initiate interactions that create the world I mean to create. When this is a world you believe in too, then we are realizing shared intention.

PHILOSOPHY
â€¢ Don't just do the next right thing, do the absolute best thing you can.
â€¢ Never stop meeting yourself; or, never stop inviting yourself along.
â€¢ Stop doing, start being.

ABOUT ME
Don't look now, I've already solved all your problems and billed you in jumping jacks.

ACTIVITIES
Throat singing, Meditation, Hiking, Yoga, Kirtan, Early Music publishing, Bearded dragons, Infographics, Paleobiology, Memes, Organizing, Bumping the supply curve, Never doing the same thing twice, Seeing the bigger picture, Taming with miracles those who must be tamed in that way

QUOTATION
"In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is." - Jan L. A. van de Snepscheut

TRAVELS
Australia, Austria, Canada (just BC/AB/ON/QC), France, Germany, India, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Romania, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Thailand, United Kingdom, every United State except Vermont

name: Bohemian Hideaway (Lic 2333774)
summary: A Boho chic getaway as cozy as it is groovy in Chicago's craft beer and cocktail lounge Mecca, Logan Square.  Easy access to downtown and O'Hare via the Blue Line or Milwaukee Ave. bus.
space: Like my other AirBnB, this apartment was designed by up-and-coming interior designer Tara Rhode.  This one is in a Boho chic style with a combination of Moroccan and East Indian accents.  One bedroom is a double bed and the other is a twin and a trundle.  All of the beds have new memory foam mattresses.  The kitchen has a stove and refrigerator, but no dishwasher.  The kitchen table seats 6. It's an old building so there's not central AC, but there are window units in each of the bedrooms. There's a little deck on the back and a grill on the top floor which can be used on the deck up there.  There's a nice view of the city skyline.
description: A Boho chic getaway as cozy as it is groovy in Chicago's craft beer and cocktail lounge Mecca, Logan Square.  Easy access to downtown and O'Hare via the Blue Line or Milwaukee Ave. bus.  Like my other AirBnB, this apartment was designed by up-and-coming interior designer Tara Rhode.  This one is in a Boho chic style with a combination of Moroccan and East Indian accents.  One bedroom is a double bed and the other is a twin and a trundle.  All of the beds have new memory foam mattresses.  The kitchen has a stove and refrigerator, but no dishwasher.  The kitchen table seats 6. It's an old building so there's not central AC, but there are window units in each of the bedrooms. There's a little deck on the back and a grill on the top floor which can be used on the deck up there.  There's a nice view of the city skyline. There is a laundry room on the top floor of the building with two washers and dryers that each take quarters. I don't really interact with my guests, not because I don't wan
neighborhood_overview: I'll be adding to this list of neighborhood attractions but, for starters, here's a recent article by Bon Apetit magazine about nearby restaurants.  (Note:  These are a few blocks away, but still considered in the same neighborhood as my building) (URL HIDDEN) Zagat's just rated the area's newest craft cocktail bar, Billy Sunday, as one of the best cocktail bars in the country (!) (URL HIDDEN) One of Chicago's best and oldest blues dive bars is in Logan Square, Rosa's Lounge at 3420 W. Armitage Ave. (URL HIDDEN)  Here's an article about its history: (URL HIDDEN) For the summer, here's a list of restaurants that have nice outdoor dining.  There are way more than these, but this list will do in a pinch: (URL HIDDEN)
notes: Across the street from the building is a popular bakery called La Farine.  It's open from 7 AM to 7 PM Monday - Saturday, 8 AM - 6 PM Sunday.  There's a very good taqueria across the street, too.  A little further north is Moe's Tavern, a slice of "real Chicago." There's a little grocery store across the street that opens early and closes at 8 every day.   A couple of blocks further is a Polish grocery store with lots of smoked meats and fresh sauerkraut, pickled herring and pickles.  There's a 24-hour convenience store, Food Smart, at 3415 W Diversey Ave, a couple of blocks from the building.   (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)
transit: Public transit is very convenient.  The #56 bus stops almost in front of the building and goes downtown.  A 10 minute walk away is the Logan Square Blue Line station that goes downtown or to O'Hare.  There is a Divvy bike station at the Logan Square Blue Line stop as well as an Enterprise car share lot at 2808 N. Christina about a 5 minute walk away. If you're arriving from O'Hare it's quick and easy to get to the building.  You get the train (the Blue Line) in the airport by following the signs that say "Trains to City."  Get a CTA pass at the vending machines at the station.  There will be attendants there to help you if you need it.   Take the train to the Logan Square stop, about a 20 minute ride.  Exit at the Spaulding Street end of the station.   That will put you a block closer to than if you exit at the main entrance/exit.   There's no elevator at that exit so if you need an elevator you should exit at the Logan Square side. When you get to the street level, you need to walk no
access: There is a laundry room on the top floor of the building with two washers and dryers that each take quarters.
interaction: I don't really interact with my guests, not because I don't want to but because I've set it up so that guests can come and go on their own, and our paths don't often cross.  My studio is in the storefront of the building an sometimes guests stop in when they spot me in there.  Most of my guests, though, are very independent.
house_rules: This is a non-smoking unit but feel free to smoke outdoors on the deck or sidewalk.  No pets please.
host_about: I'm an artist who has lived in Chicago since 2002.  My studio is in a building I bought in the old Polish neighborhood on Milwaukee Avenue.  I've turned one of my apartments into an AirBnB as an experiment in August 2013.  I like to stay in AirBnB's whenever I travel around the country for my public art commissions and painting exhibits.

neighborhood_overview: We're biased, but we do believe this is one of the best neighborhoods in the city.  The dining and entertainment options are numerous.  We have included plenty of recommendations in the guidebook, but at a glance, our favorite spots within walking distance are: Longman & Eagle, Yusho, Parts & Labor, Reno, Fat Rice, La Cocina and Intelligentsia Coffee. If you're fortunate enough to be staying with us on a Sunday during the summer, the Logan Square Farmers Market is a short walk away, just south of the square on Logan Boulevard.  It is widely known as one of the best in the city and has great hot and prepared foods in addition to excellent flowers and produce. If you're looking for entertainment, consider the Logan Theater, which shows a mixture of newer commercial and arts movies, as well as classic films.  It has recently been extensively restored and has a full bar.
transit: In addition to your two private garage spaces, public transit is very convenient. There is a blue line stop less than 5 minutes away, which offers direct access to O'Hare Airport (it literally terminates in the basement) and in the other direction to Wicker Park (via the Division and Damen stops) and downtown (the Loop).  You can also easily transfer to all other lines in the Loop.  Grant Park and Millennium Park are a short walk from Blue Line stops. Multiple bus lines also stop at the nearby Blue Line stop, and at the nearest intersection. For those who love to bike, check out Divvy, which offers unlimited rides (30 minutes or less each) for $9.95 per day.
access: You will have complete access to all parts of the apartment, and, if necessary, to the detached garage.
interaction: I'm very available (by phone and through the app) to answer questions and solve problems before and during your stay.  But if you don't have any questions and there isn't something to be fixed, solved or stocked at the unit, you will probably never meet me.
house_rules: - Use of the fire pit in the back yard is permitted. - Please be cautious when using the rear porches.  Children under 3 and groups larger than 6 should not congregate on the porches. - During the winter, the rear exterior stairs are not maintained and sh
host_about:
I was born and raised on the north side of Chicago.  My wife is from Manhattan by way of Rochester and Cleveland.  We live with our son in Logan Square.

She's an academic and I am an entrepreneur and real estate investor.  We both love design, art and photography.

We keep telling ourselves that we're going to start cooking more, but constantly find ourselves out exploring new restaurants and revisiting neighborhood favorites.

As hosts, we pride ourselves on being responsive, providing a clean, friendly environment, and sharing enough local knowledge to help you experience the city not only as a tourist, but also like a local.

notes: If you like to bring a pet please ask us.

host_about:
I moved to Chicago in 2002 and live here with my lovely husband in the Avondale neighborhood. We love flowers and growing our own vegetables like you can see in our pics and also make our own honey. For that we do have 2 beehives in our backyard.
We love to have people from all over the world in our house and treat them as we would treat our own family. Often we do have a BBQ or a meal together and also share  a breakfast. I love to bake and so you will find all the time a treat and can stop for a good cup of European coffee. We also love animals and have our self 3  cats and 2 birds. If you wish to bring your pet also, please let us know and we do our Best to make it possible.
We are both strong believers in the christian faith and love to travel to places like the library of Billy Graham in NC or the Bill Gaither studios in Alexandria, IN. We love to watch Seinfeld and anything else what is funny and we consider our self as very outgoing and easy to live with people.

It has everything you need for a short stay or extended stay, including fresh linens, towel service, and a hair dryer.  The kitchen is well stocked with free fresh coffee and tea, and all necessary kitchen appliances and utensils. This apartment will is perfect for a peaceful weekend while also providing ample workspace for the avid business traveler. The 50" Roku Smart TV is internet connected so you can use it to go online, watch movies on your Amazon, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Pandora account! Basic Cable also included.  Smart Thermostat keeps the living space comfortable. Green Living, we Proudly use 100% green, non toxic cleaning products and make every effort make your stay flawless and as comfortable as possible.

neighborhood_overview: The history of Logan Square/Irving Park is probably the first thing that stands out to me. Noted by many for its historic homes, I love strolling the streets of Irving Park to admire its architecture. As a lover of bungalow-style houses and all things historic, I have a soft spot for Irving Park.  The area also has loads of transportation, which makes it easy to come here for the day or commute in/out if you make this your home. I love the peaceful tree lined streets, and also the easy access to every restaurant and bar in Chicago.  Great access to Wrigley Field and all that Chicago has to offer! Check out the Kilbourn Park Organic Greenhouse! The first-ever public fruit tree orchard in a major metropolitan city was planted in Kilbourn Park at the Greenhouse in fall 2008!  It is a wonderful resource for the community and visitors alike.
notes: Please note - that while the home is beautifully situated for indoor use - we have strict guidelines regarding noise, in accordance with City of Chicago and neighborhood laws. We respect our neighbors greatly, and simply ask that you do the same. We do penalize aggressively for violations of this - including reporting by neighbors or ticketing by police.
transit: Free street parking is available along with some metered parking. Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round BIKE sharing system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!  This is a great way to explore the neighborhoods of Chicago and you can drop bikes off at any other Stations! Home to Belmont Blue Line Station (0.9 Miles) Belmont Blue Line to/from O'hare Airport (16 min) The #77 Bus takes you straight across Belmont to the Station #56 Bus 2 blocks away on Milwaukee Ave will bring you into Logan Square, Wicker Park, Bucktown, and River West in Minutes! Easy to Grab Uber/Lyft...about 15 Minutes to the Loop! 15 Minutes to O'hare Airport Via Car! Also, Chicago has a citywide, year round bike share system called 'Divvy'. There is a Divvy Bike Station 2 blocks away!
access: Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.  There is also a shared backyard for guests on the property. 24 Hour Check-In!  Extra free street parking is available in the neighborhood as well as some metered parking.
interaction: I travel often so I use and trust an off-site management team to help guestsÂ get the information andÂ serviceÂ they need to make their stay enjoyable!
house_rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out/lost key penalty  3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.  4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.  5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
host_about: Hi I'm Lara, and I am very proud to be an Airbnb Superhost! I am a Chicago native, and studied hospitality management at Boston University, and decided to follow my passion in trying to provide an amazing travel experience through AirBnB!  My husband and I love trying new places to eat, and have a real passion for traveling to exciting parts of the world.  I put a lot of work into getting my spaces ready, and I know you will enjoy your stay with me! Welcome to Chicago!

neighborhood_overview: A fair description of Logan Square includes cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands. At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy,

neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park is an emerging Chicago neighborhood on the near west side.  It's close enough to Wicker Park, Bucktown, and Logan Square that you can easily get to these neighborhoods by bus or taxi, but far enough away that it's quiet when you want it to be.   The park is BEAUTIFUL and offers swimming, fishing, tennis, baseball and soccer.  We are also a 5-minute walk to the 606 bike/ walk path  that enters on either Drake or Lawndale.  This bike path will take you to the Wicker Park, south Logan Square, and Bucktown neighborhoods.
notes: My husband, Dave, is a local Chicago chef and is available for a private tasting menu at our house if you'd like to book that with your stay (not included in Airbnb fees).
transit: We are right by the North Ave bus that will take you to the Blue L line in 15 minutes and a short distance from the Chicago bus that will take you to the Red L line.  Uber is your best bet in our neighborhood because we are a little ways from city action.
access: Aside from the bedroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen, dining room, and porch areas of the house.  Cold and hot coffee are available and our fridge is available for your use/ storage.
interaction: We'd love to help you navigate the city and give you our feedback as well as share what we love about the city.
house_rules: Smoking outside, please.  We have an old Chocolate lab who is friendly and gets along great with FEMALE dogs.   If you are interested in bringing your dog, please let us know.
host_about:
I'm a Chicago transplant via the Quad Cities and have lived in the city since 1993.  I've lived in several neighborhoods and my husband and I settled in Humboldt park for the diversity of the neighborhood and the beauty of the actual park.  

I'm the founder and executive director of The Arts of Life- a professional arts' studio that supports artists who have developmental/ intellectual disabilities.  We have two studios (Chicago and Glenview) and we'd love to show you around if you are interested in intuitive art and a unique not-for-profit. 

I'm also involved in my husband's not-for-profit, Rogue Philanthropy- a restaurant concept that gives our profits back to local not-for-profits.  

We have a chocolate lab, Tucker,  who loves new people and looks forward to our guests.  We spend most of our free time with him at the park or other forest preserves.  

Favorites:
     Movie- Fight Club// Funny Girl
     Book- Pride & Prejudice// There Eye's were watching God
     Band- The Replacements//Wilco// The Flaming Lips
     TV Show- The Wire
     Bar- Scofflaw
     Restaurant (affordable)- Bite Cafe// Antique Taco
     Restaurant (middle)- Owen & Engine// Cumin 
     Restaurant (expensive)- Green Zebra// Mirai Sushi
     Food- Sushi// Indian

neighborhood_overview: Humboldt Park is an up and coming area which is currently one of the fastest growing neighborhoods in the country. Why? Because there is no argument that this is one of the largest and most stunningly beautiful parks in the city. Recently more and more amazing bars and restaurants are moving into the Humboldt/Logan Square area.  The 606 trail, an elevated park system was recently built on the old train tracks and is only minutes away from the park itself.  This area is full of diversity and all walks of life which is what gives it its charm.
transit: The Grand Ave. Bus will take you straight downtown. no transfer necessary! Take a cab or Uber 5 minutes north on  Kedzie and you are right in the center of Logan Square. This location is actually quite easy to get where you need to go from here.

host_about: Bruce has been a Chicagoland resident his whole life and has been a staple in the Chicago music, art and culinary scene for over 20 years. He is currently involved with bands such as Yakuza, Bloodiest, Led Zeppelin 2, Corrections House, and his solo works. He has been a longtime bartender and manager at the Empty Bottle, Thalia Hall, Goose Island Brewing Co. He has travelled all over the world and hopes to continue to find new place and meet new people. His life motto is: DO IT!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in a gentrifying  neighborhood bordering the trendy West Loop area.  There is a very large multinational Fresh Food Market a few blocks from the house.. While we do NOT  have any cafes or restaurants within walking distance, we are ONE BLOCK WALK TO  THE GREEN LINE TRAIN with  ONE TRAIN STOP  to  many Chicago attractions including the United Center, Union Park,  and the West Loop -  Randolph Street restaurants bars and shopping. This is a large, nice, clean, affordable, alternative to pricey neighborhoods if you are ok with not walking directly to Chicago attractions and your travel style allows for a gentrifying  city neighborhood.  See "getting around" info.
notes: I would prefer to welcome you in person, however when this is not possible keys will be made easily available for self check- in.  You can leave the keys in the house when you depart.  I understand travel time can be challenging. I will always do my best to accommodate early or late check in/out whenever possible. Please make this request when booking.
transit: We are very centrally located. Uber and Lyft provide very reasonable options to travel to many close neighborhoods such as the Loop,  West Town, West Loop, Ukrainian Village, Wicker Park and Bucktown.  You are a $10 ride from many tourist attractions.   We are a few blocks from I-290 expressway. We are one block to CTA Green line "L" train with one stop to Union Park, one stop to the United Center and 2 stops to the  West Loop . You are a 12 minute Train ride ( 3 stops) to downtown Chicago Loop , Michigan Avenue , Grant Park and Millennium Park and the Lake.  We are located 3 miles west of Lake Michigan.  Airports Ohare and Midway are about a half hour ride ( pending traffic)  and cost about $20. Also easy by public transportation.  Ohare is blue line to green line and off at California.  Midway is orange line to green line and off at California.  We are 2 minute walk from California Green line train stop.  I AM HAPPY TO ANSWER ANY TRAVEL QUESTIONS!
access: 24 hour access to the entire house. Come and go as you please.
interaction: I will always be available to answer any questions or concerns if you message me on AirBnB.  I live next door and I  look forward to sharing any information I can provide regarding your stay in Chicago!
house_rules: Please remember we provide a cleaning service not a maid service. To keep our costs low and respect our home please leave it as you found it.  -Use dishwasher or wash your dishes & empty your  trash before departure.  - No guests that are not on reservation. -Smoking allowed outside on back deck only please -All  used towels to be put in laundry baskets provided in each bedroom  closet  -Do not move furniture - air mattress to be used in bedroom only
host_about:
I have lived my entire life in Chicago and I love sharing my knowledge. I am happy to help you live like a local and EVERYONE IS WELCOME! 
One of my greatest joys in life is traveling and exploring and I am currently planning my next  trip to Sicily and Spain.

neighborhood_overview: 5-minute walk to Lagunitas Brewery, Saint Anthony's Hospital, Mount Zion Hospital.  3 train stations from 18th Street trendy district with lots of restaurants, bars and nightlife.  15-minute train ride to UIC campus.30-40-minute train ride to downtown and all its attractions.  10-15 minutes walk to main thoroughfare of Cermak with Walmart, Pete's Groceries, Subway, Burger King, and great, exotic Mexican restaurants serving wild game meat. Historical Hispanic/Latino neighborhood with an increasing number of hip, young professionals.
notes: Parking is available for free one block away next to the Lagunitas Brewery.  If you have a very small car, like a Smart Car, you can try to park in the garage for free. Steps are being taken to make it possible to park larger cars in the garage.  You can park on the street right in front of the building if you purchase a parking permit from the city. The apartment is on the 4th floor and there is no elevator. The shared bathroom is very small and has no ventilation, so you will be motivated not to stay in there very long. Downstairs neighbor sometimes plays rock music. I sing classical music and play the viola and keyboard, but I will be considerate of your need for peace and quiet. I am told by my friends that my snoring sounds like a bear in agony.  Well, no extra charge for that.
transit: Pink Line train station is 5 minutes away.  There are also buses on California Street right on the block.

name: Alewyfe Inn- Urban Farm Garden Apt.
summary: Private cozy apt. on the 1st floor of an 1880's brick cottage. Charming details like a farmhouse sink, stocked pantry, & your own bathroom, and chickens in the yard! 2 blocks from Pink Line, Lagunitas, Cinespace, & Mt Sinai hospital. 3.5 mi to Loop!
space: This Bohemian brick building has a lot of original character, including a farm sink, vintage woodwork, and radiant heat!  The apartment has a living room with fold-down futon and chaise (sleeps 1-3), and a small bedroom with a queen-size sized bed.  There's a TV with local cable channels and Showtime in the living room, so you can binge watch all your favorite shows!  High-speed wireless internet for your work or web-surfin', and the cute little vintage desk came from a convent in Wisconsin, so any work you do there might be blessed?  Can't hurt!       The eat-in kitchenette is stocked with necessities (vintage dishes and basic cookware) and staples (coffee, tea, oatmeal, popcorn, flour, rice, sugar, condiments, and more) and a full-sized fridge (with front-yard farmed fresh eggs in season), coffee & tea bar, microwave, and oversize toaster oven.  There is no stove, but if you need to do more cooking than the kitchenette can accommodate, you can use the stove in my kitchen whenever I'm
description: Private cozy apt. on the 1st floor of an 1880's brick cottage. Charming details like a farmhouse sink, stocked pantry, & your own bathroom, and chickens in the yard! 2 blocks from Pink Line, Lagunitas, Cinespace, & Mt Sinai hospital. 3.5 mi to Loop! This Bohemian brick building has a lot of original character, including a farm sink, vintage woodwork, and radiant heat!  The apartment has a living room with fold-down futon and chaise (sleeps 1-3), and a small bedroom with a queen-size sized bed.  There's a TV with local cable channels and Showtime in the living room, so you can binge watch all your favorite shows!  High-speed wireless internet for your work or web-surfin', and the cute little vintage desk came from a convent in Wisconsin, so any work you do there might be blessed?  Can't hurt!       The eat-in kitchenette is stocked with necessities (vintage dishes and basic cookware) and staples (coffee, tea, oatmeal, popcorn, flour, rice, sugar, condiments, and more) and a full-sized f
neighborhood_overview: Walk over to Lagunitas for a tour or just have a few pints at the brewpub, then stroll through the park.  The soccer fields are across the street, so you might find a pick-up game... Or just watch the geese & ducks in the lagoon! Yes, you're definitely in the inner city, but keep your head up, your wits about you, and be nice and you'll be fine... I've never had a problem here.  Or, walk the other direction and explore Little Village (La Villita) on foot or by bike, or hop on the Pink Line to Pilsen for fantastic Mexican food, art galleries, and vintage shops, or stay on the train and head downtown or up north. I've lived in this city for half my life, and am happy to help you find your way around! I bike everywhere, so if you're up for some urban cycling, I can give you tips. Divy bikes (public bikeshare stations) are all over, and a fun, inexpensive way to see the city! Note that this is definitely an inner-city neighborhood.  You will hear sirens (most of them are ambulances as ther
notes: I have a Rottweiler named Zeus (da Moose)... he's limited to my apartment upstairs when I have guests, but if you're very allergic to dogs or afraid of large dogs, please let me know beforehand so I can be extra careful when letting him in the yard!  He's SUPER friendly once he meets you (looking for a 98# lapdog to smother you in dog kisses? You found one!), but also takes his watchdog duties seriously, so don't try to go upstairs if I'm not home (I keep the door locked, but just in case).  You can rest easy knowing that he's keeping an eye (and an ear) on the house even when we're out and about!  There's a beehive in the garden- they won't sting unless they're defending their home (unlike wasps, if a bee stings she dies).
transit: 1.5 blocks north of the Pink Line California stop.  Divy bikeshare bikes available for rental at the train station also (I have spare helmets if you'd like to borrow one).  The 94 California bus stop is a block away!  Of course Uber and Lyft are always an option.
access: You'll have access to your whole apartment with private entrance, shared free laundry in the basement (with eco-friendly, fragrance-free detergent), and the large front yard and garden.  There is high-speed internet with WiFi... the log-in and password are on the guest info board in the apartment.  Please enjoy the spacious front yard, and feed some treats to the chickens (there's are sunflower seeds in one of the feed bins by the coop- toss a handful into the run and make some feathered friends)!
interaction: I live upstairs, so I'm never far if you need anything, but also respect my guest's privacy.  I work full-time but am not too far away in case of emergency... and I work at a rock climbing gym, so if you want to add some vertical adventures, yoga, or personal training to your visit, let me know and I can help you set that up!  Want to learn about beekeeping, canning, baking, homebrewing, or worm composting?  I can set up a private lesson for you with enough notice.
house_rules: R.E.S.P.E.C.T.  Otis wrote it, Aretha owned it, and we've all gotta live it. Otherwise, have fun, be nice, and don't burn it down or break anything? Keep us safe by locking the front gate always (and apartment doors anytime you leave), close the inner gate so the dog doesn't harass the neighbors and the chickens don't get out, and return the keys to me or the lockbox when you check out! Please tidy up after yourself and try to leave the place as you found it! There's a padlock and privacy latch on the back door from your apartment into the basement/laundry room- please lock this during your stay if you like (small key on the ring), but unlock before you check out to make it easier for me to prep for the next guests- thanks!  No smoking indoors please (I don't mind, but for the sake of future guests...).  If the weather is really terrible outside (Chicago has cold winters!), I don't mind if you smoke in the basement as long as you're careful and keep the door to the apartment closed- th
host_about:
About me: Chef, farmer, photographer, soapmaker, agitator, rock climber, reader, yogi, biker, homebrewer, beekeeper, butcher, baker, doggie treat maker, betty crocker punk rocker... all disguised as a (mostly) mild-mannered HR professional.   Kind of a nerd, but not a dweeb?  Geeks welcome!  I love to travel, and sharing my home with interesting people from around the globe! 

Favorite quotes (the second one might double as a life-motto): 
"In order to make a pie from scratch, you must first create the universe."     â€• Isaac Asimov

â€œOf all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.â€ 
â€• John Muir

name: Private small bdrm with view
summary: Small bedroom in a 2-bedroom, 4th-floor apartment with airbed , very private with partial view of downtown skyscrapers.  Full kitchen with gas range/oven, fridge, toaster oven, microwave, rice cooker.  Washer/dryer in the hallway.
space: Sunny, bright, clean, cozy and private.  Cheap, yet with many amenities.  Short trip to major city attractions, downtown/the Loop, UIC/Medical District.   Your bedroom is small, intimate and private, with a partial view of downtown Chicago's skyscrapers.  The view is cut off at the bottom by the rooftops of the buildings next door.  But you can see downtown if you are a tall person or tiptoe or stand on a chair. I have allergies so I try to keep the place pretty clean and have air cleaners running.
description: Small bedroom in a 2-bedroom, 4th-floor apartment with airbed , very private with partial view of downtown skyscrapers.  Full kitchen with gas range/oven, fridge, toaster oven, microwave, rice cooker.  Washer/dryer in the hallway. Sunny, bright, clean, cozy and private.  Cheap, yet with many amenities. I have allergies so I try to keep the place pretty clean and have air cleaners running. Private bedroom, shared bathroom, kitchen, living room. I am open to socializing, going out, showing you the city and having meals together, when I am available.  I enjoy getting to know people from all over the world and learning about different cultures. However,
neighborhood_overview: Half a block from intersection of California Street and W 18th Street in the Pilsen neighborhood of Chicago.  Close enough for daily commute to downtown, UIC/Medical District.  3 train stops away from 18th Street trendy district with bars, restaurants and nightlife.  You can walk in 10-15 minutes to the neighborhood's main thoroughfare of Cermak with shops and exotic Mexican restaurants serving venison, Walmart, Pete's Groceries, Planet Fitness.  Douglas Park is only half a block away for walking, jogging, biking.   5-minute walking distance to Mount Sinai Hospital, Saint Anthony Hospital, Lagunitas Brewery. Historic Hispanic/Latino neighborhood, with more and more of the hip, young crowd moving in.
notes: The apartment is on the 4th floor with no elevators.  It can be hard to go up and down three flights of stairs with heavy luggage or groceries.  You either need to be fit or you will get fit! The bed is a small, inflatable airbed, not super luxurious, but I have slept on it for several months without a problem. I have allergies against dust, pollen, mold/mildew, cats, etc., so I try to keep the place very clean and have air cleaners on all the time. The room is very small, but it's sunny, well-ventilated, and quite private and intimate.  The view out of the window is partially blocked in the bottom half by the rooftops of the next buildings, but it also means that you can have the window open and still have your privacy. The bathroom is a bit tight around the sink and has no ventilation. I am 5 foot 8, about 180 lb, and I feel that the space is more cramped than to my liking.  If you are much taller or bigger than I am, you probably won't feel too comfortable in the small space.  It's
transit: CTA Pink Line Train's California Station is a 5-minute walk.  There are also buses on California Street right on the block. Bicycles are available for rent at the CTA train station. You can have a car and can 1. park on the street a block away right next to Lagunitas Brewery for free  or  2. park in front of the building by purchasing Permit 526 or 3. if you have a very small car like a Smart Car, park in the garage for free.  Steps are being taken to make it possible to park a larger car in the garage.
access: Private bedroom, shared bathroom, kitchen, living room.
interaction: I am open to socializing, going out, showing you the city and having meals together, when I am available.  I enjoy getting to know people from all over the world and learning about different cultures. However, I will also leave you alone, if you prefer to have your privacy. I listen to and play and sing classical music for fun and enjoy reading world literature, foreign films, art, opera, etc.  I will make some noises sometimes with my singing and viola/keyboard practice, but I will be considerate of your need to have peace and quiet.
house_rules: 1. Please wear the house slippers provided inside the apartment. 2. Please wash your dishes before you leave the place. 3. Moderate drinking inside the apartment is ok, but please no heavy boozing.  Come sober and leave sober. 4. No visitors.  No smokers.  No drugs.  No drama.  No police.  No problem.

summary: You're going to like this place! It's clean and very spacious. It can fit 4 people. Free and available parking. Good location. A block from train & bus station and rental bikes. Thanks for viewing and send me any questions you may have.  Fast wifi at 73Mbps
space: First, this is my home and everyone is welcome, including LGBT peeps, people with disabilities, all immigrants from any and every country, all women, minorities, international travelers, marchers, and everyone else. Positive, safe, and fun energy is welcome here.  The bedroom is very clean and very spacious with high ceilings! It has two, elevated full size beds in it and a closet. It's a great value and you're going to like the place. Everyone that sees the place is impressed and you will be, too. Fast wifi.  It's 20 min from downtown on the train. Bike rentals, busses, and trains are 2 blocks away.  Guests will have access to coin laundry in the basement and the kitchen, bathroom, and living room in the apartment. I'll give you the keys, including the one to your bedroom door.    The apartment is a block and a half from the train, busses, and rental bikes.  It's 30 min by bus directly West from McCormick Place and 25 min by train to Grant Park. It's also a bit over an hour from O'Har

neighborhood_overview: It's safe. Parking is free and available. Just be sure to read the signs.
interaction: The vibe of the Poker rooms is that they're similar to a hostel, but with private rooms, too. You will have the opportunity to meet other travelers if you want or have as much privacy as youâ€™d like. I find that guests who enjoy staying here are those that truly enjoy interacting with other guests. So don't be afraid to chat with your flat mate, share a story, grab a meal together, or explore the wonderful city together, if you're inclined.  To insure safety I require guests to upload their drivers license or passport to AirBnB's website.  Often, guests enjoy each other's company and sometimes attend the same events, so it enhances their Chicago experience. And, of course, you'll have your key to the bedroom, too, so, again, no privacy will be given up.
house_rules: 1) Check in is from 4-10PM.  2) Check out is at 11:00AM. 3) Please read the itinerary that AirBnB will send you upon booking. 4) Read the signs as far as parking and yes, it's free and available.  5) And if you book the room for safety reasons I would prefer to greet you and hand you the keys, not your guests.  6) I've found it best to communicate with guests only through the Airbnb thread because it helps me remember guests' questions. So please talk to me through this Airbnb message thread only.  7) If keys get lost I must charge $50 to replace them. Thanks for your inquiry and interest. If you have any questions, please ask.
host_about: I enjoy hosting people and seeing to it that guests have a great time in Chicago. There's tons to do and the pizza is second to none and is also my favorite food. Downtown is fun, but there are also fun neighborhoods, like Wicker Park, that are nearby. There's a cool pub that I've discovered that I'll go to with friends sometimes, I spend time with Ziggy, and I work. I'm a teacher. I live nearby the United Center and recently saw a UFC event there, which was cool. I'm generally a down-to-earth guy, so if you want to know anything ask or book a reservation. Thanks!

name: The RAD DONUT PAD!!
summary: Come stay at my (almost literally) SWEET pad, decked out with its own giant inflatable donut and lava lamp. You can't eat the donut, but you are welcome to stay at my place, conveniently located just BLOCKs AWAY from Douglas Park!
space: The apartment is a sweeeet space with a really open feel! Drenched in SUNLIGHT and perfectly cozy, you'll be able to breathe deep, put your feet up, and relax. There's art and weird knick knacks everywhere and I have a TV you can watch movies on. I don't have cable unfortunately, but hey, there's a whole city out there waiting to be explored!! I don't have pets but if you bring one (per my approval) there is a courtyard you can use and large green strips around the corner on South Marshall Blvd where they can use the toilette. There is one shower in the bathroom (no tub) and the water gets nice and hot! If your party is greater than 2 people keep in mind I have three 2-person inflatable air mattresses and a 1-person inflatable air mattress, a comfy couch to sleep on, and space for a bunch of people to sleep on the living room floor if they bring sleeping bags. You can smoke in the apartment just open the windows. Also go ahead and eat the food and drink the drinks! I don't want you to
description: Come stay at my (almost literally) SWEET pad, decked out with its own giant inflatable donut and lava lamp. You can't eat the donut, but you are welcome to stay at my place, conveniently located just BLOCKs AWAY from Douglas Park! The apartment is a sweeeet space with a really open feel! Drenched in SUNLIGHT and perfectly cozy, you'll be able to breathe deep, put your feet up, and relax. There's art and weird knick knacks everywhere and I have a TV you can watch movies on. I don't have cable unfortunately, but hey, there's a whole city out there waiting to be explored!! I don't have pets but if you bring one (per my approval) there is a courtyard you can use and large green strips around the corner on South Marshall Blvd where they can use the toilette. There is one shower in the bathroom (no tub) and the water gets nice and hot! If your party is greater than 2 people keep in mind I have three 2-person inflatable air mattresses and a 1-person inflatable air mattress, a comfy couch to s
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is super awesome, but if you are any ethnicity other than Latin-American, you will be in the minority in Little Village. Please be careful walking around after midnight. My neighbor friends and I have never had a problem with safety and we really love this neighborhood. That being said, it is not Wicker Park (meaning it ain't Gentrified to hell and back just yet, so there are no cute coffee shops or boutiques). There are however, amazing weird little shops (I love the resale shop across the street), cool residential streets with old houses and friendly families, and AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING Mexican restaurants that are so easy on your wallet! Most people say Little Village really grows on 'em, and I hope you'll feel this way by the end of your stay. :)
transit: From the apartment you can walk right to the Pink line CTA stop! Just turn right along W Cermak as you exit the building from the front. Walk 2 blocks east down Cermak towards S. California Ave. Turn left on S. California Ave, and you'll be able to see the train stop from there! You can also take the Cermak bus to get fairly close to downtown (it takes you right to the McCormick center as well). There's a bus stop right outside my apartment and the fee is only $2.25, super cheap!
access: You got access to the whole unit and attached balcony!
house_rules: Please respect my home. Thanks!
host_about:
Hi, I'm Joe! I love to travel - I've been camping in South Africa, rode elephants in Thailand, explored castles in Scotland and many more! I love to make friends all over the world.  

In the wilds of Chicago you can find me spending time with friends over dinner or having a cocktail at a nearby hotspot; playing Cards Against Humanity, Apples to Apples, or Connect 4 at a bar; soaking in the atmosphere in various Chicago neighborhoods; curling up in the sun with a good book, stepping on dance partners' toes at spur of the moment dance parties, or playing ultimate frisbee.

The master bedroom has a sizable closet and vanity. The cozy guest bedroom offers under-bed storage. The living room has a sleeper sofa for additional guests. The flat comes with granola and yogurt, as well as a coffee and tea bar. The guest will have access to the suite, as well as our large patio, and are welcome to use the bbq grill and smoker, on a first come/first serve basis. We also offer bicycles for u
neighborhood_overview: We're walking distance to Lagunitas Brewery and Tap Room, Cinespace, and Douglas Park. Our train stop is the primary one for Cook County Criminal Courts and Jail. There are walk-up taco joints, sit down Mexican restaurants,  grocery stores, and a Planet Fitness within three blocks of the house. The neighborhood is predominately multi-generational Mexican and black families. Kids play on the sidewalk, parents upkeep their properties, and grandparents sit on the stoop.
notes: We have two standard poodles, often in the yard, that are very friendly, and a little rowdy only with each other.
transit: We're one block from the train, 20 minutes to downtown, or a 15 minute Uber(we've had great coverage in our area). Bike rental is very close too. Street parking is plentiful. There are buses that will take you in most directions. The nearest metra is the BNSF Western Stop, about .7 mile from the house. If you're coming from Midway, Orange Line(leaves from airport) to Pink Line downtown, transfer at Harold Washington Library. If you're coming from O'Hare, Blue Line(leaves from airport) to Clark/Lake downtown. Take Green Line west(Harlem/Lake direction) one stop to Clinton, and transfer to Pink Line west(54/Cermak) to California stop. The purpose of the Green Line one stop ride, is to prevent you from taking all the downtown stops the Pink Line would otherwise make you go through before heading back west to our neighborhood.
access: The guest will have access to the suite, as well as our large patio, and are welcome to use the bbq grill and smoker, on a first come/first serve basis. We also offer bicycles for use (as well as helmets).
interaction: We live on the property and try to check in guests directly, to introduce ourselves and maybe our dogs. We are accessible via phone and text, as well as the app.
house_rules: This is our home. Not a motel. We've put a lot of time and energy into creating a space that is both warm and inviting for our guests. Please treat it with respect. If you're uncertain or not knowledgeable about the Little Village neighborhood, please look it up before booking with us. The neighborhood is fine, safe to walk during waking hours, but may not meet the comfort level of certain guests.   Check-in time is 3PM, if same day booking, please allow for flexibility as we may have work we weren't able to plan around.   Please wash any dishes used, it's ok to leave on the drying rack.   While there is absolutely no smoking or vaping inside, guests are allowed to smoke tobacco and other herbal products outside, on the front stoop or on the patio, for example. The house is on a shared ventilation system, anything being smoked inside can be smelled throughout the building, and when detected, will result in terminating your booking, with no refund. It's ok to smoke, just do it outside.
host_about: Relaxed, non-smoking, bike riding, morning people. We enjoy walking, exploring new neighborhoods, and reading, usually have a cup of coffee in hand at all times.

neighborhood_overview: About Little Village: The neighborhood is called "Mexico of the Midwest" by many of its residents. Little Village celebrates Mexican Independence Day every September with a parade down 26th Street. It is the largest Hispanic parade in Chicago. The Parade attracts thousands of spectators each year who flock to the neighborhood to show support and pride for their heritage. For green spaces and recreation in Little Village, residents can make a visit to the community parks. Washtenaw Park has a baseball diamond and offers a variety of arts and crafts classes for adults as well as day camps for kids. Shedd Park is a little park in Little Village named for John G. Shedd. Piotrowski Park is the neighborhood's largest public park and is the most popular outdoor retreat for Little Village residents.
notes: Washer & Dryer are located in Laundromat across the Alley (30 second walk from back door)
transit: This House is less than 5 min. walk from the Nearest Public Transit.  From there, all of Chicago is easily accessible! Want to know how far your Destination is from my Place?  Enter 26th & Pulaski into Goo.gle Maps, then type in your Destination.  You'll see pretty accurate Travel Times whether you're driving, taking the bus, using the CTA system, or walking.  This will also take into account real-time traffic to give you an even more accurate estimate! Here are some common travel routes and the Public Transit Routes you'll need to take: From Midway International Airport: - Orange Line (CTA) to Pulaski Station - 53A Bus from Pulaski Station to 31st St. & Pulaski Ave. - Unit is 5 min walk from 31st St. & Pulaski Ave. Travel Distance to Chicago Landmarks: - Pulaski Pink Line Station = 0.5 mi.   - MDW International Airport = 4.5 mi. - ORD International Airport = 17.5 mi.  - Union Station = 5.5 mi.  - United Center = 4.0 mi.  - U.S. Cellular Field = 5.5 mi.  - Wrigley Field = 9.4 mi. - Sol

host_about:
Hi! 

I'm Tricia - a lover of travel, the environment, reading, liberal politics, having fun, and breakfast. I am originally from Minnesota,  moved to Chicago for work, and just got back after 8 months of volunteering with an NGO dedicated to providing clean water in rural areas of Nicaragua. 

I can't live without: best friends, yoga, froyo, new books, and traveling. My favorite recent travel destinations are Croatia, Colorado (Rocky Mountain National Park), Chile, and Nicaragua. 

When I travel, I prefer to stay in places that will help me embrace the local scene. I like to interact with my hosts and get recommendations on where to see and what to do. I love meeting new friends via Airbnb and am happy to help you find some cool activities in Chicago! 

I look forward to meeting you!

neighborhood_overview: Pilsen is one of the best neighborhoods to stay at when visiting Chicago. If you are looking for art, culture, a real feel for the neighborhood, active night life, bars, cafÃ©s  Pilsen is the place for you to accomplish it. We want your stay to be the best most comfortable stay so that all you have to do is explore and enjoy your stay. Pilsen is a fantastic neighborhood to stay in everything is located within walking distance. We also will be glad to inform you of all the best restaurants, markets and help you choose the best transportation to navigate through the city. We recommend checking out the flea market every Sunday rain or shine. They have excellent food.
notes: We are a very large family and love family get togethers. We are a kid friendly home as we have 3 boys of our own. We will gladly supply the apt with toys/books if needed for your stay. We love to share and introduce the neighborhood we call home. We want your stay to be stress free and relaxing as possible and will do our best to help make you feel at home.
transit: We are located minutes/walking distance from pink line train that will take you anywhere in the city that you wish to explore. We are about 20 minutes from downtown on L train. We are about 10 minutes driving. We have maps located I'm apt if needed to help navigate through city. We also recommend getting lyft or ubber it's kind of like a taxi but much less expensive.

If we are not around to greet our guest we do have a lock box with the key which we give before the stay so that in any case that we are not around our guest can access the apt at their convenience.
house_rules: We don't really have any house rules. We enjoy the idea of people from all over the world staying at our place and being able to explore Chicago and make memories. We love to meet new people and hear all about where they come from and give them the opportunity to see where we live and learn our culture. We expect everyone to respect our home as you would your own.

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is part of the Arts District of Chicago. Itâ€™s in East Pilsen which is a young and vibrant neighborhood. Thereâ€™s much to enjoy about this area, particularly in regards to transportation, nightlife, and food. My place is a short walk from both the Pink Line and the Orange Line trains. Itâ€™s also very near to downtown so Ubers usually run only a couple of bucks to get into the Loop (~$6 or 7). Just a few blocks to the east is Halsted street which is lined with art galleries. On the second Friday of each month, all of the artists open their lofts for free live paintings, dj sets, and the like. On this street also has a dive bar called Skylark which was used in the movie â€˜The Break-Upâ€™. Two blocks south is a brand new brewery which opened up called Moody Tongue Brewery. It has outstanding beer, oysters, and chocolate cake. Two blocks to our west is Duseks (a highly recommended restaurant), Thalia Hall (music venue), the Punch House (a cocktail bar), and Tack Room (a piano b
transit: There are numerous options for transportation. My neighborhood has free parking and never makes finding a parking spot very difficult. A short walk to the west is the 18th street Pink Line station. Also within walking distance are the Orange Line Halsted stop and a bit further of a walk, though entirely walkable, is the Red Line Chinatown stop. There is also a Divvy station on my street which makes using the city's bikeshare program very easy.

name: Entire One-Bedroom Apartment with a Parking Space
summary: Sunny, clean one-bedroom apartment with clean sheets, towels, kitchen wares, Wi-Fi, 55" HD LED smart TV and more. There is one full-size bed, one twin fold-out cot with mattress and one futon. Comes with one free parking space behind the building! To create the best experience for you and other renters / residents; no pets, no parties, no smoking and quiet hours from 10 pm until 8 am.
description: Sunny, clean one-bedroom apartment with clean sheets, towels, kitchen wares, Wi-Fi, 55" HD LED smart TV and more. There is one full-size bed, one twin fold-out cot with mattress and one futon. Comes with one free parking space behind the building! To create the best experience for you and other renters / residents; no pets, no parties, no smoking and quiet hours from 10 pm until 8 am. There is a private back deck that guest can use as well as one of the two parking spaces within the yellow guardrails. It is accessible via the alley behind the building. I recommend Uber and Lyft, but the #18 bus also comes down 18th St, which is 1.5 blocks from the apartment.

host_about:
I am an athlete, constant student and business owner.  I am a world traveler and I have spent time living in Spain, Ecuador and Rome.  I enjoy entertaining and cooking for my friends.  I have an entire apartment in Pilsen listed on Airbnb that has two bedrooms with full size beds.  The clean and comfortable atmosphere of the apartment is great for all types of guests: tourists, students, families and professionals.  I have lived and worked in Chicago for most of my life and I am eager to direct my guests to the cityâ€™s best attractions including delicious restaurants, fascinating museums, hilarious comedy shows, various beaches and more unique Chicago offerings.  Please be my guest, have a great time and leave a review!  I respond promptly to all inquiries, I honor my reservations, and I update my booking calendar daily.  Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. Please make sure that your profile includes a photo of you and a few sentences about yourself.

Additional Info:

Sports Accomplishments: State Swimmer, Elite Triathlete (top 14%), Division 1 Rower

Languages: English, Spanish, Italian and Latin

Schools: St. Ignatius College Prep and Georgetown University

Greatest Adventures: studied abroad in Spain, traveled Europe, studied in Ecuador, ran with the bulls in Pamplona, went skydiving (2x), and hiked 70+ miles in the wilderness of Philmont, New Mexico (2x).

I'm an Eagle Scout.

summary: Affordable private bedroom in the south loop of Chicago. We have hosted over 300 different users on our Airbnb apartments. Free WiFi,free Netflix, and free street parking. We are close to restaurants, bars, museums, and Universities.
space: A private bedroom within a centrally located large 3 bedroom apartment with beds, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, etc. Living room has a couch and TV with Netflix, local channels, sports channels (ESPN, NBC). notes: Free WiFi, Free Netflix, and Free parking. We don't charge a security deposit The address is 1115 W 19th PLACE and not 1115 W 19th STREET. 19th STREET is one block from 19th PLACE.

host_about:
We are clean and neat freaks that have hosted over 1000 different sets of Airbnb guests from all over the world in our Chicago apartments!. Our apartments are in the south loop of downtown Chicago. The museums, stadiums (United Center, Soldier Field, etc.), and McCormick Place, Thalia hall, China town, University of Illinois, University of Chicago,  Rush university, Medical district are all close and easily accessible. The magnificent mile is: 9 minutes by bus and 5 minutes by taxi or Uber. 
 
We are friendly people who enjoy meeting new friends and traveling. We have lived in the Caribbean, London, and New York before moving to Chicago. Came to Chicago primarily for school but then we loved it and decided to stay. Yes, we love Chicago, and even the winter is GREAT! Good food options are unbelievably amazing in Chicago.

Taneisha and I have multiple apartments on this website. Some of the apartments are  3 bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. Some are two bedrooms, bathroom, living, and kitchen and the others are 1 bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We provide additional airbeds if needed. The airbeds are extremely comfortable and are queen size and 18 inches high. 

All the apartments have free WiFi, guestbooks, and basic amenities such as TV, iron, iron board, refrigerator, hair dryer, with water, pop, and juice, microwave, coffee maker, cups, plates, pots, pans, bathroom towels, shower items, etc.

Airbnb is extremely fun for us since we are also international.  We have traveled to most of the states in the US, London, Milan,  Italy, Turkey. I have also attended Universities on both sides of the Atlantic (London and Chicago). 

Favorite music are Reggae, R&B, hip hop, Latin music, country music. I love to eat and my favorite food are fish, fruits, and vegetables. My favorite sports are rock climbing, archery, diving, soccer, and basketball. 

These days if we are not out with friends, we are with family, or spending time on the computer. Our life motto is working hard and taking care of health!!!!!

Came to Chicago primarily for school but then we loved it and decided to stay. Yes, we love Chicago, and even the winter is GREAT! Good food options are unbelievably amazing in Chicago.

Taneisha and I have multiple apartments on this website. Some of the apartments are  3 bedrooms, bathroom, living room, dining room, and kitchen. Some are two bedrooms, bathroom, living, and kitchen and the others are 1 bedroom, kitchen, bathroom, and living room. We provide additional airbeds if needed. The airbeds are extremely comfortable and are queen size and 18 inches high. 

All the apartments have free WiFi, guestbooks, and basic amenities such as TV, iron, iron board, refrigerator, hair dryer, with water, pop, and juice, microwave, coffee maker, cups, plates, pots, pans, bathroom towels, shower items, etc.

Airbnb is extremely fun for us since we are also international.  We have traveled to most of the states in the US, London, Milan,  Italy, Turkey. I have also attended Universities on both sides of the Atlantic (London and Chicago). 

Favorite music are Reggae, R&B, hip hop, Latin music, country music. I love to eat and my favorite food are fish, fruits, and vegetables. My favorite sports are rock climbing, archery, diving, soccer, and basketball. 

These days if we are not out with friends, we are with family, or spending time on the computer. Our life motto is working hard and taking care of health!!!!!
