name: Arts District Near McCormick/Loop/Lake/Museums
summary: Loft space with high ceilings, lots of light in a unique, converted 1920â€™s speakeasy. Guests have private area with futon bed, dresser, love seat and coffee table, access to business area with desk, wifi, and fax. Close to all highways, free street parking.
space: Loft space with high ceilings, lots of light in a unique, converted 1920â€™s speakeasy. Guests have private area with futon bed, dresser, love seat and coffee table, access to business area with desk, wifi, and fax. We are in a real loft with several levels and a lot of wide open space. Your private area is created with multiple bamboo blinds, and it is separate and distinct and private.
description: Loft space with high ceilings, lots of light in a unique, converted 1920â€™s speakeasy. Guests have private area with futon bed, dresser, love seat and coffee table, access to business area with desk, wifi, and fax. Close to all highways, free street parking. Loft space with high ceilings, lots of light in a unique, converted 1920â€™s speakeasy. Guests have private area with futon bed, dresser, love seat and coffee table, access to business area with desk, wifi, and fax. We are in a real loft with several levels and a lot of wide open space. Your private area is created with multiple bamboo blinds, and it is separate and distinct and private. You can access your living space, bathroom, kitchen, and living room.  There is a work desk, fax and printer for business use, as well as the free WIFI. The WIFI password is posted on your dresser. Private access is limited to your living space ~ the rest are shared spaces, including the bathroom. We offer a continental breakfast including coffee, tea
neighborhood_overview: This is really a great neighborhood, close to McCormick Center, the Loop business district, Lake Michigan, Museum Campus, Soldier Field and all highways, with easy and free street parking.  We are bounded by Pilsen (Mexican community), UIC/Greektown, and Chinatown all within close proximity, all with great food and unique shopping. The Chicago Arts District hosts 2nd Fridays Gallery Night, the monthly opening receptions at the galleries and artists' studios centered around South Halsted and 18th Streets.
notes: We have 2 lovely cats, one who will introduce himself immediately and the second more timid one who you may not see at all during your stay. There is a coin laundry in the building.
transit: Easy access to public transportation, highway, or if you like biking we've got a Divvy bike station 1 block away. We are 10 minutes by car/Uber/taxi to McCormick Center. The bus to McCormick takes a little longer, and the walk is about 30 minutes next to the Lake. The Red Line train station in Chinatown is close by and will take you directly into the Loop business district, Millennium Park and Art Institute area and River North. The #27 State Street bus is nearby and takes you directly to Navy Pier, and passes through the Loop business district, Michigan Magnificent Mile shopping district, State Street shopping district, Art Institute, and River Walk. The #8 Halsted bus is nearby and will take you to Greektown, West Loop and River West and also stops at the Blue line train which takes you to/from O'Hare airport and the Loop business district, Millennium Park and Art Institute area. If you stop in either Greektown or West Loop any of the Eastbound "president streets" have bus lines that
access: You can access your living space, bathroom, kitchen, and living room.  There is a work desk, fax and printer for business use, as well as the free WIFI. The WIFI password is posted on your dresser. Private access is limited to your living space ~ the rest are shared spaces, including the bathroom. We offer a continental breakfast including coffee, tea, bagels or English muffins, fruit, and cream cheese. Feel free to make yourself breakfast, and just clean up after yourself.
interaction: We are often at home when guests arrive, and will give you a key and show you around. But if that is not possible, then we have a lockbox outside and will go over those details at the appropriate time. We look forward to meeting you and hanging out, but that's not a requirement. We're happy to give you the lowdown on getting around the city, what attractions and events are happening, restaurants that might interest you, and answer any questions to help make sure your stay is a great one.
house_rules: Please be respectful of the loft. No smoking, no drugs, drinking in moderation is fine. No outside guests. If you use the kitchen please clean up after yourself. Don't leave personal belongings in bathroom. Don't use bathroom sink for washing clothing - there is a coin laundry in the building. No pets please.
host_about: Me, my husband and our 2 cats enjoy meeting and hosting guests from around the world! We are avid downhill skiers, campers and bikers. We love Chicago and all the things it has to offer, and we'll do our best to help you love her too!

name: Pilsen Grdn Apt/Rush/UIC/McCormick
summary: Welcome to our modern, comfortable apt. We are conveniently located blocks from Pink Line train. We live in a fantastic neighborhood full of art, great food and many convenient grocery stores. 5 minutes from Rush Hospital on Pink line train.  McCormick Place.
space: Our place is fantastic for people that wish to explore, relax and enjoy. Whether it be for work or just vacation. The neighborhood is very unique with great art, festivals in summer, very very family friendly. We have many convenient local stores to choose from.
description: Welcome to our modern, comfortable apt. We are conveniently located blocks from Pink Line train. We live in a fantastic neighborhood full of art, great food and many convenient grocery stores. 5 minutes from Rush Hospital on Pink line train.  McCormick Place. Our place is fantastic for people that wish to explore, relax and enjoy. Whether it be for work or just vacation. The neighborhood is very unique with great art, festivals in summer, very very family friendly. We have many convenient local stores to choose from. Guests will have access to wifi, also a shared backyard, to enjoy a drink at the 6 piece outdoor patio set. This is definitely why I choose to be a host for Airbnb,  I get to meet great people from all over the world.  I love to share my way of life to all.  I try to greet every guest, but when not available I do have an easy access code for entry. My neighborhood is just the greatest to me and all of my family.  We are primarily Ã  Mexican neighborhood, but also with a gre
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is just the greatest to me and all of my family.  We are primarily Ã  Mexican neighborhood, but also with a great mixture of all other great people.  We are a vibrant neighborhood full of culture, arts, Great Authentic Mexican Restaurants and small businesses.   All in walking distance.   The train station only one block away from our location.  Also we are located right across the street from Harrison Park.  With plenty of free street parking, other than once weekly Friday street cleaning.
notes: For this particular listing if noise bothers you, maybe you shouldn't book this apt.  There is our unit up above, and you may hear noise of foots steps and occasional barking.
transit: Yes we are located only one block away from the train station.  Damen stop, on the Pinkline.  To were you can take to the loop downtown, then transfer to any other color train line to reach many parts of the city.  Also Ã¼ber and Lyft are also a great way to travel as well.
access: Guests will have access to wifi, also a shared backyard, to enjoy a drink at the 6 piece outdoor patio set.
interaction: This is definitely why I choose to be a host for Airbnb,  I get to meet great people from all over the world.  I love to share my way of life to all.  I try to greet every guest, but when not available I do have an easy access code for entry.
house_rules: We would expect our guests to treat our place as if it were there own.  And return our place as was given.  No need to make beds as all get washed after every visit.  Also absolutely NO SMOKING indoors.    Thank you
host_about: Hello, my name is Mario and I was born and raised in Chicago.  I enjoy out door activities, bbq's, love eating, art and design.  I have a huge family I enjoy hanging out with.  I also love music and vintage stuff.

name: Entire 2 BD Apt  w/ 4 Beds (FRONT)
summary: Great clean 2 bedroom apartment with clean sheets, towels, Wi-Fi, 39" HD LED  smart TV and more.  There is one full-size bed in each of the 2bedrooms, one ottoman folds out into a twin bed, one couch that folds out into a twin bed, and one small cot.
space: All pillows and both full size bed's have soft hypoallergenic (and waterproof) covers and to prevent dust mites, bed bugs and any other grossness.  The couch fold out into a twin size bed and the ottoman folds out into a twin size bed too! Lastly, there is a sturdy spring-and-mattress twin size cot on wheels.
description: Great clean 2 bedroom apartment with clean sheets, towels, Wi-Fi, 39" HD LED  smart TV and more.  There is one full-size bed in each of the 2bedrooms, one ottoman folds out into a twin bed, one couch that folds out into a twin bed, and one small cot. All pillows and both full size bed's have soft hypoallergenic (and waterproof) covers and to prevent dust mites, bed bugs and any other grossness.  The couch fold out into a twin size bed and the ottoman folds out into a twin size bed too! Lastly, there is a sturdy spring-and-mattress twin size cot on wheels. You will have the apartment entirely to youselves.  I know A TON about the city - especially restaurants - so I am happy to provide help and recommendations. I love Chicago and hope you will too! One block from the 18th St Pink Line stop!  One block from the #18 bus.  3 blocks from Costco.  1 mile on #12 Ashland bus to Rush University Medical Center. Take the #21 Cermak bus 12 minutes to McCormick Place. Less that 2 blocks to convenie
transit: One block from the 18th St Pink Line stop!  One block from the #18 bus.  3 blocks from Costco.  1 mile on #12 Ashland bus to Rush University Medical Center. Take the #21 Cermak bus 12 minutes to McCormick Place. Less that 2 blocks to convenience stores and supermarkets. 5 minute drive to the loop (downtown Chicago).   Near other great Chicago neighborhoods like Little Italy and Chinatown. Great authentic Mexican restaurants in the area.
interaction: You will have the apartment entirely to youselves.  I know A TON about the city - especially restaurants - so I am happy to provide help and recommendations. I love Chicago and hope you will too!
house_rules: Please be quiet and respectful of others in the building.  They will do the same for you.  No smoking anywhere on the premises - This will cost you your security deposit. No pets, no parties.  Don't leave dirty pots or pans.  Leave the the stove clean and free of any cooking oils.  By the way, the apartment DOES look like the photos...I always keep it neat and clean :)  Please leave it that way when you check out.
host_about:
I am an athlete, constant student and business owner.  I am a world traveler and I have spent time living in Spain, Ecuador and Rome.  I enjoy entertaining and cooking for my friends.  I have an entire apartment in Pilsen listed on Airbnb that has two bedrooms with full size beds.  The clean and comfortable atmosphere of the apartment is great for all types of guests: tourists, students, families and professionals.  I have lived and worked in Chicago for most of my life and I am eager to direct my guests to the cityâ€™s best attractions including delicious restaurants, fascinating museums, hilarious comedy shows, various beaches and more unique Chicago offerings.  Please be my guest, have a great time and leave a review!  I respond promptly to all inquiries, I honor my reservations, and I update my booking calendar daily.  Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. Please make sure that your profile includes a photo of you and a few sentences about yourself.

Additional Info:

Sports Accomplishments: State Swimmer, Elite Triathlete (top 14%), Division 1 Rower

Languages: English, Spanish, Italian and Latin

Schools: St. Ignatius College Prep and Georgetown University

Greatest Adventures: studied abroad in Spain, traveled Europe, studied in Ecuador, ran with the bulls in Pamplona, went skydiving (2x), and hiked 70+ miles in the wilderness of Philmont, New Mexico (2x).

I'm an Eagle Scout.

host_about:
I live and work in the heart of Chinatown. I own a travel agency and on my free time, like to dabble in real estate + health/life insurance. I have a gorgeous home but now that I'm an empty nester, I like to house short or long term guests in the guest room.

name: Cozy Private Room in Roscoe Village
summary: One private bedroom with a full size bed. Close to public transportation. Easy street parking. Located in the Roscoe Village neighborhood of Chicago. Building is updated and clean. One shared bathroom. Steps from restaurants. I do not have any pets.
space: Updated apartment that is nicely decorated.  Located on a quiet, tree-lined street.  Easy parking.  Great outdoor patio space for relaxing or enjoying a meal outdoors.  Additional patio space with a grill is also available for use.  Start your morning with a cup of coffee by choosing from a variety of flavors for the keurig in the kitchen. There is not a TV in the bedroom, but there is a TV in the shared living room that you are welcome to use.  I do not have cable, but I have Apple TV with HuluPlus, Netflix, and an HBO Go account.

One shared bathroom. Steps from restaurants. I do not have any pets. Updated apartment that is nicely decorated.  Located on a quiet, tree-lined street.  Easy parking.  Great outdoor patio space for relaxing or enjoying a meal outdoors.  Additional patio space with a grill is also available for use.  Start your morning with a cup of coffee by choosing from a variety of flavors for the keurig in the kitchen. There is not a TV in the bedroom, but there is a TV in the shared living room that you are welcome to use.  I do not have cable, but I have Apple TV with HuluPlus, Netflix, and an HBO Go account. Please feel free to use the apartment as if it were your own!  Feel free to whip up a meal in the kitchen, or store food in the refrigerator.  Guests can access any part of the apartment, with the exception of my
neighborhood_overview: Great, safe and friendly neighborhood located on the northside of Chicago.  Great restaurants just steps from the apartment.  15 minute walk to Wrigley Field, or you can take an express bus straight there.
transit: Easy to get around!  It's a 5 minute walk to the train.  A div-y bike station (commuter bike rental) is located one block from the apartment.  Multiple bus stations are within a couple blocks walk as well.
access: Please feel free to use the apartment as if it were your own!  Feel free to whip up a meal in the kitchen, or store food in the refrigerator.  Guests can access any part of the apartment, with the exception of my personal bedroom.
interaction: I'll be available for questions, conversations, advice on how to get around the city, etc.  I'll respect your privacy and take cues from you on the level of interaction you are comfortable with.
house_rules: I just ask that you be respectful of my home. Clean up after yourself.  No smoking. No pets. Only airbnb guests allowed, unless you clear it by me in advance. Otherwise, please make yourself at home!
host_about:
I'm a working professional with a passion for travel, dance, and adventure.  I work in the music industry and love live music, so you can usually find me checking out a concert around the city.  

I tend to keep very busy and am always on the go.  A typical summer weekend might consist of biking to the beach, attending a street fest, BBQing with friends, attending a book club, running a race, working out, camping, bike riding, checking out a new restaurant...basically anything.  I'm always up for a random road trip, and trying new things or seeking out an adventure.

In 2010 I made a New Years resolution to get out of the country at least once a year; it was the best New Years resolution I've ever made.   Since then I have traveled to the Dominican Republic, St. Lucia, Costa Rica, Italy, Thailand, Vietnam, Jamaica, Grand Cayman Islands, Mexico, and Peru.  

In the interim between my own travels, I love to host fellow travelers and help make their own experiences as comfortable as possible.

name: Lincoln Square Garden apartment
summary: This is a cozy space in the truly great, fun, friendly, relaxed Lincoln Square neighborhood. Many cafes, vast assortment of restaurants and shops in walking distance. Downtown is just a train ride away on the brown line El. Two miles from Lake Michigan. Free and generally easy street parking.
space: Our goal was to create a cozy, inviting space for our guests. Michelle is a fine artist and has lots of fun decorating this apartment. She is always on the lookout for more items to add. The vintage bedroom set was gifted to us from her mother. She used that as a starting point in decorating the bedroom and added one of her own large industrial photographs to give an Old Chicago industrial feeling. Likewise the cowboy corner started with the wagon wheel bed that Thomas had as a child (note* both beds have new mattresses!*) We continually work on the Chicago-themed art in the kitchen and living room area.

neighborhood_overview: So many things are walking distance from us! Shops, groceries, public transportation, parks, a public pool, Divvy bike rental, car rental, a library, amazing and diverse restaurants. Even a movie theater. There are always new businesses opening up in the neighborhood, check with us for the latest hot spots.
notes: This is a friendly, quiet neighborhood full of families and fun stuff to do. Parking is almost always available right in front of the house. We'd love to have you as our guest!
transit: There are 3 brown line El stops nearby. All are about a 5-10 minute walk away (depends how fast you walk!) These are the nearby stops: Western, Montrose, Irving Park. There are several Divvy bicycle rental stations very close by. Also, Enterprise and Zip Cars. But if you love to walk, this neighborhood is a good fit for you!
access: Guests may use key or lock box with code for apartment access. Private entrance. You do not have to go through our living space to access this apartment.
interaction: We are a family living above the garden apartment. We have lived in the neighborhood for more than 20 years and will be more than happy to help with directions and sight-seeing recommendations!
house_rules: No pets. No smoking. No parties. No additional overnight guests without approval.

house_rules: I like to keep a very peaceful home atmosphere.  Please respect the animal living here as well as the neighbors. No smoking, NO drugs policy. If you have any questions, feel free to ask! :)
host_about:
Hello there, my name is Kay! I've been in the service/hospitality industry for over 15 yrs, and love every day of it. It would be my pleasure to be your hostess! I decided to become an Air BNB host because I feel Chicago is such a beautiful city, but it's shame that hotels are so expensive. Since lodging is the weight of most trips' cost, this is a wonderful way to help each other. I am a Chicago native, born and raised, and know the city very well.

The atmosphere of my home is peaceful, pleasant, and fun.  I enjoy music, film, sight-seeing, dining, travel, photography, yoga, and nature. I also love to cook, and will provide fresh fruit, coffee/tea, yogurt, and muffin for your stay. You are more than welcome to bring and store your own food for extended stay. There is a mini-fridge in the room, and a space in the main refrigerator for you. 

A cat lives in unit, and he rules the roost--14 yrs young! He's very friendly and sweet, but if you're allergic to pets, please be aware. I DO NOT allow other pets to join you, I apologize in advance. I also do not allow other guests without prior approval. The Landlord has a strict policy. 

I have some ground rules for my BNB home: BE courteous, BE friendly, BE honest, BE open. If you have ANY questions or concerns, feel free to ask any time. I am a very reasonable, down-to-earth person. I'm here to help you have a wonderful trip! 

I also have a NO DRUGS,  NO SMOKING policy, as my Landlord is a police officer, and is on premises.  The check-in times are case-by-case basis--I have somewhat normal hours and am home in the evenings, but the usual checkout time is 9am. Please message me with any questions. :) 

I would love to make your stay in Chicago a great one!

name: COMFY CITY HIDEOUT
summary: LIKE STAYING AT GRANDMA'S, if she was a 30-year-old hipster who does yoga and enjoys climbing stairs! Our place is good for couples adventurers, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Youâ€™ll love our place because of how relaxing and comfortable it is. A 25-min train ride from Midway airport. Easy access to all of Bridgeport, Chinatown, Pilsen, Little Italy/University Village, downtown shopping, restaurants, and public transportation. Expand your horizons and see all Chicago has to offer!
space: We are located in a quiet neighborhood with some traffic noise. For those who are driving, free parking is fairly easy to find. Exercise is mandatory as their is no elevator. There are $1 laundry machines available for use in the building. Our place represents city life with an artistic modern tranquil flair.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is in the Bridgeport neighborhood in Chicago. Nearby parks include Bosley Park, McGuane Park and Wilson Playground. Bridgeport is a 4-minute drive from Chinatown and the Pilsen neighborhood. We are about a 12-minute drive from the loop. As well as an 8-minute drive north of the White Sox baseball stadium which is US Cellular Field.
notes: We have two small lap dogs both under 10lbs. Levi is a 6-year-old male Morkie who loves people and hates it when people yell or sound like they're fighting. Lakota is a 3-year-old female Chihuahua who is timid when you first meet her, but give her 2 hours and she's your new best friend.
transit: This location is Very Walkable so most errands can be accomplished on foot. We are close to grocery stores, restaurants, gas stations and convenient stores. The Orange Line is 0.5 mi away, an 8-minute walk, and the Red Line is 1.5 mi away in Chinatown. Both trains will take you straight into the heart of Chicago and pretty much anywhere else you're trying to get to. The #62 bus is right outside the front door, which takes you into Chinatown, and then eventually into the loop/ downtown Chicago, a 20-minute ride.  McCormick Place (Lyft/Uber 12 min) Soldier Field (Lyft/Uber 13 min)
access: You may access our apartment as your own home (except for our bedroom, please). Coffee maker, teakettle, fridge, microwave, stove, oven, toaster, feel free to use these things!
interaction: We are clean and respectful, we expect you to be the same. We will be out of the house most of the time as we both work during the week. However, depending on the time of year we're usually home often. We'd love to offer you suggestions on restaurants, and attractions, and if we are available we wouldn't mind showing you around if you'd like! We can always give you your privacy, as much as a two-bedroom apartment allows. When we are not home our dogs are away in our bedroom. Lance's schedule is pretty flexible so if there is anything you need feel free to give him a call. Weekends we are both around.

space: The first floor offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. The kitchen and living room area is also on the 1st floor. There is another bedroom and bathroom on the second floor. There is plenty of storage space in the 2nd floor.
description: The first floor offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. The kitchen and living room area is also on the 1st floor. There is another bedroom and bathroom on the second floor. name: Family home in Chicago
summary: Family home with extravagant Master bed/bathroom, well-lit back yard replete with fire pit and fireflies, one block from park/playground, three blocks from train to downtown, excellent restaurants in the area, piano. Fun and romantic. We have a dog.
space: The Master bedroom includes a California King bed, a two-person shower, a jacuzzi tub and treadmill and weights. There are two additional bedrooms available, one with two full-size beds, and the other (kid-friendly) with twin bunk beds and a third twin bed. Two full baths (including the one in the master bedroom) are available for guests. The third full bath is in the basement apartment and can be made available on request and/or if there are overflow guests. During the school year, host family will be in residence in the basement apartment, which is also the bar/party space. If you are booking specifically to use that space, please make note of it in your reservation inquiry. It can be made available on weekends, but requires a little notice. There are currently no railings in the stairwells, the house was built this way. May be unsuitable for those who need assistance walking. Guests have access to everything except the basement apartment/bar, which is my living space.   Edison Park

neighborhood_overview: Edison Park is the safest neighborhood in Chicago, most of our neighbors are police or firefighters. We have fabulous restaurants in the area, Zia's Trattoria, Elliot's Steakhouse, Firewater Saloon, Don Juan's, Nonno Pino's. Great food and beverage options.
notes: Lovely backyard area with nice herb garden, private patio and large dining area.
transit: Metra station is only three blocks away and the ride downtown is 20 minutes.
access: Guests have access to everything except the basement apartment. That is my living space.
interaction: I rarely interact with guests, as I am traveling frequently. There is a male couple who live in the basement (where I also live when I am in residence) and are caretakers for the property and I have a cleaning service come in and turn over the property between guests.
house_rules: No parties. My home is not the place to host your house party. No smoking. If you NEED to smoke, utilize the backyard, there is an ash pot out there, but absolutely no smoking inside my home. I expect that my belongings will be respected and undamaged, any booze that is consumed will be replenished/replaced, and the house will be left clean with no dirty dishes.  No loud parties after 10pm, no smoking indoors and no food/snacks in the bedrooms please.
